Reviews.Title: “Not Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: MySweetKate
Reviews.Content: We have been to Orlando 3 times and this was our first stay outside the House of Mouse. The experience was definitely not up to the Mouse's standards. We stayed for 7 days, spending 2 days in the Universal parks, 2 days at Disney, 1 day at the pool, and a couple more days chilling out re-visiting the Universal attractions, the pool, and some other area attractions. The early park access/line cutting privileges were nice - the reason why we choose to stay at the Hard Rock -- though it turned out the crowd levels were light the week we were there so we didn't really need the line-cutting access. Check-in was easy and our room was ready early. While the lobby and lower (pool access/restaurant level) were elegant, the public areas in the guests wings were very tired with soiled carpeting, sad laundry room, etc. Our room was pretty basic/generic, but very clean. It seemed to be better maintained than the hallways. Housekeeping did a great job. The pool area was beautiful, but the pool was very shallow (about 4 feet at the deepest) so not very fun for our 12-year-old. Though the hotel seemed to be pretty empty the majority of the week, the pool was always bustling. I think it would have been wall-to-wall people on a busy day at the hotel. We had read a guide book review that called the Hard Rock Hotel family-friendly, but really disagree. The pool scene was similar to what we have seen at various all-inclusive Carribean resorts -- lots of adults drinking way too much and acting inappropriately. There are a lot of life guards and other staff at the pool, but they did nothing to curb the inappropriate behavior of other guests. We arrived on a Sunday - early afternoon - and headed straight for the pool. There were quite a few intoxicated guests. One woman in particular (with kids in tow) was so inebriated she could hardly walk, but was served yet another drink. She ended up vomiting in the hot tub/spa - sending the other guests fleeing and setting a nasty tone for the beginning of our vacation. Her husband had to physically drag her into the hotel (leaving the unattended kids behind). Every day we saw numerous drunk guests dribbling alcoholic drinks into the pool. Not very classy. We were there the last Thursday of the month when the hotel hosts a concert. It was very loud. That night someone either spilled a large alcoholic beverage or vomited alcohol in the elevator -- I didn't want to get close enough to figure out which. Again, not very classy. My husband took our daughter to the pool on Saturday night around 8:30 for the "dive-in" movie which was obstensibly for children as it was an animated movie. They returned before 9:00 as my husband reported a couple was making out so intently in the pool he thought they were actually having intercourse. Although he and several other guests complained, the pool staff did nothing to "break it up." Yet again not a family-friendly evening. This hotel would be a good choice if you want the early park access and you are an adult-only group that likes the party scene. I don't think it is a good choice for families.

Reviews.Title: “Like a second home!”
Reviews.Author: Kathya100
Reviews.Content: Have been staying here since it opened at least once of not twice a year ( two weeks at a time) This hotel is first class. Rooms very clean and all areas are maintained to high standard. An excellent pool area and beach club bar with both afternoon and evening entertainment, for young and old!! Velvet Bar is also must for evening drinks overlooking the pool area. Excellent choice of food and drinks in both bars. ALL staff are friendly and very helpful nothing it too much. In all the years we have been staying at Hard Rock we have never had one complaint. From the minute you check in to check out you are treated like rock stars!!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoad1947
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were clean and the personnel were very helpful. We needed to leave a note for the housekeeping staff as there were no washcloths or hot cups when we came. But they were prompt in cleaning when we left the sign on the door. The pool is quite crowded with kids (like preteen age) but there is a spa for just adults which is nice. The music is loud and constant until 10 PM. The location for a visit to Universal cannot be beat. They could get rid of some of the many pillows on the beds!

Reviews.Title: “best vacation ever !”
Reviews.Author: caterbug_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Hard Rock. This was our first time staying here and it was Awesome ! From the time we checked in , until we checked out the service we received was outstanding. We opted to stay on the Club level...well worth it. We were amazed at the amount of food & drinks available all day...great money saver. No matter where we were in the hotel the staff were so friendly. The hotel is quiet at night, very clean and the pool is great ! All of the entertainment they have for kids & adults too kept us busy when we were hanging out at the pool. The room key/fast pass was great as well. Loved being able to walk to the parks or take the water taxis...so much fun. We are already planning a return trip !

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel Universal Studios Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Claudia M
Reviews.Content: Very happy we chose to stay at the Hard Rock. The staff was great & nice rooms. Loved the pool, beach club and the short walk to Islands of Adventure, Universal & the City Walk. The best part about staying at the Hard Rock is the ability to get into Islands of Adventure early and also the express pass that is included with each guest's stay. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: ellendott
Reviews.Content: I brought my 3 kids, ages 20, 17 and 11 and we all had a blast. The Hard Rock staff was super friendly and the DJ by the pool on Sunday afternoon had everyone entertained for hours. Worth every penny!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: SevilleGroup
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived until we left the staff was outstanding and this hotel was beautiful. We stayed in the club suite and it was WELL worth the extra money. If you travel to Orlando this Hotel is a must.........Great job staff keep up the good work and we will be returning..

Reviews.Title: “Positive Experience at the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: SuzieQ29
Reviews.Content: Pool area is beautiful and the hotel staff are very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Quality time is PRICELESS”
Reviews.Author: wakeandbake
Reviews.Content: When choosing our vacation this year we gave our son his choice of Disney or Universal. We normally rent a home but this year our older kids were at college and we only had one 13year old.We chose the Hard Rock because of great reviews. We booked a club level standard room two queen beds garden view, 4 day park passes with 2 park meal deals. I arrived at 2:00 and the room was already for us. The 7th floor is accessed by your room key only. The elevators always went straight up and never stopped.Nice touch. The room was standard and clean. We did use the room safe and would recommend it with such a busy hotel. We found the staff to be friendly and always helpful. We met a man who worked for room service and he sent a tray of cookies to our room later in the week. The club lounge lady gave my son pins and guitar picks. The club lounge was definetley worth the extra $. Sodas,snacks,breakfast,beer and wine saved alot of dollars. It was very convient. I didn't think it was as busy as some reviewers experienced and the bartenders worked quickly. I was suprised when a security guard told us we can use the other pools at the other hotels. Great idea for when it got busy but we never made it over there. The hard rock had a DJ who entertained the kids with boy vs. girls activities. Very amusing to watch.We also saw Hulk Hogan in the elevator. My favorite part was singing all day. I kept saying "Good Tune". My son and I explored the memorabalia one day. We spent at least 2 hours walking around. It was easy to tell him dreams are achievable with all these great artists to look up too. Quality time is priceless. I loved the hard rock music channel on the T.V. It was like having the old MTV back. The parks are great and of course that fast pass and early entry rocks.We didn't feel sunburned and discouraged at the end of the day. We always returned back for lunch and dinner with our meal deals. They saved us alot of cash. The fried chicken was soo good! The only thing was the claim of getting your packages delivered to your room. I bought a shirt at the hard rock cafe but they didn't deliver packages go figure neither did the fudge store. Whatever it was a short walk back. City walk was very fun. My son made a lot of friends so we ended up alone several nights. Quality adult time can be a blast. We sang 80's songs with other guest at the Lone Palm. After that back on that water taxi for a quick trip to the hotel. No driving for us!! Never did see the car till we left. I actually didn't want to leave but all good things come to an end.I would definently recomend this to all "cool"families. I never regretted our choice. Really it was better than I thought it would be. We hope to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, ideally located and excellent benefits”
Reviews.Author: Harrylondontraveller
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel with a great rock theme, fun entertainment and good, although somewhat variable, attitude on pricing of drinks, food, mini-bar etc. You can get some good deals if you book in advance directly on their website, but the most impressive benefit is the universal express / fast pass and the early park entry that you get by being a resident at Hard Rock hotel. This makes a HUGE difference to your enjoyment of the parks and is worth a lot of money on the ticket price of the Universal parks. Only thing that's slightly annoying is having to pay for parking at a hotel that your staying at, which at $17 per day plus tax adds up, but apparently that's quite normal in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Harry Potter and the four Smith's”
Reviews.Author: rick s
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best vacant ever! Our 5 day trip Inc 3 days @ US w/ early admission & express passes. The HR is awesome! Great staff & accommodations & music; kept two 13 yr old kids entertained w/ games, vollyball, pool activities & movies.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: Ladydi4
Reviews.Content: The room is beautiful and the pool entertainment was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Just Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: ShylaQ
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and loved it! The room was clean, incredibly comfortable and well appointed. IPOD dock was very much appreciated! Bathroom and vanity area were EXCELLENT! Can't beat the location and the water taxi service was a great bonus when you were tired from a long day of walking! The pool area is really pleasant and lunch poolside was yummy! Every staff person i encountered was beyond fabulous!!!! I sadly became ill during my stay and went searching for ginger ale. The gentleman working at Emack and Bolio's went and got me a can in the bar even though they didn't sell it themselves. And when i ordered room service of dry toast (which arrived quickly and beautifully presented) a bonus can of ginger ale accompanied it. The room service staff even called back later in the evening to ensure i was doing ok!!!! Every thing about this stay was magnificent(even with my brief illness) and when I return to Orlando there is not question where i will stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lowes is simply the best.”
Reviews.Author: CooperBear
Reviews.Content: The property is spotless. The rooms are immacualte and the ambiance is awesome. The food is great - order poolside at the beach club and let the kids play. The bar staff is spot on and everyone on property wants to make sure you're comfortable and feel welcome. And if you are going to the parks (Universal Studios or Islands of Adventure) the Express Pass feature of your room card is worth double! Great hotel for families with young kids ( 10 to teenagers) as well as couples.

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is "WOW"”
Reviews.Author: Brian T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel at Universal about 3 years ago. This was the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in. The hotel had such a clean and new smell to it. The room was extremely clean and there was not a speck of dirt near the baseboards. The only thing was, you could hear people in the next room, but that is expected at all hotels. I would love to stay in one of the Jurassic Park rooms one day.

Reviews.Title: “April Vacation at the Hard Rock.”
Reviews.Author: Pokershark
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock is in a great location if Universal is your destination. You can walk to City Walk/Universal/ Islands of Adventure from the hotel. Its a beautiful 10 minute walk or you can take the free water shuttle or a bike type ride that can take 3 or 4 people. There is a bike type thing that can take 3 or 4 people and I think its free just tip the guy doing the pedaling. By staying at the Hard Rock you get early access to the parks by one hour which is great and your room key gets you to the front of all the lines at all the attractions except two, Harry Potter and the Rip Rocket Ride. I cannot tell you what an advantage this is. We never waited more than 10 minutes to get on anything...priceless. The hotel is cool as is the staff and the pool is great...open till midnight with lifeguards. There is a DJ most of the day, a live band sometime and at night they show a movie. There is pool service, a walk up bar and a restaurant or you can just sit and someone will bring everything to you..my kids loved it. We only had lunch at the pool as we ate at the park or in Orlando somewhere but it was reasonable. Self parking is about $18.00 a day and valet parking is available for more of course, we self parked its right next to the hotel. The rooms are comfy and hip..I have an All Access pass so I got a free upgrade to a pool/garden view. Go to the Rock Shop and ask about getting an All Access Pass, they are cheap and worth every penny. If Universal is your destination than the Hard Rock is your hotel...no doubt about it !

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: KimS10S
Reviews.Content: My seventeen year old daughter brought a friend for a weekend at Universal. The Hard Rock Hotel was amazing! The location was the best. The girls could walk or take a water taxi to and from the parks. It is a very safe, friendly atmosphere. The hotel has a beyond beautiful pool area and employees could not more friendly and helpful. It costs a bit more, but the early park entrance, unlimited fast pass on all rides, closeness to the park and quality of the hotel and staff make it a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Do Orlando like a rock star”
Reviews.Author: plannergirl34950
Reviews.Content: Im sitting poolside next to the pulse thrumming music at the bar, drinking a generously-poured Hurricane, wrapped in a warm towel, looking over the 0 entry pool and feeling particularly beneficent about the Hard Rock hotel. I've stayed here 5 times or more, and have no desire to stay anywhere else. The awesome staff, the incredible location (walking to every Universal attraction on lush waterfront paths), rooms getting a bit tired tho I noticed this trip. What I love best- they are ultra cool about coming early to use the pool, then using it after check out. Add this to the included express passes to universal, you can't get better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Great location... perfect with kids...”
Reviews.Author: RBNY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock in Orlando for six nights with a total of 4 adults and 4 kids and had a great experience: Rooms: Had two pool view rooms which had sufficient space for 2 adults and 2 kids. Rooms were definitely bigger similar level Disney properties and bigger than the rooms at Lowes Royal Pacific. Pool: Was very large, never felt crowded, the slide was awesome, loved the music and the dj!. Food and drink service poolside was perfect. We picked the Hard Rock over the Portofino in part for the more relaxed / party-like atmosphere and for the slide (which the kids throughly enjoyed). Food: Breakfast buffet had something for everyone. Loved dinner at The Palm (on site). Also had dinner at Mama Della's at the Portofino, which was very good and at Emril's Tchoup Chop at the Royal Pacific, which was not impressive. Location: The hotel was about a 5-10 minute walk to the parks. The water taxi takes a bit longer given the time spent waiting for the taxi to arrive - but offers a nice relaxing ride. We would definitely stay here again given the fun atmosphere and the benefit of the Express pass included in the cost of the rooms!!! While the parks were not as crowded as we expected (given we went during spring break), having the Express pass meant a 10-20 minute wait for a ride (if any at all) as compared to 60+ minutes on the regular lines!! Totally worth extra cost of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive But lacked something”
Reviews.Author: DisneyloverUk
Reviews.Content: Didn't know what to expect, as we always stay in Disney. We decided to spend the 1st 4 nts here to take advantage of the benefits in the theme parks. Great drive up to the lobby & lobby. Staff helpful, but felt something was missing. The guys in the gift shop were friendly too. We ate at The Kitchen for breakfast twice really enjoyed it, except from the flys. Never noticed them until I walked over to the bakery & there was a few all over the Danishes - gutted. A great choice of breakfast items & great themed restaurant. Never tried it for dinner, went to City Walk or elsewhere. Did try the Beach Club by the pool, great atmosphere so ate here a few times. Love the coffee machine & varieties of coffee. Pool great, although not as big as the pictures still impressive though. I was glad to go to Disneys Beach Club & felt 4nts was too long here, my daughter was 8yrs at the time & would enjoy this place more when she's a teenager I think. Love the Rock music & theme especially the memorabilia. Just didn't feel like the feeling I get when I'm in a Disney World resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for universal”
Reviews.Author: Ironships
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in pool view room. Access to universal was so easy and the express passes are fantastic. Room was large and easily accommodated a family of 4 with lots of bags. Room service was excellent and a welcome relief at the end of a day in the parks. Great having laundry access. Staff so friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah7896
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our family of five, my husband and I and three kids ages 11, 9, and 5. We originally wanted to stay at the Portofino, but it was booked. Really glad we were at Hard Rock! Nice vibe at hotel, DJ at pool. Pool has sandy beach and great waterside. The DJ does fun games with the kids at the pool in the evening. Hotel itself is really neat, lots rock memorabilia. I was worried about it being too loud from previous reviews, but was fine and the music actually added a nice element and feel to the hotel. Staff was wonderful all the way around!! Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “I was shocked how great this hotel was for a family...”
Reviews.Author: Nancy G
Reviews.Content: I am originally from Orlando and worked as a Tour Guide down there for years and then worked as a Leisure Travel Agent for many years before becoming a stay at home mom. Because of this, I am very familiar with the hotel options in Orlando, but this hotel was booked as a backup hotel when we couldn’t get our whole stay at our usual hotel. The Hard Rock was not what I expected it to be… and I was so very pleasantly surprised! The first 4 days of our trip were at the Hard Rock and last 4 were at our usual hotel, the Hyatt Grand Cypress. We wish we could have just stayed at the Hard Rock! Here is why… Hotel Itself: We decided to split this trip to Orlando into two halves. The first half would be at one of the Universal Hotels so we could get the free express pass (MAN, IS THIS WORTH IT!!) to skip the lines at both Universal parks and also get early entry to the Harry Potter area before the general public can enter the park. Having stayed at the Portofino several times before, this time we decided to change things up a bit and try the Hard Rock for the first 4 days while we go crazy at all the parks. While we did think the Hard Rock would appeal to our 9 year old son, I was a little afraid it would be too trendy and young for a conservative family like ours with a 9 and 5 year old son and daughter. As a result, we were not expecting much. Just rollin’ the dice. We were so wrong… It is so much fun! So family oriented! Yes, it is young and trendy… but still simultaneously very tailored to families as well and very welcoming to all of us. I am 20 years older than many of the bikini clad beauties by the pool, but I realized that many of them were there with their moms and dads and little brothers and sisters, too… not there vacationing to pick up men at the casino… because there is no casino at this Hard Rock. This really makes the guests at this particular Hard Rock very different than other Hard Rocks and the feeling here is not a sleazy or slutty vibe, but rather one of an upscale resort. (Clearly what they are going for here.) I want to also mention that the fun poolside activities ranged from just fun to watch to absolutely hilarious. The entertainment was great, leaving people from 5 years old to 50 drawn to participate or even just take a seat and watch the fun. Everyone seemed to enjoy the pool activities and entertainment regardless of age or the individual guests ‘cool factor’. Now, it is loud. At times, VERY LOUD. Pool chairs (when the hotel is crowded) are almost impossible to come by and cabanas are quite expensive to reserve for a day ($290 or something like that???), but it was a great pool with a large, fun slide, a zero entry pool layout so little kids that can’t swim yet really can enjoy the pool by just running in and out and standing where they feel comfortable. Food was good and service was mostly excellent. (We had one *nasty* female bartender at the little bar hut thing by the pool, but everyone else was beyond friendly and attentive.) Location: Location is the best if you plan to go to Universal. You can easily make the short walk to both of the parks from the hotel. At the end of the day at the park, you can take one of the rickshaws that go back and forth. (They are free, but tip the guys well… they earn money only off tips and this is hard work.) The boat is a pretty ride, but is longer than the walk and drops you off at a location that leaves you walking just about as far as if you had just walked straight from the hotel, so don’t do the boat unless you want to go to City Walk. Also, if you want a quieter experience by the pool while staying here, you can take the boat to either Universal’s Portofino Hotel which has 2 pools, one is a “quiet” adult pool or the Pacific Hotel, which I did not have an opportunity to visit. (Guests here have access to each of the Universal Hotel amenities.) Rooms: We stayed in a 2double bedroom in the club level at this hotel. Club level at this hotel is key access only to the club floor. The room was very nice, nothing too crazy great but very well decorated, very clean and very comfortable. No balcony. Our view was of a parking lot and part of Universal Studios park. The view was disappointing, but someone has to get the bad view and this was our turn, I suppose. (The kids did like seeing the rollercoasters from our room.) Our view was not the best but certainly not worth any complaints. Bathrooms were well situated for a family with a sink both inside and outside of the toilet and shower area, leaving one person able to shower or ‘whatever’ while another person brushes teeth or applies make up. (Not the case at the Hyatt Grand Cypress.) Club rooms came with robes for guests to use over their stay. (Not provided at the Hyatt Grand Cypress but I just love having robes in the room.) The “club” itself was quite nice. They offered a much wider selection of breakfast foods, snacks drinks and cocktails than at the Hyatt. (Yummy deserts, too!) We were here 3 times a day, every day, but at the Hyatt we wound up just avoiding the club because the kids hated everything at the Hyatt Club. At the Hard Rock, I should say that while we loved the cub, the coffee was *awful* and they could have done a better job keeping the club cleaned up in the busy times, but other than that, we found that we did get a lot out of the extra fee… thanks to the variety of breakfast and snack foods and drinks offered through the day. Service: Other than our one bad female bartender at the hut thing, we found ourselves constantly saying how nice everyone is at the Hard Rock... How beyond friendly people were, constantly greeting us, opening doors for us, remembering our names, offering to do just about anything we asked. The valet guy (Michael) greeted us each day with a smile and took care of us as soon as he saw us approach, making us feel like, well… rock stars, which we very much are not. Overall: We left this hotel for what was our fav hotel in Orlando, the Hyatt Grand Cypress. But once we got there, we wished we could go back to the Hard Rock just to hang around the hotel some more and relax at the Hard Rock, instead. The kids had more fun at the Hard Rock, which made us have more fun and while the nightly rate was slightly higher at the Hard Rock, all the hidden charges at they Hyatt made the Hyatt cost WAY more for way less. As a result, I do not see us going back to the Hyatt again. It was a disappointing stay for us at the Hyatt after having such a wonderful experience at the Hard Rock. The Hard Rock wasn’t perfect -- as mentioned, some of the views are not the best (just like any hotel) and if it is busy, it is very hard (almost impossible?) to get a pool chair and it can be very loud and very lively by the pool at certain times of the day, but the hotel is so well maintained, rooms are clean and very nicely planned and decorated, customer service (for the most part) is excellent, if not exceptional, location is out of this world if you plan on going to Universal parks, VERY family friendly (I was shocked how family friendly!), food is good, very few unexpected fees, if any (unlike the Hyatt with a SLEW of costly hidden daily fees!) so this is our new, “go to” hotel for Orlando. Bottom Line: Love it, love it, love it.

Reviews.Title: “Great option if you want to see Harry Potter at Universal”
Reviews.Author: Pyner
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed on night here before a day at Universal Studios. As a guest you get early access to the park, and park fast pass for every person in your party. The lines for Harry Potter make this a great option. This alone makes the hard rock a winner. We also used pool the day we arrived and after our day at the park. It was great for the kids, fun atmosphere and good service. The room was standard. The lobby staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: traveler12768
Reviews.Content: I really can not say enough positive things about this exciting beautiful hotel. From the moment we entered the hotel until the day we left, we were treated as family and VIP's. This place is like a fine tuned watch, with careful attention to detail. The atmosphere is fun, exciting, relaxed, and elegant at the same time. Ofcourse music plays a large part in the hotel's atmosphere, but the rooms are as quiet as you make them. The pool is amazing with a sandy beach zero entry, and nightly movies. The restaurants and bars are all excellent with great food, and service. Staff very friendly and ready to please. The only reason I did not give 5 stars is that the hotel needs minor remodeling in hallways and rooms. We look foward to our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “great spot”
Reviews.Author: vacapro
Reviews.Content: we stayed here memorial day weeknd 2011, if you dont like loud music by the pool ,, dont stay here, go somewere boring! it is the hard rock!! poll was awsome, loud great mixture of rock, and activities! loved the beach feel, at a pool,, short boat ride to park, well worth staying here , as you get a quick pass to cut lines,, that was worth it alone! hotel itself seems moore geared to young teens, adults, but pool is great for all ages. we would definately return! and will

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place......”
Reviews.Author: Greg J
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from Florida vacation (Couple days in Orlanda and 4 night Bahamas Cruise). We stayed at the Hard Rock for a night, took advantage of the pool on the day of check in and did the parks the next day. From Check In to Check Out, the staff was great and very helpful. Storing our bags at check in so we could hit the pool until our room was ready to storing our bags when we checked out so we could be at the parks all day. What a great hotel, we stayed in the base room and was nice sized room. The pool area is just fantastic, had activities (DJ and contests) going on through out the afternoon. Plenty of wait staff coming around frequently. The early access for Harry Potter World and the express pass was great. The parks weren't very busy but the few times that the signs said 45 minute wait, we walked right up and had a 5 minute wait. The parks are only a 5 minute walk on a nice walkway or can utilize the water taxi. We would definitely stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “A fun upbeat vibe”
Reviews.Author: surfermom
Reviews.Content: Nice room, comfortable bed, and absolutely the best location in the area. Express access to rides and an extra hour in the morning at Harry Potter made the $400+ per night Easter week worthwhile. This is an especially good choice if you have older children or teenagers. A short and pleasant walk to the Universal parks and to City Walk, where there is always music and many good choices for food or drinks. The pool is very nice with a sandy beach. It never felt overcrowded even though we were there Easter week. Outdoor movies some nights and a loud somewhat annoying DJ other nights. We ate at the hotel restaurants multiple times because it was late; they are acceptable but not great (The Kitchen and Beach Club, not The Palm). Check the schedule for character nights at The Kitchen to eat with Scooby Doo, Shrek, and others. There is also a snack shop with ice cream, but I was annoyed that they charged $5 for bottled water. There is also $7 Fuji water available in your room if you like your expensive bottled water shipped from halfway around the world. Hard Rock has nerve claiming to be green by not washing towels every day. Bring a refillable - the tap water tastes great! There's a coin op washer and dryer on some floors which is handy because things dry very slowly hanging in the humid air. I liked Hard Rock but I might stay at one of the other Loews nearby next time; the rates were much less but you still get the perks of staying at a Universal property hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Totally worth it for Universal”
Reviews.Author: jedigiraffe
Reviews.Content: Very fun place with an awesome pool & slide. Definitely, DEFINITELY worth it for the extra perks of Universal Resort access--the early admission hour, water taxi, proximity, automatic Express Pass... TOTALLY worth it. Almost impossible to find a lounge chair/spot by the pool. The pool restaurant, though, was awesome! Great convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Kate B
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a club level room (level 7) and was very impressed. Great value for money with the lounge (drinks, snacks etc) beautiful views and friendly staff. Brilliant benefits, with early park access and queue jumping priviledges. Staff were fab, leaving little gifts every night, as part of the complimentary turndown service. Restaurant very expensive, only ate there once for breakfast-well overpriced. Hotel itself was amazing! definitely rock star quality!! Swimming pool was awesome, everything was awesome!! Thanks to all the staff for a wonderful stay-will return again, this time with the kids ;-)

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kristy47
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week doing Disney and Universal. We stayed at the Hard Rock in Universal and we loved it. From the second we drove up, we knew this place was our style. The music that is piped in and played live was amazing all week. Everytime I walked in to the lobby I said "good song". Everyone in the hotel is nice and friendly and accomodating. There is a great pool, and a great place to eat called "The Kitchen" and Emeric and Bolio Ice Cream is insane. Don't get me wrong, it isn't a bargain by any stretch, but in my opinion it's worth it. We did not pay for the valet parking since it's not far at all to park your own car. There was also no issue at all bringing food/drinks to your room from the Supermarket. What is great is the proximity to the theme parks and we loved City Walk and the mini golf there. NBA City had great food at reasonable prices as did NascarGrille (Fried Pretzels...insane). Hotel guests can get in early to the Universal Parks which I recommend doing just to get on the Harry Potter ride since fast pass cannot be used on this ride and it's a must! Also I recommend bringing a poncho and/or a towel for all the water rides as you do get DRENCHED...we loved the hotel and loved our day at Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: laurajean492
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock for 2 nights in April 2012 and we had a great time there. The rooms were spacious enough for the 5 of us, and the kids had a great time at the pool participating in the contests and games the DJ had going on. It is an easy walk to both Universal and Islands of Adventure from there, and the Express Pass that is a perk of staying at the on-site properties is worth its weight in gold!!! We had such fun at both parks and the hotel.. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Paul C
Reviews.Content: My family, including my daughter of seven stayed here for a week. This is a fun hotel, with an excellent pool and restaurant. It was an ideal escape from the parks and only a five minute stroll away from the fun. The early access to Harry potter and the q jumping entitltlemet were added benefits to staying here. We stayed on the concierge level and the extra price was worth paying for access to the lounge, this included continental breakfast and nibbles and drinks in the evening. Excellent family hotel close to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Great Perks, Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: backcountrytraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in March. We chose the Hard Rock Hotel mainly for the perks offered--early admission to Harry Potter, Express Line at Universal & Islands of Adventure, location to the parks and restaurants, etc.--well worth it! These perks were very valuable when traveling with kids. The hotel room was clean, but nothing special. We did have a pool view, but the room was small. We booked a package through Universal for 2 adults, 3 kids--paid in advance--but realized when we arrived that the rollaway was an extra $25 a night. I'm sure it was in the fine print, but just thought when booking a package for 5--we would have bedding for 5. Be sure to check the details. On another note, the kids loved the pool area, water slide, music, and movies by the pool. Nice way to end the day. Overall, average hotel, but great perks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay & Vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: KIMBYMembertou
Reviews.Content: Loved the resort during our March Break. I had an ALL ACESS Hard rock pass but forgot it at home and couldn't use it. However, we got a new one when we checked in. Loved the property as we entered the entrance and it so cool with the music playing in the lobby. The guitar fountain was awesome during the day and night times. Rooms were well kept and very nice. We had a garden view room at the end of the Hallway which was peaceful but a long walk to the elevators. Loved the sweetgrass amenities like soap, bodywash and shampoo! The food was expensive so we decided to eat only in the market, at CityWalk, or the US Theme Parks. Managed to go to a store off the resort to get cereal and snacks. At, the Market downstairs the ice cream was real good! We were so busy trying to get both theme parks at US & Disney that we were so tired during the evening to check out the pool. I did get to take a day off for myself and finally enjoyed the pool. Loved the music playing there. The Rock Shop was awesome. Got my 2012 guitars pins!! :) Got 10% off with my HR pass there. Also, used the card to get 10% off my meal at the Hard Rock Cafe at Citywalk. Loved the benefits. Our room key was our free EXPRESS Pass at Universal and was the best part of the stay. Even though it was March Break, you either got on the ride right away or the next ride which saved us alot of time. The lineup for picking up your tickets at US was long so if you are checking in the day you arrive it would be ideal to pick your tickets up a day before so you can start the park early. The HERTZ car rental representative was helpful when we first rented the car but the second time they were not there and I waited over 2.5 hours for someone. Finally the hotel called HERTZ and they sent someone over from another resort with a car. Definitely, would return !

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: CharryM
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hard Rock in Orlando and we have enjoyed it both times. As many reviews state, it's worth staying here for the perks alone! The fast pass saves so much time and the early entry to certain areas is great too. So close to both the parks and city walk! There is a water taxi available but this really isn't needed for most people. It takes less than ten minutes to walk to universal studios and about five minutes more to walk to islands of adventure. By the time you wait for the boat you could be half way there or further! The hotel itself is great though, even when you take away the perks. We loved the theme, even though we aren't huge rock fans. Impressive lobby Room was very spacious and the beds were large and comfortable. A little dust here and there and bins were a little dirty! Personally I can live with this, it was clean and well kept apart from those 2 imperfections. I feel that a hotel of this standard should provide a robe and slippers for guests, which we did not get. However, this was also the case at the disney resort we stayed in just before we came here, so maybe it's just the norm in the area? We ordered room service a couple of times which was prompt and the food was nice. MASSIVE portions though! One meal will feed a family of 4! We ate at the Kitchen restaurant once which is great if you fancy a hearty meal. We didn't bother going to the palm restaurant as I am a veggie and the options were very limited for me. We also did not bother spending any time by the pool... it's very loud and busy so if you want quiet and relaxing look elsewhere! Service is a hit or a miss. Most staff are friendly and very pleasant but some aren't as brilliant. One member of staff was rude to us because he couldn't quite understand our accents and he felt that we weren't speaking loudly enough (not impressed, english is our first language so funnily enough we speak the language perfectly!) Despite a couple of minor complaints we had a lovely time! The hotel isn't quite great enough to get a 5/5 from me, but it's in a great location and it's really good fun. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel within walking distance to all the fun”
Reviews.Author: JenLee02
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hard Rock because it was the only Universal hotel to accommodate 5 people in a room. We were traveling with our kids and preferred not to split up into separate rooms, so the "Deluxe Room with Two Queen Beds and a Pullout" was great for us. The room itself was large with 500 sq ft of space and a view overlooking the pool. The Hard Rock is also the closest hotel within walking distance to the parks, so it worked out great during the times we didn't want to wait on the next ferry. The hotel's decor was meant to be the imagined home of an aging rock star with opulent tastes and a collection of rock memorabilia spanning a few decades. I found it edgy without being gaudy and the common areas were nicely done with marble floors and expansive spaces. Rock music is played throughout the hotel and is even pumped through underwater speakers in the pool. Some visitors took the rock star theme a little too far as I saw one young couple being escorted off the premises and I was told another guest had caused a fire in their room. Even with all the partying, our room was quiet and our sleep undisturbed. Onsite dining options were plentiful, ranging from the upscale Palms Restaurant to the grab-and-go Marketplace. Here are a few pointers for eating onsite: **Make reservations for the Palms as far in advance as possible since it is popular with locals. We had a nice dinner there and also had appetizers the night of our arrival in their bar area. For the value, I highly recommend doing gourmet appetizers and drinks at the bar (no kids allowed though). **The Kitchen has a wonderful breakfast buffet and is a great way to start your busy day in the parks. **Try room service when you have crowd fatigue. They serve the same great burgers as the Hard Rock Cafe as well as some other Cafe items and prices are comparable. **Emack and Bolio's Marketplace is a quick breakfast stop where you can grab a hot breakfast sandwich or cut fruit as you head to the parks. Eat on the ferry ride over and you won't be late for early admission. Because we were visiting as a family mainly for the Wizarding World of Harry Potter, staying onsite gave us an hour early access to the park before it opened up to general admission. That extra hour allowed the kids to see and ride everything multiple times in HP World. (Of course, we were there in January!). It was a huge benefit for us to stay at a Universal hotel just for this early access. Although I didn't check it out, the Velvet Bar had live entertainment every night and seemed to be hopping. I also didn't have time to visit the spa or fitness center, but perhaps next time. :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a short family stay”
Reviews.Author: JJudy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel for 2 nights as part of our vacation in Orlando over this year's March break. Two adults and two kids stayed on the concierge floor. The close access to Universal Studios along with the automatic fastpass made the extra cost of the hotel worthwhile. The kids really enjoyed the pool and, in particular, the slide. However, the pool was really crowded and we had to be very resourceful to find chairs. The room was clean and the bathroom was really nice but the concierge floor eating area really left quite a bit to be desired in terms of its cleanliness, ie. it was not clean. The staff did not wipe up the tables or clean up the crumbs on the floor and the chairs between guests. While it was a bonus to have access to a quick breakfast before we left for our early access to Universal Studios, and it was clean at that time given the early hour, it was very easy to be put off by the visible dirt, crumbs, and stickiness at cocktail hour. Hard Rock does need to get its act together so that guests don't feel like they are eating in someone's dirty kitchen. If you can disregard that, and enjoy a glass of wine amid the crumbs, you'll be ok. All in all, the proximity to Universal Studios, as well as the fast pass and the kid friendly pool, makes this hotel a nice place for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine but pool area was a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: paulyred
Reviews.Content: The pool area was overcrowded and the rooms a little too small. But the reason you book into any of these hotels is a fast pass and early into Harry Potter and that's what we got, the Kitchen does great breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “We had issues during our stay but they were resolved fairly....”
Reviews.Author: abcjjl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights from Sunday 4/1/12 to Thursday 4/5/12. We booked our stay in September '11. We were staying in one of their over-sized rooms (around 500 square feet) that contained a sleeper sofa. We needed this since we have 3 sons. We stayed at Portofina Bay Resort 3 years ago and wanted to try a different property. One of our primary reasons for staying here was to take advantage of the inclusion of express passes for the entire party and the early opening option at IOA. We arrived around 8:00AM on Sunday, parked our van and picked up our room keys. We did not receive a text when our room was ready but when we checked back around 3:30PM after touring the parks, our room (#4101 with a lovely courtyard view) was ready. Not going to belabor the points of how expensive everything is. It is a full-service hotel. These type of hotels charge pretty much for everything. Our room rate was $440 plus tax. Self-parking is $17 a day. We knew that there were extra charges for internet access in the rooms, no fridge, extra charge for work-out room and so on and so forth. We research all of this type of information before we choose a property. One can choose how much of these types of services that are needed and either choose them or not. Just like paying for a bellhop to carry your bags. That is one's choice. The valets were great about letting you park your car to unload yourself. They would show you where to park and just hold your key while you were up at your room. They offered this anytime you needed drop things groceries etc. and they did it with a smile. We chose the HRH for the express passes, great location to the parks, and the over-all theming of the property. We found the beds to be quite comfortable. We felt that the room did not cool as well as it should but it was adequate. The 2 sinks were great for 5 folks. We used an over-sized cooler to store our milk and orange juice. We had a smaller cooler to store soft drinks and bottled waters. We just used the available ice machines for this. We had breakfast items in our room-- cereal, muffins, donuts, yoguart, etc. Not a problem at all. There is a Super Walmart nearby where we picked up all of these items. Maid service was great. Amazing what a $10 tip on the first day will do. We had towels, shampoos, and body wash coming out of our ears. We loved how they were good about getting to the room early in the day. It was always serviced when we returned from the parks in the early afternoon. The pool area is nice and includes a decent slide for the kids. This is another area that can be expensive but we just took a drink with us to the pool. The servers give you a dirty look but that is nothing versus saving multiple dollars. Our kids drank bottled Gator Aides at the pool and it was no trouble to run up to the room and grab them. We learned at Portofino that Loew's frowns on folks bringing their small coolers into the pool area. We were always able to locate a couple of chairs. Occasionally that meant moving a towel that was obviously just laying on a chair for now reason. Not a biggie. We did not dine at any of the on-property restaurants at the HRC. The Kitchen was a possibility but the price just seemed a tad much for us. We ate @ JB's Margaritaville one night in City Walk. We also dined at Mythos in IOA and Confisco Grille in IOA. We ate lunch at Circus McGirkus in the park and @ Thunder River Falls, also in the park. On our last day, we dined at Cheesecake Factory at a nearby mall on our way to Melbourne and Kennedy Space Center. The issue we had during our stay occurred on Monday afternoon mid-day after touring the parks in the morning when we returned to our room to take naps and some were heading to the pool. There was a terrible drilling sound like concrete being broken-up directly above us. Just an amazing sound. We called the hotel operator and after she asked us what the terrible noise was, directed our call to the front desk. Without boring you with lots of details, (it is amazing how the geniuses at the front desk will try and spin a story) we got a manager on the line who at first offered 1 night "free" and then when she literally could not hear my wife on the phone because of the noise changed the offer to two "free nights". The short story was that this work was to be going on for the next 2 weeks from 9 to 5 during the day. They really had no room of our type to switch us to. We headed to the lobby to take naps that day and play on our computers (free wi-fi in the lobby) and the next day barely heard any noise. We did not hear anything on Wednesday or Thursday. The bottom-line don't put people who book rooms 6 months in advance into a room that has construction going on and not even bother mentioning it at check-in. Poor planning on the hotel's part but, again, they made it right in our opinions. The savings of $880 plus the tax that would have been charged amounted to around $1000. If not for the noise issue and how it was handled at first I would have rated our stay excellent. Yes, this hotel is expensive, especially during the busy times of the year (Spring Break) but it is so convenient to the parks (a 10 minute or so walk to IOA and even less to Universal property) and it is very lovely. All that and the before mentioned express pass inclusion was wonderful. We bypassed some lines that were over 100 minutes during our stay. The passes are our primary reason for staying "on-property". Those that try and compare the Disney fast passes to the express line are ill-informed in my opinion. We are Disney Vacation Members and love Disney for what it is but the express pass option for Universal hotel guests is awesome. We had a great time on this vacation. Our stay at the HRC was hugely responsible for our excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: boooche
Reviews.Content: We went to Universal Studios Orlando for the kids winter break and had an amazing time. We stayed at The Hard Rock Hotel at Universal. The hotel was great! It was only a short walk to both parks and City Walk. Every staff member we encountered was extremely polite and helpful. While watching a movie poolside, we asked for popcorn and even though it was not offered on the menu they brought us hot buttered popcorn. The hotel, pool and grounds were impeccable. I would definately recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Lake Grove, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “very tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim M
Reviews.Content: this hotel needs to be updated. We booked a week during my kids winter break from school. We stayed one night and left. The rooms are really small and dirty. I don't know how they get the rating they do. I had a hard time giving them a 2.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!! - This Hotel Made Our Trip To Universal Studios Great”
Reviews.Author: mnasf
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, but if you are going to Universal Studios, you cannot beat this hotel. It is close to the parks (you can walk, take a boat, or a pedicab). As a guest, you can get into Islands of Adventure an hour early (beat the crowds to Harry Potter), and you get a specail access pass that lets you spend less time in line (on all but 3 attractions)! The hotel is very nice, with a great pool with a slide, they showed a movie each evening at the pool, and the rooms were so comfortable. After a long day at the parks, it was nice to come back to the calm, quiet room. Everyone at the hotel was so nice. When we lost one of our room keys, it was not problem to get it replaced. The hotel has a little store on the first floor that sold drinks and snack. While we did not eat at the hotel, there were several choices a places to eat. The pool was very large and had a great slide. Our youngest really had a good time at the pool. While we were visiting the theme parks, we could not get over how lucky we were to be staying at this hotel and enjoying all of the privledges it offers. The parks were so busy, and it was so nice to not have to work about the lines. Next time we go back to Universal Studios, you can bet we will be staying at the Hard Rock Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “We always come back to the Hard Rock!”
Reviews.Author: Brenda J
Reviews.Content: Tried a DIFFERENT hotel this March Break and were very disappointed. The Hard Rock is one of the best in Florida! We usually stay in Club level rooms and love the extras. It is worth every penny. The customer service is truly exceptional. When it was raining outside they handed us towels as we entered the hotel. And they were very helpful with directions or reservations. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Club Level worth the upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: Donegal1968
Reviews.Content: We took the kids for a few days over a school break. Loved the Express Pass option received by staying at on on-site property and we used the early admissions to Happy Potter each day. We stayed on the Club level and thought it was worth the money as breakfast, snacks, drinks can be a budget buster with kids. Also enjoyed the gym.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay when heading to Universal”
Reviews.Author: ilovesummer2
Reviews.Content: The location, express pass and water taxis make this hotel worth the high price tag. We love Universal and Island of Adventure and during spring break express pass is the only way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: buddog245
Reviews.Content: Second time back with our family. Hotel is really well maintained. Rooms a little small but very nice. All ameneties are on site - great big pool, game room, restaurant, ice cream snack bar - and easy walk to the parks. Though not cheap, a really good value given location and fact that front-of-line passes are included with price of the room. Can't imagine anyone being disappointed with their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but good”
Reviews.Author: AIH95
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 7 day holiday here and had a great time. The hotel is a good 4 star hotel which has it's pro's and con's. Con's Parking was $17 a day plus tax which is a rip off. We had paid extra for a club room so I think club room guests should get free parking. Reception was so noisy we couldn't here the receptionist speak! (there was a live band playing which is cool just not when you're checking in) The club lounge should may be have a separate check in area to avoid long waits. If you don't get to the pool before 8.30 then all the sun beds were gone. What was particually frustrating is that most beds were reserved by people who had gone to the parks for a few hours first and would return after lunch. There are plenty of pool guards and waitressing staff around the pool they should be more observant and if a bed has not been sat on for. 40 mins or longer then they should remove all towels etc that's reserving them to make it fair. There is a dj by the pool most days which is fun but just sort the sound out so it's clear and not just noise. Pool side rooms are noisy bring earplugs!! PRO'S The staff are very friendly especially around the pool service is very attentive. Rooms are pleasant enough with all your basic amenities and extras air conditioning is a bit on the warm side though. Good hairdryer, good shower, and great coffee machine. Plenty of channels on the tv. Club Lounge is different to club lounges I've visited before but then this is a "hard rock" hotel and has a different vibe so just go with it. Breakfast in the lounge is a selection of cereal, bagels, pastry's tea coffe and juice served from 7-10 Snacks 12-15.00 included crisps and chewy bars and a selection of soft drinks. 17.00-19.00 they serve complimentary beer and wine along with nibbles such as cheese & biscuits and lots of other canapés . (this part of the day is very busy and resembles feeding time at the zoo). We didn't visit the parks this time but those who did enjoyed the fast pass that your room key provides as it was spring break the parks were packed. Free wifi by the pool and in public areas was good but not great connection but was fine for my needs. All in all we had a fantastic holiday. The hotel has room for improvement but I would definatly return as the place just has a really good vibe to it.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Air Conditioning Situation”
Reviews.Author: Jtthjones
Reviews.Content: This is so ridiculous!!! The heat is set at 74*. We've called twice after messing with the unit for hours ourself and wondering why it's not going down. It's way to hot to sleep. No where does it say you have to call down to get the temperature adjusted, then when we finally did, they don't turn it down. I go to the front desk and she just gives me crap about it being a "green" hotel and there's nothing else she can do. In the meantime, we're in our room sweating and can't sleep. Not going to make for a fun day at the parks tomorrow, when we're all exhausted and cranky. I can't believe that this is the service we get for paying $400 a night. We had a better nights sleep at the $50 hotel last night. We will NEVER be staying here again. It's also crazy that you have to pay $15 for parking, and pay for Internet in your room, $18 for a hamburger at the hotel. I could prob deal with it except its to hot to sleep and now im getting a headache and am cranky. SO NOT HAPPY right now. We stayed one night an the fast pass was a good idea as the lines were way shorter, but I'm really unhappy with the air condition situation and the not so nice employee.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: DirtyDiana67
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here for 4 nights in March. The outside is lovely, the Beach Club in particular. The pool is a maximum of 4ft deep with various areas with jacuzzi type jets. There is also a kids pool and a hot spa. Inside I would say that although the rooms are spacious and spotlessly clean, they are looking a little shabby now. In room you have free safe, hairdryer, coffee machine and TV. You can also purchase films on the TV. There is a mini bar that is very expensive. The Kitchen is good for great food but is pricey, and the Beach Club does good food too which can be served around the pool. Wifi at the pool and the lobby is free and $9.95 a day in room. We bought a 3 day pass to the Work Out Room for $20 each which gave access to a smallish but adequate gym, sauna and steam room. Staying at the Hotel automatically gives you Express passes to most rides which is why we stayed there - we waited no longer than 10 minutes on any ride even though it was Spring Break and many rides had over 90 minute waits.This does not apply to Hollywood Rip Ride Rocket or Harry Potter. You can get into the park before general admission to ride these though. Overall, a great Hotel with friendly, helpful staff, and a real feel good atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Velvet Sessions”
Reviews.Author: Kirbdo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I won two night stay at a Universal property hotel along with one day park hopper passes. We chose Hard Rock as we are locals and have never stayed here. It was a nice hotel, way kid friendlier that I thought it would be. The food served there is just okay. We attended the Velvet Sessions - Tonic concert in the lobby which was a great way to see the show. You pay an up front price and get free "specialty" drinks up until the show. The specialty drinks they offered were horrible so I ended up paying for all my drinks. Otherwise, the hotel is nice, it does need some updating in the rooms and what is with the bathroom door, you can not sit on the toilet and then decide to close the door, just doesn't work. The pool had a great atmosphere and in fact I am looking forward to going back in the heat of summer to enjoy the pool more when it is warmer outside. Would I stay here again, yes, at a discounted rate, not full price.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dornette A
Reviews.Content: First time styaing here and loved it. We traveled with 2 adults and 3 kids (16,8,6). The staff is awesome. Very kind and friendly. The hotel is spotless. Rooms are perfect. We had the best time ever. The pool is less than 4 feet in all areas, there is a live music playing, activites for the kids. I could not have had a better experience. The bonus is bypassing the long lines with the express pass from the hotel. Your room key is all you need. You can purchase food and souvenirs with the card if you leave a credit card on file. I wish there was free internet, but other than that...an amazing hotel. Oh, you can walk to Universal, Adventure Island and City Walk.

Reviews.Title: “Use it for the Express Pass but be ready to pay for everything else”
Reviews.Author: Chitownbigcityfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed because it was Spring break and we wanted the Express Pass. It costs three times what other hotels do in the area but worth it for the Express Pass since the parks were crazy busy over break. On line it did not show a AAA rate. I called and got the rate and it saved us a ton! I did ask for an email confirming the rate twice and did not get it and was worried there would be a problem at check in but did not have one. I asked for a room on a higher floor and it was not ready when we checked in which was early in the day. If we wanted the main floor we could have gotten in right away. We waited since we were going to the parks anyways. The hall ways are very long. Reminds me of Vegas hotels where you can get lost just going to your room. If you do not want to be down a long hall you might want to be near an elevator. The pool was nice. The drinks expensive as I expected. One pet pieve of mine with expensive hotels. Paying for Wi Fi. It is free at Hamptons if I am paying over $300 a night for a room it should be included. Same with parking. This is not downtown in a city where parking is a premium. Would I stay again? Only if going to Unviersal. The hotels are more themed and fun at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE EVER!”
Reviews.Author: chris g
Reviews.Content: the hard rock hotel in orlando is by far the best place to vacation. first time visiting & everyone there made it the best possible experience. the staff is extremely friendly, very outgoing & very helpful in whatever you need. great view, wonderful atmosphere - especially at the beach club-i cant wait to do it again! chris g.

Reviews.Title: “3rd stay and gets better each time”
Reviews.Author: kw05
Reviews.Content: Hi , we as a family of 3 have stayed in this hotel on 3 occasions . First time we stayed was in 2007 and it was for one night and got upgraded to club level, 2nd time we stayed was in a deluxe room on club level for 7 nights. The most recent was August 2011 for 7 nights in a garden view with club access. After getting upgraded the first time to club we found it hard not do anything else so its club for us any-more :) This is not your typical 5 star resort but its more layed back without being in your face kind of way. Rooms are clean , fresh and suits everyone's need love the coffee pod maker and always got extra hot choc of the cleaner. The only thing there is no set time for rooms to be cleaned and it can be late when they are cleaned but the was only twice out of the 7 days we were there. All staff we encountered were always smiling and seemed happy to be enjoying the job they were doing. From valet to lounge staff each would take time out to chat to ya. Lynn in the club lounge was great booking spa treatments for my mom in the portifino even given her a discount code. My mom and 2 treatments and would not recommend them for the prices they were charging. The hair dresser seemed less interested and was not great. Early entry to harry potter was a heaven given it was peak season though it amazed us at the crowds there at 7am. Club level snacks, drinks, breakfast and dessert got us through our day with very little money spent on food. Pool area is great, loads going through the day and night and there is something to keep everyone occupied. Drinks and snacks at the pool a little expensive but not that bad considering the service and location. Cabanas by the pool are a great way to spend the day by the pool and can highly recommend the Steve wonder one for location and theme. Security by the pool at weekends is strict and your room key has to be shown to gain entry. Express pass is the only way to do universal and its included with your room cost. 5min walk to parks or you can get a boat or rickshaw. It must be good if we keep going back, Thanks again to Kellen and his staff for making our stay memorable. The Walshes Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to skip the lines....”
Reviews.Author: yann y
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Hard Rock only to be allowed early in the parks and to use the express line hotel room card to skip the lines! The staff is very friendly, the hotel very clean, but we somehow expected a little more than just a typical hotel experience, and really...it never happened! But, we enjoyed our 2 days at Universal and made the most of our days in the theme parks. Our longest wait was 10 minutes and we got to ride 3 times in a row the Harry Potter Ride with no queue at all...So the price for the room makes for the extra time you get to spend on rides. The park gets crowded around 11AM so make sure you wake early and are the first one at the gate! Also, you may choose to do all the ´get wet´ rides together and go change at the hotel if the weather is not that warm. If you don’t want to get wet, I suggest you buy a plastic poncho and have it ready to use in your backpack. They sell them just about anywhere in Orlando for US$1 instead of US$ 5 or 10 in the theme parks! You will use it again in Sea World... so it’s worth buying it on your first day!

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a treat!”
Reviews.Author: vacationbuff17
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 4 night, 5 day stay at this hotel. 2 adults and 2 children (ages 8, 14) and stayed in the basic 2 doubles room. VIP service from the moment we stepped on the property. Arrived 5 1/2 hrs before we could check in and were still treated like vip customers. We were able to use the spa to change into our suits and enjoy the most amazing pool until they texted us with our room number. Our room and beds were clean, comforatble and maid service was exceptional every day. Easy 5 minute walk to the parks, water taxi avaialble but only used once. Too slow for us! We got in the parks 1 hour before openeing with room key and also served as express pass for almost all of the rides and attractions. Having the fast pass was the best part of our trip! Wouldn't ever go without it! Hotel restaurant The Kitchen had great food, but menu was pricey. Wait staff were exceptional as well. We treated ourselves to the buffet breakfast one day ($19 adults, $10 kids) and were not disappointed. An amazing buffet and worth every penny. The convience store/starbucks in the basement was overpriced ($7 for water bottle) so we just didn't go there. The poolside has a large ice cold water cooler with lemon slices filled all day long that we just used to refill our water bottles poolside. Beach Bar was great but also very expensive! Poolside activities, slide and water activities all day long for kids of all ages. DIVE in movies and night beach volleyball were a hit for our kids. All in all, would definitely stay here again just for the convenience to the parks and the friendly staff. Would pack snacks or take a trip to the Walgreens again for snacks and water bottles.

Reviews.Title: “Rocking pool, VIP service but all the extra charges did'nt make us feel like rock stars.”
Reviews.Author: Pat E
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights here over spring break. I'll start with the positives. No detail of the rock and roll theme is overlooked at this hotel. Music fans will love checking out all the rock star pictures and memorabilia. A great variety of tunes streams continuously through the lobby and pool area. The pool was spacious and well maintained and there are plenty of chairs. My kids liked the slide (pretty good size for a hotel pool). The service was exceptional from the front desk to the wait staff and everywhere else on the premesis. I disagree with some of the other revirews about the grounds not being kept up, I thought the grounds and common areas were nearly flawless. The beds were the most comfortable I've ever slept in. I am going to try and get one for home! I will agree that the rooms although fairly well appointed are small and starting to show their age. A face lift is in order to maintain a rock star status. I also didn't appreciate all the extra charges for parking, Internet and the fitness center. I realize this is par for the course at many of the area hotels but it's none the less far from rocks far from rock star treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here it's worth the speed pass if you're going to Universal!!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer J
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Hard Rock so we could be onsite and get the hour early entry and the speed pass. The room was pricey but worth it considering the great time we had at Universal by getting in early and utilizing our speed pass throughout the day. Our longest wait was probably 15 minutes. We went to Harry Potter first thing and then again at the end of the day since you couldn't use the speed pass for it and we didn't have to wait at all. The hotel was nice and the beds were especially comfy. I usually never sleep well in a hotel but their beds were so nice I slept great! Food was a little pricey breakfast for donuts/bagels and juice was $38 for 5 people and they didn't like that we ordered Papa John's pizza for dinner but we had to save money somewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed, compared to all other theme park hotels”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller915
Reviews.Content: Highly Recommended. After staying a few nights at the Grand Floridian at Disney, the Hard Rock Hotel Universal was an absolute pleasure. We found that theme park hotels felt like an absolute rip off, and as everyone says, mainly good for location and extra park hours etc. This wasn't the case with Hard Rock. We are an executive couple, and tend to have quite high expectations of hotels for decor, service, cleanliness etc. and Hard Rock ticked all the boxes. Incredibly convenient to Universal with a very nice shuttle boat service. of course you need to like the rock theme, or it may not be for you. highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Like it the First Time So We Did it Again”
Reviews.Author: sfore93392
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to the Hard Rock Orlando we actually won about 12 years ago. We decided to go again and take our adult children and their girlfriends. The hotel was still a great place to stay to expierence Universal and Island of Adventure. The Express Passes make staying there even more value added. The rooms are very comfortable and the pool area is fantastic. Our game plan was to hit the parks early morning before they got crowded and then lounge poolside for the afternoon then back to the parks. Be able to walk to the parks from the hotel is a plus. Our kids are in there mid 20's and they there is enough there to do that we new they would enjoy it and we were not wrong. Would stay there a third time.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: keanser
Reviews.Content: As most other reviews have mentioned the biggest advantage of staying at the Hard Rock is the express passes and early entry. As a stand alone Hotel it is very good but verges on being poor value for money. We booked a room which was supposedly to have a 'Garden View' but actually all we could see was a rooftop? We asked to be changed room and the next day moved to an identical room but with a much better view. The pool area was great with deck chairs always available but the pool itself wasnt great with a max depth of about 3 feet!? Must be just to cater for the many children that stay there? The staff were in general very helpful and accommodating. On the day we arrived we weren't due to check in until 4pm but they gave us dummy room keys which we could use in the parks, that was very useful as we had arrived at 8am and wanted to go straight to the Islands of Adventure. We also dined at The Palm restaurant for a special occasion and the service and food were absolutely brilliant, definitely worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Heart of the Action”
Reviews.Author: wjl51
Reviews.Content: .Great hotel for visiting the parks as you get express entrance to most rides .Hotel itself is very good with excellent memorabilia on the hotel walls. Rooms are okay two double beds tv coffee machine and mini bar .pool area is the best thing about the hotel with a water slide and sunbathing areas it also has a pool bar and a games room we had some issues at check in room was not available till 8.30 that night not acceptable for a 5 star hotel. When complained about this management did not seem interested at all. Overall a good hotel with easy access to universal parks and city walk.We have visited this hotel three times the last time in august 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Been around....”
Reviews.Author: nicholplated
Reviews.Content: Look it's fun here, food is decent, excitement level is up there, and my bartender asks "how can I make it better today", and the bartender dude (I mean dude becuz he embodies "the dude" - like he knows how to make a white Russian) is cool as the flipside of ur pillow... What do people want a ceremonial king & queen entrance with flowers flowing in the air with palm trees dancing in the night air as you enter?? Then go to Rio as a billionaire! Otherwise this place meet's and exceeds expectations by far!

Reviews.Title: “Great On-Site Experience”
Reviews.Author: trimacseb
Reviews.Content: Pros: No waiting in lines during peak time of March Break at Universal Parks with Express Pass, friendly accommodating staff with five star customer service, clean rooms with new modern furnishings, comfortable beds, good size room for family of five, upgraded room for birthday, smooth check in/check out Cons: One issue: Housekeeping did not come one day until late in the day (after 4pm); apparently the girl was stuck in meetings all day and was not able to clean her rooms The Housekeeping situation is the only reason I'm rating it a 4 rather than 5 star experience because in all other respects our experience at the hotel met or exceeded our expectations. We went to celebrate my son's 15th birthday and the hotel did a great job of making him feel special including a room upgrade (which we appreciated), a slice of birthday cake and a free sundae (both which he loved!). My family of five (11, 13 & 15 yr olds) loved everything about the resort. The music/entertainment that played in the pool area kept us all enjoying the experience despite the cool, cloudy weather. The Express Pass though was the best (free with hotel stay on site) - we never waited in any lines in the height of March Break on a Friday and Saturday. The equivalent cost of the Express Pass is the cost of the room for one night. We ate dinner at an italian restaurant at Portofino Bay which was recommended by the concierge. It was good although not great but what I would expect both price and food wise on a resort. For us, we felt that in seeing both resorts, we would again go back to the Hard Rock as it seemed a little more in keeping with the age and interests of our kids.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, excellent staff, great place!”
Reviews.Author: HudsonValleyMan
Reviews.Content: If you're visiting Orlando's Islands of Adventure or Universal Studios and looking for an on-property hotel, this is a great place to stay. It's a little pricey, but for the convenience and amenities it's well worth it. Both theme parks are literally a short stroll from the property; if you're too tired to walk from all the sightseeing there's a complimentary shuttle boat which seats about 40-50 people making regular runs from the rear of the hotel to Citywalk, an area offering restaurants and nightlife adjacent to the theme parks. Your room key acts as a fast pass to avoid long lines in the theme parks and also gets you admission to the parks an hour earlier than people staying off property. Back at the Hard Rock, the pool area is a great place to hang for the day; it has a beautiful large pool (the only drawback being that it has no areas deeper than about four feet), several hot tubs, a sand volleyball court, ping pong tables, an outdoor bar/restaurant, cabanas, and tons of staff to bring you food and drink right to your beach chair. I traveled with my teens and they loved everything about the experience. The only drawbacks we experienced were some of the food prices; for example, a plain bagel is $3.00 in the convenience shop, the restaurant breakfast buffet is close to $20 per person, etc. Other than the extra money you'll have to fork over for some overpriced food and drink items you'll enjoy the experience. The staff is great, the whole hotel is clean, and the location is ideal. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Royal Pacific Instead”
Reviews.Author: 8675309bergman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock three nights during Spring Break. The early admission to Islands of Adventure is a big plus. We also stayed one night at Royal Pacific and I would pick RP over Hard Rock if we could do it over again. There seemed to be more activities for kids, better food in the restaurants, and service just seemed a step up at Royal Pacific and it was slightly cheaper than Hard Rock too. We ate the first night late in “The Kitchen” and service was slow with refills, the complimentary bread they were bringing never arrived, quesadillas were bland, and chicken on my BBQ pizza was tough. My son liked his kid’s cheese pizza though. A better option would have been to make the 10 minute walk over to City Walk and eat at the Hard Rock Café there – it had much better food. We ate at the pool restaurant too. The waiter did not inform us soda refills were not free so our bill came to $70 for one adult and two children to eat lunch and over half of that was just in beverage charges. The hummus was awful and the quesadillas were the same bland ones we had in “The Kitchen.” The room was slightly larger at Hard Rock but most of that is in the bathroom which had two sinks, tub, and toilet all in one room which made it inconvenient for two people to be getting ready at the same time. I liked having the sink separate from the toilet/bath at the Royal Pacific. My boys enjoyed the slide at the pool but had more fun on the “water park” at Royal Pacific. We would go back but would definitely stay at the Royal Pacific next time.

Reviews.Title: “A bit Pricey - but well worth it”
Reviews.Author: CravingSun
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during peak season in March. Great hotel, with a great pool and many conveniences including proximity to parks and express passes included. Kids really enjoyed themselves both at the parks and at the hotel. Ate at the Kitchen restaurant only for breakfast as was included for two adults as part of our rate.
