As long as you have breakfast between 7am and 9am , only $5 for each child 12 and under for a full breakfast. Overall a fun time and we were very lucky to also have had incredible weather for the majority of the week. Kids already asking when we can go back again !

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: sdahl
Reviews.Content: We were impressed by the high quality of service from everyone we encountered. The only problem was the rain all day. I have to agree with most of the reviews, you stay here for the convenience and location for the parks. I did find it a bit pricey for everything, happy hour from 5-7 in the Velvet Room was a deal and the room key express pass is a must during peak season.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location but expensive”
Reviews.Author: H M
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel, great location and can't beat the "Express Pass" and convenience to the parks and City Walk. Our room was clean, the beds were comfortable and the hotel was not as noisy as I had anticipated, after reading some of the reviews. We had the Hard Rock All Access Pass and were given an upgrade to a pool view room when we checked in. The room was not ready yet, but were told it should be ready soon. We checked our bags and went down to eat at The Kitchen, as it was raining. We waited over 2 hours for our room, but our room was not available until after 5pm - over a 3 hour wait. We were give Breakfast vouchers for the inconvenience. When we were finally informed our room was ready it was not the room we were promised and had been waiting for (even a different floor) and we also were not give a free cot for the 5th person like we were promised. Once we checked into our room, everything went better from then on. Like some of the Disney Deluxe hotels, I liked the water taxi's to the Universal parks. We were so busy we didn't get to enjoy the hotel and pool area as much as we would have liked, but the kids weren't real impressed with the shallow pool anyway. Everyone was very friendly. It was our son's birthday and the hotel sent up a piece of birthday cake, candle and matches - very nice! I know we paid a premium price for this hotel because of location and being peak spring break season. I'm really glad we stayed here, although don't know if we will be able to stay here again at that price.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Janet L
Reviews.Content: Great location, excellent service, rooms and everything in the hotel. The kitchen restaurant is pricey for the quality and variety of the food, staff is extremely courteous, pleasing guests, the express pass is a plus, you can ride one of the parks in half a day and go the other one, harry potter regular line had a two hours waiting time, guest from hard rock are allowed to ride it before the park open to regular public, overall trip was amazing nothing bad to say about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location, but lacking the basics of customer service”
Reviews.Author: KCHolle
Reviews.Content: I'm in the travel industry, so I understand that "upgrade subject to availability" means, during spring break, you're more than likely not going to get an upgrade. That being said, I purchased the VIP Access Pass through Hard Rock in the hopes that I might get a room upgrade for my vacation. My husband and I traveled with another couple and arrived prior to check-in. When we registered, we inquired about the upgrade and were told that the hotel was fully committed. We understood but, when we came away from the front desk, the other couple told us they were asked if we'd like adjoining rooms. At that point, I was confused and, quite frankly, upset. If they couldn't offer an upgrade, how could they offer adjoining rooms? If they're booked, they're booked. So, when the rooms became ready, we again asked about an upgrade and again were told nothing was available. Being in the industry, I was expecting to be offered to be put on a list for a possible upgrade during our stay, but got nothing other than, "We're fully booked, here are your room keys." When we looked at the keys, we saw the name of the other couple on the folio. No apology, no nothing; they simply crossed out the room number and wrote the correct one on it...or so we thought. When the other couple tried to call us and gave our name to the operator, she insisted she couldn't connect them because the front desk had them listed as us, and vice versa. When our friends tried to get into their room initially, they had been given 2 sets of keys...one that didn't work (which were actually to OUR room) and their set. Just poor, poor front desk service all the way around. When we got off the elevator, the hallway carpet was absolutely filthy, and I thought we were in for the stay from hell, what with the problems with the front desk already setting an extremely negative tone for the start of the vacation. However, when we opened the door to the room, I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were bright, clean, fresh, large, and appeared to have been recently renovated. Ours was the last room on the end, and I thought the stairway noise would be overwhelming, but we had absolutely no noise trouble whatsoever. The beds were the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept on, and I have a Sleep Number bed at home. The early entry to Islands of Adventure, not to mention the Fast Pass, was a great added perk, too. Overall, I'd definitely stay here again; I'd just lower my expectations of the service.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad, and the awful”
Reviews.Author: pattiwilkinson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights for Spring Break with 2 adults & 3 kids. We stayed here one other time 2 years ago for Spring Break and had no issues. The Good - Express pass to all the rides at Universal - No need to rent a car - Easy access to all Universal and CityWalk - Friendly service at coffee shop downstairs & great bartenders at Velvet Bar - Nice pool The Bad - Eating or drinking at hotel is very expensive - Awful service at pool bar/restaurant. A lot of "I don't care" attitudes from employees - Rooms (see below) - Pool area too noisy if you're trying to just relax The Awful When we arrived we decided we might do better in a kid suite rather than trying to cram 5 into a standard room. We asked for an upgrade which cost us an $150 extra per night (this is on top of the $375 or so per night we had already paid). The furniture in the room was very worn and dirty. The sofa sleeper had questionable dried white stains on it on the cushions and dried booger looking stuff on the side. GROSS! Would not expect anyone to sit on this, let alone sleep on it. How does this type of thing get by housekeeping? Reported the problem and was put in a different suite. This one wasn't much better. No gross looking stains on the sofa, but still very dirty & dusty. Obviously hadn't been cleaned in quite some time. Worn out upholstery and sagging cushions. Mold in bathrooms, broken shower door, scratched up furniture. Problems are not just wear & tear, but cleanliness. Ended up putting sheets on the sofa & chair so we could at least sit on them. I felt like I should report the issues directly to management (Steve) to make sure they were aware of their housekeeping issues and at least voice my dissatisfaction with the condition of the accomodations. He offered to move us again, but after seeing 2 bad rooms, figured a 3rd wouldn't be any different. He compensated us by cutting upgrade fee in 1/2 for the 1st night, comping the rollaway (it would have been an extra $25 per night) and giving us $200 in hotel comps to use around the property. No compensation was on the bill the night before we checked out so had to go to front desk to get it worked out which involved pulling manager back in for verification. He didn't recall what he had told us two days earlier because he had forgotten to make a note on the account. Took awhile to get it squared away. Hard Rock needs some attention. When I pay $400/night for a hotel room, I expect it, first and foremost, to be clean, no matter what the room cost. That said, if cleanliness is important to you, you might want to consider one of the other two on-site hotels until Hard Rock bucks up and deals with their housekeeping issues and updates the rooms. Really disappointed. Loved this place 2 years ago when it was showing a bit of wear and tear but at least it was clean. We won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “School of Hard Rock . . .”
Reviews.Author: Mis_Adventurous
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best "Universal" properties on the strip . . . being within walking distance of the park attractions, shopping, and restaurants is a huge plus. The staff at the Hard Rock are always accommodating and friendly. This was our second stay at the Hard Rock and we made sure to ask for a room at the FAR END of the hall away from the elevators and "snack room." If you have teenagers, you understand the IMPORTANCE of being able to sleep in a little later! Now, I would like to make a few suggestions to the hotel . . . during Spring Break, it is imperative to staff housekeeping so that your guests don't return after a long day out, only to find that the room has not been serviced! This happened (4) out of (7) days during our stay. Secondly, who builds a hotel with MOTION ACTIVATED A/C? Yes, this is correct . . . so, when you wake up in a cold sweat . . . it wasn't a nightmare about that roller coaster . . . it is the A/C which has turned off since no one MOVES while they are sleeping. Our unit was actually broken, but was serviced immediately. The "club level" is a great idea when traveling with kids with big appetites . . . I would definitely recommend this floor. Again, the housekeeping should be prepared to remove the plates littering the hallway throughout the day. We had a tray sitting outside our door for (2) days! The POOL . . . nice, heated and not too deep. The seating can get competitive . . . so, be prepared. I was a little miffed by the idea that our family could not use a small, soft ball that we'd brought along . . . only "toys" PURCHASED poolside may be used! This seemed a little greedy. The food selections on the menu were all really tasty and there are plenty of options for fruit and other "healthy" items, but for the most part it's regular old junk food, but good junk food! The wait staff are all very friendly and helpful in choosing food and drinks. Now, the chairs are a totally different story . . . they were sticky and many even had "USED" band-aids stuck to them . . . come on guys . . . part of maintaining a pool area is cleaning the chairs and removing trash . . . this includes used bandages. The snack area just inside the hotel on the pool level has all sorts of items for breakfast and lunch. I was really hopeful that there would be a few more healthy selections, but it's mostly donuts, bagels, and giant flavored milks that no child can finish. Again, during the "high season," the ONE check out person who seemed confused as to where all the people were coming from . . . clearly, needed some assistance. The valet has a new TEXT system for retrieving your car from the outskirts, however, this system only worked sporadically. I felt really badly for these guys . . . they are always very helpful and it definitely was not their fault that the TEXT method wasn't working. They simply were not receiving the messages. So, overall I would recommend this hotel to friends. However, I would hope that the management would pay closer attention to detail and staff appropriately during busy times.

Reviews.Title: “Rock Out at the Hard Rock in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Glenda P
Reviews.Content: Absolutely excellent service from all aspects. We could not have had a better hotel for our Universal stay. Hats off to the Hard Rock staff...friendly, courteous...made everyone in our family feel special.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL ALTHOUGHT A BIT PRICEY”
Reviews.Author: 477laurab1976
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February 2011, the rooms, service and everything about the hotel was wonderful. The prices of meals and drinks are a bit pricey though.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: KSUProud
Reviews.Content: We arrived late afternoon and checked in and were lucky that our room was ready. We were greeted by every staff member we saw and I was very impressed with how quick check in occurred. We were only staying for one night so we could enjoy Universal and so we headed right over to the parks to start enjoying our express passes. After a late dinner, we were surprised to come back to our room and have a delightful treat waiting for us. It was a lovely surprise. The rooms were fine and I found them to be very quiet. We are really picky about noise levels when we sleep and didn't have any problem. We only wish we'd known about their guitar program earlier in our stay. Our son would have loved to try out a fender. We will definitely stay here again and try to take advantage of more of the amenities. The express pass was worth the extra cost of staying here. We ran into friends at the park who rode 3 rides in 4 hours and we'd been on that many in 30-45 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but very loud.”
Reviews.Author: MSusie
Reviews.Content: You can't beat Hard Rock's location, but after a day at the park it would be nice to relax at the pool. I ended up with a headache, the music was so loud. Even my teenagers thought it was too loud. The first day I was there, I heard several people ask for the music to be turned down - they did eventually turn it down and the next two days were better. I stopped by the other on-site hotel to see what the noise level was like.....so peaceful!! Bottom line, if you like loud music by the pool (and in the lobby, snack bar, restaurant, etc.) Hard Rock is the place for you. If you like to relax or read at the pool, choose one of the other on-site hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great time and location”
Reviews.Author: mugszack
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days on site and had a great time the location makes this hotel the best. We stayed at Royal Pacific and that was great as well. Hard rock was better because we had teenagers which really enjoyed the site. Food was great at the Beach club but service was slow and meals and drinks got lost at times. We ate at the beach club on arrival and food was excellent, as for the kitchen no so slow service appetizer arrived with the meal waitress talked to the table beside us and then remembered our meal. Should of walked out this was the poorest of the three restaurants we ate at Momma Mia in Portafino and the Royal pacific meals were 10 times better. Would like to thank the bartender in the Velvet room can't remember his name but his wine and drink knowledge was excellent. Plan on going back again try different restaurants. Safe was not working my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Just arrived...... Excellent so far !!”
Reviews.Author: golfandsunluvrs
Reviews.Content: We arrived yesterday at 1:30PM. We were pleasantly surprised to find out that not only was our room ready but we had also been upgraded!! We also received free WIFI in our room for being Hard Rock All Access members. When we arrived back in our room last night there was a beautiful fruit bowl, a bottle of Hard Rock cashews and 2 bottles of Hard Rock water waiting for us . Also 3 very cute Hard Rock key chains which my son loved , courtesy VIP services. We are hardly VIP's ...... Just regular people . It would seem that joining the All Access program is well worth it and being polite and friendly to the front desk staff goes a long way also. We are here for 7 nights so I will review again after we get home . Book this hotel , it is awesome !!

Reviews.Title: “What an Amazing week. Thank you Hard Rock Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kirstie m
Reviews.Content: just come back from a 8 day stay at the Hard Rock Hotel and what a fantastic Hotel. From the minute we arrived till the minuite we left the staff and services was out of this world. The food was excellent from the pool and restaurants, we couldnt have asked for more. Being from London it took a while to get used to everyone being so polite and friendly. we also had the Express passes for universal which was excellent and used the free boat service to both Parks which was a great added bonus. The rooms were lovely and had lots of space for the 5 of us. Beds were comfortable and the rooms were very cleaned and well kept. house keeping ladies were all very friendly as well. The pool was beautiful with great music and plenty of life guards which makes you feel more comfortable with the children in the pool. All in alll the Hard Rock and Orlando is a fantastic Place. And i would def return again. Thank you for an amazing stay x

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun - Great Location-Great Service”
Reviews.Author: MaryBeth5150
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a wonderful vacation at the Hard Rock. The Kid's Suites are perfect for our family and the room was always clean and tidy - no easy accomplishment with my two boys!!! The staff were all very friendly and helpful and the dinner we had at The Kitchen was excellent. Room service is also exceptional - food was great, served beautifully, and very quickly. In all, I would recommend this hotel highly. This was our second stay and we were certainly not disappointed. The only issue I have is that I think the Concierge Lounge needs to be better "policed" for lack of a better word. We chose to upgrade to this level and it was worth it for the breakfast, snacks, drinks, and evening offerings that were provided. However, I suspect that many of the individuals partaking in this benefit were not paying for it. We observed as people would try their cards in the door or wait until someone left to come in. The door was kept open quite often and it was frustrating to go to the lounge at times only to find that there were no PB and J sandwiches nor chips. This is my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Great benefits - mediocre room”
Reviews.Author: akmnyc
Reviews.Content: A room at the hard rock comes with an express pass to universal and early entry to Islands of Adventure. These two benefits alone make it worthwhile to pay the extra $ for the hotel. That being said, the rooms are far from luxurious and are a bit dated (and not in an intentional retro style). The hotel does not provide free internet access and it feels a bit like being nickled and dimed when paying $450+ per night. We stayed in a garden view room that overlooked the front entry and noise was not an issue at all. The room was very quiet except there's no threshold under the door and the hallways can get loud when people are coming/going from their rooms and yelling down the hall.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Cindy B
Reviews.Content: We just left the Hard Rock Hotel in Orlando at Universal Studios and we loved it. We stayed for 3 nights at the beginning of our Canadian March Break with 2 boys aged 8 and 13. We are now staying at a Marriott elsewhere in Florida and the kids are missing the Hard Rock and to be honest so am I. The room was awesome (we had a Kids Suite - 2 bedrooms and a living room area). It was clean, the beds were heavenly and the internet was fast. (These are the things I am missing at the Marriott right now). Also, it was so much fun, the music at the pool was great, the restaurant outside was very good, the movies at the pool at night were a big hit with the kids, the Emil restaurant where you could just run in and get quick food worked great when you were on your way to the park. That was just the time we spent at the hotel but it is a perfect location to visit the park. You can walk in 10 mins or take a water taxi or get a bike taxi. The hotel in on the park site so you can get in 1 hour before the park opens to the public which allowed us to get to the Harry Potter World before the crowds, we did not have to wait to get on the rides there at all. Then when the park opened and it did get a little busier, our hotel room key can be used as an express pass for the rides so we really did not wait in lines much at all and it was Canadian March Break, I thought there would be long lines! Overall, we would definately go again! Cindy Pickering, Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Rest up for the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: Jillian V
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is beautiful, food is good and the location is perfect for visiting Universal. The problem is the noise you hear from your room. We have stayed at this hotel twice. The first time we didn't get to sleep until after 3:00 a.m. because of the noise. Lots of partying during the Halloween Horror Nights we thought . . . We tried again last weekend and we had no peace until after 2:00 a.m. only to staff wake us up at 8:30 to ask when we were leaving! We had the kid's suite and that was a great perk, but never again will we stay there. It's back to the Portofino for our family.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock Hotel really rocks!!”
Reviews.Author: eferg_11
Reviews.Content: This is our first time staying in the Hard Rock and we had a fabulous time. It is the perfect setting for teenage children. The hotel staff are extremely friendly and helpful. We stayed on the Club floor which has its own lounge which provides breakfast, snacks and soft drinks, wine and beer in the evening and light appetizers. The lounge itself is fairly basic but has the great advantage of being able to have a quick breakfast before heading to the parks. The soft drinks were a bonus bearing in mind that a bottle of water in the room was $7! We had interconnecting rooms and the beds were really comfy. Staying at the hotel gives you the advantage of early access to the park an hour before it opens which was fantastic for getting into Islands of Adventure to do Harry Potter. It also gives you Express pass on to the rides which is an absolute bonus. The hotel also provides complimentary water taxis to the parks. The hotel also has a library of guitars which are free to borrow with a substantial deposit held on your credit card - for our 16 year old son this was one of the highlights of the trip. If you have time to linger, breakfast at the Kitchen was great. The Velvet Lounge is great for some adult time and an evening nightcap. Bri gave us the best service. Of the three hotels at the resort the Hard Rock is closest to the parks. The Beach Club is a great place for lunch - the whole pool area has a buzz about it. Free wireless internet is only available in the lobby - we were disappointed it was not included in the room and there is a daily charge. We had a wonderful time and will be back . . . .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: ZoeKe
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for Universal (Harry Potter fans!), great room (size, style and cleanliness) fantastic pool area - we just loved everything about it. Our 7 year old daughter thought it was the 'coolest place ever!'. Personally we think the Hard Rock is the best of the 3 Universal Hotels. Can't wait to come and stay here again! And, staying at the resort hotels have such bonuses - in particular queue jumping in the parks!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but definitely not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: helenesq
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during President's week. The rooms were nice, comfy beds & kept quite clean but not any different than any other hotel. There are no refrigerators in the rooms, unless you want to pay $15 extra to request one. There are public laundry facilities on the 2nd & 4th floors. There is a Keurig coffeemaker in the room with supplied coffee, tea & hot cocoa, which is replenished daily. The bathroom is very very compact. However, there is an additional sink/mirror outside the bathroom so that two people can be getting ready at the same time. My most major complaint during our stay was that there was a noise coming out of a large vent in the room which hindered our sleep, even for my 10 year old. We had to muffle it with pillows but you could still hear it. We purposely did not turn on the air-conditioning for this reason but still had the constant noise. The hotel was packed to capacity so we were unable to change our rooms. Another negative was that when I made my reservations, they would not honor an internet special of 15% off reservations because they said they had reached their maximum number of special rates (even though that was not mentioned in the email or website). I then asked to use my AAA card & they would not honor that either for the same reason, which is really unfair. I have never had my AAA card declined for hotel reservations before for a hotel that typically accepts it. The pool area is nice but not as big as it looks. There were two days in which we walked around for ten minutes and could not find loungers. The loungers are placed so close together that you are practically on top of the person next to you. There is a sandy area of the pool which to me was a negative because when you enter the pool, it feels gritty on your feet from all the sand. There is a Beachclub outdoor eatery & although we normally like to eat poolside, the music there was blaringly loud & prevented us from doing so. The music was a bit loud in general in the pool area. I know it is the Hard Rock but some of us actually would like to relax quietly after a day at the parks. Another negative was that they allow smoking at certain sections near the pool, which I did not like. Sometimes we only found loungers in a smoking area & were stuck breathing in other people's smoke. On the plus side, the location to Universal cannot be beat & was the sole reason we stayed here. It is about a 5 minute walk to both parks & Citiwalk. Water taxis ran approx. every 8 - 10 minutes & were very convenient after all the walking at the parks. The ride & walk there is very scenic & beautiful. They do allow you early access to the parks for staying onsite HOWEVER the only thing open is the Wizarding World of Harry Potter from 8 am to 9am, before the park opens. However, to our dismay, we got up early to go to Harry Potter & arrived at 8:40 only to find non-hotel guests already being allowed into the park at that time. It was not even clear which line hotel guests were to enter, so even though we got to Harry Potter at 8:45, there were already a ton of non-hotel guests there & we ended up waiting 45 minutes just for Harry Potter. Not cool. There is a place on the first floor were you can buy snacks, ice cream, bagels & cereal food, however, it was expensive. A bagel was $3.50, which is outrageous. They have large water bottles for $4.50 and $6, again too expensive. Water at the parks was $2.75. We brought our own mini thermos & filled it with water & ice from the sink & icemaker. They do sell mini pints & half-pints of milk. We ate at the Kitchen restaurant, which was very good. Our favorite meals during our stay were at the Hard Rock Cafe restaurant, NBA City restaurant & Mythos at IOA, which I highly recommend for it's awesome interior atmosphere & food to match. They are usually open for lunch & on some evenings for dinner. I preferred them more for dinner but call ahead to see if they will even be open for dinner. All the restaurants/shops throughout Universal, IOA & City Walk honor AAA so be sure to use it! Also, there is no supermarked/drugstore within short walking distance, so if you do not have a car, be sure to bring enough toiletries with you.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Property!”
Reviews.Author: miami33029
Reviews.Content: Wow. This hotel is incredible. The pool is awesome. Especially the underwater music. It's not inexpensive by any means, but if you take into account the early admission privileges for Harry Potter and the Express Pass ability with each room key, it's definitely the way to go. The breakfast buffet at the Kitchen is awesome. All of the staff were terrific and the ferry shuttle makes park access a breeze. We'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel ...Club Level”
Reviews.Author: brazilgirl
Reviews.Content: The word that comes to mind is Hip...in every way. The decor , the fabulous pool , the great music , the attractive staff. The whole atmosphere is just oozing cool. We stayed for four days at Club Level. The rooms were nice...I really liked the decor. However the bathrooms were small and uninspired. We had 2 rooms , 1 with a pool view . Very pretty. The lounge for CL was good for our big groups....there was a computer and constant videos. At night , hot appetizers were available. The CL at the WDW Boardwalk was without a doubt better food /service) but the Hard Rock lounge had a fun vibe. The absolute best thing was the " fast pass " available for resort guests at the Universal parks. That alone makes your stay well worth it. And the great pool with music pumped in underwater We all really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “The hard rock hotel rocked!!”
Reviews.Author: Plustwokids
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in June 2011 to take advantage of the front of line passes and early entry to Harry Potter World, and boy was it worth it aside from a fantastic room in a great location , to be able to walk up and ride immediately was a refreshing change from queuing at Disney. we had a couple of full on days in Universal and loved coming back to the hotel and chilling out in the pool watching a film on the big screen. the room was fine for our family of four for a couple of nights, I wouldnt recommend it for any longer than that , but we had a spacious villa to return to , although if the budget would have stretched we would have loved a few more nights but in a suite! All the staff we dealt with were excellent and we will return on our next trip hopefully for a longer stay !

Reviews.Title: “loved our stay; club level rocked!”
Reviews.Author: jenlikesrocks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose Universal Studios for our anniversary trip this year. We had never been, and I am a huge Harry Potter fan, so my husband humored me for this trip :) We had a blast! We booked a room at the Hard Rock specifically because of the off season deal prices, and the fact that your room key doubles as a fast pass for all the rides. This alone is worth staying on property, it saved us so much time and it was great being able to ride things as many times as we wanted. There are a couple of rides it doesn't apply to but we didn't have a problem anyway (although it WAS off season, as I said). When we checked in, we mentioned to the desk staff we were there for our anniversary and they upgraded us to a club level suite at no charge. This was completely unexpected and so appreciated! It totally made our stay. Being able to enjoy free breakfast, free snacks/water/soda, free alcohol at happy hour, and free dessert/snack every night was such a nice perk. Even if we didn't get this free, I would say it was worth the price for next time. The day of check out, our flight didn't leave until later in the evening, so we checked our bags. One of the perks of staying here is that anything you buy in the parks, you can have sent back to your room so you don't have to carry it around all day. As we were leaving our room, they brought us some bags of things that weren't ours. It ended up being a mix up with another guess miswriting their room number as ours, but as an apology for the "inconvenience", the staff gave us 2 free buffet breakfast vouchers for the Kitchen restaurant downstairs. Since we were checking out we asked if we could use them for lunch instead, and they couldn't do that. Instead, they offered us drink coupons for the restaurant or Beach Club. This was more than enough for us since it was such a minor inconvenience, so we got to enjoy a delicious lunch at the Kitchen, and then some free drinks. I read someone else's review that the mixed drinks are poured lightly and I have to disagree - ours were quite strong (and very good). Overall this was a wonderful stay for us. I'd stay here again the next time we visit Orlando, and we've recommended the hotel to many friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Arvid2012
Reviews.Content: Not the biggest room for the price in the area, but the benefits by staying at this hotel are priceless. The early admission to Harry Potter World and the Express access to most of the attractions in the parks are absolutely worth the extra price. So basically, if you are there to visit the Universal parks it is a fantastic hotel. If not, you could probably get a better deal on a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the price :)”
Reviews.Author: mandychats
Reviews.Content: It seems expensive to stay at the Hard Rock, but with the added benifits of getting into Universal an hour early to spend at Harry Potter World and the VIP express access to the other rides means the hotel is a normal price. Great heated pool with a small slide for the little ones. Musi, entertainment or movies on the pool side ment it was great to relax after the day in the park. We took the free water bus to City walk or it was just a 10 minute walk through loverly grounds. If you are planning on doing Universal then stay here for 2+ nights :)

Reviews.Title: “expensive , but worth it if you are going to Universal theme parks”
Reviews.Author: maryannbg
Reviews.Content: The Hotel rooms are nice but not what you would expect for the price. What you are paying for is to be within walking distance of Islands of Adventure and Universal studios.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place/Great Staff - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Sonicolone
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Hard Rock Orlando with our three kids. The resort was kind enough to upgrade our room at no cost, and the entire experience was positive. The pool and common areas were tons of fun for our kids ages 9, 7 & 5 and the location right next to the parks cant be beat. The staff was extremely friendly and the room was super comfy. We typically stay at the Royal Pacific, but now that our kids are older, this will be where we stay when in Orlando. Really an awesome stay - highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Karen W
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 4 day stay at the Hard Rock with kids (8,10 & 12). Did both parks in two days with no problem and had some time in the evening to swim in pool, kids loved the waterslide the dive in movies. We stayed on the club level in a standard room with cot. I thought the room was clean, bathroom nice and big. It was a tight squeeze for 5 people but we new it would be and we managed for the short time we were there. The club level was well worth the money. The service and food far exceeded my expectations. I thought selection was great and it was a nice bonus to have throughout the day. Breakfast was a nice assortment of breads,cereal, fruits and oatmeal...something for everyone I thought. Didn't use service at noon because we were in the parks. Evening assortment of foods was great for the kids with potstickers, beef sticks, meatballs etc...and they always had some nice cut up vegies & hummus on the healthier side and of coarse a glass of wine or beer to end the day. Most of the time the service was great. . We didn't want to leave...wished we had more time by the pool listening to the great music! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly a good experience with some room for improvements”
Reviews.Author: GettinBye
Reviews.Content: Arrival at the hotel was easy. I was traveling with my two sons (10, 12). We arrived at noon and I appreciated that our room was ready. Our check-in was easy BUT I had paid for concierge level and the keys had the elevator admittance code. This wasn't a problem at all but the front desk guy said NOTHING about how level 7 floors worked, how to use your key to get there or what was offered on how we make the most of the EXPENSIVE upgrade. Very poor. I have stayed concierge level before but it was very poor service to not review with the customer how to make the most of it. Was I asked if I wanted any meal reservations? No. Was I asked if I had any questions on how to make the most of my stay? No. I may as well have been checking into a Holiday Inn Express. The room? Just a normal hotel room. I wasn't blown away by it at all. Concierge level rooms are often bigger and cushier. This really wasn't. Bathroom was basic. Clean, though, which of course is important. It was similar to a Marriott type room. We headed to the Concierge room to get some water and snacks before heading out to Universal. This is my biggest complaint about the hotel. The concierge eating room was very small by most other hotel standards, and our "snacks" was trail mix. The bottles of water were convenient and helpful, but I was totally underwhelmed by the array of food/snacks. We had last stayed at the Animal Kingdom Concierge level and it was MUCH nicer. So as not to beat a dead horse, all in all, the concierge level at this hotel is NOT at all worth the expense. In the mornings, when breakfast is being served, it is Soooo crowded. Breakfast was the good meal but if you crunch the numbers, you'd have to stick AWFULLY close to this room during your stay to get your money's worth. The Happy Hour is quick and packed up quicker. Do I think this service at this particular hotel is worth it? No. That said, the women who worked in there were very friendly and welcoming, and that's always nice. The vibe of the hotel is cool. Lots of loud music playing which I loved. My kids thought the music was uncool, but for my age demographic? I loved it. The pool........ warm? yes. Clean? yes. Kids were so bummed out that there was no deep end. I can appreciate how this appeals to parents with younger children, but for a tween? They got bored quickly. The slide is just okay. I think they each went down twice and that was that. They bought a $6.75 beach ball and that bought me an hour. Service around the pool is excruciatingly slow. Spend your money on beer or wine. The mixed drinks were poured very lightly. The biggest perk (and for a guest in a regular room vs. concierge level) is the proximity to Universal and to City Walk but mostly the EXPRESS PASS associated with you being a guest at this hotel. It saved us literally hours. We kept repeatedly saying, "Wow, this is great!! We are saving so much time". Would I stay here again? Yes. Would I stay Concierge level? Definitely No. But all in all a very fun few days with no major glitches.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Elizabethpt
Reviews.Content: We went to the Hard Rock with our 2 children 10&13 to meet up with some friends. It is a great hotel with nice rooms (my kids say the rooms smell like candy and I agree). The hotel has upscale, casual and snack bar options for dining. We had lunch twice at the poolside restaurant and it was great. I have to say every staff member we encountered from check in, wait staff, pool, cleaning,gym were extremely friendly and courteous. Honestly I rarely see this level of courtesey outside of the Caribbean. The location is a 10 min walk to City Walk and Universal/Islands of adventure. Ultra convenient to get to parks and restaurants/ bars without needing a car. I recommend this hotel and will stay there again. My only criticism is that security is a bit lax. It would not be at all difficult to hang out there and not be a hotel guest. Be mindful of your valuables.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock Hotel Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Mae4545
Reviews.Content: So clean. Very close to universal resorts. Free shuttles. Great service. Huge pool. The hotel is a bit pricy but you get a great experience with front of the line passes at both parks. The only complaint i have is i dont think for what you pay that WIFI should cost extra. Food is really good also. Would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel for families !!!”
Reviews.Author: kg34
Reviews.Content: Hard rock hotel exceeded my expectations all around. Traveled with family of four with 2 kids ages 13 and 9 -- staff and service was excellent , catered to every request we had, so many activities around for kids to be kept busy while parents relax whether it's poolside or in main hotel. Staff very friendly and helpful !!! I would highly recommend this hotel to all my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Comfortable but be careful with billing”
Reviews.Author: redstone1365
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed in two connecting rooms at the Universal Hard Rock Hotel when we went to visit Universal Studios in Orlando. The room was not that big but it was spacious enough for our family. The rooms were very clean and we even had a view of the garden which was serene and peaceful. I was expecting when we were given a room on the second floor that it would have a dull,boring view of a building/wall but instead it was quiet and had lovely view of the greens. The beds were the best, you'll feel really rested each time you wake up. The room has two lavatories, one in the bathroom and another one just outside the bathroom which was very convenient. Our rooms were equipped with a coffee making machine that came with a variety of coffee capsules all for free. You can even ask for more if you wish. Room service was courteous, fast and efficient. We asked for some plates and cutleries and immediately we were sent several sets (we're five) more than enough for what we asked for. The location can't be beat. You can either walk (10 minutes) to the park or take the ferry which comes every so often. They offer the best deal of having to use your room key as an express pass to most of the rides which could save you a LOT of time. Waiting was a thing of the past. Just for this privilege alone was worthy enough of staying inside the Universal Studio otherwise it would cost you something like more than $50 per person if you purchase the express pass when staying outside the park. We ate in one of their restaurants. It was of good value but some dishes were quite salty for our taste. The only lowdown in our stay was the billing. We were inappropriately and erroneously billed. It was very clear on our checkout how much our bill was. We were charged also for mini bar items we did not use. That we thought was already cleared out and reversed when we were checking out because the receptionist at that time made sure she did and we saw it on our billing statement. When we got home, we were surprised that we were being charged with so much more than what we should pay for (the mini bar and a room charges we could not understand. We called and emailed the hotel to clear things out and they too accepted the mistake. We were there last October 2011, and it's now almost the end of February 2012 and there was no refund until now. During our last conversation, the hotel representative wanted us to make the necessary arrangements with our bank (which was not supposed to be because they were the one who billed us wrongly) and wanted us to call them (the hotel), and have a three-way conversation with the bank, the hotel and myself. This was very unprofessional considering it was their mistake. If not for that, I would have given this hotel a 5. Overall, I would still recommend this hotel but I would advise you to take extra precaution with your bill before you leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Universal Parks”
Reviews.Author: Baronsboy
Reviews.Content: Had 3 nights here whilst doing the Universal Parks and Wet n Wild. Great location and a very friendly, comfortable hotel. Kids suite perfect for the four of us - giving kids and adults a bit of privacy. Didnt really need fast passes as the parks were relatively quiet - but can imagine a real bonus at busy times. Nice to have early entry to Harry Potter park. Kids loved the pool and slide. Found breakfast expensive but great choices - otherwise ate out. Impressed they had Guest Laundry room rather than just expensive Laundry Service - useful when some of the rides left you soaked !! Would definitely recommend - however needless to say it is not a cheap option !

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday Ever”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug0809
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here in September 2011. Facilities were great. Room was great. Location the best. Would recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Just a little bit dated in the rooms, but still special!!”
Reviews.Author: zef9
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights because I wanted to get the fast pass for Universal and it was a special stay. Very nice and helpful staff, great pool area. We had drinks at the pool one night and they were great!! And you have to try the Nachos, excellent! The rooms loooked a bit dated, for the price I would have expected a little more. As I read on the reviews about the special breakfirst, we choose the buffet and I did not really like that. It was ok but just ok, nothing special. I would definetly come again! Keep in mind though that EVERYTHING is expensive, food, drinks... but the fast pass was relly a great beneft.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel location”
Reviews.Author: Rbk2005
Reviews.Content: We have just come back after a week at hard rock hotel. We stayed in club level. Positives: the rooms are of good quality, beds comfortable, extra vanity unity outside of toilet, getting breakfast and light snacks throughout day was good with club level, swimming pool is good for Kids, the position of hotel is great and hotel card doubles as express pass which makes going on most rides quick and easy. Negatives: at the beach club they automatically charge you 18% extra charge then still expect extra tips! Chancers! The noise at times can be a bit too much at night, when we checked out they tried to charge us with a $86 room bill!!??? Must have been a ghost, the receptionist said did u keep receipt!! Well receipt for what!! She said manager would phone, was quite a fuss over something that was non existent. Overall though we would definitely go back but would just give caution to all staying to check there bills when leaving!

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: chamosvargas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this place with a youth group! The rooms were very nicely decorated and the beds where comfortable! We had a nice continental breakfast included in our package, and the teens were very satisfied!! The proximity to the theme parks is excellent. The pool was nice and warm. I'll recommend this hotel if you want to stay at Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Universal Mardi Fras 2012”
Reviews.Author: Sgarboden
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. The pool was fantastic and the kids lived the slide. Definetly staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Bad security”
Reviews.Author: v0yageur
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel February 15 &16. The room was clean and an average 2 queen room facing the pool area. The music from the pool club starts at 8am and plays until 10 pm and is so loud it is annoying. Beware families with napping children. My daughter and two grandsons were returning from the parks abs were mugged by three men in the trail to the hotel. The hotel security did not register a complaint not did they take a statement from my daughter. Beware walking this path to and from the parks the security is park. The Hard Rock was not worth the price and security is lax.

Reviews.Title: “A+ from beginning to end”
Reviews.Author: njwanderlust
Reviews.Content: Wow, dont' know where to begin. This was a wonderful experience from the prearranged hotel pickup to our departure. We were there for 5 days and had a blast. If you can, splurge and stay on the club level. It was really worth it. Especially enjoyed the happy hour and nightly dessert. Also, our room was newly redecorate with fresh linens etc. Beautiful outdoor pool with a secluded adult area and hot tub. Every staff member was very friendly and seemed like they couldnt do enough to make us enjoy our stay. Not to mention the Universal express pass and early admission, the stay was almost worth this alone. Easy walk or boat ride or you can even take a pedicab ride over. One of the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: TIFFANYHONDA
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 days recently at this resort and we enjoyed it very much. I have a 11 year old daughter and she really liked the pool. I did order room service one morning so I could get out to the parks early. Thinking cereal was the cheapest my bill came out to be $50 for 3 people with room service charges and tip. I did not notice they added a tip already so I added a extra tip. I also noticed they overcharged me for fruit. I called them to tell them I did not see the tip was already out and the lady just said "We appreciate the extra money" and they would only refund the overcharge. That kind of service upset me. Other than that the rest of the staff and hotel is awesome!! I did not see a value in club level because they wanted $75 extra a night and I can do alot with that money. When we return to Universal Studios I will look into staying at the Hard Rock again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and club level service over-the-top”
Reviews.Author: chuck52nt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 days at the Hard Rock with our daughter's family. Great location for Universal parks (well worth it for Express Pass alone), but I think the kids (5 and 7) liked the pool and giant slide more than many of the park rides! Easy to get around - we only used the car to go to nearby Legoland one day. Hotel service was overall great, from check-in to room cleaning, boat rides to the parks, etc. We stayed on the club level, and that was the best move ever, especially with kids. Breakfast, snacks and a lite "dinner" (finger-food) and late-night dessert made things easy without always running to (expensive) restaurants. And the service was "over-the-top" - the club lounge staffers made sure our two family members with severe food allergies always had something (good) they could eat. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT hotel......if you don't like to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Beth1225
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the positive....The staff at this hotel was extremely nice and willing to please. They were courteous and quick to address any issues that they could. The room was clean. The pool was super fun and there were plenty of chairs for everyone. The restaurants were good. The hotel was extremely conveniently located to all Universal Studios attractions (an easy 5-7 minute walk or 3 minute boat taxi ride). As a bonus, staying at this "on property" hotel afforded you an "express pass" that allowed you to skip many of the lines in the theme parks. The only downside was the comfort/quiet (or lack thereof) in this hotel. The beds were uncomfortable. The rollaway bed that we needed in order to accommodate our whole family was literally all springs. This was also the loudest hotel I have ever stayed in. The hotel obviously has no control over the people in the hallway, but they were extremely loud after presumably coming in from the clubs at City Walk. Starting at about 10:00 at night and going on through the early morning hours we were constantly awoken by loud patrons. We could also hear literally every sound (running water, footsteps, etc.) in the rooms next to and above us. I think this hotel may be better suited for adults who are also able to stay up late rather than families with small children who try to go to sleep on the earlier side.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to visit Universal Studios, great pool & staff. All round family hotel”
Reviews.Author: GarethWilson
Reviews.Content: We choose HRH due to both it's funky theme, & close proximity to Universal Studios. It lived up to our expectations on both for a half term Orlando break. A short 10 mins. walk to the parks, or a river boat ride if you have a little more time. The 'express pass' & 8am access to the Parks made the whole theme park experience for us. The hotel was great for both our teenage girls, and slightly more grown up parents, with the pool a particular highlight at the end of the day. The complimentary transport to the 2 other hotels on the resort meant access to some great options for dinner, as well as the Palm at the HRH. The only downside was drinks & room service charges quickly ramped up, eg. $85 for a shared steak and 2 drinks in the room for our daughters one evening! Apart from that it was all good!

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: Kwhat
Reviews.Content: Our new favorite resort. They have it all figured out at this resort. Hotel staff, entertainment and food were all excellent. Our 11 year old son had a blast and we did also.

Reviews.Title: “Rockin' birthday”
Reviews.Author: LHoffman
Reviews.Content: We booked a one night trip to Hard Rock Hotel to celebrate our son's 10th birthday. We originally booked a kid's suite, but the day before we were scheduled to go, I received a changed confirmation email. We had been bumped up to the Club level and given adjoining rooms instead. The service at this hotel is always amazing and the staff smiles when they greet you and they are overall awesome. The only drawback we have had at this hotel is the beach club bar. There is smoking allowed and it seems you can't get away from it if you are wanting a table. If you sit at a lounge chair, the service is not very good and there is an 18% auto gratuity added to each check. During this stay, the bartender came out and served us and she did an excellent job. Our bartender was much faster than the servers (we seem to get the same one every time who is rather slow and when it is not even busy). Other than that, everything was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Our perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: eelectric
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel! The staff were so helpful and friendly, the room comfortable with gorgeous showers. We had a twin room which had two queen size beds in. Being huge rock fans, we loved the Rock memorabilia all around the hotel. Everywhere you went, something to see - and great music playing as well! There was even music under the water in the amazing swimming pool! We only tried out one restaurant - The Kitchen - which was fantastic. The food was excellent, and the atmosphere perfect. On our last night our server (Emily - what a star!) arranged the most amazing dessert for us! We had the buffet breakfast in there a couple of times which was equally excellent - we didn't need feeding for the rest of the day! The Velvet Bar was a nice relaxing way to spend an evening too, their house white wine was very nice. The grounds are great too - we loved the Butterfly Garden and watching all the wildlife. And loved that the hotel is so close to Universal Studios - it only takes a few minutes to walk there, and if you don't want to walk, they have boats running all day & night! If you need to go further out, the valets can organise a taxi for you very quickly. Basically I can't praise this hotel highly enough. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Keep on rockin'”
Reviews.Author: JanicePetrolia
Reviews.Content: We loved the pool area- the bar service was great- staff went out of their way to make us feel like rock stars while we were there! So close and handy to walk to the parks of Universal - made the trip so relaxing - not having to worry about any transportation. Restaurants were great too!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Beat”
Reviews.Author: Jimdoagh
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hard Rock was fantastic. If you can, stay in a room on the club floor, the complimentary breakfast and happy hour are great. The pool is outstanding and the facilities are 2nd to none. This hotel has everything and is well located for everything you might want or need in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Service, and Perks”
Reviews.Author: Ashley T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock this past weekend during a girls trip. The staff there were friendly and extremely helpful. It is so close to the parks and central to most everything in Orlando.The express pass and getting into the Wizarding World of Harry Potter an hour before the park opens is a great perk, and I can't think of anything that they could have done that would have made my trip more enjoyable. The Velvet Lounge, grounds, Kitchen ect. were excellent. I will definitely stay there again, and can see how this would become my favorite spot to stay when I visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Horrid time of the month”
Reviews.Author: HHNsrum
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, the service was great. However for the money we paid you would think you could get a room that wouldn't leak. Me and my family stayed for three nights, we had two rooms and they both leaked water the entire time of our visit. One room leaked through the windows, and the other leaked through the closet and the windows. The hotel had already given us another room, so all they could do is comp our breakfast. Don't get me wrong the hotel was nice and all, but for the money we should have gotten dry rooms. I would recommend trying to stay on days it didn't rain and if you do don't stay on the seventh floor.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: polarspeech
Reviews.Content: First, the facts:This Hard Rock is on-site. It's a 5 minute walk  to Universal studios -10 to Islands of Adventure. Your room key acts as a credit card throughout the theme parks and all of City Walk (except theater). All charges to your room. Purchases can be delivered at no charge. The best part? It is an express pass on all rides (except Rockit Rollercoaster and the Harry Potter and the Forbidden Journey). It also gets you into the Wizarding World of Harry Potter-all of this section of the park - 1 hr before the park regularly opens. If you really want your wand to pick you or must enjoy a breakfast pumpkin juice, you will want to stay at this hotel.  There are 2 other hotels on- site.Hard Rock is the best because it is so accessible. When you're soaked from the water rides , you will be glad you chose this hotel. Price: Not as cheap as some off-site hotels.  I have gotten a deal 2 ways . The first, I book my room early- 6 months out or more. This way I have a room during peak times. Then I watch their website for specials. Hard Rock has always honored any discount if I booked with them on a regular room rate. I always ask for a room upgrade on check-in. It's a 50/50 thing but if they aren't too full, it can happen. The other way is frequent flier miles . More airlines are offering this perk . Use your miles or split cash/miles. I've been able to stay for "free" the past 2 trips using miles (miles DO have a cash value but not dishing out anything for the room is wonderful ). Just don't get carried away with that handy room key/credit card option! Finally, the hotel accommodations . The beds are comfortable and the rooms are jazzy . Watch an evening movie with the kids at poolside. The staff is excellent . From the front desk to the guy manning the pool towels. People are friendly and offer to help. It's our choice every trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the hard rock!”
Reviews.Author: newenglandtravel73
Reviews.Content: My family was recently here for 3 days as part of a Universal package and we really enjoyed the hotel. The rooms are fine, nothing special but clean and comfortable. The food at the hotel was quite good and reasonably priced for a resort hotel. One day we spent at a cabana by the pool and the kids had a wonderful time playing in the pool and riding the slide over and over and over! The water taxi is very convenient and offers a fun alternative to the 15 minute walk or so to the parks and city walk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Close to Universal”
Reviews.Author: EMSSPERR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hardrock 2 nights and really enjoyed it. Easy to get to Universal. Clean and nice rooms. The only complaint was slow service at the pool. (could be the time we went November)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful with Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: RuthCM
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from a fantastic weekend at Universal Orlando. We stayed in a garden view room on the 6th floor of the Hard Rock Hotel.Check in was quick and easy, and all of the staff were friendly and helpful the entire time of our stay. The room was a nice size with comfortable beds. We liked that not only did the bathroom have a sink, there was also a sink outside the bathroom which made getting ready in the morning more convenient. It takes only 5 minutes to walk from the hotel to Universal Orlando and 10 minutes to walk to Islands of Adventure. There is also a boat that will take you to city walk, but we found it was more convenient to walk than to wait for the boat. My kids loved the pool area. The pool is very large, and has a 260 foot winding water slide that is built into the landscaping. I especially loved that the pool is 4ft deep at its deepest point so that I didn't have to worry about my youngest daughter having difficulties playing in the pool. There were always at least 3 lifeguards on duty at all times. My only complaint about our stay was the loudness of the hallways at night. In bed I could hear everyone talking as they walked by, the sound proofing in the hotel is lacking. The first night I did not sleep well at all, the other nights were a bit better ( I think exhaustion had a part in that!) A few tips that I would love to share from our trip are: 1. Eat at Mythos in Islands of Adventure - the food is great and the prices are comparable to the restaurants in City Walk. Our favorite items were the panini and bacon cheeseburger. 2. Harry Potter's Forbidden Journey ride made my son and I nauseous. It is a fantastic ride - I loved it, but I could not walk straight after getting off and felt a little ill all day. If you are prone to motion sickness - beware! I have heard that wearing a motion sickness patch that you can get from your doctor helps. 3. Pastamore on City Walk serves breakfast that includes eggs, potatoes, biscuit, and bacon/sausage for only $7. A great deal compared to the other breakfasts available.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family hotel with great access and benefits”
Reviews.Author: travelbettie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from five days at the Hard Rock at Universal, and can't say enough good things about our stay. We were two families, totaling 3 adults and 3 children. Hotel is about 25 min from the airport. We rented a minivan, because we also did a day trip to Legoland (another review, but a great time). Upon arrival at Hard Rock, we were so impressed. The property is spotless, and the staff is terrific. The check in desk spent about 20 mins going over all the amenities and telling us about the parks, the restaurants, etc. Our rooms were clean, well decorated, and well equipped with free wifi, cable, etc. I am a nut about things being clean, and everything here was spotless. Housekeeping did a great job each day while we were out. We did notice room service left trays out longer than expected, but not a problem. There is an in room docking station for iPhone, which was a nice extra. Pool area was gorgeous and extremely well staffed and well maintained. Every staff person we dealt with during our stay was friendly, and went out of their way to bring us more towels, give advice, accommodate requests, and was generally extremely friendly. The Kitchen restaurant was great for breakfast (buffet was included in our package and was AWESOME). We had dinner twice at the pool bar restaurant-great place to unwind after a day at the parks, and they even had a "dive in movie" each night. Kids loved the huge water slide, and adults loved that the pool is never deeper than about 5 feet, so no stress watching children. Went to Universal one day, and Islands of Adventure the other, plus strolling on City Walk both days. Hotel is super accessible to parks, either on a beautiful walking trail (5 min) or by water taxi. Rock and pop music pumped into every nook and cranny (it is the Hard Rock, after all), and great rock and roll items throughout. Kids loved the guitar fountain, and the music themed rooms. Also had character dinners, magicians at dinner one night, and a nice play space off the restaurant for young children. Great store on ground level with Emack & Bolios ice cream, Starbucks coffee/lattes, and snacks. PROS: Express pass makes this a no-brainer. Made ALL the difference in enjoying the park. Clean rooms, good food, great pool area (open and lifeguards from 8am-10pm), super close to parks, included breakfast, great staff. CONS: $15/day to self park. Walls between rooms not very sound proof. Would suggest that light sleepers bring earplugs or white noise of some sort. We were so tired each day that it wasn't a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: Janet B
Reviews.Content: Loved the Hard Rock! I visited Universal in September of 2010 ( I know a little late with the review!) it was a familiarization trip for work (travel agent) It was my first time to Universal Orlando. I have been to Disney a few times. Room was really nice. had a great view overlooking the pool Loved the Keurig type coffee maker in the rooms. Toured lots of other room types , all very nice - suites are awesome. Lobby was large and open, staff was amazing, music playing all the time - so cool! Loved the pool area the best. Busy trip, wished I had more time to spend in it! The time I did, the wait staff around the pool was very attentive. Hearing the music underwater was neat too. They have dive in movies at night, so you and the kids can watch movies in the pool. Had a few meals at The Kitchen, all were really good. Hard Rock is a fun resort. If you are looking for quiet and relaxing away from the parks, I wouldn't recommend it to you. Portofino would be a better choice. Loved how close the resorts are to the parks and citywalk! A stroll or water taxi ride away. I was able to tour the other 2 resorts and both were very nice, but the Hard Rock would be my choice for my family! Blue Man Group show was a must see as well.

Reviews.Title: “Coolest Hotel Ever Visited”
Reviews.Author: David D
Reviews.Content: Total buzz, from arrival and best valet service possible to cool rooms, superb lobby, brilliant Velvet Bar and the greatest pool. Everything is absolutely brilliant. Top tip hire a cabana for a day by the pool it is the ultimate decadence!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Would stay her just for Queue Jump passes.”
Reviews.Author: em85x
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April 2011. Great time to go as wasn't so busy and weather still great. The rooms were nice and clean, perhaps a little small. We had 2 double beds and four people (2 adults and 2 children) so could be a little cramped. The service around the pool was excellent - waiters/waitresses walking around and constantly checking if you needed anything. Food and drinks great! I would stay here for the Queue Jump passes alone. They allow you to skip the long queues in Island of Adventure and Universal Studios which can save hours, aswell as allowing you into Island of Adventure an hour early to get to the Harry Potter ride (as this is only ride you can't use the Queue jump for). Pool area is loud, music all day and plays movies at night, if you'r looking for a quieter hotel I'd go for The Portifino Bay or Loews Royal Pacific. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend it EVERYONE!”
Reviews.Author: 5fords
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Hard Rock Orlando the week before Thanksgiving and had one of the most memorable family vacations yet. We are experienced travelers. We've stayed at All Inclusives, 5 * hotels, and Super 8's...and everything in between. This Hotel has everything you could ask for. Yes, it's more pricey than most (drinks and food are expensive, but it's Orlando and what isn't overpriced?) Drinks pool side will run you about $7/beer or $9/drink. The pool is heated, which helped at night when it got down in the low 70's. The poolside movies were a nice treat for the kids (11, 9. 6). The pool slide was fun even for the Adults and the Sand area made for a nice break in the day. You can walk to either Universal park within 5 minutes. We had about a 15 min. drive to The Magic Kingdom. The week went, the longest wait we had for any ride at the parks...including Disney, was about 10 minutes. The week before Thanksgiving was not crowded AT ALL.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: thebernard
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for my birthday recently and can honestly say that we really had a great time. We chose this hotel because of its links with Universal Studios,and the early access to the Harry Potter rides. It did not let us down and although it may be expensive the service we received was superb. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel welcome and it was noted by the receptionist that it was my birthday. Our room was upgraded immediately and when we asked for a single bed rather than a double we were told that one was not available for the first night but they would move us for the remainder of our stay the following day. This was done whilst we were out and when we returned the next night our belongings had been moved for us. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, our room was always kept clean and the house staff always helpful and polite. We did have a slight problem with a room service order but this was resolved without fuss immediately. The pool area is very good along with the food and service. We would recommend this hotel and will hopefully be returning soon. One tip, if you get an All Access Card prior to your stay you get free upgrade and free wi-fi all for $25.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, needs more attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Oaklands4
Reviews.Content: This hotel could be great. We had a club level family suite. The room is beautiful but not well enough maintained. The safe did not work. Had to wait for maintenance who are not allowed to work on it without you in the room - even if it is empty. Battery was replaced. Then had to reschedule for them to check the motor, another time slot booked. Following this we needed to have them a 3rd time for someone else, gave up on it. The mattress was sloping down on one side and aircon could have been better. Shower was great, bathroom well designed and rooms too. If just maintained better it would be excellent. Queues for assistance in lobby were a bit too long. Were supposed to stay 4 nights, checked out early due to poor mattress. The feature of fast passes for most park attractions is great, but Harry Potter only works first thing in morning.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Luck, Changed”
Reviews.Author: 16Atalaya
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved my stay at the Hard Rock. It is so close the parks. Take the brief (maybe 5 minute) walk, ride in a rickshaw (work for tips), or ride the water shuttle (runs every 10-15 minutes) to get there. The rooms were clean and the staff was AMAZING. Everyone was friendly from the time you pull up to the curb to check in. I have the worst luck when it comes to employees. The ones with bad attitudes tend to flock to me, but this vacation changed that. The housekeeping staff greets you in the hallways, which is rare. I used the Do No Disturb sign the entire 1st day and received a phone message informing me that if I needed anything they are there, I just need to call. I used the luggage service, all of the transportation options to the park, and ate at the restaurants (The Kitchen & Emelios) and everyone was helpful and chipper, for lack of a better term. I chose the HR because it was recommended for my 11 year old daughter and I'm glad that I did. It was well decorated as well. The self-service laundry on the 2nd floor was well maintained and has great amenities such at the ability to text you when your wash cycle has ended. I went in January so I didn't really need to use the Express pass that came with the hotel but I did anyway, just because. I do like a hotel with a balcony and didn't get that here, but that is just a personal preference. I am already looking forward to returning later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: KASL1969
Reviews.Content: Was ok hotel...not as "hip" as you would think. Very uptight. Not much music or nightlife. Was under impression that we could only get a room on concierge level...thought it might be worth extra $$ but it wasn't. Was processed breakfast foods. bag of chips during the day etc. The best part of the hotel is the bartenders at the pool and the velvet. Only reason I'd go there again...great drinks and awesome attitudes. Front desk staff...I'd leave em.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and express facility key factor”
Reviews.Author: Sharmies
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Dec 2011 for 3 nights. The hotel itself and the grounds are really nice with a good friendly ambience. The location is of course great if you plan on visiting Universal and the express pass facility is the reason we booked to stay here. The water taxi is good - not far from the hotel itself to get on - drops you off near the Fossil shop. It's a very pleasant walk - 10 minutes to the entrance of Universal Studios. The food was good, although not the best we've had in Florida. The rooms are adequate, although felt a little 'tired' and not sure how often the huge pillow cushions are cleaned. Our iPod dock didn't work and within minutes a maintenance guy was at our room and put a brand new one in - very efficient service. The staff are all really friendly and poolside service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the sleazy”
Reviews.Author: V Traveler
Reviews.Content: My 6-year-old daughter and I stayed here 3 nights to go to Universal/Harry Potter one day and Epcot the second day. Nice hotel, and the Fixx (the real band) was even playing in the lobby when we checked in which was very cool. It seems like all of the highpoints are touched on in other reviews, but from our perspective: The Good: Fun atmosphere. Close walk to Universal and City Walk, although given that our room was in the wing closest to City Walk it would have been nice to have exit/entrance doors on that side of the hotel so that we didn't have to walk back to the middle of the hotel coming and going. If the doors were there we couldn't find them. The Kitchen restaurant is one of the best hotel restaurants I've eaten in, and very kid friendly. Great food. The fast passes worked great in the park. And the free internet worked well. The bad: It's not a quiet hotel. I was awakened several times by voices in the hallway, in adjoining rooms and by nearby showers turning on. There is also an anti-Disney bias, which makes sense to some extent given that they're competition, except that it hurt the overall experience. Kids after long theme park days want to watch a little tv, but of course there are none of the Disney channels on the tv lineup. There's not even NickJr. So really disappointing viewing options for kids. Also, even though the concierge said that she gets Disney questions all the time, she said that she knows nothing about the Disney parks. Really? And you can't buy Disney park tickets at the hotel - "everything but Disney" was how they put it. Because really, who comes to Orlando to go to a Disney park? Also, although the band was great, it made it very difficult to check in. We had to shout back and forth with the girl at the front desk. And I may have missed something because I thought that she said that there was a 10% discount at Hard Rock Cafe with our room keys/charges. So we went there late our first night and had a mediocre meal only to learn that there was no discount, and worse, it took almost 10 minutes to pay using the room key card because although it is supposed to be a seamless charging option throughout the parks and at the cafe, apparently it is a complicated process. It would have been far faster just to use a credit card. The sleazy: when I quickly glanced over my bill at checkout, I noticed a $60+ charge for long distance to some foreign country. I had receipts showing that we were shopping/dining at Downtown Disney at the time, and they said that they would remove it from the bill. It may have been some random mistake, but more likely is that a hotel employee came into the room while we were out and made a long phone call. Not cool. I'd definitely stay here again given the location, but I'll check my bill carefully, I won't try to use the room card to charge anything, and I may move to a Disney hotel the days that I'm planning to go to Disney parks.

Reviews.Title: “It's not just about the hotel, it's also about the parks”
Reviews.Author: crzzzr
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here because it was the mid-priced hotel within the park, because you got free fastpass access, and for convenience. We stayed for a week and got a great 7 night rate. We were hardly in our room there is so much to see and do. Riding rollercoasters at 7.30am was certainly a different way to wake up! If you are a Harry Potter fan, do yourself a favour and stay inside the park at the Hard Rock or one of the others, you will save yourself some serious queue time. Go straight to Harry Potter using your early park access - do the more popular rides then leave. Go back 1 hour before closing time and do a few more attractions there. Using the hotel supplied fastpass access - we waited only 10 mins for rides showing a 45 minute wait time - i can't imagine doing these busy parks any other way. We also bought a 6 park 14 day unlimited park ticket which was around $300 and well worth it as you can jump between parks whenever you want. This hotel has a Hertz rental car counter which was very handy - though their walk-up prices seemed quite high. So I recommend pre-booking if you need a car. Easy 7 min walk to the park from this hotel. No need to wait for the water taxi to the parks. Garden View rooms good enough in my view - you are hardly in your room anyhow :) Breakfast was around $20 plus service charge for a good buffet service. We ate at various other restaurants within the parks/universal city and had a great experience every time - the Hard Rock Cafe (restaurant, not hotel) meal was particularly good too. Another plus is that you can charge in-park purchases to your room and have them sent back there (the next day) so you don't have to carry them around with you. Guest laundry facilities were great and very useful to us as we were travelling for 6 weeks. Would definitely stay here again. Negatives: 1. Rock music can be a touch overpowering at times (and I like my rock music) - if you don't it could get on your nerves quickly 2. Charge for in-room internet (free in foyer) 3. Parking charges

Reviews.Title: “Location and extras!”
Reviews.Author: Ozetravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here purely to go to Harry Potter World and Universal Studios. And it was perfect. Firstly, the hotel itself is very nice with several dining options (none of which we used) but I did go and have a look at the restaurants and the menus. The foyer is lovely with free internet access there. There is a Hard Rock shop with reasonably priced goods. The room was a standard hotel room with 2 double/queen beds and adequate room for 2 adults and 2 children. The only drawback was the tea and coffee machine was one where there were individual containers that were put in containing tea, coffee or hot chocolate... all of which were disgusting. But we found these machines in other hotels including Disney so it seems to be a universal problem! The location of the Hotel was sensational.
