It was a quick walk to both parks, and to City Walk where there were plenty of restaurants to choose from (and much cheaper than the hotel). There was also a boat directly from the hotel to all these places and it was free! But the best part of all, was that when staying at the hotel (or the other 2 Loews hotels nearby) you got a free Express Pass for each person to use at both Islands of Adventure (containing HP World) and Universal Studios. These are worth $87 each and allowed you to enter rides from a special queue which had very little times (mind you, it was very quiet when we went and the lines were very short anyway, but they would be priceless in busy times!) The 4 passes we got for free were worth one nights accommodation in value! Lastly, the service at the hotel was excellent apart from one issue with a bell desk staff member which management resolved even better than my expectations. So, we will definitely stay there next time we plan to visit Harry!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel! Feel like a rock star!”
Reviews.Author: ElDubElPool
Reviews.Content: Straight away; coming up the drive-way you can see how majestic the hotel looks. The grass and other flora outside is kept really well, and just out the front of the hotel lobby there's an awesome water fountain with a guitar sculpture in the middle (it's seen in all the brochures e.t.c.) Inside there is a great lobby area and the place is extremely clean. The staff are all very courteous and a great many of them have quite unique looks (fans of 'hard rock' music I would guess), lots of spikey hair and cool jewellry (makes a change from the 'Disney-Look' you'll be seeing for a lot of your stay in Orlando no doubt). We stayed in a standard room but it felt like pure luxury. The rooms are spacious and have framed pictures of various rock legends on the walls which adds that cool touch. We didn't have much of a view because we had palm trees right outside the window, but who can complain about that? "Ooh! This exotic plant of paradise is preventing me from seeing the pool!" The bathrooms are also very spacious, very clean and to add to that extra bit of 'star treatment' you have some huge vanity mirrors over the sinks (the ones with all the lightbulbs around the glass). There's a few different restaurants (my favourite of which is called 'The Kitchen') and you can get a good variety of food. I can't remember though what the vegetarian selection was like, sorry. Breakfast, lunch and dinner are all good here. There's a hot tub and swimming pool available to guests too. One of my favourite features included underwater speakers for the pool! It was quite a strange sensation to be floating along listening to a favourite tune and then dunking under the water and not having it interrupted at all, but it was awesome. Scattered around the hotel is various 'hard rock' memorabillia; if you're familiar with the Hard Rock franchise you'll know what I'm talking about. In cabinets all around the hotel you'll find famous outfits worn by rock legends, instruments and all sorts. I'm sure they probably rotate but while I was there I saw outfits and instruments that were previously owned by Elvis, Madonna, Jimi Hendrix, Kiss and many more. There is also a merchandise store if you'd like to take some cool, branded souveneirs home with you. The hotel is also situated right by 'City Walk', which is basically Universal's version of 'Downtown Disney', having lots of different shops and restaurants to spend your money at. It includes a Hard Rock Café if you're a big fan of the brand. At the end of City Walk is of course; the parks. Which means your hotel is roughly a five minute walk from the attractions. Nice! Lastly; staying at the hotel you get early access to the Universal theme parks which is awesome and your hotel key card also doubles as a fast pass for the rides which was just incredible. I almost felt guilty walking straight past all the general admission folk... almost. Because of this we got to do basically every ride at Islands of Adventure and Universal Studios. The hotel is on the pricey side but it did feel like luxury to me and is probably the nicest hotel I've stayed in. At the very least it's extremely clean and a unique place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “rock and relax”
Reviews.Author: RethymnoCreteElena
Reviews.Content: We really had a pleasant stay at this nice hotel . The hotel was nice decorated with good and kind personal .Room was large and very nice decorated with comfortable large beds and very clean.Food is o.k. , but we are are from Europe so we have different taste .Pool is nice with water slide for relax . Very closed to Universal only few min. walk and nice gardens .

Reviews.Title: “Laid Back Quality - Great Pool - So Close to the Parks”
Reviews.Author: Stephen J
Reviews.Content: Very laid back, friendly, favourite hotel in Orlando. Rooms immaculate, Only problems... corridors hap hazard, have on more than one occasion reported broken glass on hall carpets, meal trays left for hours and hours. With kids running around its a problem. Car hire desk in the lobby, shamelessley over priced, we usually travel to Avis at the Hilton, downtown Disney, 30% of the price. IT can at times, especially if there is a problem, feel like the hotel is staffed by interns, (it probably is) who have no authority to get thing sorted. Some times a smile is not enough. Check everywhere for rates. They vary wildly. Occasionally Park Tickets are included in room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rachel1310
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in the Hard Rock numerous times and we love it . The atmosphere around hotel is great .Hotel is spotless and also the pool area .The restaurant "the kitchen"is fab for breakfast great selection of food . The fast passes are and added bonus while staying here the queues for the rides are normally only a few minutes wait which is great . It is expensive to stay but I suppose you get what you pay for!!!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous fun and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen W
Reviews.Content: I have just spent a most wonderful 5 days at this hotel and feel compelled to let you know just how impressed I was by the Hotel, rooms and the employees. Angie, stood out as an outstanding member of the work force. She was polite, informative and nothing was too much trouble for this young lady, I hope you will pass on my thanks to her. All members of staff must receive praise for their politeness, caring attitude and good humour. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The facilities are excellent. The rooms large, spacious, well stocked and beautifully clean. I cannot praise it enough to do it justice.

Reviews.Title: “A Winter Weekend Get-away to the Hard Rock Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wishIweretraveling
Reviews.Content: Our family spent Martin Luther King weekend at the Hard Rock Hotel. The most attractive incentive for this hotel is that they offer a package that gives you an early admittance pass (1 hour earlier) to the parks and a "skip to the front of the line" card for the rides. The pool area is also amazing! The location makes having a car unnecessary, as you can walk or take a complimentary water taxi ride to the City Walk area, which is where the 2 parks have their main gates. Our room was rather spacious, though it had weird angles to it. For example, the wall on my side of the bed got increasingly wider as it went the length of the bed. (ie: think a triangular line) This made it difficult because the narrowest part was at the top and my head was faced right up against the wall. The bed was comfortable enough, however the pillow was the worst that I had ever used in my life. There were lumps throughout it and this made sleeping very uncomfortable. I did not find any replacement pillows in the closet. The sink area and the toilet/shower was separated. This was especially helpful because someone could be in the shower getting ready (it also had a small sink and mirror in it) while someone else could be preparing in front of the sink and mirror outside of the bathroom. (Great for family travel!) Two of my biggest complaints are as follows: 1. The walls were VERY thin. The second night we had neighbors that we could hear everything they were saying. Luckily they went out for a late night evening, so we were able to fall asleep. However, they returned after 2 AM and the noise started all over again. We were in a room that had an adjoining option. It was connected to that room, so maybe that was why the walls offered less sound proofing? 2. Although the room seemed clean, if you look close, you could see some neglected areas and that made me question how clean the rest of the room was. For example, when I looked around the mirror, there was dust all around it and behind it. It looked as if it hadn't been dusted in months. Nevertheless, the lobby area appeared spotless. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for family travel. (They also have a "kids club" option on site.) If you're looking to be right near the parks,are looking for a beautiful pool area, or want to be able to spend your time at City Walk, this is the place for you. A few years ago we stayed at the Portofino, which is close to the Hard Rock Hotel. The Hard Rock has a better location and is more family/kid friendly. However, I thought the Portofino was beautiful and had a romantic feel to it. So if it's just the two of you, consider looking into that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: streakey
Reviews.Content: we did not stay here but we visited it and had drinks there. it is a nice place to relax. the staff were very friendly. It has a good shop too. the gardens are pretty and you can wlak through the park to get to the Universal complex or you can take the quaint free ferry, which we did. Well worth a visit. If you stay ehre you get fast track passes to the attractions and early access too, very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Facilities and Location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: ssnagy40
Reviews.Content: Spent long weekend at Universal and stayed at the Hard Rock. Club level rooms are small but well kept. You can't beat the value- breakfast, snacks, pop wine and beer all included. It beats shelling out each time someone in the group wants something. Awesome pool area--weather was too chilly to use, would have loved to. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Universal Parks. Perfect location--and no need for a car! Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: kaydayAlabama
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few months ago. It was nice and convenient. Loved the waterslide snd music in the pool. The memorabilia is great. Love the guitar fountain.Prices are high for a small room however. Stay here once just to say that you have and see the rock items. Then save your money and spend the rest of your stay somewhere more reasonable! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Davidm99999
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 7 nights. There are many great attributes about this hotel. The room was very good. We had a kids suite which gave the 4 of us plenty of room and our own space. Having the benefit of the express pass and early entry to Harry Potter was uncheck a bonus. The staff were great. The pool area was well down. The pool however was too shallow. It needs a deeper section where an adult can actually swim not slide along on their stomachs. As we did not choose it for the pool it did not much matter. All the extras were good. The water taxis to th parks, the closeness to the entertainment area universal walk which have some good family restaurants and entertainment. The Blue Man Group is a must see. I highly recommend this hotel for a family vacation. As soon as you walk in th lobby, you wil be engulfed in memorabilia and the music is great

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: Lucia J
Reviews.Content: On our trip to Universal studios we decided to stay in Hard rock hotel. It has great position! Nice area: pool, gardens, river... Hotel is nice and walkaway from fun parks and lots of restaurants. If you are lazy to walk, there is boat taxi for free or riksha bikers for small tip. Rooms are nice and in Hard rock hotel standard. Velvet bar has a good and polite staff. During our stay there was a live music we really appreciated. Only small complaining about children runing all day up and down the hall infront of our room :((( Hotel like this that have so many families with children should have better sound isolation... Breakfast in Kitchen restaurant was very delicious. Just the waitress was unpolite and I can say rude. He communicate only with me and absolutely ignored my husband!!! But if I forget this, our stay was really nice and we would like to come back :)))) Advice to everyone ;)

Reviews.Title: “Well above average for Orlando hotel--pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: mommythek
Reviews.Content: On our most recent trip to Orlando, we decided to stay near Universal and opted for the Hard Rock because it has the "early access" to Harry Potter part of the park. We were very pleased with the grounds, the pool, the decor, etc. It's really a very nice hotel. The staff was almost all great--my biggest complaint is with the laissez-faire attitude of the concierge staff. They were a little "too cool' for their official job. Everyone else (bell staff, restaurants, pool, gym, cleaning staff, front desk, restaurant) very nice. Good option for a family travelling to Universal--almost all families.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location location. Read for GOOD & BAD”
Reviews.Author: BigDaddy45013
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights 1st week of 2012. 4th floor, Garden view. GOOD: if your coming for the Theme Parks you can do no wrong here. The HR is located in the BEST spot for Universal/Adventure Island and City Walk. Express Pass given to Hotel patrons is priceless and I wouldn't go to parks without it. BAD: $15 bucks to park for paying guests is thievery. Unless you use valet you can't use luggage carts, ridiculous. Make sure your room is close to elevator or you'll walk a mile to and from your car/parks/pool etc... Bottom line: if I'm going to the Universal Parks I will stay at the Hard Rock. As far as a rating for the Hotel itself I would say the building/facilities/rooms would garner a 3.5 out of 5. Nice but not spectacular. If your not expecting a 5 star experience (and you shouldn't be) this Hotel will make you happy.

Reviews.Title: “Why we stay here...”
Reviews.Author: GirlsonTour12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October for 8 nights. This was our 7th visit to the Hard Rock Hotel in as many years. The Valet Guys remembered us from the year before as soon as we got out of the limo....."Hey, its the English Princesses" was our welcome!! All the staff are wonderful especially the ones by the pool who loved discussing fashion and hair with my daughters!! When requesting a room i always ask for one on the same floor as the reception/shop. It is just our preference as it is easier to get to without having to use the lift. Position of the hotel is ideal for the parks and the FOTL is worth its weight in gold. Harry Potter World was out of this world...the detail in the shops was brilliant. Well worth lining up for Ollivanders. If you utilise the extra hour in the morning and go just before the park closes it is possible to ride Harry Potter Ride several times - i rode it one night, as a single rider, 7 times in a row!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: BluenoseJosh
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at the hotel it looked great with a big drive up to the entrance and the fountain in the centre and that set the tone for everything else about the hotel. It was very clean, staff were always helpful and had great facilities such as restaurants, shops and a gym and very good swimming pool. Only downside is that it was about $12 a day for parking which is unusual for hotels in Orlando. Also the iconic memorabilia is all around the hotel. The room was big and had nice interior but the facilities could be improved as you had to pay for wifi unless you had a hard rock access card, also you had to pay to rent the use of the fridge to store you're own drink in. I don't think you could get a better location than this hotel if you want access to the Universal parks and City Walk, either a 10min walk or a free boat ride which arrives/departs every 20mins throughout the day from just outside the hotel and drops you off just outside the parks. There is also a service where people on bikes with a trailer for people to sit on will take you to the parks, it takes about 5mins and is good if the boat isn't there and you don't feel like walking. There is no charge but they earn off tips, I gave $6 each time. There are very good benefits staying here aswel as the location. With you're stay you get a free fast pass for the Universal parks. As we were there over christmas this was very helpful, both parks became full at one point and the queues for the major attractions were between 2-3 hours, with out fast pass we were only waiting 20mins max so they are definetely worth it. At the time they were charging $70 for a fast pass at the gates for people who didn't have one. You always get priority seating at the Hard Rock Restaurant. If you sign up to the 'all access' card you can get free internet access and 10% off at the hotel shop and Hard Rock Restaurant. Don't think you can get an overall better hotel in Orlando for the Universal parks and City Walk which has a good number of restaurants and nightlife. Disney parks are about 20mins drive away. Would definetely stay here again...great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend trip!”
Reviews.Author: Cox1
Reviews.Content: We took a last minute trip to Orlando and stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel. The hotel was awesome and the staff was even better! We had a regular double room booked and could not check in until 4pm so they upgraded us to a suite for the inconvenience. Pool was awesome, food was great, and the room was superb and beautifully decorated. We had access the the concierge lounge which had complimentary coffee, bottled water, snacks, etc. The staff was above and beyond and took care of our every whim including the waiter at the pool getting us a 3 hour late check out for free so we could hang out by the pool longer. They set up all our park passes, cars, dinner reservations, etc. Beds were new and excellent and the room had blackout curtains so we slept really late. We will go again!!!

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MUPPET1508
Reviews.Content: we booked just the one night so we could take advantage of the front of line passes with the room key. 'checked in' at 8am so we could get our room key, no problem at all...headed off to universal. Rooms were beautiful. bathrooms were massive, Tv channels were great, coffrr/tea machine did everything but dance!! Only complaint i would have is that we only booked the one night :(

Reviews.Title: “No Rock Star treatment here. Do not waste your money.”
Reviews.Author: Julie P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock hotel in Orlando January 2,3,4 on the 7th floor Concierge level. and were treated to an experience that made us feel like 2nd class citizens not rock stars. The hotel more closely resembles a one star motel. Filthy, run down, poor service. The concierge level does not have cold drinks but you can get cups of ice. Lunch was an offering of bags of pretzels and cheetos and warm sodas. We had to ask for warm bottles of water if we wanted water because it was not readily available. The dining area was filthy with no one cleaning the floors or tables. Mashed food in the carpet, on the tables and chairs was standard. No nightly turn down service. Our rooms were not cleaned until after 4pm every day. The second night there when we returned to our room the lock was not working properly and we couldn't enter our room. It took the engineer well over an hour to fix it. When we asked to be compensated for the inconvenience we were reluctantly given 4 drink cards for the Velvet Lounge then told that it didn't allow children. We had 3 kids with us under the age of 13 and had to wait in the lobby until after 10pm to get into our room. The same experience happened the 3rd night only we were not given drink cards. Locked out of our room until after 10pm again. When we asked the managers Eric Delvin and Al Patnik to compensate us in some way they refused then reluctantly took $17.00 off our room charge. We demanded a room change and were given a room across the hall but the hassle of moving because the door still wasn't fixed was a nightmare and we were tired after being at the AWESOME Universal parks all day. We are a family of 5. We have spoken to several people about our experience and appartently it is general knowledge that this hotel is known to be run down and provide poor service. Wish we would've known that before wasting our money. We have since been told that the Portifino hotel is a much better choice. Next time we will stay there. Any reviews to the contrary about Hard Rock are likely written by people employed by this hotel because I cannot believe anyone would be happy at this hotel. The second night

Reviews.Title: “Dont listen to any negatives about this place x its heaven on earth xx”
Reviews.Author: montyma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hard Rock for 2 nights between 30th oct and 2nd nov 2011. we were a party of 19 and we were married at the Hard Rock cafe on halloween. I cannot begin to tell you how fantastic our time was there,right from the moment we all landed there.The staff are amazing right down to the cleaners they all have a smile on their faces and nothing is too much trouble.We stayed on the 7th floor club level,yes it was a little more expensive but soooooooooo worth it. The hospitality room and staff was amazing and i dont know what the few people who do moan are talking about The food and drink was top class and let me tell you they are far beyond just snacks you can easily fill your boots and its constantly being replenished. Nobody is looking to see how much you are taking and if you are traveling with kids it pays for itself ten fold. The drink are all premium makes and they do not cut corners anywhere even the continental breakfast was massive in choices and again it was all lovely and fresh.We had our evening reception meal in the hotels restaurant "The Palms" OMG is all i can say i have never tasted food so good and topped my wedding day of fantastically and hy i even wen on the hulk roller coaster in my wedding dress !!! how rock and roll was that??. I only hope and pray we can afford to revisit this year for our anniversary and its a truly unforgettable place and just to note dont think im getting caught up with the whole awe of orlando as it was our 13th visit there and we have stayed many places there but nothing compares to the Hard Rock Hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Dave1071
Reviews.Content: Great food great service. Try the burgers. The service was very friendly. They even take your picture, for a price. Make sure if you eat at Hard Rocks to get their card it saves you money in the long run. Great place to end your busy day at Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Rock on”
Reviews.Author: Paulie1382
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel stayed twice there once on buisness once with family ,can highly recommend the family suite seperate bedroom for the kids ,ahhhh the peace !!!!!!!!!.one of the great things here is that because your staying at the Hard Rock when you buy your tickets for universal studios you get to skip the lines at the rides its worth it beleive me in the blazing orlando heat skiping the lines and going straight to the front on the attractions is excellent !!!! Check when you book your accomodation if there is a concert in the lobby book ahead we did and saw rick springfield he was great overall a rockin good hotel to stay at !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: dizzylinzy
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 Jan for 5 nights booked with virgin holidays in a garden view room. Room overlooking lawn and boat dock on 5th floor (5076) twin queen beds - very clean and spacious. I have stayed at Hard Rock previously - pool view not worth it imo - and club level - also not worth it imo - garden view room fine. WE were also given complimentary internet access - hence I am writing review in room!! BONUS!!! Yes this hotel is expensive but you get what you pay for and this is the most convenient to the parks - easy 10 min walk or boat ride. Early access to Island of adventure for Harry Potter - we were first in queue for Olivanders!! By 10.30 the queues were 2 hours - although the day before at 1.30 the queues were 30 mins so suggest you leave it until the afternoon to ride. The Hotel is still in good condition - staff all very helpful and friendly - check in efficient - we don't use the parking as no need for car hire - taxis easier to get to malls - they no longer use yellow cabs at hotel - town cars which are more expensive but more luxurious. Had breakfast in The Kitchen once - fine - and rooms service a couple times - also fine - so no complaints at all and if I return to orlando would be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fanbloodytastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jules G
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic place to stay!! Lots of reviews are going on about a bottle of water being $8. That's just a bottle in your room that you could buy if you wanted to. It's just normal hotel priced drinks. It's walking distance to both universal parks and your room key gets you to the front of the Qs. The whole atmosphere of the place is just ace. The pool is the best one I have been to and at night there is Dive in movies shown at the pool. I went with my husband my daughter and my daughters son, so a mixed age group, but we all loved it. The little one was 2. There was a perfect little pool for him to sit in. Only thing we didn't like was that you got charged for parking! That's a bit cheeky. We didn't really use the car much tho. We never even went to Disney, just did a week at the hotel, getting up early walking to the parks and going back to the hotel for the afternoon pool fun and back to the parks at night. Around the pool they have groups playing and people entertaining the kids. I love five star holidays and this as been my best holiday up to yet!! Anybody who reviews this place and gives it a bad review, needs give thier head a wobble. Hard.

Reviews.Title: “new years 2011-2012”
Reviews.Author: gonutts
Reviews.Content: We just spent a few nights over new years eve. Location, lOCATION Location! I valeted my car (224/day), and didnt see it again until i checked out!! we have a toddler - this was perfect! Bring your stroller and bathing suit! The pool was awesome, sand beach type- beach volley ball, great music, HEATED pool, lounge chair service - i was in heaven! and it was December- check weather it does flex depending on the rest of the country a bit. i wore a light fleece at night and jan 2. 10$/ day to workout we stayed on the 3rd floor (which is also the Lobby level- nice with a stroller!) We stroller out the back pool gate thru a beautiful greenery lined path - you can get on a water taxi or a bike carrige or walk..if you walk slow, it probably takes 8 minutes to enter CITYWALK- (Clubs, shops, restaurants) and Univerals entrance...walk thru the CITY WALK another 5 min to Islands of Adventure..Super cool! We ate at Emeralds, and Latin Cafe- both fantastic! we wanted to eat at Margaritaville, but 1 hr wait! The EXPRESS pass which is your hotel room key is AWSOME! there are 2 lines at most park rides, the reg line and the Express line!!! so VIP feeling!! go to ABOUT.COM and familarize yourself on each park, so you make the most of it.. we went to character breakfast at Isl of adv, so worth it!! and it got us going early!!! and by 12:00 it gets very busy! so you go back to hotel pool, take a nap, go to dinner and go back to park- NO DRIVING, no carseats!! in the hotel we ate at KITCHEN- very nice breakfast buffet- most the staff is really great- alittle immature- younger type- so you really want respect and service, but you sometimes get not such great service-! remember you Pillow and anything in your safe when u leave, because the bellman didnt remind us,,and--- we forgot and called back, and got no help!! just to tell us to call back later after 5pm- WHAT!!,,,so we turned around on i-4 and thank goodness we still had a room key :) (i will always keep my room keys until i get home to throw away)..AND GOT OUR IMPORTANT papers from the safe, and pillow we love! the most annoying thing was that the parks and the citywalk and the hotel didnot have wifi!! UNLESS YOU PAID 10$/day- and i thought that was a ripoff!!! and i could not get on 3g either!! so the little downtime i did have, i couldnt open my email (i have an iphone 4),iwanted to enjoy my sitting in the sun, and wine,, and maybe read my emails, i couldnt send my friends and family photos via email (the mms worked and texes and phone,- but not internet) i couldnt get my gps to open, just browsing- it was very very very very very annoyong.,. i even went to the coffee shop, but the wifi was locked,,,,i went to citywalk, same -and the parks!! i dont know if id stay here again for that inconvience! i got to the marriott courtyard on my hAlf way drive home, and i had 35 emails!!! can u imagine,....and it was new years, so it was a bumber i was so out of touch-- like i left the country...!? other then that i loved the place.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it really rocks!”
Reviews.Author: k-dog021
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel was our second-choice hotel for a family trip to Universal -- the slightly-less-expensive Lowe's Royal Pacific sold out while we were booking it. But boy, were we happy with it! We booked a complete package through Universal Parks & Resorts Vacations (UPRV), electing to stay on site in order to save the cost and hassle of a car, parking fees, and so on. A huge bonus is that the hotel room key serves as a "free" (if you can call it that!) Universal Express pass. Even if the parks aren't crowded, which they weren't for most of our visit, Universal Express saves a lot of walking: without it, you find yourself "furbling" through long walkways and queuing areas; Express generally takes a shortcut to the rides themselves. Service was fantastic, right from the start. We arrived mid-morning after an early flight to Orlando, excited but hungry. Front desk staff was great at orienting us to the hotel and its features-- and to our surprise, our room was ready early! We opted to drop our stuff off at our room only to find that engineering was just finishing up a paint touch-up. The bell captain, who made the trip to the room with us, apologized for the miscommunication and then had us follow him back to the Kitchen restaurant where they treated us to a wonderful buffet brunch for our "inconvenience!" The hotel has a park tickets desk and automated kiosk for picking up tickets that you've bought in advance. Free tickets are available for transportation to Wet 'n' Wild and Sea World (these buses only run once per day in each direction). Other ticket-related transactions (adding days or features) have to be done at the parks' own Guest Services windows. Everyone at the hotel had this very-refreshing "service first" attitude. It's what made me want to visit Orlando again in the first place-- the people here really understand hospitality. The entire hotel has typical Hard Rock theming-- you'll find rock memorabilia everywhere (a tour booklet at the front desk describes the hotel's entire collection), a great classic rock "soundtrack" throughout the common areas that makes it hard not to smile and tap your feet; yet never loud or obnoxious, just fun. The hotel itself is 650 rooms on 7 floors, with the Kitchen Restaurant, Emack & Bolios / Starbucks, and a nice workout room on the first, the lobby, Velvet Lounge, and Rock Shop on the second, guest rooms on 3-7 (where 7 is the "Club Level"). It's spread out in a large semicircle with the pool and Beach Club in the center. The heated pool was gorgeous, and really does have a working underwater sound system (though, once experienced, that's more of a novelty than anything else). Most of it is quite shallow-- 3.5 feet, with a small section of 4.5 feet. It has a fun waterslide at one end and plenty of seating around, including a "sandy beach" area. At night, the hotel hosts "Dive-In Movies"; you can watch a recent DVD release while you lounge in the pool! Beyond the pool (and surrounding one side of the hotel) is a pathway that's a short walk to Universal Studios; a bridge connects that to CityWalk, and another bridge joins the far end of CityWalk with Islands of Adventure. If you spend all day at (particularly) IOA, your feet will appreciate the water taxi service that runs between CityWalk and the hotel every 15 minutes. It's a great scenic ride day or night. The rooms themselves are fairly typical in size and amenities. No fridge or microwave, but very clean, nice dressing area outside the bathroom, very clean and neat. And what a view! Our room faced both the pool and the parks-- a great sunset sight, with the parks all lit up and the colored lights on Hollywood Rip Ride Rockit reminding you of just where you are! The only real issue I found with the room itself was that the bathroom is sized, and the door located, such that you have to stand in about a 6" diameter circle-- between the sink and toilet-- in order to open or close the door without hitting your toes. The Kitchen restaurant is fantastic-- best buffet breakfast we've ever had anywhere. Huge selection, friendly staff, great food. The real only downside is the price. When you visit a theme park, you expect to be treated like the captive audience you are: $9.00 hamburgers, $2.75 beverages, and so on. Staying in an on-site hotel extends that experience, depriving you of even a temporary escape back to the world of normal prices; That breakfast buffet at the Kitchen is $20/person, which is a lot even for a resort, and there's no real options other than feeding your family some kind of packaged food you brought with you. My only other pricing gripe: At Hard Rock's prices, Wi-Fi internet should be free. It's not-- it's $9.95 per day per device. They offer free internet in the lobby area only.

Reviews.Title: “Good for its Universal perks, otherwise expensive”
Reviews.Author: Stateomaine
Reviews.Content: Stayed just 1 night so we could access the early entry and universal express benefits at the parks. Room was fine, though hallways were a bit maze-like and layout of hotel is weird with lobby on the 3rd floor. Nice coffee shop/ snack bar on the 1st floor for those who don't want to pay or wait around for a sit down breakfast. You can do water taxi or walk to the park. There was very little info about how frequently the taxis ran, so we walked. Took us about 10 min with a stroller and 2 kids. The decor, obviously, is rock-related, but couldn't help thinking all the excerpted music lyrics displayed everywhere reminded me of my binder from 8th grade. Got right into the park at 8 or so, not in retrospect so necessary because during the 2nd week of Dec no one was there. We only used our express passes x2 since wait times were minimal nearly everywhere. Also worth mentioning that the express pass doesn't work at Harry Potter and the Forbidden Journey. At around 2 we decided to head back to the hotel to do a little pool time before heading to the airport. Waited for a shuttle for 15 min but it didn't come so we walked. Our keys didn't work to get us into the building, but staff let us in and we changed in the poolside lavatories. Pool is nice though music a little loud, with good poolside bar/food service. All in all, if I was going back to Universal during a peak time, the perks would make the room price worth it, but if those things aren't important to you, you can find just as nice a place for less.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe The Hype”
Reviews.Author: djp4268
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hardrock Orlando from New Years eve for 1 week, we booked a club level room which is not worth the extra, the club room is very small and not enough seating to accommodate all the guests staying on the 7th floor, you had to stand up eating your breakfast and don't even bother going in there after 9.30am as there will be nothing of the very poor selection of food left!!! - also they say free wifi for the 7th floor, the signal was that bad in our room we couldn't get on it, after the first night we complained and they moved us to the 5th floor where the internet was ok, they also credited us with 75USD per night as we were no longer in a club level room, the rooms on the 5th are identical to the 7th. Now for the good points, staying in one of the 3 hotels on sight gives you an automatic express pass for all the rides, this in itself is worth staying there, also the breakfast in The Kitchen is excellent, a buffet style with a hugh choice for 10usd for kids and 19.99 for adults, the staff are very friendly and the Valet parking is a must, this is an extra 7usd per day over the standard parking charge of 15 per night, when ever you want your car you just text them and it's waiting for you outside within 5 minutes, then when you come back just drive up to reception and they take it off you. Overall it's an OK hotel with it's good and bad points and if I was visiting Universal Orlando in the future, I would probably book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunloverSpain
Reviews.Content: We stayed in fhis hotel to celebrate husband birthday and the experience just made the holiday all the more enjoyable. All the staff we met were friendly and the room was spacious, clean and the coffee machine was a godsend when getting up early for the parks.The kids loved the pool and the cabana with the games console. The location of the hotel is close enough to walk but the water taxi was a nice experience as well as the ricksaw.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Makes all the Difference”
Reviews.Author: velk19976
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel After a short but expensive cab ride to the hotel, my teenage daughter and I walk into a very quiet lobby at the Hard Rock Hotel at 12:30 a.m. It is the Monday before Christmas. The front desk clerk tells us he has some good news and some bad news. My daughter and I decide we will be nice no matter what. The hotel had some problems with some of their rooms and there is no room for us at the hotel. However, we will spend the night free at the Doubletree Inn. As a side note, I found this incredibly funny (room at the Inn on Christmas week). While the front desk staff braced for our outrage, we assured them everything was fine and could we return for the rest of our stay. Our “niceness” was rewarded with all kinds of giveaways and free breakfast. During all this excitement, the night manager comes out to check on the situation. I tell him that his front desk staff are extremely accommodating and have treated us very well. Smiles are in abundance. This was a wonderful start to our great stay at the Hard Rock. The water taxis are great ways to get to the parks. Early entry is a big help at Harry Potter’s World of Wizardy. And all guests get fast pass to most of the amusement rides. Thanks Jose!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Average Rooms & Excellent Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SanjG
Reviews.Content: Being a first time visitor to Orlando, we chose to stay at the Hard Rock Hotel due to its location to the Universal theme parks and its fast-pass benefit. We originally booked a Kids Suite and later changed it to 2 double rooms (garden-view). The rooms were average in size while the bathrooms were small. Breakfast at the Hard Rock, at an additional cost, was fantastic with a very good selection and value for money. Access to the park via the river-boat was marvellous while the fast-pass was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando Universal option”
Reviews.Author: pgranados
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel inside Universal. The rooms were nice, clean, comfortable beds. The front desk personnel was very nice and friendly, as well as the bell boys and the rest of the staff. Everyone was very helpful. But most important, it is within walking distance from the Universal Studios parks and you get the Express Pass option with your room key card which is fantastic and extremely necessary specially in peak season. I did find that the convenience store at the hotel was very expensive. $5 for a bottle of water is absurd. But the option is to get some goodies right before you check out outside of Universal at regular prices.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service and Park Perks”
Reviews.Author: klynnied
Reviews.Content: We stayed christmas week and the Hard Rock was our oasis amidst the choas of the parks. We stayed in a garden view room which was decent size with nice amenities including Keurig coffee, large tv and extremely comfortable beds. The room was fairly basic in decor with a sprinkling of rock-related photos but was clean and well-maintained. The biggest standout at this property was the service. We were greeted immediately for help with luggage upon arrival and at check in, were invited behind the desk to look at photos of the views from the various rooms left so we could pick our favorite. The bellman who delivered our luggage was so friendly and provided a full insider's strategy to tackling the parks over the course of our stay to ensure we saw and did everything with minimal wait times. Service was again very attentive, friendly and hip throughout the property, including in the restuarants and out at the pool. The pool is great for kids, with a really cool water slide, ping-pong, pool and a volleyball court. A couple of tips - the Kitchen restuarant has a huge buffet breakfast and if you're seated before 9am kids eat for $5. While this is somewhat dangerous, you can charge anything you buy in the parks to your room so you don't even need your wallet while in the parks and you can have merchadise delievered to your room so no need to carry bags. We also used the Emack and Bolio's ice cream shop to grab coffee in the morning before heading out. Also, we purchased the Hard Rock all access card prior to arrival which can gets you priority seating at the cafe in citywalk which we used cutting our wait time from 45 minutes to 5. The card can also give you a room upgrade if available. Of course the biggest perk was the free Express Pass to Universal and Islands of adventure for all guests (your room key is your express pass) which you can use even on the day you check out all day. Lastly, we didn't bother renting a car until the day we left and the Hertz on property was probably the best experience I've ever had renting a car. Valet pulled the car right up...no waiting in line and to return, we just dropped it off in the front of the hotel with the valet. so easy and much better rates than picking up at the airport. The hotel was only a 5 minute walk to the parks (the closest out of the 3 on property) but you could also take a free boat shuttle or these rickshaw bikes in which passengers dictate the fare (free ride with tips as you see fit). Great stay and despite the high price, tremendous value to staying right at Universal. This is the only way to do Universal...would stay again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location & Fast Pass”
Reviews.Author: Princesssam1992
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel over Christmas, four adults and one teenager. We had 2 rooms, which were spacious, each had double beds and bathroom, with seperate sink area. There was also a seating area, table and chairs, TV and coffee and tea making facilities The hotel and decor were lovely, the gardens well maintained and the added extras, such as the memorabilia were nice. Staff were friendly and helpful. When staying at the hotel, you can visit Harry Potter World an hour before the park opens (but this is not unique to the hotel, and we still waited an hour to get on the ride at 7am) you can also fastpass on most of the rides in Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure. If you like the rides, it is definately worth staying here, we visited the parks most days to do a few rides and they were charging $70+ per day for fastpasses in the parks. The pool area was lovely, although unfortunately we did not have time to use it! There is a secure car park (which unfortunately, is chargeable- works out at about $16 a day, or $30 valet.) I have visited florida 12 times and never had to pay for car parking at the accomodation. You can use either a walkway to get to Citywalk/Islands of adventure/Universal- which takes about 5-10 mins, take the free water taxi (approx. every 20 mins.) There are also people on bikes (with trailors) that can be used, for a tip to the driver. The only bad points were the car park charges ($16 a day), internet charges ($10 a day) and we used the hotel phone for 9 mins which cost over $70 + tax. before visiting, it is worth signing up for the hard rock 'All Access' Card- which gives you 10% off in the shop, restaurant, and they will also upgrade your room when possible. Apart from the car parking, internet etc charges, I would recommend the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rockin' at the Hard Rock!”
Reviews.Author: cljd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights over the New Year's holiday. We're a family of 5-- Mom, Dad, 3 kids ages 12, 12 and 9. We booked 2 adjoining rooms-- 1 was a deluxe king, the other had 2 queen beds. A wonderful hotel with great perks! If you plan to visit Universal during a busy season, I'd highly recommend staying on-site. You get an express pass which allows you to enter a separate line for almost every ride at both parks. Even over a busy holiday, we never waited more than 10 minutes in any line using this great perk. The Harry Potter ride unfortunately does not utilize the express pass.... but the Harry Potter area and the ride opened at 7am just for on-site guests, so even for the most popular ride, without an express pass, we only waited for 30 minutes to ride. Staying on-site is expensive, but in return you get to skip lines and waits. The hotel was lovely-- delicious food, welcoming staff, great housekeeping, cool rock and roll memorabilia everywhere. I especially loved the pool and the poolside bar and food service. The hotel rooms were not the biggest or the grandest, but you're really not there to lounge in your room all day! You want to see the parks, walk through City Walk and check out the underwater sound system in the pool! We can't wait to come back. Keep on rockin', Hard Rock Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great place... and toddler friendly!”
Reviews.Author: hubbard53
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at The Hard Rock with my wife and 16m old son. Service was exceptional and accomodating to a toddler. Restaurants are not always 'kid friendly' but The Kitchen was excpetionally so - from a kid's menu and buffet to a kid's play area, they made the effort to make it easy for parents. When we first checked in, we were on the 1st floor which is also the pet-friendly floor. Being allergic to most dogs and cats, my eyes promptly swelled. A quick call to the front desk had us moved to the 4th floor. Kudos to the staff for making this easy. Room was nice - a normal hotel room with two phones, two sinks, flat panel TV, and a Kurig coffee maker (yes, the in-room coffee is free). Nothing special but clean and comfortable. We ate at The Kictchen four times - each time, the staff was exceptionally nice and accomodating - they loved our son and made every effort ot making him comfortable. From cold milk refills to freshly made mac & cheese, they provided him with eveything he wanted. For one champagne brunch, they made sure Mommy & Daddy were equally fulfilled :) The pool was nice - I didnt go in and our son was too young to participate in the kid-oriented activities but the poolside bar was awesome! Agian, great food and even better drinks. Be sure to check out the "Purple Drank"...mmmmmm..... Proximity to the Universal theme parks was wonderful. Unlike Disney Parks and resorts, the parks were easily accessible by walking, water taxi, or pedi-cab (bicycle taxi). We chose to walk as it was a nice stroll through well-maintained paths and lanscape. Early park entrance and Express Pass was a huge plus! We spent two days at Universal theme parks and one day at Disney. Universal was fun and easy - Disney was long, boring, and consumed by travel. Ugh, It was a great 5 day getaway for my family - we'll definitely be back. My son had a great time at 16m - I can only imagine how much fun he'll have at 16 yearts! :) Thanks, Hard Rock!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing vacation”
Reviews.Author: Macilly
Reviews.Content: We took the family to Florida to see Harry Potter park and booked Hard Rock due to location. Completely fell in love with the hotel, the pool area and the walk to the park. My kids have traveled all over but this was their absolute favorite vacation spot. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, modern feel.”
Reviews.Author: Alis0n33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights. We were originally going to stay at the Portafino Bay Hotel, but we decided on the Hard Rock Hotel. The resort is beautiful and has a rock 'n' roll feel. The hotel room keys give anyone a one hour early entrance to Universal. The location is perfect for both of the parks; we were able to walk to the parks in fifteen minutes. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, however, the bathroom is very small. We rented a cabana for two days, and it was great. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time and still as good”
Reviews.Author: lilaw
Reviews.Content: Worth staying just for the fast pass and early entry to go on fj. Staff very friendly and kind to the kids. I had a badge, a mention on the birthday page in reception, a piece of birthday cake in our room and a voucher for a drink or ice cream because I was celebrating my birthday, which were all nice touches. It's so easy to get to park, I walked it in about 7 mins, even got to entrance of universal studios before the rest of family who used the boat, as it stops other side of the water. Rooms were plenty big enough, with 2 very comfy beds and a cot for my 2 year old. Movie on the big screen by the heated pool (shrek 4) and character dining with Bart add to a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced, segregated by price, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: MinorityWhiteMale
Reviews.Content: Nice bedding, nice room but no better than Embassy or Hampton. Atleast with them you get 2 rooms microwave 'fridge breakfast and drinks without using a credit card limit to have it. Like many things - too much hype for too little product. You better pay for the top of the line room if you expect anything special. The Loews Hotels clearly and distinctlnctly seperate classes by financial status at every inch of their properties.

Reviews.Title: “"The Unexpected"”
Reviews.Author: Carol G
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights here and what a surprise this hotel had for us. The hotel is lovely, the gym and staff were excellent. Dorby in Emack and Balios makes the best smoothies in Orlando! The hotel is in an excellent position for the two theme parks and we recommend the bike rickshaw rides to the theme parks. We had one meal in the kitchen on the saturday night and unfortunately my meal was cold and i had to send it back. The pool is only 4 foot deep, my autistic daughter was not aloud to take her water ball in, the pool manager was way over the top and upsetting. Ashley the manager was lovely and helpful but the damage had already been done. Note to Virgin guests - If you intend to take your luggage to Downtown Disney make sure you tell the maids even though you haven't checked out and you have a late check out time, otherwise you will find your belongings gone and shared out with the maids like we experienced. The Club 7 lounge was way too small for the amount of guests staying, it was like feeding time at the zoo but the staff were brilliant and friendly. Unfortunately my daughter still wants to come back just for the smoothies that Dorby makes! We had an enjoyable stay with some surprices! and will return. Kind Regards The Garnett Family x

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could stay longer!”
Reviews.Author: mbc2012
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with a teenage daughter and son in December 2011. Everything from checkin to checkout was handled with superior service. The staff was always both willing and able to answer any questions or address our needs. Facility is beautiful, clean, and attractive. can't wait to go back - a respite in the center of theme park madness!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Hard about it.”
Reviews.Author: Michelfoucault
Reviews.Content: We loved our one night at the Hard Rock Hotel. Nothing went wrong and many things we wouldn't even have thought of went very right. Check-in was smooth, courteous, and efficient. The person at the desk gave us detailed and accurate information (without our even asking) about hotel amenities, how to get the most out of our early-admission-to-the-park privileges the next morning, and more. Our room was very spacious, clean, and luxuriously appointed. They have a deal where you can check out a classic guitar of your choice and use it in your room for free. This aging-hippie rocker dad was totally blissed out by that option. The next morning we were able to zip right in to Harry Potter's world at the crack of dawn and see it all before the hordes descended. Our Fast Pass (they call it something else, which I can't remember) that comes as a perk with the hotel room--just show your room key--made the rest of the day go very smoothly. We were glad we splurged on this experience.

Reviews.Title: “A great getaway destination!”
Reviews.Author: jgreene2992
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock for 5 days in early December with my wife and two daughters and had a really great experience. Nice facilities, generously sized rooms and ample services. Really liked the proximity to water taxi and path to City Walk, Universal & IOA. Highly recommended for families. We'll definitely be staying at the Hard Rock the next time we're in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: wklima
Reviews.Content: It had been over 7 years since we stayed at the Portofino during the summer and remembered how wonderful it was to stay on property. My boys were 9 and 13 then, they're 17 and 20 now. Big difference! So, we stayed at the Hard Rock this visit during the week before Christmas and loved every minute of it. Spend the extra money and stay on the Club Level if you can. It was definitely worth it for us. Our room was at the end of the short hall which was an unexpected bonus. It was a brief walk down the hall to the Club where they have breakfast, lunch, dinner and nightly snacks. It's awesome because you really don't have to spend extra money on meals if you don't want to. We also liked the short walk to the theme parks. We never took the water taxi. There are also bicycle rickshaws who work for tips. The boys rode one from the parks to the hotel one time and each gave the bicycler $5. The Club level also has a private concierge which was fantastic for us. They take care of everything you need. I had a roll away bed and it was awful so I slept with my youngest son but we put this huge, long, round pillow in the center of the bed as a divider and it worked out great. The next day I talked to the concierge and she took care of having the roll away removed and crediting the charge of $25 per night for the bed. Also, we signed up for the Total Access card, it's free, and got free Wi-Fi in our room, which is normally $9.95 per night, and 10% off in the Hard Rock Store, which I used several times. The room also had a Keurig coffee maker and K-cups. If you don't know what that is, you are in for a real treat. If you do know what that is, you will be excited, am I right?! I took my own K-cups, but they had a nice selection of Newman's brand along with some teas, hot chocolate, plenty of sugar and creamers. The advantages of the express pass at the theme parks is worth staying on property. Of course, you can't use the express pass for Harry Potter but they do open the attraction to people staying on property one hour before they open to the general public. From the time we left our room, walked to Hogwarts : ), stood in line for the Forbidden Journey ride, and got off the ride, it was a total of one hour. The boys went back to get in line again and the wait to get on the ride was already up to 2 hours! So, if you stay at the Hard Rock or one of the other hotels, drag yourself out of bed early to see Harry Potter, it's worth it!!! We also had tickets to an Orlando Magic basketball game and I didn't want to drive to the Amway Center and deal with traffic, parking, walking and finding my way back to the hotel. The concierge told me they had "on demand" transportation services on property so we just went to the valet and told him we needed a ride to the Amway Center and a town car that was parked at the hotel pulled up, whisked us away, and dropped us off in front of the Amway Center! The driver gave me his card and I gave him my number and I called him when we were ready to be picked up. It was worth every penny and we felt so important! When we got back to the Hard Rock, we had missed the nightly snack and we were hungry so I decided to spend the money I'd saved on the roll away to enjoy "Star Service" room service. It was exceptional! We were definitely treated like rock stars. If you are planning a trip to Universal and want to stay on property, check out the Hard Rock, especially if you have older kids. The pool area is unbelievable and would be great during the summer, but we didn't spend any time at the pool this trip, even though it was warm enough! Also, if you are a Florida resident, as we are, take advantage of the discounts. I saved a lot of money on the hotel and theme park tickets!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Universal”
Reviews.Author: Davehewett1
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock at Universal was above average and the staff was fantastic. The valet parking is $22 a day and self park is $15 (I think the $7 was money well spent). The breakfast area downstairs had a decent selection and overpriced Starbucks coffee. If City Walk is open and you are heading to Islands of Adventure, just go by the real Starbucks and get some coffee and a bagel. The location is perfect for walking to both parks. Universal studios is a closer walk but both are less than 10 minutes. They also provide free water taxi to and from the hotel to City Walk and both parks. One final note; As a Florida resident we get a discounted rate. The rooms are almost double for non-residents. The pool speakers must have been broken.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: luvgoofy4064
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at Disney and drive over to spend a day or two at Universal. We decided to stay at the Hard Rock to take advantage of the express pass. We wished we would have done that a long time ago. We didn't wait more that 5 minutes for each ride and it was a busy time of the year. The express pass couldn't be used on the Forbidden Journey (Harry Potter) or the Rip, Ride, Rockit roller coaster, which are two rides that have extremely long lines. The benefits of the express pass alone make staying at this hotel a value. Saving time by not waiting in long lines is definitely a plus. The staff was amazing and often used the lingo of a rock star. My kids loved it. The room was average with it being clean enough and large enough. They have Keurig Coffee Brewers with a variety of coffee/cocoa/tea to choose from...wonderful! The only negative about the room was that there was a locked refrigerator that was a stocked bar. They would bring a second fridge up at a cost. I would rather have the stocked bar removed and the fridge be included in the price of the room. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again. I would even venture to say that the staff at this hotel was probably one of the best staffs we've seen at many hotels, including Disney hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere, but inconsistent Service”
Reviews.Author: WorldAtlasJGalt
Reviews.Content: I spent the week before Christmas at the Hard Rock with my 7 yr old boy and we enjoyed ourselves immensely. Between the Universal Parks, City Walk and the hotel pool, we were entertained our entire stay. As a music fanatic, I truly enjoyed the music playing at all times in the lobby and pool area. They even pumped music under the water in the pool. The decor was funky and fun and the layout flowed well. While I received great service at some points of our trip, other times I encountered staff who were unwilling or unable to help. While the room was in pretty good shape, the shower curtain rod was rusted, which could have been overlooked had we not been put in a room that had 4 dogs on one side and another 2 on the other. While I like animals, I would have liked to be consulted first before being lodged next to dogs who would bark and whine at different times of the day and evening. While I understand that tipping is an important part of how employees at hotels get paid, I felt that much of the service was insincere and geared only towards getting the largest tip possible from me. Also, it felt sometimes like everyone had their hand out looking for a tip. The above things I mention were small things, but they did add up to taint my view of this particular hotel. Overall, I enjoyed my stay as did my boy and I would go back and stay there again because of the atmosphere and close vicinity it has to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & vibe”
Reviews.Author: rickandjohn
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Hard Rock in Orlando. Wanted to stay in the park to take advantage of early admission & express rides. We checked out the Porto Vino Hotel to compare & we're glad we chose the Hard Rock. Only negative was that we took advantage of the valet parking only to find that 2 sets of our grand kid's headphones were taken from the car during our stay. Not the best way to end a fun trip.

Reviews.Title: “Rock on!”
Reviews.Author: JenfromMaine
Reviews.Content: My family (husband, wife and 12 year old) stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel during the week of Thanksgiving 2011. We decided to stay at the Hard Rock solely for the benefit of having an express pass, which is really great. I don't think we'd do another Universal trip without staying on property. The rooms themselves are just average. Clean and plenty of room. It would be nice to have the use of the refridgerator without having to pay extra. We had a garden view and it was very quiet. We thought the beds were comfortable. The people that worked there were really outstanding. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. We definately appreciated the service. The pool area is very nice. The grounds are well maintained. Of course, you can't beat the location. It was great to be able to walk to the parks, or take the ferry. The only downside for us was the price of the Kitchen and Emack and Bolios. We ate breakfast at the buffet at the Kitchen one morning, and while it was good I don't think it was worth the price. We got pizza from Emack's and that was just bad. We don't mind paying high price for good quality, but do mind if the product is just average or below. The atmosphere there was nice. I liked seeing the Rock'N'Roll paraphenelia, and the music was nice...not too loud. If the property didn't have the added bonus of the express pass I would have probably rated it a "3" but that added amenity is definately worth another star. I'm not sure if we'd choose the Hard Rock again, but would definately stay at another Universal property.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: lauriem05
Reviews.Content: When my husband told me he booked this hotel, I sort of expected a Hard Rock Cafe experience- ok food with rock n roll in your face. Let's just say I need to be less judgmental. The hotel was beautiful, the restaurants were nice, the pool was well laid out (easy to find our kids), clean, and what you might expect at a Four Seasons. And for the music, it could not have been better. We had a kids' suite, which was basically a king room with a 2nd bedroom with twin beds, plus a kid size table and chairs and very handy cube shelf so they can organize their stuff. The decor was very nice, with Beatles photographs, and.Peter Max print-- no Kiss tongues or anything tacky. My husband really enjoyed the free loaner electric guitar. I was worried our neighbors might be enjoying theirs at 2 am, but not so. Plus, they all come with headphones. Another nice Inge about the hotel is its proximity to Universal. It's a 10 minute walk, but through a beautifully landscaped lawn, a 5 minute water taxi, or 5 minue bike cab ride. While we were there we dined at the nearby Portofino hotel and the Royal Pacific and enjoyed them both.

Reviews.Title: “Family weekend trip to Orlando”
Reviews.Author: gottaride64
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 rocked at the Hard Rock Hotel! We took a long weekend trip in December to Universal and what a pleasure staying at the Hard Rock! Everything and everyone was top notch. Room-immaculate. Service-attentive,friendly. Property-beautiful with location, location, location (walking distance to parks and free shuttle to Sea World). Music-nonstop (just the way we like it). Having the parks' fastpass feature built into the room key was icing on the cake and totally worth it. We ate mostly at the Kitchen and enjoyed the breakfast buffet, which had everything you could hope for to power up for an action filled day at the parks. Dinner offered a great selection of standards and nicer options - family friendly, too. Bottom line, we have older kids (9-15) who are far past pirates and princesses and this was perfect for their tastes.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous all around!”
Reviews.Author: earthlingdee
Reviews.Content: We spent the end of our honeymoon at the Hard Rock at Universal, and wow what a difference it was compared to our accommodations at Disney! For the same amount of money we had a pool view room (and we could see the parks from it!), with excellent service from the moment we walked in. The beds were fluffy and comfortable and all of the decorations and amenities were great. Really nice touches all around, like the ipod dock in our room, and all of the memorabilia on the walls. We weren't on the club level, although I think we might try that next time. It's a very easy walk to the parks, and there's also a water taxi that can take you to the City Walk. We spent time in both parks and in the downtown area, and never needed to leave. Inside the Hard Rock, we hit up the Kitchen for breakfast (definitely get the buffet - totally the best value for the money, and you'll leave stuffed!), as well as Velvet for drinks. It was cozy and wonderful. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to pass up the value”
Reviews.Author: ILUVTRAVELCHANNEL
Reviews.Content: When visiting Universal Studios, many people shy away from the higher priced Loews Universal hotels, but there is so much extra value at these hotels. Our last stay was at the Hard Rock Hotel and it was amazing. The hotel is walking distance to the parks so it's no problem going back to your hotel room if you forgot something, or just to rest from hours of walking (not standing in line). I say not standing in line because as a guest of the Hard Rock (or any of the Universal Hotels), you use your room key as an Express Pass. This means you don't have to wait in the regular lines to get on the Rides (except for Harry Potter). We went during the off season which was a little cooler (upper 70's) but we still got to enjoy the pool and waterslide because the pool is heated. The hotel room was nice, but not up to standards with the rest of the hotel. We found the rooms at the Royal Pacific to be much nicer. Still, in all we were impressed with the overall look and service provided. Dining options are very nice with two restaurants within the hotel, cafe, and restaurants at City Walk within a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “So disappointed in the service”
Reviews.Author: lvemxco
Reviews.Content: Our family travels to Florida every year. We normally rent a house with friends, but decided to stay onsite this year. So excited about our choice to stay at Hard Rock. Thought it would be perfect for us and our 15 year old son. The hotel was very nice, clean, and the wait staff, and cleaning staff were very nice. No one could answer questions for you, or gave you wrong information. The concierge staff was the worst I have ever experienced. My husband and I have stayed at 5 star hotels and 2 star hotels. We are not hotel snobs by any means, but when you are paying what you pay to stay at Hard Rock I would expect wonderful concierge service. They treated you as if you were a bother and inconvience. When I was not given correct information from one of them regarding the name of the shuttle service that would be picking us up, the concierge working that day was down right rude to me when I was trying to figure out what shuttle we needed to get on in 15 minutes. I tried to set up a Seaworld experience with them, and they simply couldn't do it and really didn't care. I arranged everything myself. Including something special for my husband and I for our anniversary. I didn't bother to ask them. The straw that broke the camels back was our last day there two of the luggage employees got in a screaming match that had everyone in the lobby on edge. So much so we were standing in front of our children and trying to leave the lobby for fear something worse would happen. I filled out a survey and called the hotel and left a message with my concerns. No one has contacted me in regarding the situation. We will stay onsite again but not at Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay to see Universal”
Reviews.Author: vacationisfun_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard rock hotel over Thanksgiving and spend four nights there. Check in was easy and the room was comfortable and clean. Two queen beds is nice with two kids. Breakfast is easy in the Kitchen which has bagel;s coffee..., expensive but the usual resort prices. We went to the park each day and using your room key as a fast pass is worth the price of the room alone. They will charge $40-50 per person per day to buy a fast pass and you can use your room key and go on every ride except Harry Potter and one roller coaster as many times as you want without any lines. We never waited over 10 minutes for any ride but Harry Potter. We chilled by the pool a few afternoons, very loud, rock music blasting with a DJ, so if you are looking for peace and quiet dont stay here. If you are looking for a rockin place close to the park, its worth the money in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but worth every penny.”
Reviews.Author: snowy1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights as a treat. I would love to have stayed longer but at £160 a night we couldn't justify much more. Especially when that sort of money can buy luxurious places in Florida. It was worthwhile for the Universal Express pass that you get when you stay at one of their hotels which means you can queue jump the rides. The hotel is steeped in history with musical instruments and costumes from all the greats that you could literally spend hours looking at. Everything about the hotel oozes luxury, but it is the subtle things that make staying there that little bit more special, for instance you can hear music when you dive into the pool as they have specially adapted speakers to play it underwater. If you are visiting Universal Studios then you have a number of options to get you there - take the boat, hire a dude in a rickshaw or have anice stroll for twenty mins. If you are lucky enough to be there when a decent concert is on too, be sure to grab tickets as it is an excellent venue. I saw a few acts there and they were always great gigs. As for the comfort and cleanliness - absolutely faultless.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better but close”
Reviews.Author: smurfette64
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 10:45pm and room not ready - apologized and gave us a coke plus told could have first night half price. As we'd pre-paid told amount would be credited to card - still waiting 2 wks later. Stayed 6 nights, 4 of us, got 3 towels on 3 days and no bath mat another day. Housekeeping needs to get their act together. Staff are friendly enough but were unable to help much, kept sending you to someone else. The best thing is it is so close to the parks we walked and staying onsite the express was a godsend

Reviews.Title: “Live the Rock and Roll Lifestyle”
Reviews.Author: DaytonaGuy
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel at Universal is one of three on-site hotels. Although I tend to stay at more budget minded hotels, I do like to splurge now and then. The hotel is not cheap by any means, but includes some nice perks which make up for the cost. As soon as you enter, you feel like a rockstar. The hotel is jam packed with Rock and Roll memoriabelia everywhere you look. Just wandering around the hotel can be an exerience in itself. If you can find some time to relax, they have a rather large pool with slide and underwater speakers which is quite unique. The rooms were extremely clean and comfortable. For those of you that are "green" make sure to look in the display rack on the table (at least that was where mine was) for a plastic bag to recycle your newspaper, cans or bottles. This is something that I have never seen in a hotel before. And now onto the perks. On-site hotel guests get early admission to Islands of Adventure and the Wizzarding World of Harry Potter! Be sure to take full advantage of this as the area is quite popular and can be crowded at times. Once inside Potter be sure to experience Olivanders Wand Shop first. This is a brief 4-5 minute show, but only 25-30 people are allowed in at a time so the wait times can be brutal. In addition to early admission to IOA, your hotel key serves as a fast pass on most of the attractions at BOTH parks. Unfortunately The Forbidden Journey Ride is not included as one of those rides, so be sure and do it before the parks open to all other visitors. Depending on the day, a fast pass can be quite expensive at Universal. Of the three hotels, Hard Rock is the closest to both parks. You can take a leisurely walk, complimentary water taxi, or even a pedicab (for the price of a tip) to the parks. If the Hard Rock is not available, all of the resorts are nice and similarly priced. The rooms at Hard Rock are similar in size to that of the Royal Pacific, and a bit smaller than those at the Portofino, but still quite comfortable. As with most high end hotel there is a $15 per night charge for parking and a charge for internet access. It would be nice to include at least the internet at these rates. The Fitness Center looked quite extensive and there is a charge for it unless you are a "Club Level" guest. If you happen to be at the resort on the last Thursday of the month, be sure to check out "Velvet Sessions" which is a rock and roll cocktail party held in an intamate setting. There is a cost for this, however it is cheaper to book in advance. According to their website past performers have included Bret Michaels, Eddie Money, Joan Jett, Journey and many others. Drinks and appetizers are provided for a limited time.

Reviews.Title: “Be Aware”
Reviews.Author: GraceH33304
Reviews.Content: I have always stayed at Lowe's hotels when I take my family to the Universal theme parks for Thanksgiving, this year I chose Hard Rock and was truly disappointed in the service provided and the cleanliness of my room. Check in was great the front desk person was warm and helpful; however once they have swiped your credit card it is downhill from there. Here are some things you should be aware of; Hard Rock Orlando will book a standard room for a party of five no problem, when you arrive and check in you realize you only have sleeping arrangements for 4 two queen size beds. When you speak to the front desk they will tell you no problem and provide you a roll away bed for an additional $25.00 a day, this could be me however I feel cheated if they book a standard room for 5 people then they should tell you up front that it will only sleep 4 and a $25.00 a day roll away bed charge will be added to your bill. The standard rooms are small and when you add the roll away bed you are packaged like sardines. When you find prehistoric size cock roaches in your room they will send someone to your room to investigate, however the young lady they sent to ours was so frighten that my son had to end up smashing the bug, while she washed the wall down to remove the evidence. You will then have to wait another day to be moved to what you can only hope is a clean(er) room which takes will into late afternoon so your night is spent looking around the room in horror your day is spent shaking out and packing your belongings and your afternoon is spent waiting to be moved to a different room. During the move my grandson left his Nintendo DXL in the dirty room when I realized this I call the front desk, which transferred me to security who check lost and found then told me nothing had been turned in. I went down to the concierge to explain what had happen this women listen carefully showing no emotion and told me there was nothing they could do. The fact is the security person was more helpful and took it upon herself to walk through housekeeping and check each cleaning cart for my grandsons Nintendo, she arrived at our door late in the evening to return the item, two thumbs up for security perhaps Hard Rock you could have them train your Concierge Staff? The one good thing I can state is look for a Vibe Manager; if you are lucky enough to find one then you will be treated with respect and feel as if someone at Hard Rock really cares about your time spent on their property. My angel of mercy was a Vibe Manager named Steven King; he listen expressed outrage made phone calls and apologized for everyone less the caring attitude. He stated that my Nov 23, stay (one day) amount would be removed from my bill as an act of good faith provided me his care and told me to contact him if I had any further problem. Yes Virginia there is a Santa Claus. Unfortunately when I checked out the charge for Nov 23 was still on my bill and when I told them it was to be removed nothing happen the bill remained the same, just like the song. There are lots of nice things at Hard Rock the Beach area, the Velvet Lounge, Restaurants and grounds for exercising and having fun, however if Hard Rock want to maintain a standard of being a Deluxe Hotel and charge upwards of $287.00 a night to stay on their property they have a long way to go in the customer satisfaction area. And should increase the budget regarding pests control.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Cool Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: Ophelia2EastLyme_CT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock on our first trip to Universal 4 years ago and loved it, so when we decided to go back this November to finally see Harry Potter (3 nights, the weekend before Thanksgiving) we didn't even think of going anywhere else.
