After reading a few negative reviews I wondered if it had changed, however I can assure you that it was even more fun than I remember. Okay, maybe if your were inspecting the property alone, it would be 4 stars plus, however when you factor in the location and fun factor, there is no question that it deserves a 5. Would you really want to come back in your amusement park clothes to sit in a stuffy hotel? No, you'd want to go to a fun and cool hotel, that is right around the corner and adds to the excitement of the theme parks. We traveled with my 15 and 12 year old kids, and just took a cab from the airport, as it was quick, easy and less expensive than paying for a shuttle for the 4 of us, not to mention that we didn't have to pay for parking. After checking out, we picked up our Hertz Rental car right at the front counter of the hotel to continue our trip to visit Florida relatives for Thanksgiving (very convenient) When the cab pulled into the hotel when we arrived , there was a team of friendly bellmen welcoming and assisting us. We had an efficient and upbeat checkin, and were fortunate that our room was ready at 10:00 a.m. when we arrived. Be sure to stop in the restroom next to the checkin desk, gorgeous! We stayed in a club level room and had a breathtaking view of the pool and the parks (yes, we could see Hogwarts Castle,wow!) Since there was 4 of us, the club level was definitely worth the extra money. Continental breakfast each morning, snacks and beverages throughout the day, a happy hour buffet, and desserts and milk at night! The breakfast was great as you could get in, have a quick quick bite, and still make it to the early opening of Harry Potter. On our checkout day we at at "The Kitchen" since we weren't picking up our rental car until 10:00. We opted for the buffet and it was awesome! You can order Omelettes or Eggs Benedict to order, and they had every breakfast item you could want. The price was very reasonable for what you received. The pool area was a lot of fun, and since you have the early entry, and front of the line access to the rides with your room key, you have plenty of time to get back to the hotel in the afternoon to enjoy it. My kids participated in some of the activities, and my daughter even won a hula hoop contest. They have water with lemon in a big glass decanter by the pool for you to help yourself which was a nice touch. It's so nice to build relaxation time into amusement park time. As others have mentioned, the walk to the parks was very short. We would take the water taxi back to the hotel at night for a relaxing end of the day. We also went to Blue Man Group one night, and again, 5 minute walk! If we ever go back to Universal, we will definitely stay at the Hard Rock again!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Stay--Worth Price if Universal Studios is your Destination”
Reviews.Author: Gripster
Reviews.Content: Though we typically like to stay off-site for better values, we decided to spring for the Hard Rock as part of a Universal Studios package. We wanted to really experience the World of Harry Potter, which meant getting in early. HR gives you the early admissions bonus PLUS you just walk over in the morning. It was a fantastic way to experience U Studios, especially with two youngsters (4 and 8). Room was spotless, fresh and well appointed. Everything in HR is ridiculously expensive, but generally of high quality, too. In the evening, you can walk or take free water taxi to all the bars, shops and restaurants in U. Studios downtown. We splurged and it was fun--definitely not a bargain, but didn't feel like a ripoff either. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality Professionals - Fun too!”
Reviews.Author: hanna626
Reviews.Content: IMPRESSIVE, in a word. Rooms are modern and clean, not overly spacious, but fine. Pool is beautiful, and the pool waitstaff just couldn't be nicer. Fun pool activities for the kids. Great music playing all the time :) BUT, the thing that sets this hotel apart is the fact that the staff seems to live and breathe hospitality. We had a booking snafu, NOT their fault, booked it through airline miles, and they felt so bad for us, doing everything they could to put us in the room we thought we'd booked. Even gave us a couple of drink coupons. When I asked why he was being so generous, when the problem wasn't Hard Rock's, he simply said, "I'm in the hospitality business - I want you to have a great stay." Oh, and the room key doubles as a fast pass for Universal. STAY HERE - you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, work to give you a Rockin' good time”
Reviews.Author: achristy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at all three Universal Resorts and the Hard Rock is superior to both the Royal Pacific and Portofino Hotels for several reasons: 1.) Great staff, From the valet, to the Pool attendants, to the housingkeeping staff everyone is trying to go above and beyond to make your stay enjoyable 2.) Location to the parks- gives you the option to walk, hitch a pedicab ride or use the complimentary water taxi. (because the Hard Rock is the closest hotel to the parks the water taxi runs more frequently) 3.) The Kitchen is a great dining experience and although it is not inexpensive the food and service are excellent. If you have a big appetite try the breakfast buffet, it is massive and has all sorts of unique breakfast items (breakfast pizza, fresh fruit, eggs made to order, stcky buns to die for). This one meal could keep you going through lunch! 4.) The vibe, seriously the energy of the whole place is amazing. 5.) Beautiful rooms with many different options for families. 6.) Staying at this resort allows you fast pass access to the Universal park attractions and entry to the Wizarding World of Harry Potter one hour prior to the rest of the park guests. As Gemma told us when we checked in "the three hotels are the 'three sisters' at Universal and the Hard Rock is the 'rebel' sister". So go on being a rebel it works for you!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KilburnAngie
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard room which isn't cheap but what a great hotel and room. Our room, 4th floor overlooking pool, was modern, stylish and spacious. The hotel staff were really lovely, especially the guy who brought our cases to our room with us, we had a guided tour of the hotel enroute! The pluses for staying here are that you get entry to the park 1 hour before opening time, you can use your room key card for express queues at the park and you can send your purchases back to your hotel room (as long as you're not leaving the next day as they say 9am-11am the next day but ours arrived 9pm the same evening). On the downside, it's expensive (but you know that when you book), and there's charges for parking and internet connection. I think when you pay that kind of money these little things should be included. The water shuttle to City Walk seemed quite frequent but we walked as it was no distance. It's a great location, a great hotel and I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good hotel but be careful when you book room.....”
Reviews.Author: suzanne91
Reviews.Content: ....their marketing pitch on their website is misleading and for guests who do care about a view and book a room based on their website's description: Deluxe Room: .....you’ll delight in every detail in our hotel rooms in Orlando. Cozy pillow-top beds, spacious accommodations and breathtaking views from every angle – what more could a superstar desire? Note "breathtaking view from every angel" -- we upgraded to this room type not just for more space but to guarantee a good view. Well, our room view was the front entrance roof awning and the line of taxis....the hotel manager did discount our room but being here for over a week to have the room we wanted (and booked) would have been preferred....and to hear from the manager not everyone cares about a view was not helpful. I left my comments with the hotel and contacted Lowes / Hard Rock upon our return but to see now two months later the hotel's website still says the same thing, well obviously they don't listen to their customers. A follow up by the hotel acknowledging their error along with a note they have updated their website would have gone a long way for this customer...especially since we travel to FL often and like to return to hotels that take care of their guests. Again this is a nice hotel but to not have our comments addressed makes me wonder if they really care about their guests' overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Live like a rock star”
Reviews.Author: Miketoberfest73
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome hotel. Very comfortable room, great pool, delicious restaurants , nice location and pleasant staff. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect (& pricey) for our Harry Potter visit”
Reviews.Author: DL1603
Reviews.Content: One of the great benefits of staying at this hotel is the package of perks that come with it. If you hate waiting in lines- you get an express pass. If you want to make sure you get done all there is to do at the Wizarding World of Harry Potter- you get into the park an hour early. If you got wet from the rain and need to change or just want to be as close to the park as possible- you get walking distance from the parks- literally only a few minutes away, and mind you, you do get distracted looking at all the shops and food passing through CityWalk. We chose a 2 Queen bed with pull out sofa to fit the 5 of us. The room was spacious for us. If you need a pull out, make sure the description says so, otherwise you could get a 2 queen bed that could fit 5- but only if you pay extra for a cot. If you like fresh coffee, you'll love having the Keurig K-cups there, part of the room. Our room seemed spotless, until I looked up and saw webs of dust hanging from the ceiling corners. There is a pool which has this cool sand beach side to it. Although the pool was not our main purpose to visit, it was nice to take a dip. Keep in mind that the pool has no deep end and the jacuzzi area is quite small- there is an "Adult only" sign there, but we happened to be share this tiny hot waterhole with "adults" who just turned 21, and they were very disturbingly drunk. The culture of the hotel is rock, and so the staff have a laid back, friendly service. Keep in mind that visitors who are of a much older generation or those unfamiliar with rock culture may not see responses like, "Awesome" and "Hey, what's up" as friendly or respectful. The staff is very knowledgable, and every staff person we met was eager to meet our needs and help. As of this date, there is $15 parking fee/per day for self parking, or you could pay for valet service. We unfortunately did not get to try any of the restaurants in the hotel; since City Walk was so close, we ate out.

Reviews.Title: “Fun atmosphere! Needs some work.”
Reviews.Author: Mary T
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a trip to Halloween Horror Nights at Universal. Have stayed here in the past and always enjoyed over the years. This time it was still lots of fun and nice, but not as nice as in the past. They were lacking a few of the little things you don't notice until they are gone. No CD in the room to listen to, the towels seemed old, beds needed to be upgraded, etc. Had I not stayed here in the past I would have not even noticed these things, but if you set standards for yourself, you have to keep them up!

Reviews.Title: “The perks will bring us back”
Reviews.Author: DisneyNut4
Reviews.Content: We felt like rock stars and were treated like them too! Loved the fresh flowers in the lobby and the decor was cool to look at. The rooms were very comfortable - wished the stocked drinks and snacks were not in the room ( the kids wanted to rip into them) I think parking should have been free for guest ( $275 and up a room you would think they wouldn't charge for your car also) The pool was nice but was not deep enough for an adult to swim in - the kids loved the slide. Last day we did have a big cockroach in our bathroom which creeped me out ( flushed it down the toliet - I told the front desk as we were checking out but it didn't seem to matter to them. The perks of being so close to the parks and getting the fast pass was worth the money - we will stay again just for that reason. Otherwise very nice but overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere almost inside Universal parks”
Reviews.Author: ElGrandT
Reviews.Content: We couldn't fully experience the hotel (1 day, 2 nights), but it's clean, has a great pool, good counter service breakfast. It's location is great for Universal parks - which for adults I found to be better than Disney parks - under five minutes walk. Room key gives you priority access to many attractions. You can also get into the parks one hour before regular guests, a great perk specially because of Harry Potter land (very crowded later the day). It doesn't really make you feel like a rock star, but the atmosphere gives you the kicks if you are into Rock n' Roll. I almost bought a guitar in the nearby Hard Rock Cafe...

Reviews.Title: “Best access to Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: berkemp
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to visit Islands of Adventure and Universal Studios either by foot or water taxi. We stayed on the club floor which is the best deal as there is a continental breakfast and then drinks throughout the day. Starting at 5PM there is complimentary beer and wine and great hors d'ouvres which is different every night. We made it our dinner 2 nights. The rooms are most comfotable and the decor of the hotel is VERY hip. It is a great way to relax after exhauting yourself in the parks all day. Would definitely go back and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it should be, soooo disappointed!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rich H
Reviews.Content: Hopefully this review will be of help to you. Booked 4 nights at hotel and was really looking forward to it, however before fully commenting see the following: Plus points: Fast Pass at Universal and Islands of Adventure - a godsend on some days Fantastic location with easy access to parks and City Walk Nice layout and good facilities Staff are very polite and helpful Bad Points: Pool and general cleanliness - They have no cleaning regime for any of the external areas from what I could see and the pool area was filthy considering this hotel is classed as a 4 star hotel. There is a charge of $15 a day to park at the hotel, this is hidden in the small print There is free Internet but only in lobby - To get access in room costs $10 a day, again hidden in small print A service charge of 18% is added to all your bills whether you had good or bad service, you have no choice other than to pay this They reduced the price of my stay period and I asked to cancel and rebook at the lower rate. This never happened and as such cost me $200 extra. Overall this is a good hotel with excellent facilities, location and staff. However this was totally overshadowed by the filthy poo, sun loungers, tables and surrounding area's. They seem to really on the rain to clean this as I saw no one in all my stay clean anything. The pool was littered with leaves and at one point the pool system blocked and the whole area flooded as the pool overflowed. Also I for one hate hidden charges and this hotel is great at them. They are also very puchy with drinks and food around the pool area and constantly pester if you want any. I felt like at all times I was there just as a way to increase their bank balance and nver once felt like the hotel was going out of its way to look after me unless I paid for it. I was one very disappointed customer and I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: justcake13
Reviews.Content: Our trip was last year from December 14 - 17th. We arrived, immediately checked in and went to our room. Within minutes, someone arrived at the door to bring the roll out that we had requested. he was able to reconfigure the room in minutes to make the extra bed fit. The room was a bit small but with 2 adults and 3 teenagers we didn't have much difficulty. The room had a view of some of the rides at Universal as well. The pool was nice but not open enough. The weather was a bit chilly but my kids would have went in the pool. They even closed it early one night right after the kids had put on their bathing suits. I wasn't too happy about that but not much we could do. The food at the hotel was excellent. We ate at the main restaurant and really enjoyed our meal and time there. Since we were there the week before Christmas holidays there weren't very many people at the hotel. I would suggest staying this week rather than during the Christmas holidays. Overall, the next time we go to Universal, we will be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “as a family with small children, we totally loved this hotel..”
Reviews.Author: vicky d
Reviews.Content: this hotel was great, we were only sorry we didnt stay for longer.. we were there for 4 nights because we were joing a cruise, in hind sight we would have stay a week befor and a week after our cruise. the room was great, it had everything a family would need. the resturant had a great choice to choose from, and aldo are waiter was fab! the staff in general were great and very helpful. the pool area was lovely and my kids were amazed to hear the musicunder the water whilst swimming. the life pool staff were also great, the were on duty from early til quite late at night. which was great because my kids loved the parks by day and swam at night, which was fine as the pool was heated. over all we would stay again and really enjoyed our stay. over all we really enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cathynWindsor
Reviews.Content: If you like rock 'n' roll and a lively atmosphere this is the place for you. If you like subdued, quiet getaways, you might want to look elsewhere. Luckily, my family and I are in the former category and we LOVED our stay here. We got off to a good start -- valet staff and Claudia at the front desk were friendly and helpful. The lobby is just beautiful too! We loved our deluxe room, it was huge and full of nice amenities. We decided to upgrade to a Club Room and it was definitely worth it. Breakfast was great, and my kids loved the afternoon snack time. For "happy hour" there were a couple nights there was so much good food we didn't even need dinner afterwards -- and we're vegetarians, so this was a surprise to us that they would offer so much. Staff in Club Lounge was also great. One nite my son wasn't feeling weel and concierge here brought crackers and ginger ale up to our room -- her idea, not mine. Only complaint: If you are a guest and come in to gorge yourself on desserts then pile a plate as high as Mt. Everst to take more back to your room, please at least put on a shirt. Seriously, there was one particularly fat man who ignored the "shirts required" sign AND turned the already loud music in the lounge up so high you couldn't talk. Grow up "dude," you look like a 60 yr old idiot. This was particularly annoying at breakfast when you are just waking up. The hotel should consider making volume controls inaccessible to guests and enforcing the shirts required rule. Moving on, pool area was beautiful, fun and great place to hang out. We had dinner at The Kitchen, staff was great and the night we went they had magicians who were quite entertaining. One note -- service at poolside cafe was horrendous for food, but Ok for drinks. The night we ate there we waited so long for the bill, my husband and daughter had time to go up to the room, change into bathing suits and start swimming while I sat in a sea of dirty plates waiting for the check. However, this was an isolated irritant in an otherwise lovely stay. The easy access to the parks was another bonus -- would never consider staying anywhere else when visiting Universal.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel to holiday”
Reviews.Author: nessie1971
Reviews.Content: Simply the best hotel to stay if your doing the Universal parks. A great pool that shows family films at night. A restaurant that makes a great brekkie. And best of all a 5 min walk to the parks. If you can't be bothered to walk there are free boat rides to and from the parks. If your going for horror night then you truely are in for a treat, a spectacular you will never forget. I highly recommend on getting special fast passes for horror nights, pricey but worth their weight in gold. Without them expect to queue for 2-3 hours per house. With them 10-15 mins. Not something you'll do every day so make sure you get them as they are limited. On normal days to the parks your room keys act as fast passes. Brilliant!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: KS79
Reviews.Content: We booked one night at the Hard Rock Hotel Universal since we planned to go to Universal Islands of Adventure the following day. We loved the vibe of the hotel when we drove up. The music throughout the hotel was great and all the hotel staff that we came in contact with were very helpful and friendly. We reserved a basic room, but it was well appointed and clean. The room was nicely decorated, bed was very comfortable with plenty of pillows and we did take advantage of both the IPod docking station and in room Kerig coffee maker. We visited the Velvet Lounge and it had a very relaxed atmosphere. We did not take advantage of the pool, but it looked great from what we could see. The hotel was about a 5 minute walk from the entrance to Universal, which was super. The early access to the park and Express Pass with our hotel room key were great amenitites and well worth the the price of the room. We plan to return in the future and hopefully take advantage of all the amenitites that the hotel has to offer. Keep up the good work Hard Rock!

Reviews.Title: “What it lacks in room space it makes up for in atmosphere and detail.”
Reviews.Author: Keefletrucker
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here every year since 2005 with our kids. Past three years we've gone club level and would recommend the upgrade to anyone with kids, especially if jet lag is an issue. Handy to let them nibble rather than fall asleep when out for a meal. Drinks all day (softs) is also great and the staff always help us out with milk whenever we asks for it. Could do with changing the options at the evening session and include more veg friendly things. That said, I'm content with the beer! I felt this year the rooms could benefit from some sprucing up and I did find toenail clippings near the window, so vacuuming on that occasion could have been better. Our fridge was also gross with mould on the products and in the trays. Someone had burst a liqueur and it had never been cleaned properly. After about 4-5 attempts at complaining they replaced the fridge. We got a free breakfast for the trouble and $100 off the bill. Site and pool are fantastic and clean, restaurants are amazing (my hair and appearance are a bit to wild to have me venture to the Palm but I love the Kitchen - try the seared ahi tuna!!!!). Drink is expensive for sure but usually includes the tip, you're on holiday!! Our oldest is 11 now and we have no problem sending him to the pool on his own. It's well staffed and we're very confident in the pool staff to let him go on his own. Other reviewers speak of the room keys and fast pass. Invaluable with kids, without a doubt. We don't even bother with Disney anymore because of the perk. The main thing that let this trip down was they swiped our credit card at check in for the entire stay amount which cleaned us out. We didn't realise til we tried to hire a car and the card kept bouncing. We were furious with that. Car aside, had there been a medical matter, as we have had previously, we'd have been screwed. We never got our car (but testement to the staff, 2 we've become friends with over the years actually took us out fishing and nature spotting on their day off - that's the special part about the hotel), but we did get a refund of a few days (on top of the fridge issue) as an apology and assurance that we will be extra special taken care of next visit. Few complaints in here, but they do address them and given the years we've been going thats our first grumbles. Everyone makes mistakes and as long as its sorted quickly and to our satisfaction we're happy campers. We love it period. We're FL tourist vets since '96. We bust our a**es all year to afford it and it's always worth the toil. If they had a time share option we'd be in for sure. If you can afford it, do it, if you can't, work your cotton socks off like we do to make sure you can (watch out for the deals they can save you heaps and are better than the broker sites). Oh, and camp li'l rock is great too if you want a few hours 'sans kids'. Just check where it's at on particular nights as it moves round the resort hotels. You can still. Heck them in but you need to get them there.

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay for universal orlando--period.”
Reviews.Author: wskungfuclub
Reviews.Content: this hotel was simply superb. i'm not one to give out easy accolades to hotels, but the hard rock was very close to being perfect for our family. the adults enjoyed the contemporary style and modern conveniences. the kids enjoyed the poolside movies, the water slide, and the simpsons characters at the kitchen. everyone enjoyed the comfortable beds and spacious room, and the luxuriously convenient location in relation to the universal parks. in short, the hard rock was the perfect blend of rock n roll and family fun. the entire staff was friendly and helpful--our bell hop stayed an extra ten minutes after delivering our luggage to give us some gems on how to enjoy all the area's attractions some of which i'll share. the front desk gave the kids blow up guitar toys and pins. the hotel's one star service made it easy to get everything you needed--you can call one place to get room service, have the valet get your car, bring you more towels, or get a table for you at the restaurant. customer service--A+ after spending a miserably cramped 4 days at the animal kingdom lodge savannah view bunkbed room (a huge ripoff) on the disney leg of our trip, we were absolutely in heaven when we opened the door to our STANDARD garden view room at the hard rock (which cost about half as much). it was like going from a closet to an actual room. spacious and comfortable with soft linens and clean decor. the towels were new and the fixtures were clean and working. the framed beatles photos on the wall were a great finishing touch. room--A the on-site facilities were fantastic as well. the huge pool has a beach entry and they had a large screen by the bar poolside where you could watch a movie while swimming (we watched harry potter and the deathly hallows part I--very apropos for visiting islands of adventure the next day). there is a pretty good water slide too. the underwater speakers pumping music were pretty cool although you still couldn't hear it very well. we ate at the kitchen--one of the on-site restaurants and it was great. my wife used the laundry room and said it was really small and cramped, but that's the only negative. on-site facilities A- but onto the biggest reason this hotel is so cool--its perks and location. i cannot imagine a better place to stay if you're visiting the universal parks. it is by most accounts along with the portofino hotel a class above the royal pacific, and it is by FAR closer to the theme parks than the portofino. if you stay at the portofino you pretty much have to use the water taxis or you have to walk well over 20 minutes. the hard rock is a 6 minute walk to universal studios and 10 minutes to islands of adventure. we got very lucky--our room was on the far end of the hotel. at first we were a little bummed because it's so far from the elevators, but quickly realized that we scored because we were that much closer to both a convenient pool entry and the theme parks. we just went down the stairs at the end of the building, out the door, and voila, we walked straight onto the walking trail to the parks. it was like a super short cut! finally, you simply CANNOT BEAT having the express pass and extra hour for the wizarding world of harry potter. we were at the gate when it opened at 8 and finished all the rides by 2 pm. when it comes to theme parks, no lines = good times. i'm sure the express pass/extra hour is even more valuable in the busy season like the summer. location and perks A+ when you factor in the overall value of staying at the hard rock, it just simply can't be beat. the included express passes themselves for four people practically makes the room free. it was so much more enjoyable than staying at a disney resort where you basically get overcharged for less quality.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Teen Bop Haven”
Reviews.Author: Ellery96
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that the hotel itself has its appeals for the average family, close proximity to the Universal parks, activities/entertainment poolside for the kids, and apparently plenty of other teens and kids to keep each other busy...oh and the rooms are comparable to what you might find at any other hotel (nothing to write home about). This is NOT the place for a couple who is looking to relax poolside and enjoy the parks also. Start off with the fact that on the weekends, they BLAST music by the pool from 1PM - 6PM with various entertainers and games for kids and maybe even teens. Its not relaxing at all -- you cannot find anywhere to go if you just wanted to have a drink poolside and chill out to your own headset music choice. Also, we had the misfortune of staying here during the Halloween horrors and the hotel was overrun, I mean overrun with about 100 teenagers roaming the halls, banging on doors, and just hanging out in the lobby until all hours of the night causing trouble. The hotel security and staff were completely unprepared and didn't seem to know what to do about all the disturbances. They have no customer service skills at the front desk and instead just gave me attitude. One last thing because I didn't know this when I booked -- you will pay $15/day to park your rental car at this hotel and if you have family/friends that want to visit...they better be prepared to pay $30. Rip off! I apparently made a mistake in choosing this hotel and will never go again but I am sure its a great spot for some folks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic guest perks”
Reviews.Author: KreonLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located on site for visiting universal studios and the islands of adventure. The room itself was large clean and very comfortable with a fantastic fresh coffee machine. The hotel was excellent value for money as the added perks made the first week of our holiday really special. Using our room pass we were able to enter the parks an hour before the gates opened which allowed us to have Harry Potter world practically to ourselves for two hours on different mornings which meant we went straight to the front of the Castle ride and had a lovely breakfast before anyone really turned up. For the rest of our stay we were able to use our room keys as fast passes which meant walking past endless queues to the front of most of the rides in the park. Something we greatly missed the next week at Disney! The hotel even provided us with free tickets to watch the live recording of impact wrestling which was certainly an experience and we were able to tell our friends we were present for Hulk Hogan's official retirement speech! The hotel also provides frequent boat taxi's to city walk which were particulary enjoyable at night when the area was beautifully lit. The only criticism was the ridiculously overpriced drinks at the pool area but apart from that the hotel is hard to fault.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly more adult orientated version of the other 2 universal resorts”
Reviews.Author: mda1701
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying and it was up to lowe's Standard and it has great pool and one of the worlds greatest steak houses (the palm) on site the location goes with out saying and the room key/express pass is almost worth the money you pay for the room

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for our family trip”
Reviews.Author: Anthony_Y_1977
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults and 2 children loved the Hard Rock at Universal Orlando. This was our first time staying at a Hard Rock property and we will be back. The staff and service was extremely friendly and polite, helping to organise a car hire down to Miami. Our pool view room had all the typical amenities and the rock and roll inspired decor was a nice touch. The rooms were clean, well kept and had no annoying smells or noises. Wifi is free in the lobby but not in your hotel room. They gave out free drinks in the lobby so I didn't mind too much! The kids loved the pool and water slide - we would crash there following a day at Universal. The hotel is located just a short stroll from Universal and the accompanying Studio Walk (which has plenty of cheap-mid range food options) is close by. We ate at the hotel a few times and the kids have their own kids corner which they'd run to after the meal to watch sponge bob or do some colouring in. The food was sensational and portions were typical XXXXL American fare. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: dansee
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms for five. Fun time at the pool with DJ. Great perk with the early entry and Express Pass. We were close enough to walk to park. Didn't like paying $20/day parking even though we had a season pass to the park (free parking at park but not hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Rockin" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bev_Hull
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this hotel for the last nine years and it still never disappoints! Great rooms, great vibe and great location. Only a short walk to the theme parks and restaurants. The velvet bar is great on an evening and the pool area is second to none!

Reviews.Title: “Best piped hotel music ever!”
Reviews.Author: paulab666
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. Looks fantastic outside, the rooms are good inside, all the memorabilia throughout the hotel, if you started seriously looking you wouldn't do anything else. The location is perfect for seeing the 2 theme parks, and if you are doing the Halloween Horror nights it's perfect for being so close. The Citywalk shops and eateries also near by. Downsides; can get a bit noisy late at night / wee hours of the morning as all the party goers find their way home, and the hotel alarm going off at 2 am for 20 minutes as a drunk messed with the sprinkler alarm in their room was more than tedious. Be prepared to be absolutely gouged by the price of stuff here, alcohol especially has a horrendous mark up, if at all possible, bring your own any way you can. No Internet in your room, bummer. Free Internet in the Lobby, yeah! More downside, the Lobby is often being used for other events, whilst we were there one night a band, the next a work function, so nowhere to sit. Would still go again, but be more prepared next time.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel Rocks”
Reviews.Author: swansfromBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in Oct 2011 for the following reasons: 1. it was a convention hotel - I had to attend a convention and shuttle bus service was provided. 2. the rest of the family hit the theme parks. We had been to Disney several times but Universal only once when my son was 2 (he didn't remember it). 3. We picked a Universal Hotel because of the early access to Harry Potter. They let hotel guests into the Wizarding World of Harry Potter 1 hour early, which is key to getting in and out quickly. Another beneifts was the front of the line pass which can be used multiple times. 4. We picked the Hard Rock Hotel over Portofino Bay and the Pacific Resort because it was the closest park to the Universal theme parks. My son age 11 and daughter age 8 wanted to stay in the hotel which was cool. 5. The pool looked awesome - had a 250+ foot circulat water slide. Also underwater music piped in. On arrival these is a beautiful circular driveway with a dropoff. Checkin was quick. They give you room cards for each member of the room. These cards also serve as your early entry ticket if you want to go 1 hour before the Wizarding World of Harry Potter opens. The lobby is impressive and truly rock star. We brought our suitcases up to our room. The room had 2 large queen beds. There was a parking lot at the side of the hotel which cost 12 dollars per day which you accessed with your room card. The room itself had 2 queen beds, a tub, toilet and small sink in the bathroom, and a large sink/vanity outside the bathroom. There is a Keurig coffee maker and my daughter ended up making multiple drinks every day - coffee, tea and hot cocoa. She loved that machine. They don't have a refrigerator or microwave in the room - I think there is a 10 or fifteen dollar extra charge, but it wasn't worth it for us as we didn't really need these features. The walking path to the theme parks comes out right next to the Universal Studios Entrance. The hotel is closer than the parking garage is to the theme parks. There is an official walking path from the pool area (which is only open when the pool is open, 8 AM to 11 PM, so that's not helpful if you want to get the Harry Potter before 8). It is beautifully landscaped but winding and less direct than the route we took. (see below) We didn't bother taking the boat becuase I had read it took longer than walking. There is an unofficial route that I read about on line - just exit the hotel through the main entrance, take a left past the palm restaurant, down the stairs and walk in the parking lot along the side of the hotel. This took about 5 minutes. The pool itself was a lot of fun. The kids went down the slide multiple times. We went in the first day of our trip but then the weather cooled down. We ate at the Palm restaurant for dinner one night - good food but overpriced. The kids and their dad had the breakfast buffet in the kitchen which was excellent (my husband said it was better than the Palm). The kids meals were only 5 dollars each though the adult was 20 dollars. I saw Homer Simpson in the elevator - they have character dining on Saturday night. Service is top notch. We usually stay in reasonably priced hotels and I was blown away by the service. 1. One of the light bulbs had blow out in a lamp. I called guest services and within 5 minutes they had brought up another. 2. We requested more pillows and another comforter. They brought this up within 30 minutes. 3. The theme park will deliver your purchases to your guest room by the next day. The first day we bought 2 bags of souvenirs which made it our room by the next day. Another day we bouth 2 bags of souvenirs - but only one make it to our room. We called guest services, we had a copy of the receipt, they checked their records and showed that it had been delivered to our room. It was a superhero t shirt for my son which was 20 dollars. We couldn't find it. It was a small bag and I suspect it had been delivered to another room by accident. It was 5:30 when we got back to the room and found just one souvenir bag instead of two. We were leaving the next day. We called the front desk, and The Universal staff sent someone over to get a new shirt and delivered it to our room later that evening. My husband and I were blown away. They could have handled it sevearl different ways. It truly is STAR service. The only mar about our hotel experience, which was not under the control of the hotel at all, was that on sat night at 12:30 AM we were awakened by an unruly man who was cursing and yelling in the hallways. After what seemed like an eternity because he kept yelling (but was probably more like 15 minutes), first hotel security surrounded him and then the Orlando police came and took him away. The kids slept though it all. I doubt he was a hotel guest. We loved the Hard Rock and would stay there again in a heartbeat. Rock on!

Reviews.Title: “The Truth”
Reviews.Author: deanrogue
Reviews.Content: Okay, so many people have stayed at the Hard Rock in Orlando and their reviews range from "VERY BAD" to "EXCELLENT"....which really doesn't help a first time visitor. So let's see if we can clear things up a bit. My wife and I stayed at the Hard Rock at Universal Orlando from the 13th - 20th October, 2011. It wasn't our first choice -- the Royal Pacific was, but they were all booked up. We didn't know what to expect so we read some of the online reviews (which were so varied that we started feeling some anxiety about staying there). As it turns out, the Hard Rock exceeded our expectations. The staff was friendly and very helpful -- not at all pushy or overbearing as we had read. The food was simply divine (we ate at the Kitchen, Emack & Bolio and the Beach Club) and their prices were within reason. The grounds were well kept (we could see groundskeepers at work from as early as 3:00am from our window) and the paths around the hotel were excellent for leisurely walks. The hotel is a five to seven minute walk from Universal Studios and the water taxi was very convenient. There are also guys with rickshaws who would give you a ride over to Universal for a small tip ($5 is fair for a couple). The rooms were clean and the folks who cleaned them were thorough. The pool was also quite enjoyable...with complimentary movies showing almost every night. All in all a great place to stay. People who complain about this place would probably find something to complain about no matter where they stay. The hotel does have a nice young vibe to it -- but hey, it's the Hard Rock -- what do you expect?! Our stay couldn't be better -- take it from somebody who stayed at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge for eight days last year -- this was just as good.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: nb1975
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit. From entry to the hotel, it is a great experience. Nothing was too much trouble. We had an issue with our bathroom, and it was fixed in 15 minutes. The hotel has a nice feel to it, quite a relaxed vibe. The rooms are lovely, we had a deluxe room. The pool is lovely, there is a spa at the far end of the pool that is hardly used - so I had it to myself a few times. The bar is pricy, but this was to be expected from this kind of hotel. At night we went to Citywalk, as it's a short walk or rickshaw ride. Front of the line passes are great. We walked past some reasonable queues, and if you want to go again, you just walk back on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: skennedy62
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at the Hard Rock Hotel in Orlando. What a great experience. I was overdue for a vacation, so I'm sure that made it better. Was traveling with myself, 40+, my daughter, later twenties and my 12 year old nephew for his birthday trip. This property completely made every one of us happy. I have never stayed at a Hard Rock Hotel prior to this and was pleasantly surprised. I am used to nice hotels, but the vibe and atmosphere here was great. It has made me want to seek out other Hard Rock Hotels to stay at. My nephew is just learning to play guitar, so he was thrilled to run around and look at all of the memorabilia. We used the early entry into Universal, so that was so worth staying at the Hard Rock. We got to do Harry Potter a few times quickly before the crowds set in. After long days at the parks, my very hyper nephew was still ready to go. We all went down to the pool area. He instantly made friends. So, I was able to relax in the lawn chair at the beach area, while he hung out with his new friends in the pool. We had snacks and drinks delivered from the lovely and friendly pool area staff. Felt very safe about the hotel and area. So, we were able to let him run downstairs to Emack and Bolio's to get a snack, etc. and feel totally comfortable. Rooms were large and comfortable. It rained hard for almost a whole day when we were there, so came back from SeaWorld early and rented movies in the room and still enjoyed ourselves. Our only negative at all was that we got pizza at Emack and Bolios on the rainy day and it took a really long time and was just not good. We had lots left over and that's not the norm for us. Thanks Hard Rock for a fantastic experience for everyone. Not an easy feat.....

Reviews.Title: “Best place on Earth”
Reviews.Author: melissa o
Reviews.Content: absolute best place to stay in Orlando. cost more than your ordinary hotel, but the perks are worth it. great decor, pool, and perks for the parks! Ive stayed here about 12 times since it opened 10 years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Little Disappointing 2nd time around!”
Reviews.Author: lmcclain
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Hard Rock Hotel Orlando. The hotel and grounds are beautiful. If you are visiting Universal Studios-an onsite hotel is a must!Can't beat the early admission to the park and express pass feature. The rooms are adequate as are the amenities. The cons to the hotel that we experienced were the noise and the bugs in the bathroom. I know Florida has bugs but there were bugs in our bathroom constantly. The hotel seemed to be overwhelmed with teenagers and young adults. The problem with this was that every night between 10 and 4 am it was impossible to sleep. There was yelling and laughing in the halls. Slamming of doors and knocking on doors was a constant. We spoke to the front desk on three occasions but they seemed to be dismissive. Other places we've traveled have had employees monitoring hallways to help keep the noise down. I didn't witness any changes attempted to address this problem. After speaking with others at the pool I came to find out I wasn't the only person who complained about the noise. The restaurants on site are not bad. The food and drinks are good but definitely overpriced. The beds were comfortable and the pool and grounds were spotless. It's a shame they don't "control" guests behavior because honestly we will not return. We walked down to the Portofino and it seemed to be a more intimate atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Harry Potter Vacations Start Here!”
Reviews.Author: 1BIGTRAVELGUY
Reviews.Content: If you are headed to the Harry Potter Village at Universal Studios, then you can't do better than the Hard Rock Hotel & Resort. There are so many reasons but let's start with convenience and safety. The beautiful green paths that connect the Hard Rock with Universal are safe, gorgeous and fun and we let our kids (13 & 14 yrs old) go by themselves from the hotel to the park without worry. The early admission (one hour before the park opens to everyone else) is incredible and we stayed in bed as our kids ventured to the park at the crack of dawn. (You do need to go with them the first day to register their ticket and fingerprint - a very quick process.....under a minute). The Speed Pass that you get from the hotel also is a great feature that saves about 30 to 40 minutes for each ride. The combination of Hard Rock Hotel and Harry Potter Village was just perfect. Now for the hotel: Clean, fun and relaxing. The lobby is huge and is perfect for meeting up with other families or just people-watching. The pool is the hub of activity with a great bar and family friendly restaurant (not to mention the wonderful "Kitchen Restaurant" that is just steps away). We had actually started this vacation a bit disappointed when we were told that our room was not ready for regular 4 p.m. check in but I have to mention that the front desk attendant, Claudia, was incredibly nice about it and she turned the issue into a positive. Claudia gave us drink passes and suggested that we try the bar by the pool - my wife and I had Margarittas while the kids enjoyed Pink Lemonaides. Within a few minutes Claudia called my cell phone and told us the room was ready, We then loved having a "friend" at the front desk that we would stop and say hello to each time we passed - it was as if our happiness had become her personal mission (if you have ever heard the term "Nordstrom Sevice", that is how we felt). There were more great people working at the Hard Rock: Robert a lightly bearded waiter at the pool would make us laugh with his good natured comments, and Sara at the Pool Restaurant was incrddibly attentive. That's why this hotel and vacation were so great.... beautiful grounds, friendly staff, immaculate rooms - and a brand new multimillion dollar Harry Potter Village next door at Universal Studios (complete with Butter Beer and Pumpkin Juice). Wow, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent, Great for the kids!"”
Reviews.Author: Makayla A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel, it was fantastic! Great for the kids with features like: Pool, Spa, live entertainment by the pool, waterslide, ice-cream shop, Universal Studios is 5 minutes away and Guitar Hero etc. This place was definitley the best to travel to entertainment-wise. If you do end up going to the Hard Rock Hotel, you get a special pass for Universal Studios, so when you go on the rides, you are able to skip the line. It was great and we would definitley go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock - The only way to vist Universal Studios!”
Reviews.Author: ronniev
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Hard Rock Hotel yesterday. This was my fifth trip to this hotel. I traveled with a group of eight. 3 Adults, and 5 kids. We had two rooms on the club level. First of all, the hotel is great. Friendly staff. Rooms are nice. Beds are soooo comfortable. Room sleeps 5. However, 5 is a little tight. This time I had three in my room. It was very comfortable. We stayed on club level, which I highly recommend. You get continental breakfast. We went in at 7, finished breakfast. Then headed to the parks. Continental breakfast was bagels, danish, cereal, hard boiled eggs, fruit, yogurt. Very nice. They had the club room open all day for drinks, and chips(etc). Great for the kids. From 5 - 7 was beer, wine, and great snacks like chicken wings, nachos, cheese/crackers, etc. Then again at night, cookies and milk. Definately worth the extra $. Sometimes we didnt even go out for dinner. The pool is beautiful. Staff is friendly. Loved Ginger, a server at the pool . Kids loved the water slide, and movies by the pool. The best part is the Express passes. Everyone gets one included in your room. So that means no wait for the rides. Get to the park early, and go on all the rides, no lines. Then you still get to enjoy the pool. You can buy the express passes at the park, and they cost you a fortune. They are included in your room cost, how great is that. I have also stayed a Royal Pacific, its nice. But its not the Hard Rock. Hard Rock is a smaller hotel, which I like. Its also a closer walk to the parks. You can also take the watertaxi. Anyway, if your going to the Universal Parks, the only way to do it , stay onsite. If you can, stay at the Hard Rock. They really treat you like a Rockstar. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “It May Be Hard Rock But This is a Classy Joint”
Reviews.Author: Michael R
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Universal Studios Orlando we decided to try the Hard Rock Hotel. We knew what loud and hectic places the Hard Rock restaurants and casinos are, so we approached it with some hesitation. Instead, we found that this is an upscale classy hotel. Designed like a Southern California Spanish-style mansion (think the cover of The Eagle's Hotel California album) it sits on lushly-landscaped tropical grounds. The action is at the enormous pool, but the rest of the place is quiet, even elegant. The rooms have first-class appointments. We ogled the original photos on the wall of early Beatles and Dave Clark Five. If you are a rock/pop music buff, your will be blown away by all the memorabilia on display throughout the building. Great cocktails at The Velvet Lounge (the Smokin' Martini is a new favorite of mine) and dinner at The Palm Steakhouse was one of the best anywhere this year. Free water taxis take you to both theme parks, Univeral City Walk and the other two hotels. You glide along in great comfort, and you can get anythere you want to go at the Universal resort in 10-20 minutes. It's even walkable through beautiful tropical gardens. Best of all, a stay at any of the three on-site Universal Hotels give you early admission and head-of-the-line privileges at most attractions. We had a great time! No complaints. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service from Universal Package booking”
Reviews.Author: Mary S
Reviews.Content: We booked our vacation through Universal Vacation Packages and chose the Hard Rock Hotel because of the amenities, great pool and acess to the theme parks. When we arrived our shuttle transfer had us going to the wrong hotel. The supervisor from the Universal Theme Park Hotel package corrected the error and waived the additional $100/night room charge due to the booking error. Upon arrival at the Hard Rock, the desk agent upgraded our room and offered great information about the hotel and theme parks. We are thrilled with this hotel and appreciate the Universal Vacation Package Supervisor's assistance in making the vacation work the way we had planned. We will certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Would likely stay again”
Reviews.Author: kwiggin27
Reviews.Content: We've been to Universal several times and decided to stay on property this time. Water taxis to and from CityWalk are fantastic after a long day of walking around and the usage of room keys as express passes was really handy, even in early October when the regular lines weren't nearly as long as they are in the summer. Early entrance into the Harry Potter area was nice as well though we only took advantage of that once. If we'd had impatient kids I definitely would have gone in early again :) The room itself was decent. Two fairly comfortable queen beds with feather pillows and a nice view of the water taxi canal. The first room they put us in was still dirty, with crumbs on the floor and an unidentified sticky substance on the table, but the front desk was more than happy to switch rooms and made sure we got a better view. The bathroom was weirdly shaped, it was a bit of a challenge to get in and shut the door before using the toilet due to the angle of the door. Shower had a non-slip surface and a nice showerhead. There's a sink in the bathroom, and a nice vanity with makeup mirror outside the bathroom. The pool was really nice, but only 4 feet at its deepest. There is an adults-only hot tub hidden in the back which is actually larger than the one in which kids are allowed. There are constantly servers from the Beach Club wandering around if you want something to drink. There are speakers underwater so you can hear the music while swimming. Neither of us used the waterslide but judging by the number of kids we saw making repeat trips, it must be fun. We made use of the self service laundry room - there is one on the second floor and one on the fourth. Be aware that it is $2.75 per load (that is, $2.75 to wash, another $2.75 to dry), and we had to run our clothing through the dry cycle twice to get it dry. There is a change machine in each laundry room if you run out of quarters. The theming of the hotel was nice. There is a lot of random music memorabilia around, everything from Elvis's jumpsuit to stuff worn by N'Sync and Tears for Fears. There are photos of famous musicians in all the rooms and a TV channel devoted to playing music videos all day. Our one complaint is that the door locks seem to have issues - our keys would randomly stop working (not just for the room - also the self-parking card slot, and the one at the pool entrance, and by the water taxis). One day the door lock on our room ceased to function, meaning that our room was unlocked all day. We returned late that night and the front desk sent maintenance up to fix it, but no compensation was offered - I felt that they could have at least offered us free breakfast or something, especially since it took the guy 30 minutes to fix the door. Luckily we had made use of the in-room safe to store valuables but it was still really disconcerting. After the fact I read more about the Club Level rooms and, if we stay again, we will likely book one of those as it seems to be more along the lines of what I feel a 4.5 star hotel should be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, definately want to go back......”
Reviews.Author: Debbie D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last October, 8 in total, 2 families of 4...We had the most amazing time and having the fast pass to the theme parks at Universal was definately worth staying onsite. The rooms were lovely, very comfy beds and good enough size room...We visited the parks in the morning as you get access to them 1hour early for onsite guests and our afternoons were spent at the pool area, our boys were 4,6,6 and 9yrs and they had loads of fun on the waterslide at the pool, played volleyball and also table tennis.. It's great because of the sandy area at the pool, kids were building sandcastles and absolutely loved it... we loved the Hotel so much we made sure we had some time each day at the pool area.... We ate at the restaurant at the pool and found it very reasonable for this standard of Hotel, think our meal was only around $50 for the 4 of us with drinks.... I stayed at the Loews Pacific the year before and loved this too but Hard Rock was definately my favourite as it had a lovely atmosphere...

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for Universal!”
Reviews.Author: Hatebeinghome
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hard Rock Hotel for three nights in April. We were on our first family holiday to the US covering 4 cities in two weeks with eleven year old triplets. We wanted to cover as much as we could with as little stress as possible. We chose Hard Rock Hotel for it's proximity to the Universal Parks, it's facilities and express pass. The kids are mad Harry Potter fans and the opportunity to avoid queuing with early entry was too good to refuse. Location If you are visiting Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure you cannot get any better than this. It is a five minute walk down a garden path to the front of Islands of Adventure and a few minutes more to Universal Studios. There is also the option of jumping on the courtesy transfer boat which stops at the bottom of the garden, great when the kids are tired, hot and cranky after a day at park. The boat takes the same time as walking. If the kids get tired you can go back to your room then head back later in the day or evening. Universal walk also has plenty of restaurants and is a short walk from your room. Park access The best thing about the hotel is the privilege of early entry to the Wizarding World of Harry Potter and the room key is an express pass for most rides. The early entry got us into Islands of Adventure at 7am (on my birthday ! aargh!) and there were still plenty of people but we got on all the key rides quickly. The queue later in the day was something you would not want to be stuck in! The Express pass is a true express pass. It takes you right to the loading point for most rides, unlike Disney fast pass system which only takes you half way. Rooms We booked a standard garden view room with 2 Queens beds and a rollaway. This room comfortably slept five. I was worried that we would need the extra space of the Deluxe room but it was fine and my kids are almost as big as us. They were able to put the rollaway under the window, three in a row. The hotel is expensive compared to other options in the area we we did not want the hassle of hiring a car and driving and battling traffic with kids. Our room cost US380 plus tax per night without breakfast around Easter/Spring break. However, we think the time saved with the express pass and early entry justifies the additional cost. It means you can visit things early in the day, move through queues quickly and either ride everything again or head back to the pool and relax for the afternoon. The bathroom is small so an if you can afford interconnecting rooms it might be worth it for the extra bathroom. What else did we like! Great pool - free wi-fi by the pool and in public areas, great kids slide, table tennis in a marquee, find the rubber duck competitions around the pool, music, playing guitar hero for free poolside with new friends (not sure if this was good with 2 boys ...hard to lure them away), ice water with lemon. Mum liked the two self serve laundrys on level 2 and 4 (around $2-3 a load). The Kitchen makes the best key lime cheesecake I have every had. They kindly helped my husband organise a last minute surprise by decorating my desert plate with chocolate birthday greetings. The hotel recognised my birthday with a Hard Rock pin on check in and a piece of cake on the day. The service was great all round and the staff were genuinely friendly. None of the the pretentious "have a magical day" that we experienced at Disney. Porters at the front door were great with luggage, cabs and shopping advice! Concierge printed our boarding passes for us (there might have been a small charge?) Kids favourite park rides Harry Potter looks great but some of the rides are not worth queuing for. Skip the wand experience (line is too long and one child selected for a 2 min experience) and the Hippogriff roller coaster (huge line that moves slowly and a very short uneventful ride). Best rides - Rip ride rock it, Incredible Hulk, Dragon challenge (Harry Potter)

Reviews.Title: “Great location to stay”
Reviews.Author: maggie1111
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hardrock in orlando on September 29th 2011 and thought it was a nice clean hotel. The staff were very helpful including conceirge and front desk. The location is fantastic as it is only about a five to ten minute walk. They also have a water boat to take you over to the parks which is free. It was great that we got to go to Harry potter world and hour before park opens as their were alot of people. Also another benefit from staying at this property was that at universal studios you go to have front of line passes on all rides except rockit which was fabulous not long waits at all. They have a small snack shop where you can purchase breakfast and snacks all day long at the hotel. The pool area was good but the pool itself is not very deep. They also have a laundry facility which is good when your travelling all over the place to do some washing. The room is neat and comfortable bed. The only thing is the room does not have a fridge but you can hire one for either $20-25 per day. I was not disappointed staying here and would recommend for anyone to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worthwhile to stay on property.”
Reviews.Author: amyeof
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend that visitors to Orlando stay at one of the on property hotels at the Universal Studios Resort in Orlando. The service was excellent from the moment we checked in to Gina at the Concierge Desk who helped us with our boarding passes for the flight home. You can't beat the perks of the Express Pass for going to the head of the lines for rides, and 1 hour early entry to the World of Harry Potter. We also received a complimentary breakfast at the Three Broomsticks Restaurant in the World of Harry Potter. For people who enjoy rock music, the Hard Rock Hotel is the place to stay. The walls can be a bit thin, but otherwise it overall very quiet. One reviewer mentioned that music was blaring constantly, but that wasn't our experience at all. If you don't enjoy rock music, stay at another on-site hotel. Thank you to everyone, especially to Hawaii-girl Theresa in the Hard Rock boutique!! I will recommend your hotel to friends who are considering visiting Universal Orlando!! A new service is the towncar service to the airport. It was a bit pricey since the driver is in a suit and the new car makes you feel like a rock star. But we aren't complaining as we didn't need to hail a cab at 5:30 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time!”
Reviews.Author: Little_LauraB
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights. Excellent location for the universal theme parks. The extra hour for harry potter and the express passes for the parks are well worth the money!! Worked out as priceless for us tbh! Got to ride the forbidden journey ride 3 times before 8.45 when everyone else is let in (you really get an extra 45 mins not an hour). Stayed in the kids suite, plenty of room for 5. Stayed in this room before and it was just as clean as before. Great service from front desk and house keeping. My only issue was with the pool. On our last night the hot tub was full of unsupervised children. They were gulping the water and spitting it back out into the hot water, DISGUSTING!!! It says max 11, but there was 16 in there. They sat on the exit and would not move to let people out. Sign says min age 12 but these kids were 9. A life guard told them to get out but they came back. A manager did nothing, just told us to use the other one, except that is for adults and my sister is 15 so wouldnt be able to :/ ruined our last night. This aside i would stay here again as its a fun and convient place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “good but expensive”
Reviews.Author: paul b
Reviews.Content: great location, excellent breakfast at the kitchen, but as with most hotels associated with attractions you pay. self parking $15 per day, internet $10 per day needs to be renewed at 1pm (found out after i renewed in the morning) room small but clean we had a two queen bed bottled water $7.50 if you want to get into park at 8 to avoid those massive lines you have to do it, the express pass is a big plus room price was $280 per night. can not fault the location you mus stay here at least once in your life time

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn R
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, excellent service, they couldn't do enough for you. Very clean and comfortable Fast pass with your room key and early entry to Islands of Adventure was great. A wonderful holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for visiting Universal”
Reviews.Author: Calfie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for those visiting Universal Studios without a car. It is a short 10 minute walk from your room to the entrance of the park. We checked in at 10 am and our room was ready, we dropped off our luggage and went straight to the parks. When you check in early, your Express Access is available from check in until the end of the day of the check out, so therefore if you just stay for 1 night, you have Express Access for 2 days. We found that with Express Access 6 hours per day for Universal Studios and Island of Adventure is enough to get through nearly all the rides. Express Access is really the reason why the rooms at Hard Rock are so much more expensive than nearby off resort hotel, but for just one night, I think it is worth the cost. The room is basic with some rock memorabilia. The furniture is a bit old, but the bed is comfortable. We tried both room service and The Kitchen. I really recommend The Kitchen for lunch as the food is nicely prepared and light on the stomach for a reasonable price. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended..”
Reviews.Author: Jase_sk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in September. Very close proximity to the parks. Service was great in all parts of the hotel. The hotel restaurant wasnt cheap, but it was great, and very good quality food (a step up from the fayre in/near the park). We'd had our fill of average standard park food, so the hotel restaurant food was very welcome! All round great, would stay again. Prior to this hotel we stayed in Disney yacht club and I much preferred the hard rock.

Reviews.Title: “Great! (except for the kiddie accident in the pool)”
Reviews.Author: VTKristen
Reviews.Content: This is a very pretty Hotel with great amenities. Likes: Pod Coffee and Tea Maker Beautiful Pool* and Nice Hot Tub Extra Separate sink area outside of the bathroom Early Entrance to Wizarding World of Harry Potter Boat travel from Hotel to Universal Parks and City Walk Front Desk Staff was very nice as well as the luggage staff Dislikes: Hotel not nearly crowded or full but they gave us a TERRIBLE view of the roof over the car port. YUCK. *We could not actually use the pool since a kid went #2 in it about 5 minutes after we got down there. So it was closed for about 6 hours the only night we were there. Smoothie in the coffee shop was terrible. I am glad I made them refund my $8 Everything is expensive and food is not very good We stayed at this hotel mainly for the early entrance to the HP area at Universal. Since there were 4 of us and it was only for the one night, it was well worth it. I would not stay here and pay over $300 a night for an entire vacation. Even though the rest of the park was not busy (we were there the weekend after Labor Day) the HP area gets very full as soon as non-hotel guests can get in. I loved having an hour almost to myself in the HP Area! The photo are not crowded with people and we could do most of the attractions with no lines!

Reviews.Title: “christmas week 2010: great experience”
Reviews.Author: jg56
Reviews.Content: we loved the hotel - rooms were comfortable and updated. nice choice of places to eat. pool was great although a bit crowded at times. best feature of course is ability to go back and forth to park. we were able to stay poolside while our teenage kids can back and forth at will. even feel the price point was right, especially given our stay over christmas week. not sure we would go back to Universal, but if we did then this would be our 1st choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Rocks!!”
Reviews.Author: WillyWonka79
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed in the Hard Rock Hotel, Orlando Universal for a 1 night experience. The reception area was full of music memorabilia and the wow factor as soon as you enter the reception area. The hotel staff were very friendly and nothing was a problem. Our room was a reasonable size with two queen bedrooms and a small but very modern bathroom. The leisure facilities were fantastic with entertainment by the pool area which can range from a projector screen tv as you relax or swim to a stage with live band performances. If you are visiting Universal Studios and/or Islands of Adventure this hotel is the ideal stopover with the Universal Walk with shops and restaurants on your doorstep. We will definitely be planning another visit to this hotel for a longer period.

Reviews.Title: “A must if you're going to Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: LastMinuteLulu
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights purely for the huge benefits being on-site gets you at Universal. The hotel feels different from the Florida pack as soon as you walk in, with attractive young staff dressed in black and music being played. Booked a "garden view" room and was disappointed to be shown to a room with a view of the entrance / car park. However, when i expressed my disappointment, this was quickly dealt with and we were moved to a pool view room, from where you could also see Universal studios. As other reviews have mentioned, there is a bit of music noise from the pool, so ask for one at the back if that matters to you. Rooms are a nice size and very clean, with a pod coffee machine. Bathroom is usual set-up, with an additional sink / vanity area outside. Theme parks are a short walk away or you can take the boat for a pleasant start to the day. Both only take a few minutes. Room keys double as queue jump passes which means you don't spend a lot of time hanging around in the heat - bliss. They also get you early (8am) entry to Harry Potter which is where the crowds head at 9am so well worth it. We were able to take photos without hundreds of other people in them and walk straight onto the main ride twice. Breakfasts in the Kitchen were pretty good - around $60 for 2 adults and 1 child. Kids are only $5 if you get there early enough (we didn't!). Dinner was definitely American portions! I found the starter quesadillas too much for a main course. Opted for a delicious seared tuna with sesame rice cake starter the next night which was perfect. There was a magician there the first night and Shrek & Scooby Doo characters the next night. Pool was pretty good with live music and a slide for the kids, but I never understand why hotels try to recreate beaches by the pool with sand....

Reviews.Title: “Amazing+++++++”
Reviews.Author: Christine S
Reviews.Content: Have to be honest and say that we only booked this as with a one night stay for a family of four., our room keys got us to the front of the queue's in universal parks all day for two days as you can collect your keys early on the first day even if room is not ready, but it was one of the best places we have stayed. Room was perfect, everywherein the hotel was imaculate,clean and fresh. We ate at the kitchen twice, food was of high standard, slightly higher price than most places on I-drive but well worth the money, shrek and scooby doo came round at evening. The pool was an experience, open late at night with a movie playing, which was great for purr daughter. There is a boat just outside the hotel that takes you to the parks. The staff were all friendly and helpful. There is ashop that sells breakfast and pizza to go etc. And has a variety of snacks. Shampoo etc. Is of a very high standard, lovely bathroom, bathrobes included for your use. Will definatley go back as our only disappointment was that we onlybooked for one night.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: dredd1981
Reviews.Content: What can I say about the Hard Rock that hasn't already been said. You will know that at the Hard Rock nothing is free. A fridge is $15 a day and you pay for wifi (except in the lobby) and the gym (i got a 4 day pass for $26). Breakfast in the Kitchen is also pretty steep, $20 per person for a buffet style or you can order individual things off the menu. This is however false economy as a portion of scrambled eggs and bacon will run you $10-15 and even portions of fruit are $5-10! You could go to the on site shop which sells ice cream as well as cereal and croissants. two croissants and a bottle of orange juice ran me $10. Also if you need a taxi may I recommend going to city walk and getting a mears taxi. If you go to the front door of the hotel there are cabs from a company called ODC (on demand chauffeur). Be warned, these guys will rip you off. I wanted to go to the premium outlet (about a mile and a half away), the driver drove up one side of I Drive and down the other and charged me $25 for the pleasure. A mears taxi a week later, $10. One day whilst in a hurry I reluctantly got a cab from the front door to go a mile up the road to get a bus to the space centre. Again the driver went every which way and charged me $20 for a journey that should have been a mile but he made into several! The hotel itself is very nice, my room on the 2nd floor had a pool view. Nice room but unfortunately at 8am every morning the rock music starts up in the pool area so if you want a lie in invest in ear plugs! The room also had two double beds, a small bathroom area, a coffe maker and a tv with about 50 channels. On my floor there was also an ice machine and laundry facilities. The hotel is also very handy to the Universal parks which are about a 5-10 minute walk away or if it's too hot take the free water taxi. There are also guys from the rickshaw company who linger near the water taxi stop. As other posters have said, the walls seem to be paper thin, if you're a light sleeper I recommend ear plugs not only for the 8am rock fest but for party goers marching up and down the halls until all hours. Overall I had a good relaxing stay, it's just a shame that they nickel and dime you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time At Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: kelapooh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock Sept 25-27. Had a great time. Hotel rooms big and comfy. Went with husband, mother in law and 4 kids 16, 13, 12, 10. Loved the whole experience. Great to get the express pass with room key. Universal was great!!! Would definetly stay here again. Staff very helpful and accomodating!!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: LoewsGold
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights over the past weekend for Halloween Horrornights at Universal Orlando Resort. This was proabably our fourth stay at this hotel. From the time we arrived until the time we left, the staff went out of the way to make us feel like "Rock Stars". The parking valets, luggage service, front desk and pool area wait staff, were awesome. As "All access" members, we received an upgrade to a pool view room. Our room was very close to the door to the outside pet walking area which was great since we brought our dogs with us. The walk to Universal Studios only took about a couple of minutes from our room. How awesome is that? The beautiful pool area not only has a water slide, but amazingly enough, a rocking live band performed at the pool on Saturday afternoon. We usually stay at the Royal Pacific, but the Hard Rock really surpassed all our expectations. We never ever get an upgrade at the Royal Pacific and we are Loews gold members. We absolutely loved our stay so much that we'll be back very very soon. This hotel rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Eh.”
Reviews.Author: Triper14
Reviews.Content: For the price, I found this hotel to be less than what I expected. After staying at Disney's Yacht and Beach Club, I wish we would have never switched to this hotel halfway through our trip. The beds were cleans and comfy, but the carpet was stained and our entire floor smelled weird. I think it's because the bottom floor of the hotel is 'pet friendly'. My dad booked the room, so I don't know if they disclosed this information at booking time or not. Make sure to ask if you have animal allergies. The pool was small compared to other resorts, and was always crammed full of little kids. The only thing I really loved about the hotel was that it is in walking distance of the Universal parks. Other than that, I wouldn't stay here again. For how expensive it is, I could have stayed at another hotel and probably gotten a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Rocked our world”
Reviews.Author: RobstersDads
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with another gay couple last April for 4 nights (I know, I should have written this months ago!). We've now stayed at all three Universal property hotels and rank this one as the best for us - Royal Pacific is aimed at young families with small kids, Portofino seems to be popular with an older, more conservative crowd, Hard rock is deffinatley the place to stay for young adults and young at heart adults. All the staff were great and cool about gay couples (why shouldn't they be? well we have had problems at some places in the States). By day 2 the bar staff at the pool and the Velvet lounge knew who we were, asked where our friends were (if they weren't with us) and knew what we liked to drink (maybe this says more about our drinking habits than the professionalism of the bar staff?).
