But the worst of the ridiculous is the bathroom, without storage, very small, not very clean tub, only one small sink, all with a decent design and layout of the 1960s. Very disappointed. Not a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect trip for WWHP and park benefits”
Reviews.Author: walker1971
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights within a 2 week break in Orlando, in order to benefit from the fastpass and Harry Potter early entrance. Hotel is as you would imagine, with loud poolside beats and memorabilia inside. Lovely poolside cabanas and waitress service for drinks; although sunbeds are jammed together, there is a great holiday vibe. Room was clean and spacious (kids suite) and The Kitchen restaurant one night was a real treat, with visits from Homer and Bart! Lovely ice-cream parlour too. Most invaluable benefit though, is the fastpass access, which allows you to get on all rides, compared to the few we've managed in the past, with having to queue. Similarly, the access to WWHP at 8am is a completely different experience to that an hour later. Managed to get on the rides within 5 mins, have a good luck in all the windows without a fight and quicker access into Olivanders - this is a magical must experience!! Great all round, even if only for the 3 full days we experienced (although you check in/out at certain times, you are allowed your fastpasses for the entire days duration - bonus!) -would def go back!

Reviews.Title: “I felt like a Rock Star!! Brilliant Time had by all x”
Reviews.Author: Carole1967_11
Reviews.Content: We decided to round off our fortnight's Florida vacation with 3 nights at the Hard Rock to take advantage of the fast pass for the Universal parks. Before moving to the HR I rang to find out how much it would be to upgrade to the Club 7 floor and was told $125 per night, so decided to stick with our Garden View room. We checked in at 9am the following day and as our room wasn't ready, we were offered a complimentary upgrade to the Club 7 if we accepted a King Bed and roll away bed (as opposed to our booked twin room) - result!!! - I was very happy! The Club 7 room was excellent, and we loved the continental breakfast, alcohol and snacks available. However, the hotel needs to monitor entry into the club room (we were never asked to show our room keys) as there were people from other floors accessing the 'free snacks'.. The staff were friendly and helpful, the hotel is very close to the parks and the 'fast pass' is invaluable! hubby loved the turn down service and the little gifts the maid left (tattoos, bracelet, cookies). My only gripe would be the pool.... the maximum depth was 4ft and was absolutely packed!!! The sun beds were also very cramped together with no spare space to move too, so you got to know your neighbours very well indeed! All in all, a very good hotel, and I would definitley visit again. Thanks again for the free upgrade! x

Reviews.Title: “location,location, location”
Reviews.Author: buddyPhila
Reviews.Content: the hotel is within walking distance to universal and city walk and you do get front of line access with room key which was great because it was extremely hot in July the rooms ars very small the bathrooms are dated the pool is fabulous for teenagers I thought the hotel was pricey for what it was but the location is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “ROCK ON! AWESOME PLACE TO STAY!”
Reviews.Author: starchild101
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay on our trip to Universal Studios. Room was very comfortable. Beds were fantastic, nice big flat screen tv, and the girlfriend loved the shampoos, lotion ect. Place had a Keurig coffee maker which was very nice, especially on the mornings you got up early to hit the park. The pool and the dj there were fantastic. The dj kept the pool crowd entertained and the waterslide was great for all ages. Drinks are a little pricey, but you can bring your own in with you to save a few bucks. Only issue we had was that we had paid extra for a pool view room and when we got to our room there was a huge palm tree taking up 75% of the window. You could only see a little corner of the pool if you stood on a chair. We talked to the front desk and they resolved it by refunding the difference between our room and a garden view room (which was very nice of them to do). If you see postcard pictures of the backside of the hotel those pictures were taken a while ago when the palm trees were a lot smaller. Those trees have grown folks, and many of the "pool view" rooms are now partially to fully obstructed pool view rooms. So TIP #1: you probabally should not pay extra for a "pool view" room. Tip #2: You gotta hit the ice cream place on the first floor. It is fantastic - I got the banana split, it was huge and delicious!! Our only minor complaint it that for the price you pay to stay here parking should be included in the room cost. Cost is $15 per day, $22 if you want valet service. Other than that, it was a great stay, service was great, place very clean, and no major complaints at all. Would do it all again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGB2010
Reviews.Content: Needed to book a couple of rooms for a quick get away and from the rep who booked my rooms to the young lady who checked us in, highly satisfied. Our rooms though not adjoining as requested, given the last minute reservation I wasn't about to complain. Rooms were clean, beds were comfortable and the staff accommodating and friendly. Loved that we were so close to Universal and City Walk which it made it nice for quick trips for shopping and meals off the premises. We had a great time and will return, no question.

Reviews.Title: “Best ever !!!”
Reviews.Author: 3066ruth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock and it was fantastic. From the moment we arrived it was great. We were in the clubroom level, which is on floor 7, we found this well worth the money, as spoke to others not in clubroom level and it was costing them a fortune for breakfast etc. My only gripe was that a few cheeky beggers from other floors rode the lift until people on the 7th floor got on, they would then get of and go get food drinks etc from lounge, But it's up to the hotel to rectify that problem. Our room did flood with the heavy rains and they were prompt in bringing dryers to dry the room. Hotel is busy loud and pool is loud lively and the kids loved it. The entertainment team were good, but repeated the same things day in day out, felt sorry for them really. The staff were so friendly and nothing was a bother to them. Rooms were cleaned daily and fresh towels everyday, sheets changed every other day. We had turn down service at night and our kids could nt wait to see the wee gifts that were left. Food in clubroom lounge was ok breakfast was cereals, pastries, porridge (oatmeal) breads for toast. Suited us. Drinks on all day for kids. Food from 5 -7 was salad and things like sushi satay sticks. Alcoholic drinks were served at this time to. Mind it was a bit mad and frantic sometimes. It was quite relaxed in dress code, people had their PJ's on for breakfast. We would definately go back, the room key was our fast pass ticket for all the rides except 2. Just brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annie92
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by how much we enjoyed our stay at the Hard Rock Hotel. We are not really fans of Universal Studios and the last time we were there were disappointed with our stay at the other hotel there - Portofino Bay. So we were not expecting much, but as our kids really wanted to visit we figured to try the Hard Rock this time. Our room was extremely comfortable and the hotel itself is very attractive - nice public areas, grounds, etc. Didn't love our meal at the Palm, but the hotel's own restaurant - The Kitchen was really very good. We ate there a few times - breakfast, lunch and dinner and were never disappointed. In terms of service, everyone we dealt with at the hotel was very good - kind, helpful and professional. It was great to see so many wonderful employees who were all quite young. The only negatives I would say are that 1- it is loud everywhere except in your room. I understand that it's the Hard Rock hotel, so that is to be expected. But just be ready that it is not the kind of place you find a quiet place to sit and relax if that's what you're looking for. 2 - we were on the Club floor and the Club was not all that comfortable. It's a nice convenience to have and the people working there were great, but during "service" hours, it was always very crowded (and loud), and not what one might expect based on other club floor experiences.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints! Thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: K_The_Hon
Reviews.Content: Myself, my partner and her family stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in October of 2010. We loved it! The room was spacious and clean, the hotel's restaurant "The Kitchen" wasn't anything to nit pick over, they had a great brunch buffet and the servers were on their game. We enjoyed the pool side bar at night with multiple tv's showing every game that was on and I can't forget to mention the easy, scenic walk to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “It was good but getting a little dated”
Reviews.Author: axlrocky
Reviews.Content: Loved it because I had always wanted to stay in a Hard Rock but some of the facilities were getting a little dated and you got the feeling they didn't expect you to be in the hotel during the day as the pool was very crowded. It was very friendly but the facilities were not extensive and the food was vastly overpriced although tasty. A 22% service charge was added to anything so watch your bills. I didnt see it and the bar staff were kind enough to give me my cash tip back as they were too embarassed to take it, which was nice. Loved the boat ride straight to city walk and kinda guess thats why the food on offer is not that great at the hotel as you have a myriad of choices just across the water. The hotel key is a fast pass for the parks which is invaluable and we rode anything we wanted with no queues. Great to look at but not much there, I enjoyed it but maybe wouldnt go back to this particular venue.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice but Expensive but Early Admission is great.......”
Reviews.Author: bstosch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with the family (wife and 2 teenage daughters) for two nights in August. We decided late to stay here and the only rooms available were on the concierge level. It was pretty expensive, but you did get a continental breakfast, afternoon snacks and some appetizers and alcohol in the evening. The food was average at best. The room was very nice, with 2 queen beds for the 4 of us. It was quiet, comfortable and had plenty of amenities in the bathroom. With 3 women trying to get ready at the same time, the bathroom sink was very large and detached from the toilet and shower, so there was no yelling to get out of the shower. The pool wasn't very deep, though it was very warm and there was always some sort of entertainment going on outside it. If you go under the water, so can still hear the music. We ate in one of the hotel restaurants (The Kitchen) and it was average. Nothing special about it at all. The hotel lobby and hallways are always interesting with Rock n Roll paraphernalia all over it. Self Parking was $15 a day. The best part of the stay was getting the front of the lines passes to all the attractions at Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure. This easily made up for the exorbitant cost of the room itself, if only for the time it saved during two very hot days. You also got into Harry Potter an hour earlier than the general public. If I got a great deal on a room here, I would return, but if you are not getting the park benefits, it is way too expensive for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Checking in was a nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: SoBeGirlNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 2 nights and had a horrible time checking in. We arrived at the hotel around noon knowing that we couldn't check in until 4pm. We spoke to the Front Desk about upgrading our room (for more $$) and he assured us that we would get a 6th floor room with a pool view and would be able to check in no later then 4:20. Well, we came back to the hotel around 4pm and it still wasn't available. When we complained finally at 4:45pm, he said that the room was available but it was on the 2nd floor. He said that he didn't remember telling us that he would give us a 6th floor room, but a pool view. Not good enough! We had reservations at 5:45 at Margaritaville with family and had to get ready. After much complaining, he gave us 4 drink tickets and moved us up to the 7th floor which was the Concierge Level. The room itself was okay. Very small for a family of 4 but clean. Of course the hotel was very busy and crowded but that is expected for the month of July. You can't beat the "fast pass" you get to use on the rides and shows at Universal and Islands of Adventure and going to the park 1 hour before the public is allowed in. That was helpful in seeing "Harry Potter" which was terrific! The distance to the parks is also great since it is walking distance to both parks and City Walk.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and superb location”
Reviews.Author: salsop50
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Orlando and the Hard Rock hotel made it for us. A beautiful and interesting hotel, and the staff were superb, every person no matter what their role, was friendly, helpful and made us feel at home there. There are choices of restaurants or the fab Emack and Bolio store within the hotel, and superb location for Universal Studios, It was always crowded round the pool and you had to be early to get a good spot but the entertainment they provided was amazing and so were the pool side servers. One of the best perks was using your room card for a fast past for the rides - worth it's wait in gold! Yes, it is definitely the more expensive option but well worth it in our opinion and we will most definitely be back! Fraser Family Aberdeen, Scotland

Reviews.Title: “universal plus”
Reviews.Author: RAlsulaimani
Reviews.Content: staying at hard rock was the best thing i did to my family.... lovely rooms... friendly staff... location 100 plus; it save time especially the water taxi and the express pass saved a lot of time.... we are 6 members stayed for 4 nights....

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: AAORD1
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location to Universal! The hotel was wonderful! Staff couldn't have been nicer! Pool area was huge, nice to come back to after spending the morning with Harry Potter. The Kitchen restaurant has come great food, hotel expensive but that's to be expected in the hotel. It was good food though! Room and bathroom were comfortable, nice furnishings, not worn out. Best thing...the Keurig coffeemaker in the room! That was a nice touch! The one and only drawback to this hotel, was the housekeeping! The four days that we stayed there, we would leave the room for the early bird park entrance at 7am come back at 3 or 4 pm and the room still wasn't cleaned. Had to call the front desk twice to have it serviced. I know there are a ton of rooms in that hotel, but hire more staff if you can't keep up with it. You want us to vacate by 8am even offering incentives of winning a free 2 day stay but I couldn't even check into my own room until after 4. Would definitely stay there again just for the perk of getting into the theme park earlier and the convenience of being able to walk the 5 minutes to the park.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: tanzio
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Gorgeous, clean, attentive staff. The pool is unbelievable. During our trip it poured and they set up movies in the lobby for everyone. Sent up a happy birthday cake the morning of my daughter's birthday and gave her a free smoothie at the pool bar. Attention to detail is fantastic. Would go back again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: missmeGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Well where do we start. What a fantastic 'MAGICAL' holiday. Hard Rock Hotel 'Rocked', staff great from Reception, Concierge, Porters, Beach Club and not forgetting Housekeeping. We stayed here because on Universal Studios Grounds, could not have been better. You can walk into Universal Studios(10 mins walk), take the Water taxi (every 10 minutes) or take the Rickshaw. Staying here you had access to the Wizarding World of Harry Potter an hour early at (7am), this was great to miss the q's - well worth going early. Also staying here you had unlimited access to the 'Express Rides' which is a saving. All in all we never waited longer in a q for 10 minutes to go on any rides. We experienced some storms later in the afternoon, when we went back to the Hotel we were greeted by the Housekeeping with lovely warm towels to dry off (this is a lovely touch). All in all this Hotel was fantastic and would recommend anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it”
Reviews.Author: Indianapolisresident
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in Orlando for 4 nights in June. We stayed in the King deluxe room. It is all one room, but there is a sitting area on one side of the room, and a nice size table for eating or using the computer on the other side. Bring a cooler to use in the room since there is no microwave or refrigerator. The minibar requires a key that is issued to you and can keep kids from using it without your knowledge. That can cut down on unintentional charges to your room. The bathroom area is two areas. The vanity area, separated from the sleeping area by a wall for privacy, and a shower / toilet area that is behind a bathroom door for privacy from the vanity area. There is a room safe in the closet. There's plenty of dresser drawers for clothing, but not much surface area since the TV sits on top of the dresser. The kingsize bed was comfortable, and our daughter slept in a rollaway bed that was decent. I did get a little annoyed at the $10 charge each day for intenet access. The airconditioning was adequate and quiet, but I would have preferred a more powerful unit. We brought along night lights to guide us to the bathroom at night and were glad we did since the black out curtains did a wonderful job, but left no ambient light to navigate around the room at night. The hotel pool is great, the location is great, and the rock memorabilia are great. The early entry to Universal studios is the overall factor for choosing Universal property hotels because the room rate and the food at the hotel are expensive.The pool is not deep and isn't intended for diving. It more for lounging. There is a pool slide, a stage for pool parties and a nice hot tub. There's afternoon entertainment like hula hoop contests and the pool employees make sure only hotel guest have access to the grounds. It's about a 10 to 15 minute walk to Islands of Adventure from the hotel if you stroll instead of rush.One of the high points of staying at a Universal hotel was having breakfast at the Three Broomsticks at Hogsmeade in Universal's Wizarding World of Harry Potter. You can only do this if you book a hotel package that included park tickets. We got a reservation for 8am, were at the main gates at 7:45 am, allowed in by showing our tickets for breakfast, walked to Hogsmeade with nobody in our way, and were admitted into the Three Broomsticks at exactly 8am. That alone was worth the price of the hotel room. No crowds and a chance to eat in peace in Hogsmeade and to imagine the students of Hogwarts showing up to eat and chat. Just remember to bring a cooler for the hotel room, leave time to enjoy the pool, and if you hate the prices of the hotel food, head over to the eating places just 4 blocks away on the main drag.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY BRILLIAN”
Reviews.Author: proudmary_11
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed in this hotel many times. Could not recommend it highly enough. The rooms are not uber glamorous but are clean and comfortable with HD TV in room entertainment etc. The pool area is immaculate with great entertainment. The Kitchen restaurant does brilliant breakfast and the hotel is well serviced with the Hard Rock shop and E Mack and Bolios ice cream shop. The surrounding gardens are beautiful and well maintained. The hotel is safe and secure and is only a short walk, water taxi or rickshaw ride from Universal theme parks from door. The fast passes the hotel room key provides are amazing giving you unlimited express rides on the attractions. Hotel staff are brilliant. The beach bar also provides excellent food and drinks served by amazing staff. Although this hotel is not cheap - it is worth every penny

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Inkylouise
Reviews.Content: This is the most resort-ishy hotel in the Orlando area. I was on business, so unfortunatly this time i did not get to partake in any of the leisure amenities. Room is super comfortable and clean, large size. Lots of other things on site, Palm Steakhouse is excellent, the Kitchen for breakfast, and a great lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Close proximity to Universal; Great also for families with teens”
Reviews.Author: gwall60
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed at Hard Rock Hotel at Universal 7/23 - 7/27. It is a wonderful hotel. Teenagers especially probably prefer this hotel over Royal Pacific or Portifino, as it has a nice energy level with a lot of music (pleasantly so). Check in was easy, it was easy to pick up our tickets to Islands of Adventure and Studios, and service at all times was great. Keep in mind it is a resort, and so it can be expensive to eat at the hotel, at nearby City Walk and in Islands of Adventure and Studios (in some ways, it is cheaper to eat in Islands of Adventure and Studios than at the hotel or City Walk). The shop on level 1 of the hotel does sell doughnuts, coffee and other items for breakfast or a small snack. There are also a few fast food options at City Walk. The hotel is about a short 5 minute walk (or water taxi) to Islands of Adventure and Studios. The room slept well and was very quiet. Be sure to take an afternoon from the parks to spend some time at the hotel pool, which had wonderful entertainment in the afternoons (and a movie in the evenings). The pool is open until midnight, which I really enjoyed after each day in the park. I did have an issue with booking on-line. I checked the price, and went back to book the room later in the evening, and the price jumped up by about $175, but I went ahead and booked the higher rate as the week we selected was our best week to travel to Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: hammertimehi
Reviews.Content: My family and I went here on a trip I won. The place was really nice. we especially loved being poolside. Lots of activities for the kids and a 5 minute walk to Universal. It was so convenient to everything. They even had a movie poolside each night which the kids loved. they have a great ice cream shop there too.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock Hotel ! They say live like a rock star but what they really mean is spend money like a rock star !”
Reviews.Author: JoanneJLancashire
Reviews.Content: Just got back this morning and already wishing we were back there. This hotel is stunning. It is the closest hotel out of the 3 in Universal and the parks and City walk are just a 5 minute walk away along a beautifully landscaped path or you can easily get on the water taxi or rickshaws (Rickshaws are free but they do like their tips as they dont get paid a salary, £5 is sufficient). We stayed in a queen deluxe room with a pool view 5134 (2 adults and 2 teenagers 17 and 15) the room was large and comfortable except for the sofa bed, this could have done with a thicker mattress as it was a little lumpy so we took it in turns to sleep on that ! The hotel is lively from 8am to midnight with rock music wherever you go you cant even escape it in the lift so if youre not keen on rock music dont go. This is not a cheap Florida holiday either expect to pay $32 for a large beer and a cocktail and a family of four cant really eat in the restaraunts there for under $100. The mini bar is extortionatley priced so we didnt use it at all. I suppose im trying to say that if you want to go here you really need some serious money in your pocket. It is defintiely best to eat out on Citywalk or elsewhere if you have a car. Its about $16 a day to park your car at the hotel and a lot more if you use valet parking. Car hire is also expensive. We hired a Ford Escape for just 2 days and it cost us $300. The use of the 'F' word is not permitted because this to the hard rock means FREE and nothing is FREE except for the towels you use at the pool !!!! This may sound very negative but its not meant to be, the hotel is truly an amazing place in an amazing location. Emack and Bolios is the cheapest option to buy cereals or pastrys, doughnuts, bagels and milk etc and is open from around 6am to 10pm. The pool waitresses work very hard and deserve their tips although these are added to your bill at 18% whether you want to tip or not. All the staff are friendly and helpful, if you are taking travellers cheques this can be a pain as the reception staff are only allowed to change a specific amount each each day so can be an issue if you go late in the evening to change any money. You can use your room card to pay for anything in the hotel on citywalk or the universal theme parks and whilst this is excellent you really need to keep an eye on it. Using your room key card in the theme parks to access the express lines is simply brilliant but every rider must have their own card. You cant use express on the main Harry Potter ride or the new Hollywood Rip Ride Rocket at Universal Studios so get there early especially for HP World, as a guest in the Universal Hotels you can go there at 7am, an hour before the park opens and it is well worth getting up early for. Theres no 'real' evenning entertainment at the hotel, some stuff happens by the pool in the afternoons but this is mainly aimed at the children with contests such as hula hooping or searching for golden eggs around the pool area. 'Scooter and Anthony' are funny, think they are there twice a week and there are also singers in reception and poolside a couple of times a week. The pool area is beautiful but its not really deep enough to 'swim' in. Lifeguards are present at all times, at least 4 of them. The pool is open til midnight and they have movies showing poolside every night from about 8.30pm, these are usually shrek, harry potter, avatar etc type films. Shuttle buses are available and free for transportation to sealworld, acquatica, busch gardens and other places but not kennedy space centre. You need to book your placeon these buses though as you need a ticket and this is easy to do from the reception attraction ticket desk. Overall this is a fabulous hotel and location just expect to spend a lot of money. We would stay here again and again if our salaries could support it !!!! But as they say you get what you pay for and although expensive it doesnt disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “I am not a rock star but I felt like one here!”
Reviews.Author: Angelmonkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights with two teens. We all had a blast! We wanted to stay onsite so we could visit Harry Potter world (we are real fanatics), and this was the best place to do it. Early park access to HP world and fastpasses throughout other rides. Seriously, the only way to go. As far as the hotel itself is concerned, think of it as your only chance to live like a rock star! We booked a Kids suite on the Club level. The suite was very roomy and although there was only one bathroom, it was brilliantly laid out. The "master" side of it is a double sink with a shower while the other side of it includes a toilet and a tub/shower. Both sides are set off with a locking door. I found it to be surprisingly convenient for us. We also rented the cabana and used the fitness center and pool area. The fitness area was smallish, but it had a good variety of machines and some free weights. The floor was a bit dirty (and the yoga mats a bit smelly), but I was too, so I overlooked that. But I can see others having issue with the fitness area floor being dirty. The Palm restaurant was fantastic and well worth the money. I was surprised how comfortable the bed was--Frankly, I expected less. But some of the patrons on the floor were quite noisy walking by at late hours (yes, kids run around at 11pm!!). Bring earplugs if you are sensitive (I did and I was fine). It wasn't noisy the entire time, just on occasion (and in our case it seemed to be the same noisy family every time). I have to say that club level is really the best way to go. Lots of included amenities and the food holds you over so you don't have to spend even more $$ for the overpriced food there. That being said, the overpriced food is pretty good and you can split plates (they are large portions). Happy hour at the Club lounge was very nice and the concierge there were so friendly. Big plus-- if you are planning to rent a cabana, you get a discount if you are on Club level. The pool cabanas are fun-- you get a ceiling fan and a TV (I know, why watch TV when you are outside at the pool but for some reason, it was actually relaxing for a short while). You also get a fridge with sodas, water, plus a fruit basket and ice cold chilled towels (for cooling off in the heat). You also get very attentive servers who are so very nice!! When we rented one, it was my daughter's 17th birthday and we purchased a balloon bouquet from the hotel service itself. Yes, it was $25 (ugh) but considering all the other high expenses, I felt lucky it really wasn't more. And, it meant alot to her to see the cabana decorated! As far as the pool, if you can stay there while the pool DJ show is going on, you should. They have lots of activities out there and some fun contests. (Husband won the hula hoop contest and got a free drink not to mention bragging rights to being able to hula hoop for a good 7-8 seconds!). The pool vibe was just fun-- and after the show, they had a movie right there. We didn't want to leave for dinner so we had food delivered out at the pool. Very cool!! Our last day, we lunched in the Kitchen- they have a giant $18 burger that you must try. I believe it was 18 oz patty or something crazy like that! But so so so good!! All in all- we had a tremendous time there-- the staff really worked hard to make you feel welcome. Can't wait to return (or maybe I will try the one in Vegas next time...)

Reviews.Title: “Short walk from Universal and Island of adventures”
Reviews.Author: mcaetano70
Reviews.Content: Staying in this hotel provides you with a quick pass to ride in most attractions of Universal and Island of Adventure. There is no quick pass to Harry Potter, but this park opens earlier to hotel guests. You can go to the park in the morning, get a rest in your room in the afternoom and go back to the park afterwards. Very beautiful hotel. My room had a very good view of the parks. I chose the Club level room in the 7th floor since it gave us access to a lounge with a reasonable breakfast, sodas and other fast meals the rest of the day (from 7 am to 10 pm). Rooms are good but not that better from a standard hotel. The only complaint is that the hotel could provide complementary internet in the room. It was only complementary in the lobby, but paid in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Been many times and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: fayel1234
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, definatly would tell others to stay here, no matter the price! Have been going since i was 4 years old, now a late teen and a travel agent! Would always give the hard rock hotel credit! The staff are always on top form, smart and helpful. If theres something wrong, the staff are there within 10 minutes and the issue is dealt with straight away! The resturaunts and cafes are amazing food, although quite expensive, totally worth the price! Getting front of line access is definately a bonus too! There are always childrens activities going on, especially around the pool area, which the staff are great at. The facilities such as the dog walking area, gym, shops etc are all great and are definatly worth a visit too if visiting Orlando, even for just a couple of nights! 5* from me!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: TravelerMan96
Reviews.Content: When we first walked in the resort lobby was gorgeous. The service was excellent and they had a bellhop. The pool was very fancy and had underwater music. You are allowed to get into Universal Studios early, including the new Harry Potter theme park. when we finished with the exhibit there was a HUGE line all the way to the other end of the park.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: PelicanSoup
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great stay at the Hard Rock......Stayed on the Club Level... rooms 7057 7058 7059. Room 7058 has a great pool view and rooms 7057 and 7059 are adjoining rooms with a connecting door but have a view over the arrival driveway. All the rooms are close to the Club lounge (but not too close). Check in was fast, friendly and efficient with that great "Hard Rock" attitude...David Bowie playing in the background. Acess to the Club Level is via your room key in the lift, kids loved it as it made them feel like little rock stars. The rooms are spacious and well equipped...nice coffee system...large tv...beds(in my opinion, but not in others) a bit soft....spotlessly clean. I have read reviews that the Club Lounge gets crowded....didn't happen whilst we were there...Breakfast was never busy...as people are either up early for "early park admission" or not.....Breakfast was good...croissants,pastries, cereals,yoghurts and plenty of fruit...loads of coffee, juice, milk etc.......... its a bit busy when the "happy hour" (5-7pm) starts but it soon settles down...lots of people seem to grab a few drinks and a plate of nibbles and head back to their rooms....I never made it for the evening "cookie session" so I can't comment on how crowded it got. The nibbles at "Happy Hour" were varied and plentiful...thursday night was my favorite with a sort of Greek feel (olives spanakopita etc.) The Pool Area.....great...BUT(sorry)....not enough shade...loads of pool beds.... but once the ones with a little shade had gone you were stuffed...maybe a ploy to get the cabanas rented out(cynical I know)...the pool was also a bit soupy...I understand with the ambient temprature being so high that a shallow pool gets warm quickly...but it was a case of jumping in and getting out wet but not refreshed...on the other hand the kids loved the water slide and spent hours going up and down. The pool bar is great, and we spent many happy hours there....food is good and plentiful....the large nachos are enough for 2/3 people to share...beers and wines are a good selection, and the kids lived on virgin piña coladas...the bar staff are great (all the HRH staff are great....100% for friendliness and service)...right...jet lag is starting to catch up with me..i'm sure I've forgotten plenty of stuff so there will probably be a "part 2" to this post... PS...I am a real traveller and have actually been at the HRH and have not been paid for this review.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fab”
Reviews.Author: hilnew
Reviews.Content: Hard Rock Hotel is everything you think it is going to be and more. It is stunning, everything about it was perfect with only a short walk or boat taxi to Universal and I sland of Universal theme parks through beautiful grounds. Staying at this hotel gives you an express pass to the rides (except 2) and early admission to Island of Universal so no queues for Harry Potter! The one night it rained the staff were waiting at the door with towels for us to dry off -

Reviews.Title: “Our 3rd time there”
Reviews.Author: RockyMtn11
Reviews.Content: I'm sure the other on-site hotels are fine, but we like the location of the Hard Rock. It's just a few minutes walk from the parks and Citywalk. The last 2 times we were on the Club level which gives you "free" soft drinks and snacks in the lounge. Also a computer & printer if you need to print your airline tickets or whatever. Rooms are pretty standard, nothing special, but quiet and comfortable. Pool area is large and doesn't feel too crowded - speakers in the water are an interesting idea. We only ate at the Kitchen once, food was good but the prices are a little high (as are most hotel restaurants). They had costumed characters come by for the kids. Best part is using the room key for early entry and fast pass through the lines. You will ride a lot more rides, plus you can take a break in the middle of the day if you need to. And it's about the only way you can see the new Harry Potter area without fighting the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: calinda
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with great staff and amenities. We queried our bill in relation to something we had already payed for and it was rectified immediately. Great fun and free park fast passes are the icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel for Universal”
Reviews.Author: JakeH77
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Hard Rock Hotel during our 2 week stay in Orlando. The queue hopping and extra hour at Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure make the extra money you pay for staying here worthwhile and i would recommend it to anyone who is planning to visit those theme parks. During peak times you are likely to queue for ages, but not with your Hard Rock Room key! Also, if you arrive early and make the most of your extra hour in the morning, you can avoid waiting for up to 2 hours to get on the Harry Potter ride! We waited just 20 minutes to get on the ride by arriving early in the morning - and it is a fantastic ride! The hotel itself is excellent - The pool is awesome - as long as you don't want a quiet and relaxing pool area - it's quite lively with loud music, lots of kids, films on the big screen and live music and entertainment. I liked the pool, but i can see why it wouldn't be for some people. The pool side service is great, they definitely know how to look after you and earn the 17.5% service charge they automatically add to your bill!! The food was great, aways ended up eating way too much - but i didn't have a bad meal while i was there. You also have free transportation to Sea World, Wet and Wild and Aquatica. If you're feeling lazy or you like boats, there is also a free shuttle boat to universal. although its just a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel room was nice, spacious, clean and tidy which is what i would have expected for the price. All the staff i spoke to were friendly and helpful - especially at the beach club and in the market place. The only downsides of this hotel, were that you had to pay to use the gym - not that i ever had the energy to go in there having walked round theme parks and eaten too much! And also our room had the ice machine just outside which constantly woke us up in the night!! All in all though, this is an excellent hotel and great location for Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel - Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Shakers56
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel with another couple as I had stayed here 12 years ago and had fond memories. It hadn't really changed, great hotel with a lot of cool memorabilia and I love the constant beat that the hotel has. The pool is fantastic although shallow all the way around and the rooms were very clean. In terms of location to Universal Studio's you can't get closer and the perks of skip the queue and early entry are huge benefits. As some past reviews have mentioned they do seem to cut the corner on a few things to save some money and teh food is very expensive as they do have a captive audience. Can still find some good priced meals at the City Walk and we loved Jimmy Buffett's Margaritaville. For convenience and the advantages the hotel brings I think it is worth the money to stay here but only just as you definitely don't get the value for money from the hotel of the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “"club level" more like mcdonalds”
Reviews.Author: Gary1027
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at this hotel a few times and have always been pleased with the service and rooms, it is a great hotel especially if your going to the parks, but please please do not be sucked into paying for a club level room, we are not snobs and we have payed the extra for a club level at a few major hotel chains in the past but never have we experianced such a canteen style sevice as this, people were queing up to get food to take back to rooms, the furniture i would expect in a mcdonalds cheap plastic coloured chairs. i asked reception if that was the childrens area and was told no thats it there was not another lounge. we felt cheated and didnt use the facilaties because of this, i would never pay the extra again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent overall.”
Reviews.Author: seasidegeordie16
Reviews.Content: When we arrived (12pm) our room was not ready but we could check in our bags and go for a wander around, so we went to city walk and at around 2pm we were called to say our room was ready. We were given a garden view room on the ground floor, I would have asked for a higher floor room but as we had waited a while I just wanted to get to the room to get changed. We were close to the pool, walkways to the parks and city walk and also to the restaurants etc. The room was lovely but the housekeeping was a tad laid back and as we had stayed in a moderate disney resort the previous week where the housekeeping was brilliant, this hotel wasn't as good. We do give tips to the housekeepers for the first few days of our stay and then at the end but this still shouldn't add/take away from the service as it should be to a good standard always, but we did not experience this. We came back one day and an "employee in room" sign was on our door so we went to get some snacks and came back but it was still there, so we went to sort some stuff at concierge we had been meaning to do but it was still there when we got back so we just went in but there was no-one there! The housekeeper had also left a bottle of cleaning fluid and a dirty cloth on the sink. My pyjamas and clothes left on the bed were also just thrown on the floor which was a surprise to me. Everything else during our stay was great though! We ate at the Kitchen and the beach club and both were brilliant, although the beach club is the only one which add gratuity to your bill automatically which I am not entirely sure why, but the servers were all great anyway! We attended the velvet sessions while we were there which was a great experience! It was around $28 per ticket which included free cocktails, beer and small appetizers so it was worth the money! The pool area was fab, and we always managed to find a sun lounger, but we usually went for a few hours in the morning before the parks so it was quieter. This hotel is worth staying at just for the easy access to parks and the express passes to rides. We never waited longer than 10 minutes in an express pass queue. We went into Islands of Adventure at 7am (an hour earlier than regular guests) once and found this beneficial for the main Harry Potter ride but the wait was still 45mins! It was good though to take photos with no-one else around in the other areas! Overall I would stay at this hotel again for the express pass benefits and believe the extra money is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but terrible room”
Reviews.Author: GGGunn
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel and terrific service ruined by an unbelievable bad room. What is called a "spectacular view" was actually a view of a roof right I front of the windows in our suite. Amazingly bad. Be careful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Lizbeth927
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Hard Rock and the whole "Universal" experience. The best thing about the hotel is the proximity to the entrance of both Universal Studios, Islands of Adventure and City Walk. There is a walking path right located behind the pool area that takes you to all three in less than 10 minutes. If you don't want to walk there is a great water taxi or bicycle taxis. We stayed on the Club level and it was a zoo in there. The line for food was so long each day at 5 oclock we couldn't believe it. I would recommend it for families with more than two kids as the breakfasts were wonderful. The Kitchen Restaurant is fantastic for dinner, you can go casual right from the pool. Also, the pool is one of the best features of the hotel. My 10 year old couldn't get enough of the water slide and fun pool games going on all the time. Plus, there are movies going on at the pool each night. One of the things that I couldn't get past was the fee to use the gym ($10/day)! I have never heard of that, but if you stay on Club level, it is waived. The rooms are fine, nothing spectacular...the maid service was not so hot. Each day we went over to Islands of Adventure to get a Butterbeer ($10.45) and both of our Collectors' mugs were taken on the last day by the maids! No one seemed to know anything when we brought it up that we left them in our room. Other than that the service and hotel were great and we would definitely return. Tips - stay at one of the three hotels on Universal Property and use your room key to fast pass rides - it is worth every penny because it saves hours waiting in line. Go to the Harry Potter experience at 5pm when everyone clears out for dinner. It hardly has a wait time and you cannot fast pass the ride in the castle. If you can afford club level, it is pretty good for breakfast, sodas and snacks all day. 5pm is happy hour with cheese, crackers and kabobs. Margaritaville in Citywalk has the best food/prices and the Kitchen Restaurant on the property is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice if you're visitng Universal”
Reviews.Author: sunlovingfamily
Reviews.Content: We were unsure what to expect since we are more used to Disney properties and had heard mixed reviews, but this exceeded our expectations. After a week at Disney at a time share, we opted to stay here for the front of the line passes at Universal, especially since we were visiting 4th of July weekend. We checked our bags with the valet and checked in at the front desk around 10:30. Although our room was not ready, we got our room keys and went to the parks. We got a call about 1/2 hour later that our room was ready, but we stayed at the park until late afternoon. Our room was on the first floor (as requested) and our bellman pointed out that although we were very far from the lobby and main part of the hotel, we were just steps from the side door to the pool and the walkway to Universal. It was super convenient. The room was clean and comfortable, but aside from 2 rock photos, nondescript. We had a view through the bushes of the pool area. The pool area is very loud and when we went to bed around 11:30 Saturday night, we could still hear music, etc. The pool area itself is great, with a huge pool. It never felt crowded. They have a sand "beach" for some reason, which i found more annoying than fun, because my feet kept getting sandy and there was a lot of sand in the pool. The hot tubs were crowded but nice, and my kids liked the waterslide. We ate dinner at The Kitchen. Food was good, service was slow. While we ate Bart and Homer Simpson stopped by for photo ops. They have a good ice cream shop that also sells breakfast food, which saves time on the way to the parks. Overall, I would stay there again. It is a lovely hotel. And with early entry into the parks and front of the line access, it's definitely worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nickle and Dime Hell”
Reviews.Author: alex55844
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the on-site Universal properties several times but this may have been my last. The staff is very well trained and helpful, but after that it starts floundering fast. The first thing you'll notice when you check in is all the people with their laptops and tablets in the lobby. Why? The internet in you room has to be paid for each day. If that's not a warning shot across the bow of your wallet I don't know what is. My wife's bed was "uncomfortable". It had a nice little valley worn into the side of the mattress. Rather than replace the mattress the Hard Rock Hotel has chosen to cover it with an egg-crate. This solution was not successful in creating a good nights rest. The big plus side of a Universal properties hotel is getting to Harry Potter an hour before the crowds. If this is important to you, stay at the hotel for a night, then get out.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked the hotel”
Reviews.Author: leeannb87
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock for two reasons, location and early admittance to Islands of Adventure. The hotel is really nice. My only complaint was the bathroom was small so shutting the door was difficult depending on where you were standing. Check-in was smooth and the gal did a great job of explaining the Hotel, etc. They have a kiosk in the lobby to print your park tickets. Everything was within an easy walk. The IOA general public entry time was 8am, we could get in at 7am, we left the Hard Rock Hotel at 6:30 after a quick bagel, etc at the hotel. The gates actually opened at 6:45 and everyone streamed to Wizarding World of Harry Potter. Also staying at the Hotel you get the fast passes which allows you to bypass most lines except the Hogwarts ride. By afternoon we were tired and hot so went back to the hotel to hit the pool. Shortly after a downpour hit and lightning. People that came back later were drenched as they shut down outside rides when there's lightening. Because we were so close, after a wonderful dinner at the on site The Kitchen, we went back for a great evening with fewer people. It's expensive to stay on property but the early entry, fast passes, convenience, and a great hotel made up for it. Our whole family (parents with 2 college age adults) enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for a family vacation to Universal”
Reviews.Author: familyguy13
Reviews.Content: We just took our first trip to Universal in Orlando, FL and stayed at the Hard Rock for 2 nights. We loved the hotel from the moment we checked in. The rock memorabilia on the walls was cool to see and the place was very clean and well maintained. We had adjoining rooms, which were spacious and very nice. The restaurants served good food and the kids buffet was an excellent value. After a long day at the parks it was fun to sit by the pool and watch movies on the big screen. As you might expect, good music was always playing throughout the hotel. The hotel is very close to the parks. We only used the water taxi once, choosing instead to walk the 10 minutes to and from the parks. The best part of staying at one of the Universal hotels is the separate line for the rides. This feature enabled us to ride every ride in the park in about 6 hours and get back to the hotel for a leisurely dinner and then drinks by the pool. It was a much less hectic experience than the typical day at Disney World. We loved the hotel and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: u7mg0
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights of July 4th weekend. I had “reservations” thinking that this was a 3 star quality when I usually stay in 5 stars. I was pleasantly surprised it was a nice experience. We stayed on the Club Level which had all day sodas, some snacks etc. along with a decent breakfast and nice social hour. The staff there were friendly, and the bartenders didn’t skimp on the pours. It was always quite crowded, but we somehow managed to get a table. A lot of people brought their libations back to their room. The hotel staff was definitely self-expressive with tattoos, piercings, Mohawks. They fit in well with the theme. The pool is always crowed and difficult to find a lounge. A young chap named AJ saw us wandering and actually went searching, found, and brought back two lounged in the shade. Kudos to him. lots of activities for the kids poolside. We ate at the Kitchen. The menu is not very diverse or inspiring. Quality was adequate. Also ate at The Palm which was a nice experience. We shared the 5 pound lobster. Enough for both of us, but most of the weight I would attribute to the shell. The wine list was large, although very pricey. Hard to find a reasonably priced red under $75. But I did manage. Service was attentive, but not intrusive. One issue was the brussel sprouts came out almost raw and hard. Had to send them back, and took over 20 minutes before I asked where they were. The manager comped them for us which was nice. Best of all is the short walk to the two parks. We were unaware that Harry Potter and the Rocket do not have an Express Pass line, so be prepared to wait. The whole reason we went was for the two, and thought it was pretty unfair being that we paid a big price for the hotel. Islands of Adventure opened at 7am for the hotel guests, but still had to wait 45 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Don't buy a drink!!!”
Reviews.Author: DorsetBert
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel, nice room (paper thin walls and doors) and the express pass really paid for itself, as does the early entry to Potterland. This is what you are paying the price for, first in the queue on the rides and early potter. The hotel itself is very clean, the reception staff and check-in very friendly and efficient. The pool area is large and very clean, lots of posers around the pool to laugh at. Hotel itself seems more geared up towards teenagers/young adults, than for those with younger children. Made the mistake of ordering a drink from the pool bar, one beer, one cocktail and 2 cokes cost me $41!!!!!! Waitresses helpfully informed me she had added 20% gratuity, which was very kind of her, 20% for doing what exactly I could not tell you, we were sat next to the bar so she only had to reach over for the drinks, then I couldn't find her for ages when I wanted to pay and go. I wouldn't take young children here, but for teenagers the whole "vibe" of the place would be perfect. As I said before, premium price for us was for the perks, hence only a 1 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: shadowbeach
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our family. Two adults and 13 yr old daughter. We paid additional $50 per night for Club level room. We had a great time, great view of Universal Studios from our pool front room. Loved the music playing, all the displays of artists outfits etc. and the pool was wonderful. $15.00 per night parking and charge for high speed internet, which we decided not to use.

Reviews.Title: “Hype is true!”
Reviews.Author: cheenee
Reviews.Content: Worth the price just for the proximity to Universal! Great decor! Club room was worth the extra price. Just a cool and hip hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Smbowers
Reviews.Content: Too loud! Pool music starts early and lasts until late. Rooms average and not worth the money. This hotel is for teens. Yelling teens were pounding on doors and walls!

Reviews.Title: “Very handy and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: MFamily11
Reviews.Content: Excellent location with early admission to Harry Potter ride and a nice pool area to kick back and relax and then an easy walk (or bike pull, or water taxi) back to fun restaurants.on City Walk.

Reviews.Title: “Like a VIP”
Reviews.Author: Texas-Tiers
Reviews.Content: We were in Florida to see a Shuttle Launch and to go to Universal Studio’s. Front desk staff was pleasant and check-in was fast and simple. Rooms were nicely appointed and clean. The hotel offers some nice perks if you are also going to Universal Studio’s. Some of the big perks are; “Early Park Admission” which allows you into the park one hour before the park opens and “Express ride access” which allows you to go to the front of the line by showing your room key. Overall I would dfinitely stay here again when I’m in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “It could be better....”
Reviews.Author: anapin
Reviews.Content: Two years ago, my husband, sister and I went to the Royal Pacific, and it was a fantastic experience... the price was fair and the hotel was beautiful... Now we decided to go to the Hard Rock Hotel and I'm sure we've made the wrong choice. In both hotels, we got the Club Lounge room. In the Hard Rock hotel, for breakfast, sometimes we had to wait for a free table for a long time. The food wasn't so good as the Royal Pacific and three times during a week I had to ask for coffee because the employees didn't pay attention when it has finished. The corridors showed how the hotel is needing a big renovation. The rooms doors are poor and ugly. We've made the reservations six months before arriving and we've got rooms so far from the elevators and the Lounge that we had to walk two huge corridors to get there. The best thing is the Concierge personal, mainly a lady that, unfortunately, I don't remember the name. They are attentive and helped us when my sister needed. But my advise is: go to the Royal Pacific if you want to stay by Universal Studios!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: carrie0514
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but great things to say about Hard Rock Orlando! This was by far the most fantastic hotel I've ever had the pleasure of staying in. Convenient location for Universal, Islands of Adventure, and City Walk. Wonderful food. Friendly staff. If I had to choose my favorite thing...it would probably be the pool. We would go back just to stay in the hotel and hang out at the pool. My boys had so much fun on the slide! This hotel is an excellent place to stay for families. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: susann616
Reviews.Content: My brothers family and I stayed here recently. We loved the pool, especially watching movies from the pool. The restaurant Kitchen was great in part because it had a kids area for the kids to play while the adults enjoyed their meals. The rooms are great and had a nice view. It is just a short walk to Universal. The staff was very nice and helpful. Loved this hotel and can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Looking very tired!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy2012UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in 2 standard rooms. We have stayed here many times (last time 2 years ago) and the rooms are looking very tired now. The hotel is huge and our rooms were a long way from the elevator. The river boat to the parks was never around when we wanted it - so we walked to/from the parks each day. The only reason I would stay here is to use the room key card for Fastpass on the rides. The hotel is so expensive and badly in need of an upgrade. We ate at the Royal Pacific Hotel one evening - food was fabulous, one of the best meals in Orlando. Harry Potter world in the park is fantastic. If you stay in the hotel you can get in early and boy do you need to. The queues were so long after the first hour. The pool area is always busy - difficult to find somewhere to sit and very noisy if you want to read a book - but great for teenagers and kids. I preferred the Hyatt Grand Cypresses - must better value and rooms are far more chic and comfortable. Only stay at the Hard Rock if you want to visit the parks.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: M0llyk
Reviews.Content: My family loves the hotel. The pros: fun (but loud) pool area, comfortable beds and sheets, fun rock music playing all the time, friendly hotel staff, very clean, closest hotel to parks. The cons: slight urine smell coming from a/c vent, no cell phone service in room, not enough pool servers. Expensive but worth it! We went to the Portofino Hotel to swim one day. They have a large, quiet, relaxing pool and a few steps away from that a pool similar to Hard Rock's without the loud music. Very pretty area-nice quiet break from constant noise of parks and H.R. But, Hard Rock rocks!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to have fun and be close to the parks -- 3rd visit!”
Reviews.Author: acyork
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in March with our family in late April -- it was as fun as always. We enjoyed dinner with Shrek and Scooby one night -- great interaction as there we not too many people there compared with a Disney character meal. Having the front of the line passes for both parks makes zipping through it a breeze. The room was very nice -- no concerns at all. Free wi-fi in the lobby is a nice way to start the day with a coffee as the girls are getting ready to hit the parks. The best part of the Hard Rock is probably just relaxing in the shallow pool after a day at the parks as the kids keep heading up and down the water slide. The DJ makes the afternoon a fun time for all -- "If its too loud, you're too old." Just makes me smile thinking about it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely way to start off holiday”
Reviews.Author: j_rich2011
Reviews.Content: Hotel had a vibrant atmosphere with really nice music playing. The pool was a great size with lots of people around, lots of sun loungers around. The lobby was very modern and elegant, with comfortable sofas and fast free wi-fi. In room water was $7, so bring your own if you can. House keeping were prompt and did a good job. Great coffee pod machine. HD TV. Comfy beds and separate sink area outside bathroom. However, the bathroom was very small with no separate shower cubicle. Express passes meant no queues for majority of rides. which was excellent and saved hours of time. The parks Universal, CityWalk and Islands of Adventure were within easy walking distance. Overall, the stay here was great but watch out for the rude, lazy black girl who gives out the towels at the pool, she needs some lessons in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EnglandKaren
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel for a couple of days whilst visiting Universal, the hotel is very well situated for the theme park , you could walk or take the water taxi. The room was lovely, spacious with lovely modern contemporary decor, coffee machine , nice bathroom - rather small but did the job and lovely toiletries. Would most certainly stay here again if going to the Universal parks.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: mckcrc
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 week at the Hard Rock from 28 May - 5 June. Every moment of our holiday was absolutely faultless. Although most reviews are positive, I read some of the negative reviews on Trip Advisor before booking this hotel and really can't understand how some people can be so picky. We stayed at club level which I would recommend we had a brilliant view of Universal Studio's from our room window, our room was clean and the hotel was immaculate and provides all the facilities you need. Food in the restaurants was excellent especially, 'The Kitchen'. The walk to Universal Studio's was about 5 mins and the express tickets and early (1 hour) prior access to the parks is priceless (especially as the queue for Harry Potter can get quite long). With only 1 week we were able to do City Walk, Universal Islands of Adventure and Universal Studios in 3.5 days which left us 2.5 days to go to Seaworld, Aquatica and shopping. This was because our express tickets meant our queuing time for the rides and shows was never more than 5 minutes (this may differ in peak period). Hotel staff were always friendly and extremely helpful - always willing to go that extra bit to provide more help than you need and always on hand to make recommendations for the best places to go and how to get there. I WILL definitely be going back here!

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: exit14
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in Disney hotels maybe 5 times -this was our first trip to Universal. We had a 6:00 am flight and we arrived in Orlando at 9:00 am. We got to the Hard Rock Hotel around 10:30 am. We checked in and received our Universal Studios, Islands of Adventure and City Walk passes. We were told that we would receive a phone call/text when our room was ready. Typical check in time is 4:00 pm -however, we read in the hotel policies that if a room is available prior to 4:00 they will assign it to you. We gave our luggage to the hotel to hold until the room was ready then we walked over to Universal Studios. 4:00 came and we still hadn't receved a call or text telling us that our room was ready. By now we had been up since 3:00 am -we were tired and hot (it was 48 degrees when we left home so, we weren't exactly dressed for 90 degree Florida weather) and just wanted to get into our room to freshen up -change clothes and relax a little. We went back to the front desk and pretty much pleaded for a room. We were finally assigned a room on the 1st floor. We went to retrieve our luggage and were told that the hotel staff would deliver it in about an hour. We didn't want to wait another minute to freshen up and change into "Florida" clothes so, we said that we'd take our own luggage to our room.... they didn't seem pleased with that -but we weren't really pleased either so, we insisted that we'd take it ourselves. If we'd waited for them that would've been at least another hour that we had to wait to change and what good was getting into the room without any of our stuff?? Getting into the room was our biggest complaint -there had to be a room somewhere in that hotel that was available before 4:00. This is one reason why I gave them 3 stars. Other than the room issue -the staff was pleasant -actually everyone in the hotel seemed nice. We ate at 'The Kitchen' a few times -everyone seemed nice and friendly and the food was pretty good. The pool was always crowded but there was plenty of poolside chairs available and room for more people without seeming over crowded. If you exited through a gate near the back of the pool and followed a path City Walk and the 2 theme parks were a short 10-15 minute walk away -this is a big bonus... no waiting for buses! Bicycle taxies were available at both ends of the path -these people work for tips only so, tip good if you ever use them. It was nice to get a ride back from the parks at the end of the day. There isn't a fridge available in the room (big thumbs down -another reason for the 3 stars) they do have a locked (the key is available at the front desk) mini bar with unreal prices -like $7.00 for a bottle of water. We ended buying water at the hotel store and filling up our ice bucket every night and using it like a cooler to keep the water cold in case we were thirsty in the middle of the night. A regular empty fridge for our use at no charge (like they have in the Disney hotels) would have been great. We read that they will switch the mini bar out for a regular fridge for a fee of $25 then charge $15 p/day on top of that to keep the fridge. There is also a small safe available for a p/day fee -again Disney gives you use of the same exact safe at no charge. The hotel and our room were neat and clean. Even though we were out of the room for most of every day no one showed up to clean our room or give us fresh towels. By the 3rd day we had to call down to the front desk and ask for fresh towels and to have our trash emptied. They were apologetic and sent someone right up. Would we stay here again...??? Maybe -but, we think that we like the way Disney runs their hotels better. We also liked how Disney gives you one card for your room key, park passes, etc -1 card covers everything. At Universal we had a room key/park express combo pass card, City Walk pass card and Universal/Islands of Adventure pass card. Having 1 card for everything is a lot better all around. If you want to stay here (or any other Universal Studios hotel) just make sure you know what's included and what's not included ahead of time so there are no surprises -otherwise just expect to pay extra for everything and you'll be good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! So convenient!”
Reviews.Author: desp4vacay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel at Universal because we just had to see "The Wizarding World of Harry Potter." We were there over the NJ Teacher's convention weekend so it was pretty crowded. Fortunately we stayed on a club floor so that was a great bonus that the kids loved. We had free breakfast, cookies and milk every afternoon, and happy hour every evening, between 5 and 7pm, I believe. Then at around 9:30 there was hot cocoa or chocolate milk, coffee, tea, etc... and snacks again. It was a nice touch. The hotel was great, we could walk everywhere we wanted to go. The parks were clean and beautiful, the citiwalk area was really cool. We even saw a movie in their huge theater at Citiwalk, and it was so clean and large, we LOVED it! Hotel Restaurants were OK but definitely try some of the awesome places at Citiwalk, like Margaritaville or Bubba Gump's. I highly recommend this hotel, if you can upgrade to club, go for it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hoping for a great experience this time.”
Reviews.Author: michelemdobbs
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hard Rock one other time. Our room had a musty oder to it and wasn't exactly what I was expecting for $250.00 night. The help either didn't speak English very well or were simply just rude. Although, the front desk attendant at checkout was extremely pleasant and expeditious. There was a large group staying on the Club Level and it seemed they were more interested in keeping that party content than making the "ordinary" visitors stay totally enjoyable. I am meeting a high school friend of 20 years here for us to spend a couple days with each other and our kids. I am hoping the hotel has really picked up it's game. I have been ill for two years and am this is the first real trip I have taken since, I am really looking forward to an enjoyable couple days at Universal and hope the Hard Rock adds to the trip and does disappoint again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: desertdad67
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out, the staff at the Hard Rock hotel rocked! It was my husband and son's birthdays during our stay, and in our room they left a huge piece of birthday cake for each of them. They each got cards and hard rock birthday pins. This was a huge hit with our 9 year old son. Our room was spacious and clean. The toiletries were very nice, smelled good. The beds were comfortable with lots of pillows. Our room overlooked the pool and initially we were worried that it would be loud. It wasn't. Our kids had fun swimming during breaks from Universal Studios. The day after we checked out, we realized we had left two bathing suits and a swim cover up in on room. Despite thinking it would be futile, I called the hotel to see if our belongings were found and turned in. They promised to check and call me back. Within minutes, I had a return phone call and they had our swim gear! My husband drove back and picked them up. What great service! I would definitely tell a friend to stay here if they were visiting the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: kirby214
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe room with two queens. It was a large room with a nice view of the pool area and an additional sleeper sofa. My children hate sharing a bed so the sleeper sofa worked out great for us. The furnishings were modern, and the room was mostly clean. Some dust left on the headboard that grossed me out a bit but beyond that pretty spotless. We ate at all the restaurants in the hotel and liked them all. My children enjoyed the pool. We all liked the beautifully landscaped and shaded walk to the theme parks from this hotel. We never even used the boats because the walk seemed faster to us.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: StitchesToo
Reviews.Content: Made our first visit to Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure theme parks. Stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel. The positive service began when I was making the reservations. The reservation agents (I called twice) were very courteous and expressed appreciation for our business. Once we arrived, the hotel exceeded our expectations. The theming throughout the hotel is great. As one example, you can hear rock music playing if you go underwater in the pool. The pool area and grounds are gorgeous. The lobby, shops, etc. are all very attractive as well. It is a short walk or boat ride to the theme parks and you get great perks like early entry and express access to most rides by staying at a Universal resort. We had a basic garden view room. I thought the decor was beautiful. The colors were creams and browns and blues. There are brushed steel/chrome accents, i.e. the lamps, bath hardware and accessories. The beds were very comfortable. The toiletries were some of the best I have encountered. Also the hair dryer had good power and the water pressure was very good. These are little things that I appreciate, I did wish there was more room to stow our bags. I like to be able to put them under the bed or in a closet and there wasn't room. But all in all I loved the room. We ate at the casual restaurant, the Kitchen. We just ordered basic food, like a turkey club and flatbread, but it was delicious with top quality ingredients. They also have other dining options including an upscale restaurant, 24 hour room service and servers walking around the pool area taking drink orders (maybe food too...not sure). There was a lot of clutter in the hallways throughout most of the day between cleaning carts and maintenance work that was going on. We also had a maintenance worker ask to change the air filter in the room. It only took a minute, so it was okay with us. Interestingly, at night there was an aroma in the hallway like people were smoking marijuana....could it be part of the theming? Service at the resort was average. Everyone was friendly, but things were a bit slow at times. For example, we had our bags unloaded from the car before anyone approached us to help with unloading. We were out of our room all morning at the theme park, but cleaning service didn't come to the room until the afternoon, when we were back to rest. The person didn't speak English so it was difficlt to communicate that we just wanted her to replace the towels. She left new towels, but didn't pick up the ones on the floor. Overall, the positives far outweighed the negatives and we loved staying at the Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BushkaTexas
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Hard Rock hotel so we could take advantage of the front of the line passes for the rides at Islands of Adventure and the early morning hour for Harry Potter. Our daughter was so excited! This hotel has a great theme. The room was really nice and the grounds were well maintained. We also had time to enjoy the pool. You can walk to citywalk which connects to the parks in five minutes or take a water taxi. You do have to pay to park your car each day which is ridiculous when you are already paying over $300 to stay there. The cost is extremely high but we did enjoy having the fast passes and getting into HP at 8 a.m. with the other hotel guests. We were able to ride the Forbidden Forest ride 2x before the public was allowed in. Then you hotel key card gets you to the front of every line.

Reviews.Title: “Still love the hard rock!!!”
Reviews.Author: coloradorbust
Reviews.Content: We have vacationed here before and in our opinion. The hard rock is still the best place to stay to orlando. So close like 5 minute to universal studios if you walk. The skip the lines and add harry potter hour are the best answered when traveling with kids. Do not hestitate with this hotel. No the rooms are not the most lavish but who spends all day in the room.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful, wonderful... give it more stars”
Reviews.Author: Family_of_4FL
Reviews.Content: Attentive, comfortable, wonderful pool... add in the Universal Express line treatment (kids had only 5 minute waits in line on Saturday of Memorial Day weekend!) and it just doesn't get better than this. Well worth the rates... definitely now my universal studios - citywalk hotel of choice!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a Rockstar”
Reviews.Author: Mailman_8
Reviews.Content: Fab times to be had, nothing too much trouble and staying in the club suites made it that little better. Try watching a movie in the pool at nighttime - Awesome

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: pickers1982
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a night to get away from disney and have a night out in city walk (which i recommend for a few magaritas!!!) Very nicely kitted out hotel and immaculate but lacked a little charm. pool was also very nice. When we returned to the area we choose the cheaper Loews Royal Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “Simply great!”
Reviews.Author: Anelim
Reviews.Content: We returned 10 days ago, from our five days stay at the HRH and agree with the two previous five stars reviews. Can add that we checked in at 11 A.M. and our Level Club Room was ready, clean and with a wonderful water view, even it was a standard room. We bought Park Tickets at the Concierge Desk, for the same price as tickets bought online thru Universal's website. The Front Desk staff was very friendly. One night when leaving the hotel to dinner, I required a hairdryer at the front desk; my husband who was leaving the room to join me received it......... It took only 30 seconds…! The Level Club, as other reviewers said, worth the money. Limitless drinks as sodas, apple juice, water and coffee during almost all the day, plus other items already mentioned. (The Continental breakfast was great and with a wide selection of pastries, bread and cereals. All the Hors D’ouvre were fresh and flavorful. It varied every evening: something of vegetables, something of meat or chicken, sushi sometimes, etc…) Never felt that guests were observed/censured by the Lounge staff due to the consumed amounts of food or drinks.....It was usual that people took several sodas, juice or coffees to the room or when leaving towards the parks…. In the Club Lounge Internet service was efficient. I could send my photos to a pendrive in seconds. They had also a printer there. We did not use the restaurants of the hotel except room service for a delicious Pizza. Even we didn’t requested drinks they send a complete silverware service, in a rolling table with 4 glasses, covered with plastic foil….and it was only a pizza! Due to the parks and the heat of the day, the breakfast, snacks, the Hors D'Ouvre and the dessert were sufficient food for us. Previous to the trip I doubted if we would take advantage of all the club amenities due to the schedules but I shouldn’t. Sometimes we returned to the hotel to refresh us, to drink something eat some snacks, a little swimming and then return to the parks. (only a 7 or 8 minutes walk, by a shaded footpath close to the water….or the boats that run every 20 minutes, or the “bike guy” ride!), The proximity and early access to parks and the free Express Pass modality at almost all the attractions seems to be a good reason to stay in-site …. Tripadvisor grants the freedom to express our view, but when reading some bad reviews seems to me that some guests will never find a hotel that would satisfy them in and around this planet! since they don’t admit human errors. Come on….it’s vacation time .....enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “So incredibly awesome”
