The room was clean and the hotel rate was fine for where you are........All in all I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone from singles, couples and families with kids as long as you are looking to have a good time partying!!!! If you are the type that just wants to curl up with a nice book and have peace and quiet this place may not be for you!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rocking at the hard rock !!!”
Reviews.Author: shopaholic98
Reviews.Content: First leg of our 3 week honeymoon and we had the best time. After a long flight from Ireland we were dying to check into our hotel and have a rest. On arrival check in was fast prompt and there was no waiting around. We were offered an upgrade to club level which included complimentary breakfast and snacks throughout the day. We took this upgrade and it proved to be well worth it. Having pre purchased all our theme park tickets in ireland we saved alot of money. Also as the Hard Rock is on site at universal our room key cards were our express tickets for both universal studios and islands of adventure. The extra we orginally paid to stay on site at universal cancelled out 10 fold by the amount we used our room keys as express tickets. An absolute must for anyone going to orlando, especially with children. The breakfast in the morning was briulliant , continental style but you really dont need anymore, and the fact that you can get up and go get your breakfast beofer heading out saves you loads of time and money. 4 nights out of 7 we ate in the kitchen restauant. We enjoyed every singel meal there and are already looking forward to a return trip. The service in the hotel is second to none and the cleaning staff work tirelessly every day. No matter when you meet them they greet you with a smile and are always asking is there anything they can do for you. As both parks are only a short stroll through lovely walkways you have fantasy land right on your doorstep. The wizarding world of harry potter is heaven on earth and we vistied it 3 times during our stay. As residents of the hard rock we had access to the [arks 1 hour before the parks opened to the public and as harry potter is attracting thousands this was fantasatic. We are already planning our next trip with extened family and will for sure be returning to the hard rock

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad and The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: TheIndigoSpirit
Reviews.Content: The Good Check in was fabulous--prompt, friendly and efficient. Rooms were clean and promptly maintained. Lemongrass toiletries were quickly snatched up by our girls. Best part--early admissions to the parks and only a three minute walk. Also, had ferry and pedicab access for those late nights. The Kitchen Restaurant was excellent in food quality, value and service. Highly recommended. The Bad No small refrigerator in room, nor microwave. Have to pay extra for almost everything--in-room internet access, self parking, access to workout room. The Ugly Nothing. But I need to stick with theme of title.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: dereckland
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very comfortable and the decor was warm and inviting. the Christmas decorations were beautiful. When we first arrived, the staff at the door was helpful, and the registration desk personnel were very polite and helpful. They told us where to go at the park, helped us with dinner reservations and were very upbeat. We only went to one hotel restaurant: The Kitchen. We had the breakfast buffet and it was delicious. The pool area was absolutely beautiful with a great family-friendly atmosphere, including an awesome water slide and night-time family movies. The best part of staying at this hotel is the proximity to the parks and the city-walk, and of course, the express ride privileges and early park admission. Without this perk, we would not have been able to access the Wizarding World of Harry Potter and ride the Forbidden Journey twice! The only thing I didn't like about the hotel is there was no free internet access in the rooms. They had free access in the business area, but we all have ipods and laptops and were unable to use that in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Fun fun fun”
Reviews.Author: susanlst
Reviews.Content: My family shared two adjoining rooms at the Hard Rock Hotel. Both rooms had two queen size beds. Both beds had clean, modern, plentiful bedding, the mattresses were very comfortable, there was a variety of pillows in the room. The room was clean, had a large desk, double dresser, large LG flat screen television. It also had comfortable additional seating. Our rooms overlooked a green area and provided nice privacy. The hotel is large, well appointed, and full of rock and roll memorabilia. We especially enjoyed the close proximatey to both Universal Studio theme parks. We walked each morning to the parks and appreciated the early admittance that staying on property allowed us. We were able to ride the rides and see the attractions we wanted to before the park was open to the general public. The close proximatey to Universal and City Walk allowed us to do the parks in the morning and early afternoon, come back to the room for a rest, and then head back out for an evening trip to the parks and City Walk. It allowed us more time in the parks and a more pleasant, fun experience. We did not use the fitness center, there is a $12.00 per day/per person charge. This seemed excessive to us. I realize this probably keeps unattended children out of the workout area, but we refused to pay more for a workout. We also were surprised that the internet is still be charged for, still? really? Enough, people expect access to the internet and I don't think it should still be an extra charge. We enjoyed the Kerurig coffee maker - we have one at home and enjoyed having it on our vacation. We loved the great water pressure in the shower and the lemongrass scented toiletry items. The bathroom was clean, neat and the towels were thick and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, awesome service - this hotel "rocks"!”
Reviews.Author: msschark
Reviews.Content: Not only was the location fantastic (5 min walk to the parks), but the service was above and beyond. From the waitress at the pool who brought us complementary chips as we were starving, to the wonderful concierge who brought an extra scooter key to the restaurant on CityWalk (I lost mine), the employees at this hotel were fantastic. We loved the ambiance; however, if you don't want to be woken up by rock music at 9:00 AM, do not get a pool view room. The rooms were nicely decorated and the beds very comfortable. The lounge area has free WIFI and board games for the kids if you get bored (which is impossible considering you are at Universal Studios). The pool had a DJ everyday with a lot of really fun games. The pool was heated so swimming was part of the fun, even with the cooler temperatures outside. Overall, we would stay at the Hard Rock again - no doubt! Great hotel for families with kids and those who love the whole "rock n roll" experience. If you are looking for a reliable, comfortable ride to the airport, we used Sr. Celebrity Transportation. Call Nicholas (321-217-6806 or nromain40@yahoo.com). For the cost of a regular cab, you get a more comfortable ride in an SUV with a very nice and friendly driver.

Reviews.Title: “Worst rock music from the '80's”
Reviews.Author: floridatraveldad
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how a hotel like this gets the rights to songs, but over a period of 4 days I heard some of the songs from the 70's and 80's that I would just as soon never have heard again. Can't they get rights to the good songs? Anyway, the great thing about the Hard Rock is that it's a 3 minute walk to the entrance of Universal Studios. Islands of Adventure is about a 3 minute further walk. Also, the atmosphere is really "cool". There is rock 'n roll memoribilia everywhere. The rooms were laid out weirdly, with no overhead lights and no bedside tables (there was a big headboard that had a clock and 2 lamps on it). We had a "kid's suite", which was great for the kids, but they could have added a half bath for their room--4 people in a "suite", and only 1 bathroom? 1st night, there was music blaring from the room next door at 11 pm. I called the front desk, and security came up, and it turned out to be an alarm clock that went off improperly! (The loudness was due to the excellent sound system--usually a plus). 2nd night there was a live concert downstairs that filled the room until it ended at 11 pm or so--not a problem if you are a night owl. The shops and restaurants were excellent. Maid service was superb. Grounds were gorgeous. Oh, a warning for joggers. They handed me a 3.8 mile jogging route at the concierge desk. Although none of the following was mentioned in the description, it involved crossing a major road 4 times, going through several other road intersections, down an almost hidden staircase, and (I'm telling the truth) actually running IN THE ROAD for about 200 yards. I would put a "recommend" for this hotel because it was really beautiful, but there were just too many little problems, especially considering it's high price. In the future I would stay at a local condo hotel for $200-300 less per night and buy express passes for everybody--net savings of maybe $100-200/night, more sleeping space, and a kitchen!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat value of Universal Express Pass”
Reviews.Author: MCPO-USN-2011
Reviews.Content: I have a large family (eight) and we are making this a annual Christmas Retreat for us. The weather, the location and the parks are just to much fun. VALUE: OK----you can rate this two ways: 1---Actual cost of the hotel room. YES, you can get cheaper rooms within walking distance of Universal. BUT, #2 is the value of the Universal Express Pass-----$179.99 at the gate, per person for Express Pass for 2-parks, per day. So, multiply that by EIGHT, and the VALUE of the Express Pass pays-for-the-room!!---now, that is Value in my eyes (WARNING---once you get the Express Pass option---you will NEVER stay off-property again----we can get thru Universal in 3 hours...all rides except Rock Rocket, and about 3 hours for I-O-A (excluding the Harry Potter mayhem). ROOMS: Due to our group of 8, I have to get two rooms. I had two Deluxe Queen Rooms, next to each other, on the 3rd floor. No door between, but next door. Rooms were HUGE, and for all the traffic thru these hotel rooms, the rooms are in fairly good shape. Nice bathrooms, Nice beds, sitting area/living room. Plenty of space. STAFF: Very accomodating and very friendly. WI-FI & Internet: OK----they nickel-and-dime you to death here....but, so do all resort type hotels in Orlando. WI-FI IS NOT FREE in the rooms....but, get over it. You don't come here to sit in your room and surf the internet. I am sitting on a big couch, right now, in the Velvet Lounge, with an adult beverage, fast internet. The huge lobby has all the teenagers Facebooking.....but, the internet is free in the Bar/Lounge...so, no kids here. BELL HOPS: Ob-nox-ious if you don't use them----they will guilt you into using them--and, then expect a huge tip. I mentioned it to the check-in staff and they agreed that other guests had complained in the past. RICKSHAW BIKES: More obnoxious than the bell hops. These vultures hang out at every pedestrian exit of the property, and "guilt" you into a ride (big/huge signs on bikes state that they receive no income and work for tips only)....so, they will hound you for cash. And, no matter what amount you provide....they will make you feel like you short-changed them. DO NOT use the rickshaws---Hard Rock is easy walking distance to the Theme Parks (really short distance). POOL: Outstanding!!! Just a fun place for everyone. Yes, kids everywhere----but, it is a Theme Park resort.....not an adults only resort. If you don't want kids everywhere, visit a Senior Citizen Center in Orlando. You can easily loose track of time in the pool area...with a bar, movies and water slide. Plus ping-pong and other games/events. FITNESS CENTER: I did not spend the money to utilize....instead, I jogged each day along the walking paths between Hard Rock, Portifino Hotel and City Walk. Well lit, and a fun run (and free). DOOR KEYs: Not only are the door keys used as express pass access, but you can put "amounts" on each card for your family members to spend. Kids love that option--makes them feel like a big-deal signing for food, beverages and other items. PARKING: NOT free. $15/day with in-n-out privileges. DINING: Breakfast is NOT included. But, Wendy's and McDonalds are withing 1 mile of the hotel. I made it from McDs and Wendys back to the hotel with hot food in under 15min and saved a-ton-of-money. Ate at "The Kitchen".....expensive ($175 for 8) and horrible service (just terrible......server could care less about our group....kept messing up the beverage orders EACH TIME he came to the table. Abandoned us for 15+min at a time.....just brutally horrible service).....but, great food. Ate at "The Palm"....very well known steakhouse......expensive ($150 for 2, with no bottle wine....just glass of wine each).....but exquisite steak and service. Overall, we will come back each year---forever---and stay here for our Annual Family Christmas Retreat. You cannot beat the value of the passes and the proximity of the property to the parks. It is just to convienent and fun. Be forewarned....the hotel was COMPLETELY BOOKED for the 3 days we were here.....I booked my room back in April for a December visit......and that was before the Potter mayhem. Book early to ensure that you get a room.....all 3 Universal Property Hotels were fully booked while we were here, and the parks were packed (22,23,24 Dec).

Reviews.Title: “Great time!!”
Reviews.Author: jbturph
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the Hard Rock on 12/2 thru 12/6. This is our third time here in the last 4 years. Although the weather was brisk to say the least this was one of our best stays. We finally booked a club room for this trip. Our previous trip we included our two boys ages 12 and 10 and stayed in the regular rooms. The club rooms are nice but no different then the rooms on the floors below. The club amenities are great. It was nice to get a coffee or hot chocolate before heading to the parks. Also, coming back and grabbing a snack throughout the day. We may stay in a club room again with the boys however, it would need to be a package deal. Our boys may enjoy it more and it may seem like a better deal since they could fill up on some of the food and snacks there too. The hotel itself was of course great. They seem to be making the effort to increase customer service. I have never has so many conversations with staff while at any hotel. Everybody was kind and fun to talk too. I could really see a difference from the last time we stayed there and it did not come off like it was forced either. The beds were great and the rooms where are very well cleaned. My wife is a stickler for clean rooms and it passed her test each day. We ate at the Kitchen for breakfast when we first arrived and even though the buffet is expensive it still is cheaper then ordering individual meals. The pools were clean and we used them despite the weather. Especially the hot tub. My one concern is that there is a adult only hot tub but yet parents still allow kids into this area. What is up with that? There is a sign. Can you read it? It just bothers me when other ASSUME it will be OK for 6 younger kids to enter this area. The parks where great although dated. The grinch breakfast is a must. Great time, OK food, but the characters make up for it. The Macy's parade was nice and the Grinch show was very entertaining. Got to get on all the rides and the lines were minimal for all areas including Harry Potter. Cannot see waiting in line for any store or a wand for that matter. Did not waste our time. Frozen Butterbeer was great even though the temps in the morning was in the upper 30's. Getting into the parks an hour early was a plus since we were able to do that entire area in that hour. For the most part the parks were dead this time of year as they usually are. I was told that after the first weekend in December to a few days before Christmas the parks are quiet. The holiday village is a dissappointment. The parks were all decorated nicely but the dated rides and the unused space at Universal allows you to completely do both parks in one day. We had 4 days in the parks and started looking for things to do but that could have been since we had been there so many times prior and knew what we wanted to do and not do. Twister? really? That movie is older then my kids and not a very good one too. The parks need updating and quickly. Workers in Harry Potter did not enjoy me asking for Team Edward or Team Jacob apparel. I am not a big Harry Potter person. Bottom line is that the hotel is great, location is great and the parks are dated. If you get a chance to go to the City Walk, hit the Rising Star, karokee bar. Great time and a great concept. Have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Value”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Scotch
Reviews.Content: You pay too much for what you get. There are dozens of other hotels within a 6 block radius that are a better value. Pros: Hotel is in a great location walking distance to many things, including Universal Studios. Cons: Bathroom was not cleaned very well. Upon check in, the bathroom floor was dirty and was never cleaned over my 5 days stay. Lots and lots of kids. Hotel hallway was loud and It was difficult to sleep with lots of noise. Hotel allows pets. Barking dogs is all I have to say about that! Cell phones do not work very well in the hotel. You must go outside to use your phone. Hotel restaurant staff was under staffed resulting in long waits. The staff was very pleasant. Parking staff block your access to and from your car to get a tip. It make me feel uncomfortable. Neither I nor my colleagues will stay at this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hard Rock!!”
Reviews.Author: Riff M
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful birthday weekend at the Hard Rock! We had a basic room but were upgraded to one(b-day amenity??) with a great view of the pool , lush landscaping , and the twinkling lights of the Universal rides in the distance. Everyone on staff had a smile and a helpful attitude! We enjoyed food and drinks at the Velvet Bar,breakfast at The Kitchen, and drinks at the pool. The location was perfect to get to the Universal parks and it was a short drive from the airport. I think that families and romantic couples or just a bunch of friends would all have a wonderful stay in this hotel!! I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Rock around the clock in convenience”
Reviews.Author: Dusty-traveller
Reviews.Content: We booked for the Thanksgiving holiday and got a great rate on a 5 night package which included Harry Potter early entrance as well as breakfast at teh Three Broomsticks. After a few nights at Disney World, we were happy to see that walking did not involve great distances or running for monorails or buses. The Hard Rock is perhaps the most concenient location of all the on-site hotels, as it literally sits next to the Universal Parks and City Walk. We booked a club level room, and while it was convenient to have drinks and snacks available to us, I wouldn't do it again. The whole set up was very basic with a limited collection of plastic chairs and tables, basic snacks and not a whole lot else. The staff, though cheerful and willing were not very good at actually assisting or particulalry knowledgeable about Univeral in general. Except for one request for a restaurant booking, the Club 7 staff referred us to the Front Desk, which sort of defeated the purpose. The rooms are lovely and good sized. Two double beds in our room with ample room for walking around, as well as an armchair and a large oval table and two chairs made for a comfortable stay. The room was clean and well-maintained. The bathroom, though nicely set up with a sink and vanity outside, and another sink, toilet, and tub/shower on the inside, it was awkward to close the door to the toliet area without stepping to one corner and performing a little dance to get to the tub without climbing over the toilet. Housekeeping was wonderful. They somehow knew when we were out of the room, cleaned and were long gone by the time we got back. One day we just relaxed in the room after a late night, and housekeeping was kind enough to look in on us before going home to see if we wanted more towels or anything else. The lovely large windows do not open in the room, which would have been nice for some freah air. Though the A/C did its job well, albeit a bit noisily at times. The internet was horrible. Bad enough you have to pay for it, but when it becomes intermittant and very slow, it is a problem. It is $10/day and really not worth the aggravation. There is a single computer available for guest use in the Club room, and it was always easy to take a few minutes to check email and reservations, etc. And even it was slow at times. The hotel itself was nicely maintained and lively with rock music playing in the public areas. It was always fun trying to "name that song" whenever in the elevators. Some have claimed the music is too loud and pervasive, though we did not find this to be so at all. The staff were ever-helpful and present, which made getting information and advice easy. We went to The Palms restaurant on site, and after hearing so much about it, thought that it was a bit over-hyped. We had dinner there one evening, and though the service was attentive and the menu diverse, the steaks themselves were quite mundane and nothing special at all. My filet mignon was nicely seasoned and well cooked, but a poor piece of meat. Period. And this was largely the case for the rest of our party. Sides are okay and plentiful, but nothing special (and we at additionaly cost) We went swimming at the pool and were not pleased. Too many people, not enough chairs and the pool area seemed a bit unkempt and sad. It did not help that the pool was overun by screaming and inconsiderate children. The pool is largely 3 feet deep in most places, with only one small area being around 5 feet -- which, you guessed it, was where they were holding kids games and donut eating contests. We went once and did not go back again. I cannot emphasize enough how good a location this hotel is. It is literally steps from the Universal parks via a nice walkway, or by boat. We were able to walk between both parks and Citywalk within just a few minutes. Do go and see the Blue Man show if you can -- it is fun for kids and adults alike. We also took advantage of the many movies showing at the Multiplex theatre, with a great $5 morning special for even new releases. There are plenty of restaurants to try also, including some fast food uptions. We walked over to the Portotino resort and walked around. It is nicely done, but quite spread out. We also went over to the Royal Pacific and enjoyed a lovely sushi dinner there. It's a nice hotel, but also with a shallow pool. (they don't encourage guests from one hotel to swim in the other hotel pools, but we had to go and have a look to see if there were other options) All in all, a good stay. and we were able to see and do just about all Univeral had to offer. The parks are not as extensive as Disney, and that was fine for us. If there were not other things to do in the immediate area, after 3 days of parks we would have been bored. And we also wondered why a large percentage of Universal's rides include having water thrown at you. There was hardly a ride or show that water was not a factor. From a spit or two on Spiderman and Forbidden Journey to a full soaking on Popeye's water barges and the Horror Makeup Show (do not sit in the front row unless you want to be soaked)

Reviews.Title: “Won Over!”
Reviews.Author: Portland_ORDdb
Reviews.Content: I admit I came to this place with a slight ambivalence in that I felt I was forced to stay here to get express line privileges at Universal. But, boy, was I won over! The staff were incredible, the room was beautiful and the grounds exquisite. We didn’t have time to enjoy the pool but it certainly looked inviting. We loved the water taxi to CityWalk and it was only a short 10-minute walk to the parks in the morning. The express line privilege was definitely a great perk in that we never had to wait in line during our visit in November. This hotel really shined in our memories especially after staying the next two nights at Disney’s Port Orleans Riverside - what a dump! I also thought that The Wizarding World of Harry Potter was by far the best attraction between both parks!

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: stoneislanduk
Reviews.Content: fantastic loved it second time vist cannot wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay up for "Poolside View"”
Reviews.Author: Jude1969
Reviews.Content: Very few rooms actually see the pool. Ours is on the 2nd floor and all we see are trees. Pool is very shallow so is dominated with kids 8 years old and younger. Location is convenient to Universal but the one hour advance entrance still means the Harry Potter exhibit is extremely busy. If Potter is a must, getting in early is a must...or go late in the evening and stay somewhere that is less expensive but even nicer than a Loews hotel. Internet access is $10 a day and per computer. Self parking adds another fee per day. The brunch at the sites "Kitchen" was not stocked up til the finish time of 11:00. When we arrived at 10:30, many items only had a few left. On the upside, the hotel staff has a laid back, fun spirit to them. They compliment by pounding fists, say "take it easy", and have a casual fun demeanor. A long haired tattooed person would be recruited to work here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel- great for honeymoon.”
Reviews.Author: pobrien2009
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Orlando on honeymoon in July. This was our first stop. The hotel was excellent. We were checking in at 4am after a 12 hour flight and the staff were so friendly. When the receptionist found out it was our honeymoon we were upgraded. He also explained all the facilities available in the hotel and told us all about the surrounding area- City Walk. Our cases were taken up to our room for us and when we reached the room, we were not disappointed. It was clean, spacious, tidy and fresh. The bed was huge, we had a lovely view and it was stunning. We ordered room service numerous times and it was always pipping hot. The restaurant in the hotel was expensive but the food was delicious. The pool was lovely, although you need to be there early to get a sun lounger. You are entitled to the river boat for free to the City Walk which is very handy, especially if you have spent a long day at the attractions. We had an early check out and staff were a great help for this also. They carried our bags to our taxi and were very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience and Service”
Reviews.Author: TMan61
Reviews.Content: At the last minute we decided to change our reservation from one of the International Drive hotels to the Hard Rock at Universal. I am so glad we did, the location and walkability cannot be beat, plus the Express Pass makes all the difference if you plan on lots of rides. Our package included park-to-park passes, Blue Man Group tickets, breakfast at the 3 Broomsticks, plus overnight and Express Pass, early admission to park privledges. IT WAS WORTH IT!!! Also, I was lucky to get upgraded to Club Level which saved some money and time on breakfast each morning, and a couple of relaxing drinks after a full day at the park. The pool areas were nice and not too crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: iknowhowitis
Reviews.Content: For our family of five (kids aged 11 ,12, and 12), staying at the Hard Rock while we visited Universal (and Disney) was the best vacation decision we ever made. First of all, we were upgraded at no additional cost to a king suite, which was a huge, luxurious room that easily fit three roll-away beds and still offered plenty of room to lounge around. The king-size bed was extremely comfortable, and the roll-aways were the best I've ever seen - as comfortable as real beds. When we arrived, the shower stall door stuck a little and had to be pulled hard to open - it was fixed the next day without our even asking. We ate our breakfasts and two dinners at The Kitchen. The breakfast buffet was plentiful and varied - a good value. Dinner entrees ranged from okay to very good. The large pool with sand border (I wouldn't quite call it a beach) is beautiful, and the kids absolutely loved the water slide, which is as good as one you might find in a water park. We didn't find the rock soundtrack in the hotel's common areas to be overly loud or annoying, and the decor was surprisingly not cheesy. The convenience of being so near the Universal parks and City Walk was wonderful, as were the water taxis, which we took if one happened to be loading when we walked out. But the walk was so nice, and the landscaping of the grounds was so pretty, that we enjoyed walking even more. The main purpose of our visit was to see The Wizarding World of Harry Potter, and that's where staying on site really helped the most - we got into the park one hour before it opened to the general public. This was end of Oct/beginning of Nov, so crowds were much lighter than during the summer, but even so, by midday the lines were long. Both mornings that we entered the park early, we'd ridden Forbidden Journey twice and were nearly inside Olivander's by the time the crowds began to arrive. In addition, hotel room keys function as express passes for most other rides in both Islands of Adventure and Universal Studios (though not on Harry Potter rides), which was nice to have, though lines were not that bad during our visit. One more convenience: When you buy souvenirs in the Universal shops, you can have them delivered directly to your room. All in all, our stay at the Hard Rock Hotel was excellent. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “excellent adventure”
Reviews.Author: bayonnemom
Reviews.Content: staff and rooms were great...the hour early entry to wizarding world of harry potter was worth staying at this hotel...rooms were spacious for my family of 4...beds comfy! the only problem i had was being charged a fee for a roll-a-way that i returned after the first night, but the staff was happy to credit my account immediately...pool was nice...food was delic! would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: Mimi1999
Reviews.Content: Yes, this hotel costs quite a bit more than neighboring venues but it made our trip! The hotel was beautiful, the staff was always courteous and very helpful with any questions I had, and all of the rock memorabilia was fun to look over. One of the reasons we choose the Hard Rock over the other two Universal hotels was the pool and it was everything I had hoped for -- warm water, sand "beach", and prompt poolside service (the onion rings are amazing!). The rooms were plenty big for a family of four and the bathroom had two sinks (one inside with the tub and toilet and a larger one between the bedroom and the bathroom) which was a big bonus. The park was a very short walk and we never had to wait more than five minutes to ride the boat over to CityWalk. Granted, parking is not cheap (around $15 per day), but I am used to that with all the business travel that I do. The only thing I would say could use improvement was the wireless service. You do have to pay for wireless in the rooms (free in public areas), but the signal usually was too weak to be useful. You can confirm your flight and print your plane tickets for free in the business center so who really needs a computer anyway? I looked into staying across the street but really didn't want to bother with driving or taking a shuttle to the park when we could stay so close and have all the other benefits that onsite offers. As everyone mentions, the Express Pass for the park (your room key) is such a huge benefit. We went in October when the park was less crowed and really did just walk up to the rides without waiting. Unfortunately, for some of the rides I wanted a little bit more time to change my mind, but I was shown to my seat before I could chicken out! We did not take advantage of the early entry to the park, but I could see that being quite valuable in the busy seasons. Our main reason for going to Orlando was to visit the Wizarding World and it was fantastic! I would have loved to have more than the 2 1/2 days we spent in the park to explore and really take in all the little details that are everywhere to discover. Ollivanders was well worth the wait and make sure you take time to really appreciate Hogwarts and all the details that I noticed most people were racing past to get on the ride. One other thing that we really enjoyed about the Hard Rock was being able to go to the other Universal hotels and tying out their pools! The Hard Rock pool was open until 11 PM every night we were there so we had plenty of time to relax and enjoy it after walking around the park for so long. Overall, we were very pleased with the Hard Rock and have recommended it to our friends. We are looking forward to our return visit!

Reviews.Title: “We love this place!”
Reviews.Author: familytraveler38
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 have stayed at the HRH the past two summers, 2009 and 2010. The first time in 2009, was our first visit to Universal Studios Orlando, after having always been exclusively, devoted Disney followers. Although we find the hotel pricey, we thoroughly enjoy our stays here. The pool is our kids' favorite pool I think anywhere we've ever stayed, and there have been several amazing ones for them to pick from. I think what we love about the pool is it is appealing to both the kids and the adults. There is always daily pool games for the kids, and often bands that play in the evenings. The pool has a sand beach on one side and concrete on the other for those that don't want to deal with the sand. There is a great water slide, and volleyball court adjacent to the pool. The hotel is beautiful! It is big, but easy to navigate. We've ironically never eaten in the restaurants inside the hotel, but always use the poolside restaurant and Emack and Bolio's Ice Cream Parlor. Rooms are great- big, well decorated, nice bathroom, nice shampoos, and great individual packet capsule coffee maker. Beds really comfortable. We love all the rock memorabilia throughout the lobby and public spaces- there are tons of celebrity costumes and clothing- Kiss, Elton John, Elvis. Best part of the hotel? Hands down is the short walk to the two Universal Theme parks. That is why we originally stayed here and also why we came back and will be revisiting again this coming summer. Negatives- charge per day if you want a mini frig. The first time we stayed in 2009, it was complimentary- they sent one to our room free of charge when we requested it. This past year, there was a charge, and I want to say it was $25 for the stay. Instead I made room in the minibar and added a few things, even though the sign said not to disturb the items or you would be charged. Daily parking charges, which always get me angry at any hotel, though my husband says I need to just pipe down about that! :LOL! Positives- FOTL pass at the parks, the close walk, and the pool! We love this place and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at thus resort!”
Reviews.Author: Col62
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel. Service and facilities were excellent. The water taxis were brilliant; although this hotel is only a short walk away from the theme parks they were invaluable due to the Florida heat! The cocktails at the pool were good; a tip is to keep the souvenir glass and return with it and pay for a refill only. We dined only for breakfast at the Kitchen, this was lovely and buffet good value. Laundry facilities were really useful too. As other reviewers have commented, the express pass hotel keys were fantastic and we never had toi wait in line! We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “overrated overpriced”
Reviews.Author: nickbergh
Reviews.Content: average hotel don't phone home on the hotel phone. we paid $408 for 6 short phone calls to the uk.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: gibby2007
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this hotel. We got two adjoining pool view rooms for our family of five. Normally I wouldn't pay for the view of the pool but that is all they had left. We got The Hard Rock All access card and promptly forgot to use it, but could have saved at least 100 during the length of our stay (3 days). We did show it at check in and they tried to upgrade us to a King Suite but they were unable to find another room within close proximity for my kids so we didn't take it. There were laundry facilities on our floor ($2.75 for each) which we could have used to dry our clothes after getting soaked on some of the wetter rides. There is a clothesline in the bathroom, as well as small sinks within each WC and a vanity and sink area outside of each bathroom. This worked well for our family, but having two bathrooms was worth paying for two rooms. The lobby and pool are LOUD! My family enjoyed it but if you don't like loud music you may want to stay elsewhere. You cannot escape it within the hotel or at the pool. The kid activities at the pool were great for my 10 and 13 year old girls but my 14 year old son did not participate. He had a great time swimming and going down the slide. We ate at the Kitchen once for dinner. The food was good and the waiter was fabulous. He made my kids feel like celebrities. Homer and Bart Simpson were wandering around and went to each table and posed for pictures. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel. The Universal rep at the Hard Rock (next to the concierge) made us reservations for the breakfast at the Three Broomsticks . You can't make these reservations before you arrive and you must pay for them when you make them, Apparently there are only a few available because they are supposed to be part of a special Harry Potter package, but we didn't have any problem.. We had an 8:30 reservation and were able to ride several rides before we ate (wich was probably just as well for our stomachs!). The other days we ate cereal that I brought and supplemented with fruit and muffins from the small convenience area inside Emack and Bolios in the hotel. There was complimentary coffee in the rooms. The park was practically empty except for the WWOHP. We had no waits for any rides at IOA except the Harry ones and getting there at 8 am before the park officially opened meant that we encountered no waits there as well (except for Olivanders). Waits for the rides at US were longer but the express pass meant that we simply walked on. No waiting! It allowed us to go on whatever we wanted then allowed us to have several hours at the pool each day. Something we could not have done if we had to wait for each ride. The proximity of the hotel to the parks is great. We never waited for the boat. We took a rickshaw once (the kids loved this). We scheduled Mears transportation to take us from the airport to the hotel and back again. They offer a shuttle or a private SUV. The private was cheaper for 5 ($111.11). It was well worth it. We had a 4 hour delay in our arrival and they were there waiting for us when we arrived. The car was new and spotless. They were waiting for us on time for our departure as well.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: salemgirl1975
Reviews.Content: love this hotel. Your can walk to universal in 5 minutes which is great because there's always a pop up thunderstorm and you can be back at your hotel in 5 minutes or so without taking a boat. Very clean and the Kitchen Restaurant is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aitkens
Reviews.Content: Just back from a three week trip to Florida, where we stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel for the first week. The hotel is fab, it was a real treat from beginning to end. Here are a few tips: If you are planning to eat in the "Kitchen" then buy a Hard Rock all access card from the shop in reception. It costs $25 but they add $10 to it right away and it also gives you 10% of your bill in the restaurant, so it pays for itself within one family meal. The card will give you priority seating at any restaurant in Universal, room upgrades and late check out, if available, well worth it. Also if you are planning to drink at the pool, then get a souvenir glass and you save $4 on further drinks. The room card is a fast pass for most rides in Universal, which was a fantastic bonus, we never had to queue for a ride the whole week. We had the best time at the Hard Rock and cant wait to go back, the bill at the end of the week was not for the faint hearted though!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: MC-7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hard Rock for 5 nights and totally loved it. We booked a pool view room, and while it was very nice, I don't think it was necessarily worth the extra money. If you manage to get a special deal, then go for it, but the view wasn't great - in fact the window took up less than half the wall - even though the curtain covered the length of the entire wall (giving the impression when you first arrive that the window is huge). The room was a good size, with plenty of room, and 2 queen size beds. The bathroom was quite old and dated, but that's something we've found with a lot of US hotels... The service at check in was great and the concierge helped out with tickets to Universal Studios (bear in mind though, that you can't purchase tickets to any of the Disney parks there). Universal Studios was amazing, and the location of the Hard Rock to these parks is unbeatable. The shuttle boat was great, but it's only a 5 minute walk, if you don't time your arrival at the dock with the boat. The best thing about staying at the Hard Rock is the Fast/Express pass you have on 90% of the rides at the two parks. This saves so much time, it's difficult to calculate just how much. There were rides that had 100s of people in line, with a listed wait of 50 minutes, yet we were able to literally walk straight on without waiting at all - simply by showing our room cards. If you go with a family, it is definitely worth the extra money of staying at the Hard Rock, just for the feature of not having to wait. Although this fast access doesn't apply to the Harry Potter attractions, guests are allowed into the park at 8am, before the general public, so there's not much of a wait anyway - and even though we're not Harry Potter fans, it's worth the wait! The facilities at the Hard Rock are of an extremely high standard - the restaurants are fabulous, the pool was lovely and the service was great. Because we didn't waste time waiting in queues at the parks, we were able to spend a lot of time in the afternoons lazing by the pool, with a few drinks from the bar (you don't have to leave your lounge - the staff are constantly wandering around, asking if you want/need anything). The pool was great - music playing underwater, waterslide and movies played every night. Although there have been other comments about the lack of a 7/11 or convenience stores nearby, you can purchase small items from either the Hard Rock shop or the ice cream parlour downstairs - and the prices really aren't bad. The proximity to the restaurants and bars at the Universal area was also fantastic - so many choices and great options. And the atmosphere there was great - safe and fun for families of all ages. Also, be aware that if you don't have a hire car, it costs over $50 one way to the Disney parks, and you may have a loooong wait at the airport to get a taxi to the hotel. We arrived on a flight from Miami, which was only 35 minutes in duration, yet we waited for a taxi for an hour. We travel a lot, for both business and personal trips, and we've NEVER arrived at an airport where there isn't a mass of taxis waiting to collect passengers. There were only 10 people in the line in front of us, yet it took an hour for us to get a taxi - not good enough for a city that relies so heavily on tourism. The shuttle bus wasn't much better - 15 min wait to buy a ticket, with at least a 40 minute wait for an available bus. Overall, we loved our stay at the Hard Rock and would recommend it to people considering a trip, with a focus/preference on Universal over Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Rock Star treatment all the way!”
Reviews.Author: Chenzhan
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed for 5 nights while visiting the Wizarding World of Harry Potter and loved every minute. When we checked in I mentioned that we were there to celebrate my sister's 18th birthday, and the day after they brought up a slice of birthday cake with a candle, a card with birthday wishes and a voucher for an ice cream! She felt like a rock star. The hotel key cards worked as express passes in the Universal parks, which was great, and we also used them as credit cards which meant that we could leave wallets and cash at home. We loved it and will stay there again if visiting Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel was Beautiful, Staff brought the Image Down!”
Reviews.Author: Lunadiablo
Reviews.Content: We arrived for Holloween Horror Nights and the first thing that damaged the rep for what we paid for was we were advised by the Desk Person that check in was at 4pm and they would call us once it was ready. NEver Received that call because we went to the park and returned to the hotel the room had just been completed at 530 pm. There is a desk to the far left on check in and a set of flowers that block the view of the attendant they from customers and customers from him. We were also advised by the front desk person to go across the lobby and check in for our park tickets already purchased. We did go over and we were treated as though we were ignorant once we went over because the Desk personnel there spoke to us as though we were supposed to know we did not need to BOTHER them because we could have gotten our tickets from the poorly marked Kiosk. They either need to get rid of the personnel and mark the Kiosk or get personnel who are willing to Meet and Greet the Guest and give them personal attention. (POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE) We had to wait for service either because the Staff member was hiding or could not see. Once we checked into the room the carts were still in front of our room, it was completed but the beds were poorly made up, no soap in the bathroom, trash in the bathroom can, hair in the shower. (PAY ATTENTION to DETAIL). PILLOWS Way too Soft. Aside from this the room was very nice and was the hotel. We had cocktails by the bar and even though the gratuity is added into the bill we received very good service from our waitress. The music/Band was fair. Although we had no children with us there were many family oriented activities provided by the Hotel. The hotel was approximately 2 blocks walking distance from the Universal Theme Park and City Walk. Over all it was adequate but for the price paid for this one night it was DISAPPOINTING! It should be noted I have emailed the Hotel as soon as we returned and still have not had a Response.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay at Universal”
Reviews.Author: kiaussie
Reviews.Content: Could not find anything to complain about this hotel, and would definetly stay there again. Would also recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - awful beds...”
Reviews.Author: Tweetiepie99
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed here for 5 nights at the end of September and as much as I enjoyed staying at the hotel it isn't something that I would do again due to the cost. We booked the Hard Rock so we could have easy access to Universal/ IOA and as we got a 'good' deal @ £149 a night. While I understand that this is a good deal for this hotel, for the price I have stayed at much better hotels. To have to pay for parking and internet access on top of this - I have stayed at WAY better hotels. The reception and the pool areas of the hotel are lovely and being so close to the parks was great, being able to get a boat home at the end of the night way lovely. Being able to get in to IOA before others was great but at the time we went wasn't really needed (we didn't have to use or front of the line pass once as there were no ques anyway). My main issue with the hotel was the beds, it's been years since i've been at any US hotel and had such an uncomfortable mattress (and we go the US every year). It was a standard mattress, no pillow top, meaning that every time one of you moves - so does the other. So we got very little sleep while there which is a basic for me. So while the hotel looks lovely, for the price, I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Location. Great Fun.”
Reviews.Author: mkouzmine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my children and my parents. All of us really enjoyed the hotel as well as Universal. We'd been to Disney many times and were not expecting to enjoy Universal and the Universal on-site property was much, but were were more than pleasantly surprised. We had a blast. The Hard Rock hotel is fun and exciting and has a great vibe. The pool is fabulous and had a lot of activities going on to keep everyone entertained either by participating or watching. We stayed in a club room and felt it was really worth the money. Breakfast was adequate with a oatmeal, cold cereals, boiled eggs, pastries, fruit and yogurt. Evening snacks were also good and changed every night. And we took full advantage of the free evening drinks (costing only a tip!) The only downside to the lounge were some of the other patrons who showed up dressed in wet swimsuits at times and other times in their pajamas. They were the same offenders day after day. The Hard Rock is the easiest hotel on property to walk to the parks. It's a 10 minute walk for quick walkers and 15 minutes if you tend to stroll. The walk is along a nice bamboo lined path. Shuttle buses and boats are also available. We ate in The Palm and The Kitchen and had good meals at both.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: LVTravelbug80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel during a recent visit to Universal. My husband and I were traveling with our 13 and 16 yr old daughters, and was our second time at this hotel. The close proximity to the Universal Parks is a major advantage of this hotel! The on-site restaurants are very good, and the staff is friendly and anxious to help. We stayed on the Concierge level and enjoyed the afternoon happy hours - nice way to wind down after a day at the park, before getting ready for dinner. Note that there is free wifi available only in the lobby area (there is a fee for in-room use). We all had a fun and relaxing stay!

Reviews.Title: “We will remember this trip for a long time to come.”
Reviews.Author: Riri13
Reviews.Content: For the most part our experience was wonderful. We stayed on the Club floor and had access to the Club room which served breakfast, snacks, cocktails and a late night sweet. So most of the day you can find something to eat. It was well worth it, not only did it provide a meeting place for our group it also provided so quick snacks when you didn't want to spend a lot of time eating a big meal. The hotel was located within walking distance to Universal Studios park, which was our main reason for visiting. Everything was very convenient and accessible. The pool was lovely and the pool bar was very relaxing and convenient. My only complaint is that we are a family of 5 and had tried to get a suite and none were available on the club floor, that was fine but when we checked in we came to find that a smaller family in our group was given a larger room with a pull out couch and we were given a standard room where they then had to move chairs out and pull in a cot that they wanted to charge us for. I thought that was very poor planning or lack of planning on their part. When I asked for a larger room they said they were all full and offered to waive the cot fee...seriously...you shouldn't be charging for that anyway.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hard Rock!”
Reviews.Author: Dancer11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Kids Suite at the Hard Rock Hotel for a week this summer, and we loved everything about our stay. The room was perfect for our family of 4. Our girls loved not only having their own room, but not having to share a bed with each other (they each had a twin bed). They also loved the pool slide. While others have complained about noise, we didn't notice any noise. The location cannot be beat - a short 5 minute walk to Universal Studios and CityWalk. And having front of the line passes for Universal was awesome. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Club levels compared.”
Reviews.Author: familytravelor2010
Reviews.Content: My family has now stayed club level at all three on site hotels. Each year we stayed in October. FOOD: Club food at the Portifino was far and away better than the other two resorts. Club was well worth the price, with both breakfeast and 5:00 food being of high quality. Dinner was beef, chicken skewers, and antipastas. Late night sweats were actual desserts. We never had to eat anywhere else. Royal Pacific had a great breakfeast, but the nighttime food was questionable. Had creative looking asian "casseroles" that our kids wouldn't touch. Cookies and milk at night. Hard Rock had lower quality breakfeast, and nighttime food was little more than chicken wings, egg rolls, or chicken dumplings. Cookies and milk at night. Hard Rock was way overcrowded, and we always had to wait in line. CLUB LEVEL ROOM: Our favorite was the Royal Pacific. Was never crowded or loud, and we used it much like a living room. Wej ust hung out in there reading..internet surfing, or watching the big screen tvs. It was really an extention of your hotel room. Portifino's club room was large, but a litte sterile. Hard Rock's club room was way too small, always crowded, and music was too loud to do anything but eat.. CLUB LEVEL FLOOR: Royal Pacific and Hard Rock were about the same, and, well, Portifino didn't have one. At the Royal Pacific, it never seemed crowded, and you did feel like you were on a private floor. Hard Rock seemed to always be crowded and cramped. Also, noticed a lot of people walking around the floor that didn't seem to be staying on the floor. Overall, Royal Pacific had the best club level experience. If we stayed at the Portifino again, we would pay the extra money for the club level. With the Hard Rock, we thought we wasted our money on the club level, and would have been better off stopping a Wal-greens and stocking our room with pop tarts, chips, and Coke.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in perfect location for Universal Studios - awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Kevinonvacation
Reviews.Content: Excellent room and services. Enjoyed the early access to Universal as well as getting to the front of the line at most Universal rides - can't fault it! Thanks for a super stay!

Reviews.Title: “Rock on at the Hard Rock!!”
Reviews.Author: diannefmelbourne
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out the service was fantastic! Arrived at 2am after delayed flights and the check in was a breeze. After calling ahead and notifing the hotel of our delay they had arranged to have our keycards printed and everything else organized to make it as quick as possible. The family room had a large queen size bed and another room with twin beds. 2 bathrooms which was handy,although only one toilet which was an inconvience at times as it was also in the teenagers bathroom! The location to the parks was fantastic either by walking through the beautiful gardens or taking the boat shuttle to drop you off at the doorstep. Used the keycards to access the express lines which was well worth it and of course to access Harry Potter at 8am before the park is open to the public. Spent time in the hotel pool which was fabulous and ate in the restaurants,a little pricey but what you would expect from a hotel like this. An unexpected bonus was the coin laundry which of course saved us money and the small convience store onsite where you could buy breakfast goodies,icecreams or drinks etc. Money saving for a family. We would certainly stay at another Hard Rock Hotel if it was as good as this one!!

Reviews.Title: “Rock music oozing from every corner but totally relaxed!”
Reviews.Author: PeteMoLuce
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and 22 year old daughter stayed here for 10days and enjoyed every minute of it. Theres rock music everywhere from the lift to the loos and rock memorabilia from Jimi Hendricks to Elton John. The room was very roomy, stylish and clean. We had fresh tea/coffee daily which is unusual for hotels in America at no extra cost. The hotel is not the cheapest but worth every penny. Also 'cause your staying at the Hard Rock you get to beat the queues at both Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure with Express entry. Would definitely stay here again. Also good time of year to come longes wait for ay ride here or Disney was 20mins.

Reviews.Title: “Lively fun resort hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmandaJaneC69
Reviews.Content: If you like a lively hotel close to the Universal Parks then this is for you. The pool is open until Midnight or 2am every night with "Dive In" movies, and underwater music!! A few nights a week there is loud rock and roll music played by the pool, so if your after somewhere quiet at the end of the day, then go elsewhere. The rooms are not massive and are expensive for what you can get in Orlando, but for convenience for the Universal parks it cannot be beaten. Your room key acts as a fast pass all day everyday as well so that does save you some money as well. Check out the overnight car parking charges as they are very steep. A good variety of restuarants but nothing is cheap. A great meal can be had at The Palm, but this is very very expensive (compared with other Orlando restuarants), so great for a special occasion. I would recommend this hotel is you like fun, and don't expect to sit next to a quiet pool!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: KJ85
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days in the Hard Rock Hotel and loved it. The rooms were beautiful and spacious. The hotel is within easy walking distance to Universal Studios and City Walk. Staying in the hotel also came with the bonus of a queue jump to alot of the busier rides. Overall I loved my stay here and would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at the Hard Rock in order to...”
Reviews.Author: cta4ever
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock in order to zoom through the Universal rides. What a mistake. The room was no more special than any Holiday Inn, except for some stereo equipment in the room. The view from our fourth floor room was that of a roof. The pool was large and clean and was the bright spot. The boat to the park was of no help for my wife, who needs assistance walking, as they would not allow the wheelchair on board. Finally, Harry Potter was spectactular. However, the price to enter the parks was ridiculous. One day is more than enough for both parks with the fast pass option. My advice, stay at a much cheaper hotel in Orlando, visit the Universal parks (one day if you have been there before and two days if you are a newbie) and buy the fast pass option in the park. The money and time you save will get you to other parks including Disney and Seaworld.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean and Rocking”
Reviews.Author: MikeAndSheila
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock at Universal Studios in Orlando, Florida is a great place to stay while enjoying the Universal Theme Parks. The Hotel is clean, modern and sleek. The staff is ready and happy to help with any requests. The food is great at the Kitchen, get the buffet it’s worth it. The Palm is very expensive but they do run special deals (I had filet mignon and lobster tails with salad, desert and coffee for $49) it is a more upscale restaurant but makes a night out a bit special and the Beach Club by the pool has really good food. Its the closest hotel to the Theme Parks and Citywalk. Its a nice walk through a topical paradise path. By staying at a Universal property hotel you get into the park an hour before it opens (take advantage of that perk), packages and photos delivered to your room and the overall convenience of having everything within walking distance. Only down side is that the pool is shallow and no more than 4ft deep. but its still a really nice pool and the music is great too.

Reviews.Title: “great time at the hard rock”
Reviews.Author: bennie1970
Reviews.Content: it was the third time ive stayed there in 3 years.there must be a reason i keep going back. we have such a great time there every time.i love the distance from the park.easy drive to international drive to go to diffrent places to eat and shop. the only complaint i have year after year is why they charge so much to park your vehicle..they charged me 210.00 a night and then wanted 28 dollars to park on top of that per day..come on hard rock work with me...

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: flowrida
Reviews.Content: We've now stayed at all three Universal hotels and we have to say this is our favourite. From the moment we arrived until the day we left we have only high praise for all members of staff. The hotel itself was amazing. Very impressive lobby and very pleasant and efficient front desk. Our rooms (3) were very impressive - large extremely comfortable beds with great view of the pool and the rides of the park beyond. A nice touch was two sink areas - one closed in with the bath/shower. Excellent pool and sunbathing area. The Kitchen was very enjoyable with great food and equally great server (David - very tall very talkative and great people skills). On Friday at 4pm they have a tasting in the main lobby of one of the offerings in the Kitchen so you can "try before you buy" - what a nice treat, we had one of the nicest Mac & Cheese ever! We hope that we'll be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Amenities but skip the so called "Club Level"”
Reviews.Author: GAFamilyUNC
Reviews.Content: We had previously stayed on the Club Level (7th Floor) and had a great experience so we were really excited to go back. The club level offers breakfast, afternoon snacks and cookies and milk for every day. We stayed for 5 nights in September and had a less than satisfactory experience this time. We stayed on the Club Level and we were not impressed with the qualify of the club level service. Breakfast and evening activities were overcrowded and numerous guests that did not belong in the room were eating and drinking for free. I know that this is the case because I spoke to a couple in the elevator who followed me in and said they were not on the 7th floor and wanted to see how to get up to the level for the service. They showed up for several activities. Also one night we showed up at 9:05 for cookies and milk and there were only four cookies with nuts left! They did not even have any more cookies when service was supposed to be completed at 9:30. Also two nights, turn down service had not been completed by 9:15. The maids said that they have until 10 pm to finish the floor. We have two children and that is too late to have maid service coming into your room when you are trying to get children to sleep. It was very disappointing that we paid for a "club level" room but we did not get any special treatment and those that did not pay were enjoying the same service for free!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel heaven”
Reviews.Author: j1lloyd
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Hard Rock Orlando & if possible it was even better than the first. The hotel itself is stunning, immaculate & contains something for everyone - young & old, the music piping throughout all common areas adds a modern yet unintrusive touch. The staff could not have been more accomadating & friendly, from the bar staff to the cleaners passing in the corridors at all times of the day. Checking in & out was particularly straight forward, as was getting taxis from the front of the hotel. The rooms were cleans, spacious & comfortable. The location in relation to the parks & City Walk along with the free express passes are undoubtable perks to staying here & add to the already incredible holiday experience.

Reviews.Title: “This "First Class" Hotel has No Class"-worst travel experience in years”
Reviews.Author: 1951traveler
Reviews.Content: Our flight on Southwest was the best part of our trip! When we got to Orlando Airport it took two hours for Mears Transportation to pick us up- AND that's with a RESERVATION based on our Arrival time which was early!! If you book a Mears Shuttle (which was recommended by the hotel (can anyone say greased palms)- be sure to look at what time you get to the shuttle stand. Make sure they write the correct time on your ticket. They pushed our time up 10 minutes and then we had to wait another 1.5 hours for another shuttle-when there were two there when we arrived. Don't stay at any of the Lowe's hotels at Universal Orlando unless you plan to take advantage of the Express admission and the early admission to the park for the Harry Potter Ride. You are just paying about $60 more per nite to be treated like dirt if you aren't a celeb or here with a special group that means moolaa to the hotel. The concierge supposedly booked a special dinner reservation for us at a dinner theatre and made a special point to tell us we had to pre-pay and it was non-refundable. When we asked if we needed to come down especially early for a cab she assured us there were always cabs out front. So our big nite arrives and guess what. First, no cabs. Then this loud mouth jerk yells that he needs a cab and presto-One suddenly appears and they usher him into it - even though we were here first. So about 20 minutes later a cab shows up and the driver is complaining because there is a parade of cabs headed to Hard Rock - "all for you" he says in his middle eastern accent. We go to the window - still relatively calm - with 20 minutes to spare before the show starts and guess what--they have no record of our reservation or payment!! So we call Hard Rock and they talk to the consierge desk and our reservation miraculously appears- however our last name is misspelled and there are two dinner shows- which the people at Hard Rock didn't bother to tell us- so we had no idea what we were looking for. Fortunately OUR show didn't start til 8pm instead of 7:30 so we finally got to go in. After the show- of course no cab- so we call Hard Rock and the girl that answers sounds totally clueless when I ask her if she can help us get a cab back to the hotel- she connects me to the Cab company line. I wouldn't stay at a Hard Rock Hotel property again if they paid ME! This place doesn't know the meaning of customer service - at least for regular folks.

Reviews.Title: “First, and not last, Universal stay”
Reviews.Author: HawgGnarly
Reviews.Content: This is my first tripadvisor review. I've gone to Orlando many times, but we'd never stayed on Universal property. We hit some of the moderate and values at WDW, and usually stay in a Hampton or similar. This hotel was awesome. We got a great deal right after the free Superbowl tickets were announced. So good, that even though our plans changed, it was cheaper to eat our first night at the Hard Rock than redo the ressie (It was aroudn $160 a night). It took them a while to find the ressie, since we were there a day late, but I had called ahead. The lobby is very opulant, and the music isn't intrusive, which seems to concern a lot of folks. The room was great. Clean, pretty big, and it had a sofa for our son to sleep on. It was also my first exposure to Keurig coffee makers, and led me to buy one a few months later. The best in-room coffee I've ever had. We shoved a few things into the mini-bar, which was against the rules, but oh well. the beds were very comfy, and the theme was great in general. We would laugh everytime we passed the N-Sync outfits in the Hard Rock Hotel. The pool is very large, with a great, long slide. Walk to the Studios park is only about 5 minutes. It would be about 1 if you could walk out the back of the pool area. There isn't much of an arcade, food options, or convenience store like the Disney resorts have with their food courts. Our only compliant was how the people that unload your bags just take them about 20 feet to bell services, who then deliver them to your room. So, you have two people to tip. Parking is another negative, you just have to figure it in to the room price for comparing.

Reviews.Title: “Universal on site hotel shows Disney how to do it”
Reviews.Author: siforest65
Reviews.Content: had 2 seperate 1 night stays and this was the highlight of the holiday. Front of line access to Universal and IOA attractions is the icing on the cake. All staff are very friendly and efficient throughout the hotel and the feel of the place is comfortable and relaxing. In my opinion on-site guests are treated here far better than Disney treat their on site guests. Would recommend this hotel for anyone who loves their rock music. Also, the kitchen is a top notch eatery

Reviews.Title: “If you don't want to spend money - stay at Motel 6 !!”
Reviews.Author: ArtimusG
Reviews.Content: Don't know why some reviewers complain about the prices. Orlando is a vacation destination and there are many discount hotels and restaurants available. Stay there and stop complaining! Stay at Motel 6 and eat at Shoney's every day and you will save plenty of money. I'm not rich, but I budgeted for a financial kick in the gut on this trip and do not regret a single dime I spent. Stayed over Labor Day weekend at the Hard Rock with my wife and 11 y/o son and loved it. The perks were great (early park entry, water taxi, free fast-pass). We upgraded to the club level (+$75 a night...was told that it is usually +$100 per night). Well worth it as we took advantage of the breakfast, snacks, drinks, and sweets. The room was super clean and well appointed. The pool was fun and very relaxing after a long day at the parks. We did the valet parking - it was more expensive, but I'm on VACATION! Check in/out was a breeze, staff was helpful and friendly. Our remote control died and I mentioned it to a housekeeping staff in the hallway as we were leaving to the parks - she got on her walkie-talkie right there and got maintenance to take care of it. We did the luau at the Royal Pacific resort and it was a good deal. The food and drinks were good and the entertainment was as well. We went to see Blue Man Group and it was a blast! I would recommend this hotel without hesitation and will likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Les enfants adorent”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsRolie
Reviews.Content: Expensive for Orlando, but the kids loved the concept ("cool!!!") and the swimming pool. Early access to Harry Potter and Express Acess on almost all rides in Universal theme parks was great.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock, really Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Luisa13
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to start, this has been the best vacation that we had in the last 6 months. Check in, fast and efficiently Bell Boy, really helpful (hats off to you Chris you really rock) We choose to stay in the club level and it was very well worth it. Not pool vie but our room had vie to the parks. (Ama you really put yourself out there, Hats off to you too). Service in this hotel is one of the best, including room service food really good Location, 5 minutes walking distance from both parks and city walk Rooms, very spacious with separate sink from toilet and shower, coffee maker, mini bar, radio, mp3 player, flat HDTV, two queen sizes beds, soft pillows, bathrobe... Housekeeper, if this good luck or what? Fabiana our housekeeper treat us like royalties, our room was very very well kept and clean, not a sign of dust, in the bathroom everything was extremely clean, carpet, mirrors, sheets, everything clean and very well done. Pool really cool my daughter enjoy the slide and the water was really warm Arcade, small but with enough games to play Live Concert, really loud and inviting music, we really enjoy the live band. Music in the hotel is really awesome The food at the Kitchen and The Palm was really good, and with fair prices too. (the lobster at The Palm really tasty and cook to perfection). Ice cream parlour, (I can remember the name) have a good variety of flavours and yogurts too. All kind of bagels and snacks for the children Rent car service, right in the lobby and with good service as well. Laundry area, really small for the size of the hotel, expensive yes, but the machines works really good. And to finish I love the security in the club level, after 11:00 pm the floor manager and the security guard where always attentive and very friendly, even though we knew they were there for obvious reasons. So if you want to feel like you are a king or queen, visit this hotel, you will really enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't feel like a Rock Star that's for sure!”
Reviews.Author: Gunth
Reviews.Content: Very Very disapointed in this hotel. For $300 a night you would expect some service. Our room wasn't ready so we stayed at the park till 8pm then waited at the front door with our luggage for 10 min with no help so I loaded the cart myself and parked the car. Got back to the door and the bell hop was kind enough to unload the cart at the door and tell my wife that its a service they perform when they are ready. We lugged our luggage up to the 6th floor by hand they wouldn't let us use the cart. Same as the other onsite hotels, the gym is $10 per person, $15 self parking, internet is a charge per night, the entire pool is shallow. Nice coffee machine though and room is similar to a $100 Hampton stay. Not worth the money and the service and service charges make this a bad value. The only good thing is the front of line at the parks for staying on site. For 3 people 1 night stay and 2 days at Universal it was half the price of staying onsite at WDW with free dining.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience at the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: jrman66
Reviews.Content: So much has been written about this hotel, so I will try to add some value. I have stayed at all 3 Universal properties and the hard rock is by far the best for: - Kids (non-stop activities at the pool, well into the night) - Location to the parks (you can walk) - Nightlife (the beach club bar was always happening at night) - Pool food (the food at the beach club was amazing; especially the salads) - Staff (everyone here is so happy and seem to love their jobs) The best hotel for room size is the Portofino. The best hotel for elegance and quiet is the Portofino. The best hotel for the club room is the Portofino. Our room on the club floor was large enough for 3 people but may be a little crowded for 4; especially if you are staying more than 5 days. The club room was lots of fun but it is too small for the number of guests. The food at night was average at best, but the staff loved to pour you lots of drinks and seemed to have fun doing their job. Unlike the portofino, happy hour is not going to give you enough variety in the area of food to serve as your dinner. If you are looking for elegance, this is not the hotel for you. If you want to have a rocking time with your family and friends, this is definitely a place you want to spend your time. who needs the parks when a hotel is this much fun!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: mj_chan
Reviews.Content: Hard to add to what all the other reviews say, but I will hit on the high points: Breakfast buffet is to die for, if pricey; Pool was awesome with live music, sand beach area with awesome and attentive staff; Parking was meh, pricey and the design of the lots in relationship to the hotel not the smartest; Access to Universal was excellent and the price of the room made worth it for the fast pass; Rooms were average for a hotel of this class; I think they try hard to train the staff to treat you "Like a Rock Star", and for most of the staff it works.

Reviews.Title: “We Miss the Hard Rock Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joalexajeff
Reviews.Content: Everything about our vacation to the HRH was terrific. The hotel was running a promotion so we booked Club level rooms with a terrific pool view. Unlimited bottled water and soda all day, breakfast, dinner and desserts plus beer and wine...made it a great deal for our family of 8. Grabbing bottled water and soda before heading to the parks and pool saved lots of money. The staff at the hotel couldn't do enough for us! The walk to the theme parks is 5 minutes and the express passes made our vacation....no waiting in any lines except for Forbidden Journey and Rip Ride Rocket. The hotel itself is amazingly themed and we are still singing rock songs a week after getting home. Pool area is outstanding with lots to do every night...there is a DJ, contests, movies...food was pricey so the club level really came in handy. Loved the Kitchen breakfast buffet, too! We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PKWGMichigan
Reviews.Content: We just got back two days ago....location can't be beat. Service outstanding, Our rooms were cleaned by the time we returned mid afternoon every day. Only issue we had with housekeeping was the coffee cups were not restocked fully most days...no biggy. Wish we would have done club level as with 5 children, the cost difference would have paid for itself in soda/snacks alone! Pool is just great...kids ages 7-12 had a blast there. Ate dinner at the kitchen one night...personally found it too salty, kids loved the buffet...Ate the breakfast buffet one day and we tried to completely chow to see us thru lunch since breakfast so pricey...didn't think the ala carte breakfast was priced to badly though. Kids loved the milkshakes at Emack's....and at $5.50 thought it was a way better deal than $4 for a coke at pool bar. They go all out for kids at the pool, very family oriented. We found the beds uncomfortable and the walls rather thin, however we were not disturbed by others in the middle of the night or anything...Only issue on cleanliness was I did find the bathroom doors in need of a good scrub, the dirt on edges of door kind of grossed me out....however floors, sinks, tubs etc were spotless. Would recommend to anyone however we were there on the pay for 4 get 3 nights free, so not sure I would be as happy paying $355 a night compared to $160. We found the hour early entry to not be worth it as it's only for Harry P and we found the crowds/lines way less at 5pm-7pm....so we did early entry once lined up at gates at 7:45 am and saw the difference at 5pm and did not do early entry again. Found Universal Studios to be nearly empty, most of the week fast pass got us in everything it works on within 5 min. We used the free shuttle to sea world and found it to be a drag, took cabs back for $20. Used cabs for wet/wild too as didn't know how long we'd want to stay and it was only about $7 each way. Hotel said Wet/Wild was only a mile and we could walk however very glad we didn't do that, busy road, no shade, looked brutal.
