Always pool games going on for all, and they try to get all involved. Great place to hang out after a long day out at the parks, as the pool stays open till late in the evening. I wanted a stress free vacation so this was absolutely perfect! Each day we visited a park, by early afternoon we headed to the pool to relax and we either ate by the pool or took a walk over to City Walk to find a place. Only complaint would be that the bathrooms are very small(we were on the 5th floor which has the most standard rooms) and do need to be updated, happy it was only 2 of us in the room. Do recommend asking for a room close to the elevators. Overall, we were highly satisfied with our vacation and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beats Disney for Service”
Reviews.Author: JoanneT
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family suite for 5 days in August. Service was excellent at this hotel, from the moment that we arrived. We were greated promptly by valet parking and our car and cases were taken straight away. Yes - you are charged extra to even park but this is well advertised on the hotel's website. We were checked in straight away and our cases arrived in our room 5 minutes later. The family suite was superb and my children aged 14 and 10 benefitted in having their own room. We dined in the Kitchen every morning for breakfast, which was an excellent buffet - I have read people moaning about the $16 dollar per head price, half price for children - this is a 5 star hotel - what do you expect. We also dined in the Kitchen one evening, which served a great filet mignon with excellent service. Having front of line assess was brilliant and meant that we could manage the parks in a morning with the afternoon free to relax. Also the quick water taxi service to Citywalk was brilliant in the evenings with plents of restaurant choices. My children think this is the best hotel they have been to in Orlando and can't wait to return. For the last part of our holiday we stayed in the Animal Kingdom Lodge - Hard Rock beats it hands down for quality of rooms and service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: squegee
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I decided for our 16th wedding anniversary we would go to Universal, since we had not been in 2 years. We live in Northwest FL so we were able to get a great rate on the room .......139.00 a night. We have stayed at the Portofino and loved it! But this time we wanted to try The Hard Rock Hotel. WE LOVED IT!!!!! All we could keep saying throughout the stay was that we would definitely be back! The pool is Wonderful and yes it is not deep (deepest part is 4 feet) but for relaxing in the cool water and sliding down the Great slide it is PERFECT! You don't need towels, they give them to you at the pool. We are in our late 30's and had a blast at this hotel. We stayed for 5 nights from 09/28/08 thru 10/03/08 and the weather was great. We walked to Universal everyday and rode the boat back to the Hotel. We went to Universal Studios,Islands of Adventure, walked around City Walk and went to see a movie. Happy Hour at Margaritaville at City Walk was from 3 to 5 pm and they had 1/2 price beer and house margarita's (which are fantastic), we stopped by each day!!!! We went to the Universal Halloween Horror nights and had a lot of fun!!! If you are easily scared this is not for you... But if you enjoy watching others get scared to the point of running and screaming this is for you!! Ha ha ha The staff was helpful the entire stay and extremely nice....which I would expect. The Room was not noisy at all, in fact we heard nothing the entire stay. There is music playing in all 6 elevators and in the most public areas. But what do you expect...... it's the Hard Rock Hotel... we liked the music. The Elevators......great elevators....6 to choose from and they are FAST, you never have to wait more than 10 seconds and it's there for you. Free WIFI only in the huge Lobby Living Room if you need it. Food is really good at The Kitchen....average prices not too far over the top. Food and drinks at the pool are really good too!!! Try the Nachos!!!! I could go on for days......... If you can get a great price, stay for a long time.... You will have sooooo much fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: WillowBlackpool
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights at the Hard Rock last month, my third time at the hotel and we were really looking forward to it. Reception which in the past has been a hassle was very smooth. The hotel was empty but there were no upgrades on offer despite us having stayed there before. We had an issue with bogus calls from someone claiming to be an employee of the Hard Rock wanting to re confirm credit card details. The duty manager advised this had never happended before and not to worry, but worry you do, someone knew my name not just poicked a random room number. I requested security check this out but they did not seem interested and I heard nothing back from them despite them saying all Hard Rock management would be updated. Interest in guests, not impressed. I also had an argument with a receptionist over car parking charges, I dont agree with these add on charges but paid for four full days, I was told that when I left on the last day that was it, after an argument with a rude Julio they agreed to let me use the car park. You just dont need these issues when on vacation. I dont think we will return despite liking the hotel. I just cannot get over how little the staff thought about us.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for a few nights.”
Reviews.Author: sueandbaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock at the end of August - for one night - primarily to get the fast passes included on the room key - and because my teenage son is a music freak! We arrived on the day that Tropical Storm Fay did - so unfortunately the pool was closed (though we took advantage of the late check out the following day and the kids spent a couple of hours in it). The service was generally good, although we had some confusion about what was included in the hotel cost by way of breakfast - and it cost us more than we thought, and we had a concierge that gave us a bum steer about the water taxis.... but apart from that it was fine. The room was clean and of an adequate size for 4 of us and we were upgraded to a pool view when we arrived which was nice. The kids loved the 'coolness' of the place and all the rock memorabilia - in fact we topped that off by eating at the worlds largest Hard Rock Cafe whilst we were there. For my part I think more than a couple of nights would have done my head in - but it was a great nights stay and met all our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Good for staying with children”
Reviews.Author: ksor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in the end of September. Our flight was delayed, so we arrived at 2am at night, and asked for a room close so we didn't have to walk so far. Got a room as far away as possible, had to walk 3 looong corridors with our suitcases. The room was nice, great with the sink between the bathroom and bedroom. Two big beds. Very nice poolarea, (but the water was very shallow), and loved the hotel interior. A nice short walk to Universal / Islands of Adventure / City Walk, or you can take the boat. I was travelling with my son, and he loved the hotel. It was quite expensive, but ok for 3 days in our lives.

Reviews.Title: “Oh . . . My . . . God . . .”
Reviews.Author: Andeh
Reviews.Content: . . . BEST HOTEL EVER! Both my Girlfriend and I are rock fan's and we can safely say that this is one of the nicest hotels we've ever stayed at! Firstly as soon as we arrived a valet opened the bus door and helped us out of there with our cases. Then we were given a ticket and told that our luggage would meet us in our room once we were checked in. We stayed in Club 7 and took full advantage of the free snacks/drinks /alcohol and breakfast, which was all top notch. They also provided free DVD rental to 7th Floor guests which was an added bonus when you just wanted to unwind in the room and chill out! After swimming around in the pool for a while listening to a poolside battle of the bands we decided we wanted to go and grab some food. We decided to walk up to CityWalk and see what the distance was like and wether it was worthwhile getting the free Water Taxi or not. Turns out it's about a 3 minute walk from the pool to the Universal Globe and Gates. We dined at the worlds largest Hard Rock Café which was incredible food and incredible Memorabilia, then made our way back to our room for our first nights sleep. When we got to our room we had a little present on the bedside table in the shape of Bouncy Balls with Smiley Faces on them! And every night from then on we got different little gifts (i.e. Hard Rock Fridge Magnets, Yoyo's, Luggage ID Tags etc.) :-D Coffee machine in the room was fantastic and the coffee/tea choices were quite varied. We didn't use the mini bar (as we've been caught out by that a few times before) but did have a look at the price list and it was fairly reasonable by mini bar standards! The only downer on this holiday was that we went in the 2 quietest weeks of the season (4th Sept - 19th Sept) and the pool was closed for 6/7 days as they had to drain it and do some work on the filtering as they weren't busy! Not that this really mattered as they offered up the use of any of the other Universal Resort pools which was a nice experience to go and see what the other hotels were like...Personally i think we chose the right one! But anyway in a 2 week break we were pretty filled up with things to do, places to see and Mice to meet. So the pool wasn't that important in the grand scheme of things. Another fact that i loved about staying in a universal resort was discounted entry to Universal and the fact that your roomkey lets you bypass all of the lines in the parks! The longest we waited in a Universal queue was a few minutes for 1 of the shows to start!...Not counting when we were barracaded into the Duelling Dragons castle whilst a huge 20/30 minute thunderstorm (Courtesy of Hurricaine Ike) passed over us! Needless to say the ride staff were most accomodating and friendly whilst we were all stuck in the queue line waiting for the ride to re-open. 1 WORD OF WARNING FOR JACUZZI FANS - The Jacuzzi's in the Lowe's hotels are maintained at 104 degrees Faranheit and the first time you get in one it's quite a shock to the system!!! All in all I would rate the holiday as a 10/10 and the Hotel and a 9.75/10 they lose 0.25 only because the pool had to close! Don't just sit there and read this...BOOK YOURSELF IN NOW!!!:-D

Reviews.Title: “too expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: CC7Bern
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at the Hard Rock from Sept. 5-7. We had booked a garden view room. As we were travelling from Europe we had 4 suitases with us. The woman at the reception desk didn't call a bell boy or offer us any help whatsoever upon check in, ignoring the luggage and showing us with her finger the way to the elevators. We struggled to get to our room. First thing I noticed was the musty smell. Wanted to open the windows to let some fresh air in and ....the window wouldn't open, because it isn't really a window. More like a glass panel. I considered calling reception and ask if they could switch us to another room, but it was pretty late and we were tired from our drive from Miami. Besides, we were only staying there 2 nights and our main purpose was to visit the parks, not staying in. The room was ok, but the whole decor was a little tired. The bathroom was quite small for US standars. We booked the room with breakfast buffet included for practical reasons, and it was pretty good if you don't take into consideration the dirty water they call coffee, or the fact that there was no cheese platter. Actually, the only thing with cheese they had on the buffet turned out to be a kind of pastry, another sweet treat. 2 days before leaving home, I received an e-mail informing me the pool would be unavailable for the duration of our stay since they'd be doing work on it and the surrounding bar. One of the main attractions for me to book at the Hard Rock was the sound system in the pool.... They did offer free shuttle to the other two hotels in the park to visit their pools, but if you are tired from your day in the parks and want to just chill for 30 min, you don't feel like taking a bus and drive to another hotel. Same story upon check out, we had to carry our own suitcases (I had gone to check out 15 minutes earlier having left the luggage in the room). Neither somebody helped us when my husband was loading the suitcases and bags into the trunk of our car, even though there were 3 bell boys standing there, chatting. We were dissapointed with the customer service at this hotel and we'll definitely stay in one of the other 2 hotels next time we visit the parks. Maybe the story would have been different had we stayed at the Club Level rooms.

Reviews.Title: “always have fun at the hard rock”
Reviews.Author: calkid
Reviews.Content: Our stay was in July, with two 19 year old boys, so of course we booked the room with breakfast buffet, which was great. We have stayed at the hard rock 3 other times over the years and although there has not been much updating going on, the hotel is still in good shape and rooms are comfortable. You stay at this hotel to have a good time and so do others. Because of that, there will be loud folks in the halls/outside but all in all, the bother is of short duration and happens at many other hotels as well. The pool area is still one of the best in Orlando and I was able to access free internet pool-side. The staff are very helpful and hard working. An exhibit of Princess Diana's dresses was onsite when we stayed and we were given free passes when we checked in. The exhibit was magical and gave a glimpse into this woman's life. Location and speed-passes are a plus but all in all, the music, the fun and the spirit, is why we stay at the hard rock. Thanks again for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: minniemoo
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed in the Royal Pacific Resort, we thought that it would be a nice change to try the Hard Rock. This was not a wise choice on my part. I cant say that there was anything I liked about this hotel. I know that the clue is in the name but when you cant escape the noise anywhere in the hotel except the bedrooms it becomes very annoying. Unlike the Royal Pacific, where at least you can have a quick service breakfast in peaceful comfortable surroundings, at the Hard Rock there is nowhere to go except the noisy ice cream parlour. We all hated this. If this wasnt bad enough, when we got to our pool view room, all we had a view of were the trees, a drainpipe and a spot of blue in the distance. The bathroom had not been cleaned properly either. There was hair and paper on the floor and the grouting on some of the tiles was black. Added to this the furniture was chipped heavily. The corridors were full of linen carts, day and night and there were several occasions where trash was left outside rooms and was still there next morning. Even the carpet was frayed and lifting in our corridor. We were disappointed with the pool too. It was no deeper than 3'6", so we couldnt swim. There is no way I would call this hotel luxury and for wouldnt dream of ever staying here again. We stayed in 3 hotels during our stay in Orlando and this was the only one that let us down. I would never ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It Rocked!”
Reviews.Author: gaila88
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel as a treat for our 15 year old son - and we rather liked the idea of staying in a cool rock place too! Tropical Storm Fay had just passed by so the weather wasn't great although the day we arrived there was a large screen in the lobby showing Red Hot Chilli Peppers in concert and also an area with soem poolside games to keep people entertained. We arrived at lunchtime, checked in and then went to the park while we waited for our room. We were able to use our room keycard as a fast pass and got to walk on and off most of the rides. Last trip we didn't even get close to the big rides due to the length of the queues. The walk to the parks is very pleasant, not too far and there are rickshaw rides for the way back if required. The room was spotless, and had lots of extras like an mp3 system, widescreen TV and my favourite a fancy coffee maker. There were some strange hazlenut coffee capsules on the tray when we arrived which were quickly swapped for regular coffee when I spoke to housekeeping. Apparently they had recently changed to the hazlenut ones but most guests preferred the regular ones(???) The beds were very comfortable and the air con almost silent. Towels and toiletries were luxurious and plentiful. I would have preferred not to have the tubular cushions on the bed as my youngest found them to be great jousting tools! They had to be hidden in the wardrobe most of the time. Unfortunately we had quite a lot of rain in the evenings so didn't get to experience the poolside entertainment. We ate twice in The Kitchen which was extremely good. I had spicy chicken salad one night which came in a collander! It was delicious. My husband who was carrying out a study in steak - he ate so many during the trip said his Rib Eye was one of the best he had had. The waitor was the same both times and was fantastic. He was funny, polite and a great ambassador for the hotel. We also took advantage of the kids Club (L'il Camp Rock) so our 5 year old could play with other kids. It was very quiet and there were only four kids there but he had a great time. The staff were very pleasant and made sure he got to try out a variation of activities. At $15 an hour it wasn't cheap but by then we needed some time to enjoy a meal on our own. One evening we sat and listened to a local band in the lobby as it was too wet outdoors. They were very good and our 15 year old bought their CD, getting it signed by the band. We love rock music and I particularly loved having what I would call decent music everywhere I went. I spent a long time just wandering around the hotel looking at all the photos and memorabilia. I loved having Starbucks coffee available so I could enjoy a dolce latte on an evening. The Velvet Sessions bar was very luxurious. We didn't actually sit in there but went in for drinks and then sat out in the lobby. It was easy to imagine being some big rock star in there. The pool - what we saw of it, was perfect for young families. Both my sons enjoyed it. My youngest was able to play in the whole pool without a life vest as he could touch the bottom at all times. On the last day they had poolside games and everyone joined in. The music playing throughout is not too loud but at a pleasant level ( not loud enough for my 15 year old though!) Every member of staff we encountered was polite and very helpful. One morning I had problems connecting my i pod touch to the free wireless in the lobby. A member of staff helped me to do this immediately. In all we had a wonderful stay and wished it had been longer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Jabawokee
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to the hotel, my first impressions were good having been checked in by super friendly staff. The rooms are a good size, although the bath was very small, infact my shower tray at home is bigger! The pool was excellent and the kitchen restaurant was fantastic often providing free character meals in the evening which you would ordinarily have to pay for in the parks. The breakfast was especially good in the kitchen. The fast pass that automatically comes wth your room key proved invaluable at the parks allowing the whole family to by- pass queues that were sometimes 45 mins long. My only dissapointment with the hotel was the noise of drunken guests returning in the early hours of the morning to their rooms presumably from City Walk. As a result of reporting the noise the following day, I was transfered to another room, unfortunately the noise was even worse in this room. On the whole I would recommend this hotel, however take ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun”
Reviews.Author: breretons
Reviews.Content: On the whole we enjoyed our week's stay, but one or two hiccups along the way... Room was not ready on check-in, although this seemed a regular thing. Housekeeping standards were very average and our room went uncleaned one day. However saying that, the pool area is great fun, if a little crowded at times, and the fact that you are 5 mins walk to Studios and Islands was priceless! And don't forget the fast-pass advantage is magic when you are faced with 70-80 minute queues!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great theme, very noisy”
Reviews.Author: LiloDayton
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock for 2 nights. The first night was only a little noisy. The second night we had loud drunks in the hallway from 2-3:30 am. I called the desk and security finally came but said they saw nothing. Upon check out I reminded them of this but was offered no compensation at all. It is a pretty hotel and very cool if you or your kids are into rock music, but be prepared for noise while your trying to sleep. Emack & Bolios ice cream parlor and snack place is VERY overpriced!! We got 2 bagels with butter and the bill was over $7.00! No drinks in that price. The pool is very nice. They boast a very big water slide. The water slide is very long, but not very high. Great location to Islands of Adventure and Universal Studios. The express pass benefit of staying onsite can't be beat. I would try either Royal Pacific or Portifino Bay if you want a decent nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: saraozzy
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel from the minuite you pull up outside this hotel you know your in for a good time its a very grand looking hotel spotlesley clean and very modern with pictures and outfits hanging on the walls of past post stars, the resturant is excellent the best burger i have ever tasted as well as lots of other things, the pool is very good with a man made beach area that the kids loved, and what couldnt be better minutes walk into universal , and city walk, or if your feeling lazy they lay on a free water shuttle which is very nice, plus show your room card in the universal theme parks at get fast track to all the rides, we found this hotel perfect and will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location a bit disorganized”
Reviews.Author: Pierry
Reviews.Content: Two years ago we stayed at the Portofino so we decided to try the Hard Rock this year. I was travelling with my 12 and 15 year old. We arrived and self parked to save some money. This meant having to lug our suitcases up two stories...no elevators by the self park lot. We were shown to a smoking room. We were then shown to a room that was not made up. Then we went to a third room that contained a gentleman from security. We waited 10 minutes and then the escort told us she had made a mistake about the room number. We laughed because after 45 minutes of going from room to room with our luggage we thought she was joking. We finally arrived in our room. For all that, we received a free breakfast. The rest of our stay was fine. The lobby is actually on the 3rd floor so it is a bit confusing. There are movies by the pool in the evening. There's ping pong outside and shuffle board. The breakfast buffet is wonderful. The best part of the hotel is the location. It is a 5 minute walk to the theme parks and all the fine restaurants. The rickshaw home is a nice plus, too. It is a loud environment but the rooms are very quiet. It is also in a great location for shopping although we did not have time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scrapbooker_in_PA
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 nights at the Hard Rock Hotel in Universal Orlando. This hotel is very nice, very kid-friendly. The pool area is also very nice, it has a zero entry. One complaint from my kids, ages 14 and 16 was it wasn't deep enough and although the water slide is 240 ft., that is in length, not height. The only frustrating thing for me was, upon arrival at 3:45 our room was not ready, I understand that 4 is check-in but we were very close. I asked the clerk at check-in if I had a nice room and she stated, yes, it is on an upper floor overlooking everything but when I checked back to see if my room was ready they had moved us to a room on the main floor and no one knew why. I think they need more housekeeping help. After visiting one of the theme parks, we returned to our room around 3-3:30PM to relax and go swimming and our room still hadn't been made up. The location is great, no need to take the bus or water taxi, it is just a very short walk along a beautiful path to either park or citywalk. We did not eat at any of the restaurants in the hotel but we did order from the beach grille, it was very good and not too over-priced. Overall, we had a good experience and if we were to return to the Universal area we would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “cannot fault the hard rock!”
Reviews.Author: normanpitkin
Reviews.Content: Stayed sadly only for one night, mainly to get the front of line pass, and cannot fault this hotel. It is easily the best hotel i have stayed at in orlando, compares well to top class new york hotels. Also quite hip and makes you feel kind of like an (aging) rock star! Cannot wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “The only way to stay”
Reviews.Author: Caney80
Reviews.Content: This is one great place to stay! If you are going to Universal/Islands of Adventure then you have to stay on property for the Express Pass or you are really wasting you time there. When most big rides had a wait of 75 minutes or more we never waited on ANY ride more than 20 minutes! You are able to enjoy more of the park and longer with this option. Express Pass more than makes up for the price for staying at one of these hotels. The Hard Rock had great service from check-in to check-out, with not blips in between. The rooms with two sinks made it nice when trying to get ready to go. The pool is large, not crowded and has something for everyone. The five minute walk from the hotel to Universal was so sweet. My wife and I are 46 yrs old and had two 13 year olds and loved every thing about the hotel, parks, pool and personnel. Be expecting the $16 per day self parking and $25 per day if you use the valet parking, but this is just another necessary evil of hotels. No nothing is cheap anywhere but you get a very classy hotel, very short walk to the parks and service that you rarely get in this kind of setting.

Reviews.Title: “Great First Impression - but won't be returning!”
Reviews.Author: Dazbats
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Hard Rock for 6 nights having spent 8 nights previously at the Hyatt Cypress Gardens (please read report on this hotel). We had again upgraded our room to 'Club' so we were in a position to compare! On two previous occasions we have stayed at the Royal Pacific (not Club Room) but fancied a change this visit. On entering the hotel lobby there was definitely a 'wow' factor. Great area, with amazing memorabila on show. Our room on the Club floor was nice, very modern and contemporary. We did ask for a room furthest away from the lift area as I had read reports of the hotel sometime being noisy. Although the view wasn't great - the room was quiet! First impressions of the hotel were all good. Great access to City Walk and the Parks (which is the reason we choose Universal Hotels - and the fast pass is a MUST!). Club Room: Very different experience from that we had at the Hyatt! We did not feel 'exclusive' in anyway. The breakfast was pastries (and more pastries), cereal, toast, tea/coffee etc. You could pop in during the afternoon and grab a soft drink (if there was any available) and the evening beer/wine/snacks was only on offer from 5pm-7pm. Needless to say, come 5pm the place was heaving. We don't actually eat until around 9 pm - so we felt we had to go out earlier just to grab a couple of glasses of wine to ensure we had out monies worth! Personally, wished we had saved the money. It was amusing to watch some folk come in during the morning grabbing large numbers of bottled water, food and soft drinks and disappearing back to their rooms (or packing the stuff in their ruck sacks!). Similar things happened during the evening too - how sad! We ate in the Kitchen restaurant twice and the pool bar just the once - very reasonable priced food and good. With there being no lobby bar we had to physically go into the Velvet bar which was for over aged 21's only. Our daughter (who is 16) could obviously not come in so this really limited us going in there together before going out to dinner. I fully appreciate the legal age of 21 being required - but offering no differentiation between aged 0 and 20 seems ludicrous to me and I think this probably stops a lot of folk from actually using the bar - shame - its really nice! Even allowing teenagers in until 9pm would have been more acceptable. Pool Area: Nice area, but got very busy early but the pool was really shallow (3ft) The Hard Rock was definitely more expensive than the Hyatt, and the upgraded Club Room was defintely not worth the extra money. Next time we return to Orlando we will go to the Club room at the Royal Pacific (we physically went and checked it out!). I'm glad we made the visit, we wanted to 'experience' the Hotel, but as said, very doubtful we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun but noisy”
Reviews.Author: badgerlinc
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the HRH at Universal. It is definitely a party hotel - it probably appealed more to us and our boys (ages 10 and 12) than it did to my parents. However, my parents did enjoy the memorabilia present throughout the hotel and they enjoyed the food. As with other Universal (and Disney for that matter) hotels and restaurants, as we were a party of 6, a gratuity of 18% was automatically added to our bill/check when we ate in the hotel. On our first morning we ate at The Kitchen. We were surprised how quiet it was in there - until we paid! It was expensive but the buffet selection was excellent and of superior quality. I even had Eggs Benedict made for me and the waiter bought hot chocolate for the children. For the other 2 mornings, we went to the Marketplace (also in the hotel) and bought smoothies and bagels. Excellent smoothies - they take a while to prepare but are freshly made. It only takes 15 minutes max to walk to the parks and the Front of the Line passes for being hotel guests are a huge plus. You can bill purchases to your hotel account but not if you are checking out in the next 24 hours. The only downside was the noise at nighttime. There were groups of teenagers who were shouting down the corridors during the first 2 nights. This was a real shame as the theming and funky style of the HRH are great fun. We would stay there again but would be quicker to complain about any noise.

Reviews.Title: “You pay extra for everything!”
Reviews.Author: Oslofjord
Reviews.Content: The great thing about living here, is the express-passes you get to the parks. You will not miss the long lines. But, at a 300 dollar hotel, it seemes kind of ...ungenerous.. that you have to pay extra for everything. And I mean everything. Six dollars for water? Seven dollars for fifteen minutes of internet? Ten dollars to work out? The taxtameter is running every minute you spend here.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service In Safety”
Reviews.Author: Ladykins
Reviews.Content: While staying at the Hard Rock in Orlando from July 12, 2008 till the 17th of July, I had the worst experience that I have ever had while staying at a hotel. On the 15th after coming back from Universal, my friend and I decided to soak our legs in the jaquzzii. Red marks started to appear on my leg and my right calf was burning. We called the front desk when we got in who told us security would be down shortly. The inner part of my thigh had what looked like hives all over it and my right calf was red and buring. 45 minutes later still no one came, we calll up again to the front desk to see what was going on. We were transferred to security for them to tell us all they had on hand was bug spray. I have never written a bad review about a hotel or any other establishment, but find this unresponsivness to a guests well-being to be alarming. There are children playing at the pool all day there and to know that the only thing they can do is call you an ambulenance or repel bugs from you is not a place I would take my children nor would I stay again. My advice would be to pay the extra money to stay on the grounds at Disney or pay less money to stay at the Marriott or a hotel similiar will provide you with more customer service than the Hard Rock ever could. Their restaurant is terriffic on City Walk though if you would like to get a taste of the Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: pdemetree
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to go to the Palm Restaurant that is located in the hotel for our anniversary. We decided since we would be drinking that it would be fun and a good idea to just spend the night. Our problems began shortly after we arrived. Check-in time is 4:00 and we arrived a little early thinking we would get settled and hang out by the pool before dinner. The hotel not only didn't have our room ready at 4:00 but it was 5:30 before we were let in. This pretty much started us off on the wrong foot. It meant that we couldn't enjoy our stay at the hotel because we really just had enough time to get showered and ready for dinner. I know as I was downstairs complaining about the issue another receptionist was telling other guests that their room still was not ready, so we weren't the only ones. I just think when you pay $400+ for a room the hotel should make sure its ready on time. Then the hair blow dryer did not work and as we were leaving the gate would not go up on the parking lot and there was a line of about 15 cars until some guy got out and just bent the gate up so everyone could leave. This hotel has some serious management issues. They need to hire more housekeepers so that the rooms are ready when they say they will be ready. The only thing that keeps me from giving it one star is that the staff was very nice. It was obvious that their hands were tied and they couldn't do anything more. Eugene in the Club room was especially great and the only reason I was able to keep my temper from getting the best of me. Next time we'll just take a cab as the restaurant was great.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Nice, Express Pass Worth It”
Reviews.Author: audnlou
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel for five nights. Our garden view room was clean, comfortable, and roomy. We enjoyed the atmospere of the hotel; the music was always playing in the hotel and pool areas; we enjoyed the pool area; lots of kids and adults using the pool; pool water was very warm. The best perk of staying on site at Universal is the express ride pass with your room key. We rode all the rides we wanted, multiple times in both parks, bypassing the hour long general admission lines. It was well worth the price of the hotel, plus we could easily take the boat or walk to the parks. We used the room key to conveniently charge food, etc. in the parks. The unfavorable elements of staying here is having to pay for parking; it is truly a rip-off for the hotel guests who are already paying a premuim rate to stay here. Also, eating at the hotel is expensive. We drove a few blocks away to International Drive and found many reasonably priced restaurants to eat dinner. Overall, it was a great place to stay and play.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: QueenORoad
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock was a real treat. My husband and I were traveling with two teenagers. We booked the 2 bedroom King Suite (6th floor). The staff was friendly and helpful at check-in, although there was a line it moved fairly quickly. The rooms were very clean and decorated nicely. It was great to return to a turned-down bed every evening. We were celebrating a high school graduation, the hotel provided a complimentary cake and drinks to help us celebrate. Also, the free "fast pass" access to the Universal theme parks was invaluable...only spent about 10 mins in line (max) for any ride. I would definitely visit again!

Reviews.Title: “the great Orlando love of the Dollar :)”
Reviews.Author: chickencottage
Reviews.Content: Good points: fabulous lobby attentive staff (all cool and dressed in black, some with black nail varnish ...and that was the men :) ) proximity to the parks, 5 mins walk fast pass to rides with hotel key card fast pass to Citywalk restaurant queues velvet lounge full of hard rocky people :) icrecream palour on the ground floor free ice dispensers nice pod coffee machine with plenty of pods for tea and coffee in the room. lovely boat ride (5 minutes) to parks It's interesting to spend some time looking at the Rock memorabolia on framed hangings all over the place. the Kitchen was nice for breakfast, although a little pricey.. lots of american food, like Grits and breakfast potatoes and sausage and egg pizzas, but plenty of more familar food too! Bad points: I had assumed park entry was included with the Virgin holiday package..I assumed wrong!.. had to buy 14 day flexi ticket. (universal parks entry was included with the hotel at portaventura in salou in spain on our holiday last year) $9.95 for tv internet, which had to be navigated by arrows on a keyboard (v. difficult) $7.95 for 15 mins internet in the lobby wifi wireless at $27.95 for 3 days was a very poor one bar connection. fridge and microwave for hire at $10 -$15 a day bed a bit hard with hard dampish linen 500ml of water for $6 pool a bit crowded and was quite shallow at a max of 4'6', so it got quite warm by the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “nothing like it use to be”
Reviews.Author: blitz13
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Hard Rock for the last 5 years on average of 4 times a year, and it has been falling every since. The first couplr of years it was great the last couple nothing short of terrible. The room service not what you would expect from a good Hotel, They charge for POOL views in which you never get as this last trip our view was a back of a tent. Charging $15.00 to park your car every night over the higher rates then other Hotels seem pretty petty. Overall not a good experience at the higher end pricing. There web site in which is to comment to them diretly is always down and never working.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: davecps2
Reviews.Content: I booked my holiday to Orlando via the Holiday Hypermarket in the UK. I originally Selected the Wyndham hotel on International Drive from a "First Choice" brochure. But, 4 weeks from the start of the holiday, I requested to change the hotel to the Hard Rock from a "Virgin" brochure, due to negative reviews and I wasn't disappointed. The only negative is that it cost me £800 to change it. On arrival the assertive valet staff aided my self with my luggage by taking my suit case to the baggage room, which was later delivered to my room. I was pleased that I was allocated a huge room with 2 double beds in it and a garden view. I ordered room service on 2 occasions. They were delivered by friendly staff, and in a reasonable amount of time. The choice of menu in your room was great, but the prices were high, but this is expected in a high-class hotel. The room that I was allocated had a mini-bar, large t.v., iron, safe, coffee maker etc. inside it. One of the big positives about the hard rock is the location. You only need a 5-minute walk to get to Universal CityWalk and Studios. Throughout the stay I witnessed security in all areas of the hotel from the pool areas to the lobby etc. This is good for peace of mind. During my stay I noticed a few celebrities including Alan Smith (football player - Newcastle United) visiting the Hard Rock. In the near future when I return to Orlando, I would definitely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay!”
Reviews.Content: Loved jumping the line at Universal in the summer, main reason we are here. Had a great stay, kids (10 and 14 girls) loved it, me too.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay.Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 0941Will
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 3 children during a Spring Break trip. The service was perfect and the staff was excellent. They held doors for the guests and always spoke to me when I passed them in the hallway, pool, and other public areas. The pool is almost a park within itself with a sand beach, beach volleyball, zero access, and a slide. Our children loved it. We ate at the Kitchen and it was also very good. They had a very reasonable chlidren's buffet for dinner and allowed two of our chidlren to make their own pizzas. The breakfast buffet was to die for. The rooms are a little small, espcially with 5 in one room, but the decor is very cool!

Reviews.Title: “Warning: don't leave a thing behind. The hotel has a Finder's Keepers policy.”
Reviews.Author: AlexandNessa
Reviews.Content: We usually enjoy our stays at the HRH Orlando. You need to accept all the highs with the lows though, and sometimes I continue to be amazed that this hotel has a supposed 4.5* rating. The highs: it is such a short walk to the parks. The pool and the Beach Club are great. The rooms are big enough and well-appointed. We love the theming and the music. For my birthday, they sent a lovely gift to the room which was thoughtful and unexpected. The lows: we have stayed at the HRH Orlando 4x now in one year for 23 nights total. Housekeeping is terribly inconsistent. We've had housekeeping try to enter the room at least twice with the "Do Not Disturb" sign clearly hanging on the door knob. Sometimes we get turn-down service; most of the time we don't and have to make repeated phone calls for the service. (Turn-down service is in our profile and is supposed to be automatic when staying in a suite, which we always do since we're Loews First Platinum). I have had terrible experiences with room service food quality as well. But, this takes the cake: we checked out of the HRH Orlando one morning, and maybe 3 hours afterwards, my husband realized that he left 3 brand new shirts in the room. Brand new as in never even been worn. Yes, we should've checked the drawers more carefully. Upon realizing this, we immediately called the hotel and were put through to security. Security didn't care. I had explained who we were, that we had checked out approx 3 hours ago, exactly what we left behind, what room they were in, and which drawer they were in. Security didn't care, and told me to call back after 6 pm because "that's when things get turned in." This was between noon and 1 pm, and security wouldn't even bother to check if someone else had checked into the room yet. If someone had, I could see calling back after 6pm. But, security would not even make a call to housekeeping on our behalf. We called back after 6pm to follow up. It was just a tired, "Nope. Nothing turned in yet. Call back in an hour." Another call an hour later yielded nothing; only that the HRH would take our information "in case something turned up." Thanks for all the help. I've left a shirt behind at the Hampton Inn, and when I called, they immediately retrieved the shirt from the room and mailed it back to me at no charge. The Hampton Inn follows up with guests, but apparently this type of service is lacking from the HRH. I was annoyed at the complete lack of response from the HRH, and e-mailed their management. I did receive a friendly little note that they would do their best to find the shirts and get back to me. That was a full month ago. Needless to say that was last I heard from them. I am over the shirts. We absolutely should've checked the drawers (and this is the last time I believe my husband when he tells me he's done so ;) ). However, the lack of caring and utter unresponsiveness from this so called 4* property leaves me just shaking my head. So, take this word of warning from me: check and recheck the room for left behind items, because you will not get them back. Security and/or Housekeeping plays Finder's Keepers. Will we stay here again? My husband wants to just to see who he can spot on the grounds wearing one of his shirts ....

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Universal”
Reviews.Author: Rocman4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at HR on 6/18 - 6/19 with my spouse and two kids ages 12 and 16. The common areas of the hotel are very well appointed with a friendly staff. Our room was a double queen and quite small compared to many other hotel chains that cater to business travelers. While clean and comfortable, the lighting in the room especially the changing area outside the bathroom was dim. Otherwise the beds are comfortable and the room suits its purpose if you are going to spend most of your time at Universal. We did request an additional rollaway bed which the hotel gladly provided for $25 each night. My biggest complaint was the lack any sort of controllable fan in the room HVAC. It is either on of off and is very quiet while running. While some may find this desirable, this is a busy hotel with guest coming and going at all hours. Especially in the early am hours, there are many guests returning from the bars at the City Walk. Unfortunately, many of them liquored up and loud. Because there is no sort of white noise to mask sounds outside the room, we were woken up frequently by loud guests. Also, this hotel caters to families, many with younger children i.e lots of hallway sprinting at 7am. While the hotel is hardly to blame for this, they could easily help mask the noise by installing or making available some sort of white noise generator in the rooms i.e the sound of a fan. The pool area is quite nice and relaxing. The palm trees and music give a real caribbean feel to this! As can happen anywhere, the only turnoff was the behavior of a few idiots. We did see one guest get in the hot tub with his shoes on and another who put his cigarette out in the water. As expected, this is not the place to go if you are on a tight budget. A cup of coffee was $4 in the cafe downstairs. A two shot bourban on the rocks at poolside was $13. A 16oz draft beer is about $6. We ate off site both days so I cant comment on the restaurant prices. Fortunately, we traveled with some friends who are Florida residents and were able to take advantage of a Florida resident discount room rate We mainly chose this hotel for the Universal Express pass priviledges as well as its close proximity. Although there are water taxi's to shuttle you back to the hotel, in most cases, its quicker to simply walk back. About 10 minutes and the walking path is very well landscaped and shaded. The days of our visit, both parks were crowded and the express pass most certainly paid off. We were able to get through most lines in 5-10 minutes. Some even shorter. Your room key also gives you priority seating at the City Walk restaurants. Some had waits of 2+ hours. By showing our room key, we were able to be seated in about 30 minutes. Overall, I would recommend this hotel mainly for the convenience factor as well as the perks offered to its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great choice in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: nickoula
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I have to travel to Orlando for a convention, we always make it a point to stay at the Hard Rock for a few days before going back home! We are a 30 something child free couple and hate the Disney scene, Universal and the Hard Rock is a great alternative - we love just hanging out at the Hard Rock's pool and playing at Universal - the restaurants are very good and they even have live music once a month! We have been here a few times and do admit that the room decor is starting to get old, but the rooms are clean and comfy and offer nice touches: 1. iPod docking station 2. Loews members get welcome amenity 3. full size blow dryer and 4. nice toiletries. In addition, the Kitchen and the Poolside Restaurants are fabulous - excellent food and wonderful, attentive service - overall, this is a great hotel and ideal for families with older kids or child free couples who want to play away from Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Great Visit”
Reviews.Author: krazykevy
Reviews.Content: I was at the Hard Rock Hotel for a site visit and overall visit to universal orlando area. The room was very nice, staff was extremly attentive, and the entire universal orlando area was amazing. Please contact me if you have any questions or need any more information.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but not as AWESOME as last year...”
Reviews.Author: Rattus
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock is supposed to be a lavish experience for all guests. Our visit last year was better. The staff were all wonderful and quite gracious this year, but our room was dark with cigarette burns in the furniture. There also seemed to be a lot less staff. No one greeted us immediately to help us with our baggage. The desk person had to call a bellperson to come and help us. I didn't feel catered to like in the past. We're not smokers, but we took a room that allowed smoking and was located on the first floor. It was available for our checkin, and we were early. (about 2:15pm)The first floor is not nearly as nice as the third floor, but it was very quiet. The bathroom was a little worn, and the beds weren't as soft and wonderful as the ones on the third floor. There were definitely less staff members, and room service was very unimpressive. The woman dropped off our meal on a fully expanded table. We had to literally take the food off the table, put the leaves down, and then reset up the table and place the food back on it after pushing it further into the room past the bar so that we could eat off of it. The lady dropped off the table and pretty much ran. I tipped her, but I almost had to chase her. It was only after she left that we realized the table wouldn't fit in the room without being taken apart. On the bright side, the room was right near the ice cream shop and on the same level as the pool and the Kitchen restaurant. The Kitchen is a little pricey, but the food is very good. I recommend the filet minon. YUM. The staff there are wonderful as well. They were very attentive, especially the young man with the blonde hair and the young man with the rosary bead tattoo. The ice cream is very reasonably priced, so we ate lots of it. The parks are a very short walk from the hotel. They are wonderful for kids of all ages. The pool is nice, but it gets crowded quickly. The man that supervises the kids' pool activities is wonderful! My 12 year old daughter had a blast. It was also very nice to have food and drinks delivered to us at the pool, but beware that there is an automatic 18% gratuity tacked onto the food and drinks. I felt that it was worth it. They gave ample amounts of food, and the servers were VERY attentive. (especially Tiffany and a young man that was African American with an underlip piercing) But I fear that like the economy, the hotel has seen better days. It's still nice, but it's not lavish and pampering like it used to be. For the price, I expected the same experience as I had last year. I did complete a review for the hotel, and I have been contacted by a hotel representative. I didn't expect an apology like I received, and the person did say that they will work to improve the hotel. And judging from my first experience, they just might. I really hope so.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend The Hard Rock Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bookwrm
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel Orlando for five nights (May 26-31). We have two daughters ages 13 and 16. I certainly don't understand the negative reviews since our stay was perfect and the hotel was top notch. Check-in was quick and the staff were friendly and helpful. I asked for a room not on the third floor since that is level of the lobby and I assumed it would be loud (there was a concert while we were there in the lobby). We were put on the 6th floor in a garden view. We never heard any loud noises after about 11:00 at night and were never awakened in the mornings so maybe staying in a room away from the pool is a better idea. We spent one full day at the pool and really enjoyed it. Although the drinks and food at the pool were really expensive, it was a nice splurge to get them delivered to you in your beach chair (my younger daughter felt like a rock star). We had dinner and breakfast at the Kitchen and it was very good. Other mornings we just grabbed coffee and cereal at the ice cream shop. Our room was standard but much larger than other hotels we have stayed at. It was clean and the beds were comfortable. I didn't notice any wear and tear as others have indicated, the carpet probably could have used a cleaning but even that was not bad. We had no problems with check out, they held our bags for us since our flight did not leave until late that night. We were able to enjoy the parks all day. The best part as many have said is the express pass. We never waited more than 5 minutes for any ride. It was amazing and really made going to the parks a joy. If you ask my kids what the best part of the trip was, they will tell you it was the express pass. The walk to the parks was beautiful and only took a few minutes. We took the water shuttle once. My only complaint would be the free shuttle to Sea World. It departed the hotel at about 10:00 a.m. and left Sea World at about 5:00 p.m. We planned to spend the entire evening there watching the evening shows and having dinner so we ended up taking a taxi back to the hotel. Would be nice if they had a later shuttle as well. If you go to the parks, don't miss eating at Mythos. We had a delicious lunch there and the price we paid was amazingly inexpensive for what we received. I would not hesitate to recommend the Hard Rock Hotel. We had a great vacation and would definately come back to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: saladomom
Reviews.Content: We received the Simpson's ride promotion in the mail; probably because we've stayed at the hotel 1X before and were on the mailing list. It made sense to us because of the 7day tickets to parks, the tee shirts, and because we loved the hotel the last time. But we got upgraded to a KingSuite and stayed on the club floor the last time; and this time we did 2 adjoining rooms and were put on the 2nd floor. The rock and roll music at the pool begins at 9 a.m. and you can hear it clearly through the walls. Many people walk down the halls with their children and when they speak their voices echo; the acoustics down there are terrible. Sometimes we didn't get fresh shampoo/conditioner and they seemed stingy with the other toiletries as well. There were errors on our bill (we were charged 2 Valet parkings because we had 2 rooms, even though we only had one car) per day; which they gladly fixed but we had to bring it to their attention. So my advice would be: Stay on a Club floor, at least on Floor 5 6 or 7, it's quieter! I think the hotel is worth the experience at least ONCE for the cool decor, relaxed atmosphere, rock-n-roll vibe, etc. The second time, when all that wears off, you may not be as impressed. We certainly weren't and will head to Portofino next time.

Reviews.Title: “Still our favourite”
Reviews.Author: boomeruk
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have stayed at this hotel a few times but the birh of our daughter in 2004 put us off long haul holidays for a while. We bit the bullet this year and decided to take our now 4 year old daughter to Orlando for her first long haul holiday. We hedged our bets a little and split the two week break between two hotels - the hard rock and the Hyatt Grand Cypress - the theory being that we would do a week at Universal attractions and then a week at Disney attractions and if one hotel was a bit poor then it wouldn't ruin the whole holiday Our previous experiences at the Hard Rock have always been positive but we approached this visit with a certain amount of fear not only wondering how a 4 year old would get on with a hotel that we had always percieved as being a 'young trendies' hotel but also about the hotel itself given some of the reviews that have been posted on here that suggested a hotel that was now worn around the edges and staff that were sometimes poor. Well our fears were unfounded. Our daughter loved the hotel and the room and staff were fine. We stayed on the club level and noticed a few things have changed since our last visit: The rooms now have flat tvs, Ipod docking bedside radio alarms and a DVD player (none of these devices were exaclty top of the range models but perfectly fine) The happy hour in the club lounge now doesn't serve spirits. There is wired and wirelss internet access in the room (i got a wirelss signal thoughout the hotel). it costs $10 per day or $25 for three days. The hotel gift shop is now almost exclusively clothing. It used to have a much wider range of branded gifts (teddy bears, wallets, alarm clocks etc). The pool bar adds an automatic 18% tip to any order whether you order it at the bar itself or if a server brings it takes your order at poolside and brings it to you. If i'm honest the service isn't perfect all the time. During the week the hotel was probably at less than 50% occupancy and therefore they seemed to have less staff on at the pool (never seemed to be able to flag down a server) but as the hotel filled up for the weekend then the number of staff increased and getting served became less of a problem. The turn down service was also a bit hit and miss - for the frist two days we forgot it existed as no one showed up ! However overall the hotel stil rates as our favourite - the atmosphere is relaxed and casual, the pool is just right for us (not too deep for a little one, has a lifeguard on duty etc.), the express past at universal is just a must have as it allows you to just try things that you otherwise wouldn't risk queuing 45 mintues for. If they could match the level of personal service we later recieved at the Hyatt I think they would have it cracked. We will certainly we returning so i hope so.

Reviews.Title: “Just the best!”
Reviews.Author: Feegeeheatlee
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at Hard Rock and it was fantastic, rooms were large and had plenty of space for all our clothes etc. Staff were amazing, truly could not do enough for you and any request was met in the quickest time. Food in the Kitchen was lovely and not as expensive as I thought after reading the reviews on this site, though thats probably because of the great exchange rate at the moment, had buffet breakfast every day and would certainly recommend it, even got drinks to go when leaving, was always stuffed after breakfast and would not eat again till much later in the day. Loved the fast pass at the rides at Universal Studios and IOA ,made such a difference and saves loads of time on q-ing, great when you have younger kids. Hired a cabana at the pool for the day and it was pure luxury, cost $160 but as there were two familes worked out at $80 or £40.. this included a fridge,(already filled with drinks) tv, phone, 4 sunbeds, table and 4 chairs, well worth it, kids spent all day in the wonderful pool and then would sit in the shade for a while play their DS`s or watch TV, you could also phone from the cabana for lunch or any drinks u wanted.. that was an AMAZING day! One down side was check in staff .. dour, unhelpful, slow, would even go as far as to say rude. That was the only fault that I found with this hotel all the other staff were really nice so this kinda made up for rubbish check in and check out. Try the millions of champage cocktail at the Kitchen... to die for!!

Reviews.Title: “cool hotel if you know the backround story to it”
Reviews.Author: mileycyrushater
Reviews.Content: a lot of people say that the carpet was old and the siding was bad and the hotel was just runned down. the backround of this hotel is quite cool. it was once a rockstars mansion, so they want to keep all the memories of the guy with them. now back to the hotel. it was very nice and cool. the express pass for universal and ioa is great to have. im telling you stay here

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: xtina72
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, we stayed on the private 7th floor, so the free food during the day was very nice, a friend of ours who lives in the area got us a discount so we stayed for much less than we would have so it was worth it for us, maybe not so much for someone who would paid full price. We had to pay for parking every day....that was not very convenient! It was an unexpected expense. Its not kid friendly either, there are no food courts, its nice to have even a small food court with kids because they are always "snacking" and the Universal hotels only have restaurants. There is no fridge in the room, just a very expensive mini bar. The water taxis and walkways to Universal studios was nice, I think they charge for parking to discourage people from getting a rental car and leaving the resort, if they trap you there you have to spend your money there. Would I stay here again? probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aubsqueen08
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in January for one night after visiting Universal for my birthday. I loved it! It is one of the nicest hotels i've ever stayed in. Rock theme is awesome! We stayed in a KISS theamed suite. It was very roomy with confortable beds and a clean bathroom. We orded cocoa from room service, and it arrived quickly and tasted delicious. Staff was friendly and handled any problems in a timely manner. Loved the blow up "Hard Rock" guitar they gave me for my birthday:) Can't comment on the food-we never ate in any of the restaurants. My only wish is that I hat gotten to spend more time there! Would definatly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “We rocked the Hard Rock!”
Reviews.Author: ROCKMO62
Reviews.Content: Hi my sister (both in our early 40's) and 14 year old nephew stayed here 4/26-4/30. It was my nephew's spring break and the hotel was only 50% occupied. Our room was not ready when we got there. Tara who checked us in was very friendly and helpful. They held our luggage and we then went to the Beach Club for some lunch. Everyone at the hotel went out of their way to make sure we were happy. Even calling us by our names right away. The room was spacious and clean. Beds very comfortable and the linens soft. We did have a problem with the towels being very hard and worn. The Velvet lounge was very cool and great for late night drinks. The best part of these Loews Hotels is the location and the fast pass keys you use at Universal & IOA. The walk from the hotel to the parks is wonderful. They really take care of the landscaping and everything is breathtaking to look at. We never did take the boats over to the park. The walk itself is only 5 minutes. I would highly recommend this hotel for families with older kids. We did not do Disney and did not miss it either. The hotel is pricey........but it is vacation!! Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: daisy91
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 day stay at the HRH. The best feature by far is the fast pass for the rides, We never waited to get on a ride more then 5 minutes with the exception of the new Simpson ride which they were not offering the fast pass option at this time. As far as the hotel, It was ok, from the outside it looks really fancy, but the rooms seemed small and alittle musty smelling. I was not impressed with the pool at all, very shallow and small, but in all fairness I am comparing this to the Hyatt Grand Cypress which has the most spectacular pool. The outdoor ping pong tables were a hit with the kids. If you are not big swimmers then this would be a good choice because of the location to universal and fast pass. But personally I would buy the fastpass and stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Stay if only for the Express Pass”
Reviews.Author: uryjm
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hard Rock for a flying visit to Orlando as we wanted to revisit the two best parks in the place, Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure. Staying in the hotel, you get a fast pass for all the rides, and it's worth it's weight in gold. An hour long queue for Spiderman? Not if you stay at the Hard Rock. The hotel's within walking distance of both parks, and a wee boat can also shuttle you there and back. This is America, after all, where walking is almost a forgotten mode of transport. It's a nice stroll through the grounds though and we actually prefered doing this, telling ourselves it was burning up the burgers. The hotel itself is very clean, the rooms bright and modern and the decor lively and interesting. There were only two bad points - the incessant piped rock music that you cannot escape from (although what should I have expected?) and the fact that there can be some raucous guests. We were woken on both nights by people living out their Excess All Areas fantasies. We felt the food was relatively expensive and not great, breakfasting to the sounds of AC/DC and Motely Crue. The pool area was nice, but again music blasts you from all sides. Now, I like rock music as much as the next man, but not ALL rock music and you can't turn it off! I don't know if we'd stay again and I think I'd search for an alternative, because Orlando isn't short of hotels at this price. Except for the Fast Pass - it's a big bonus.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: AnnieT71
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 4 nights in April. It was the perfect place to stay. We were within walking distance from Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure, as well as the City Walk. There was always something to do. We went to the parks in the morning and hung out at the pool in the afternoon. There were so many places to choose from for dinner. My friend and I walked over to the other nearby hotels (Portofino and Royal Pacific). They looked nice. But, I was happy that we were at the Hard Rock Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic if you have teenagers!!!”
Reviews.Author: honest2u07
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the HRH. Stayed there a week with our two teenage sons, age 13 and 14. We traveled with another family as well, that also had teenagers same age. What we loved is that the property is so close to Universal and Islands of Adventure that during the week long stay, the kids could walk over late afternoon and spend a couple of hours there while the adults dined. Don't get me wrong, we spent loads of time with the kids. Universal, Islands of Adventure, the new Aquatica park, Discovery Cove and Wet and Wild and Seaworld. But we seemed to finish up at the parks around 2:00 p.m. Went back to the pool at HRH, and then sometimes the kids would head back for a few hours. The kids loved it! They met other teenagers, hung out in the hot tub, played volleyball. All around the 13, 14, 15, 16 and 17 age group! We dined at the Palms, which was somewhat of a let down, because there were tons on little kids..very pricey, but food was good. We dined one evening outside on the terrace at the Kitchen, at was a bit more reasonably priced. The beach bar/restaurant was fantastic. We also made a reservation at Emrils restaurant for 8, but then changed the reservation to 4 and let the kids do there thing at Citywalk...they just checked in with us. We sat next to AL ROKER!!! Food was without question incredible, service was second to none! VERY, VERY EXPENSIVE...but if you can swing it, it was so good! We ventured out to a restaurant call Bonefish...Not the chain FISHBONES, but Bonefish. Ask a the front desk, it's only about a mile away, and the food and atmosphere was fantastic. The kids came with us and they loved it! If you stay here, just expect to spend, spend, spend....we skipped breakfast every morning and just grabbed a bagel and juice in the market at the hotel. It was not too bad. The location of this hotel is steps away from both parks. The fast pass was worth staying here because we skipped lines, never waited....which allowed us to be back at the hotel early to enjoy the tropical atmosphere, and have a few cocktails! All in all, we loved it! Service was awesome, no problems what so ever! Stay here if you can treat yourself and your teens....great for youngster too! If you decide to check out Aquatica water park, get there early (about 1/2 hour before it opens). Chairs in the shade go quickly...there's a lot of them, but if you get there an hour after the park opens you won't get the shade. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Twinkle40
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for most people and especially if you are going to go to universal and islands of adventure. We have stayed in the best of hotels and we will definately be returning. Our children are 17,15,13 and 10 and they all enjoyed the experience, the beds are comfy and the rooms spacious enough, we had a pool view. The food in the beach club is really yummy and the staff throughout the hotel are great. It is by far the coolest hotel in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: spireman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights from 4 April with my husband and 16 year old son. What is all the hype about? It's just a hotel much like any other but with "rock music" playing. Booked it to take advantage of the room key express pass but have since found that you can purchase an express pass and stay at a cheaper hotel which would make your stay more economical. Friends were staying at the Staybridge Suites on International Drive at the same time and they had a suite with 2 bedrooms, lounge and kitchen AND breakfast for less than £100 a night. Much cheaper and the suite was far superior to our room at the Hard Rock. They also charge $14 for self parking and $22 for valet parking so you don't even save on the theme park parking. This charge bumps up the price of the stay considerably. It wasn't the worst hotel I've stayed in but it certainly didn't live up to my expectations. Didn't eat there as it was too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: basketballer
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before and it was great, the room was nice, they have remodled them in the last year. Check in was easy and no problem getting a room before 3pm. Still charging to park in the hotel lot which is the only negative it has, for the price of the room you would think the parking would be free. The pool area was clean and the food at the pool bar was really good (the nachos). Being able to use your hotel room key as a fast pass is worth the price of the room, also the parks are right there, we just love the Hard Rock

Reviews.Title: “Laid Back, Relaxed, Fun...Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: zen_journeyman
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice now, both times were fantastic. *Everyone* that works here enjoys what they do, and it shows! From the front desk staff, to the housekeeping staff, Wait Staff in the restaurants, to the pool staff, *all* were genuinely friendly, interested in making sure our stay was the best possible by providing outstanding service and tips about the park, hotels, local information and following up with us afterwards after checking their tips out. Both times we received complimentary CD's at check-in. The rooms were up-to-date, modern, the beds comfortable, and very clean as well as spacious. After noticing an errant room charge to the mini bar in the room (we had no key to it), they promptly removed the charge. The pool with the underwater speakers, live bands, water slide and perfect mix of music playing everywhere was great! We were a short walk from both Universal, City Walk, and IOA or we could aways take the water taxi. Their memorabilia collection is extensive. We stayed on an upper floor both times and will definitely be back. If you have a Universal Preferred Pass you also qualify for discounts on the rooms. Check ahead as rooms often sell out ahead of time. Special Events and Concerts are hosted throughout the year, check their calendar. Even my 70-year old father loved it as well as my 16-year old niece, my girlfriends' 15-, 16-, and my 21-year old nephew - tough crowd to get to agree on anything! You're *never* too old or young for that matter, to enjoy Hard Rock Orlando. This is everything you expect and more - they certainly raise the bar and expectations for everyone else - a good thing I believe. You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “3 day/ 2 night Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: islandd
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed here at the end of our Spring Break. The first part of the trip was spent at the Disney Swan. Because it was my birthday weekend, I splurged and booked a Club 7 room. Paying around $425/night. We loved the resort. It is beautiful. The grounds are great and the pool is really spectacular. We were very happy that we booked an onsite hotel and found the perk of express passes for the parks made it really worth the money. We had a great room, very clean and spacious. Will we go back to the Hard Rock? Definitely! Not sure if we will do the Club 7 though. We enjoyed the breakfast but due to the parks only being open until 7 during our stay it was not convenient to take advantage of the happy hour drinks and appetizers. So I'm not sure we got our monies worth.

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: OReily23
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for one night. This was a splurge for us, so we were expecting a lot. First of all, the pluses... Beautiful lobby and grounds, delicious meal and wonderful waiter at The Kitchen, loved the rockstar wake-up call (although if you have young kids, be warned, the message can be R-rated), in room ipod player and music video channel on TV, quick walk to the park, (actually quicker than waiting for the boat), express pass that was included made our day at the park. The minuses... Carpet in room was ripped up and frayed in 2 places, towels were thin and rough, bed and sheets were not as luxurious as we expected from a 4 or 5 star hotel, pool was beautiful but a bit disappointing as it didn't get any deeper than 4 ft something and the slide was closed when we went to the pool at night, and we were awaken at 3am by a drunk, fighting couple in the hallway. All in all, this was a good one time experience, but probably not something we would do again.

Reviews.Title: “live like a rockstar”
Reviews.Author: disney-pals
Reviews.Content: hi we have stayed in the hardrock many times we stay at disney for 2 weeks then move to universal for a week. We love this hotel i have a 8year old son and a 13 year old son and we all think its awesome you actually feel like a rock and roll star. After staying in disney you find that the hard rock is very chilled and layed back were as disney is more magical. In july 07 we stayed in a club room it works out around an extra 350 english pounds but is well worth it, youre room is bigger youre breakfast is included unlimited soft drinks throughout the day, between 5-7 they serve snacks and beer /wine AS MUCH AS YOU LIKE and of a night they turn down your beds and you can help yourself to cookies and milk its well worth the extra money. We are returning again this july and have again booked the club room (be sure to prbook in advance as there is only limited room on club 7. hope you find this review helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “What an overpriced disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: jenjenh
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel Saturday night...and paid an arm and a leg (450) for an OK room. But the noise was horrible making it hard to sleep. Room service was very disorganized...for ok expensive food. We actually had to order 4 bottles of wine on their list before they had one of them available. Then they forgot the appetizer and had to call back for that too. I feel for the prices they are charging they need to offer a better standard of service. Its definetly not "upscale".

Reviews.Title: “Great spring break vacation”
Reviews.Author: kwagmeister
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 7 nights at the Hard Rock - March 22-29, and had a great time. We are a family of 4 with kids aged 12 and 14, so this was a nice change from the Disney trips we've taken in the past. We view spring break as our family trip, and we don't mind spending for a quality experience. Last year we were in Maui, the year before Atlantis in the Bahamas, and in between Cozumel and several Disney trips, including the short and longer cruises - we make spring break a priority family time and I spend time researching where we're going so we are sure to maximize the time for family fun. We had heard great things about this property and opted for the club level, which meant extra concierge services and food and beverage presentations throughout the day - something we took advantage of especially in the morning and late afternoon. That level also includes free admission to the fitness center, and I took advantage of that and enjoyed the fact that I could breeze in and out. The hotel key cards serve as your express pass for all Universal and Islands of Adventure rides, which was fabulous and well worth it to us. We ate at Kitchens two nights and found it to be very good - the kids thought the character visits were fun, too. The pool is large and well maintained, and they had a dj there who kept the kiddos involved and active. There's plenty of waitstaff who are quick to attend to your every need - in fact we were impressed with all the staff at the hotel. Anything we asked for they were only too happy to help us with. The hotel is less than a 5 minute walk to the parks and to City Walk, which provided lots of dinner options and extra entertainment. Truly a fun time. We paid a higher rate given the time of year ($499 a night) but given all that we got in return felt it was well worth it. The rooms are ready for refurbishing, true, but I heard that the club level is set for a renovation this year, which it needs. The last day of our trip there was a near drowning incident in the pool -- a mom turned her back for a moment and her very young daughter (who clearly couldn't swim) went under - we were very impressed with how quickly the lifeguards sprang to action. My husband is a heart surgeon and was one of two docs and an EMT who also ran right over - the guard administered CPR and she began breathing and was quickly taken to a hospital. This kind of thing happens anywhere -- it was clear that the hotel took it very seriously as they cleared the pool and quite a few staff were present and working to quickly stabilize the situation. There are lots of lifeguards present - but parents should always be alert for their children, especially when there are lots of active people in the pool. Speaking of the pool, the night movies were neat - you could swim while watching the latest feature and that was a neat extra, too. We would definitely return and highly recommend the property to anyone looking for a fun time. Our kids loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock was Cool!”
Reviews.Author: jerseygirl424
