Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 in Disguise”
Reviews.Author: auburn8
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day stay at the Hard Rock Hotel in Orlando. If location were the only consideration this would be a 5 * hotel. The hotel is a few hundred yards from the attractions or a short Water Taxi ride. That and the Express Pass for the rides were the only redeeming qualities of this hotel. Our problems started with check-in. We were a couple of hours early but we were allowed to check in and were promised a call on our cell phone when the room was ready (the official check-in time is 4:00). We went to the Islands of Adventure and by 5:00 we still had not received a call. We stopped back by the front desk and were told the room had been ready for a while and the girl just laughed when we asked about not receiving a phone call. Also, as a result of ineptitude at the front desk my credit card was rejected at a restaurant the next night because the check-in person had "accidently" charged about $20,000 in room charges to the card. It took two days to get it resolved and they never even appologized for the error except to say it was a typo. The room is not worth the nearly $300 charge. It is small with a small bathroom that you have to squeeze next to the toilet to get the door opened. The toiletries are sub-par and the decor is nothing to write home about. The maid service, however, was excellent. The grounds are nice, though not Disney quality. The pool was very nice and the kids enjoyed the slide tremendously. The restaurants are very expensive with only so-so food. As another reviewer said, go to the grocery store before you get there and bring a cooler to put drinks in. We walked over to the Portifino Bay Hotel and were able to look at a room there. For similar room rates it looks like the Portifino would be a much nicer place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel -- A Few Words of Caution & a Tip”
Reviews.Author: Mominator
Reviews.Content: Stayed Week of March 6. 2005. We found the hotel to be very clean -- carpets were fine. I think some of the past reviewers interpreted the subtle shading as dirt. We even saw them shampooing the carpets while we were there. The staff was very friendly, professional, and helpful-- top notch. Our room was truly one of the nicest we have stayed in -- and we have been in a lot of hotels. Everything was clean, new, amenities were great. Here's your tip -- We had a Loew's First Card (free if I remember correctly) and the upgrade to concierge level was $50 instead of $100 per night. Just make sure you tell them you are a member; they won't offer unless you ask. You will get a newspaper every day and some other free stuff, too. There are even better benefits, like free room upgrade, the more you stay at Loew's hotels. I think there's information on the website... Here's my beef(s) 1. The hotel is sorely lacking in sundries -- magazines, toiletries, sunscreen -- the things travellers need. The only items available were in the back of the Hard Rock merchandise store. A tiny little section, with things like individually wrapped aspirins. And you will not find a good store anywhere else on the entire Universal properties -- I looked. 2. We have stayed concierge in many hotels and it has always been a quiet, quality experience. Not at the Hard Rock... There were more people in that small lounge than in the lobby! People sleeping, unsupervised kids in pajamas running through tipping plates of food on the carpet ... the whole gamut. I got the feeling that some of these people had crammed 20 into their room and were using the lounge as overflow. Most times we could not find a seat & wouldn't have wanted to anyway. The food was just OK... I think it was because it was such a free-for-all that the hotel decided to put out the "bad stuff" or the "unwieldy stuff" to cut down on the gluttony. Many times it was as if a swarm of locusts had descended. The worst was the night that someone had set up their child's birthday party in the concierge lounge. They had balloons, party favors, and the food was... evening cookies from the lounge! They took big plates of them for their party, leaving store bought Oreos for the rest of the guests. I guess concierge is still better than buying food at the hotel ($13.00 for two cokes and a bag of chips), but it sure wasn't the treat that I am used to. Note to HRH: Consider having a family level and also an age 15+ level of concierge service. Or limit the age that can say on the concierge level, and the number of guests per room. Note to self: Ask driver to stop at a grocery store before checking in. The extra transportation costs will be dwarfed by the savings in bringing your own sundries and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from HRH. Stayed March 10-15. I had read many reviews before going. Because of the reviews I called ahead of time to reserve club level. Basically it is the seventh floor. Your room key has to be inserted into the elevator for anyone to even get up there. I was told on the phone that club level was an upgrade of about $80 per night.. When I got there they wanted to charge me $100. I got it down to $80 by explaining that to them. For that extra money you get breakfast which includes bagels, muffins, doughnuts, unbelievable cut up fresh fruit, and juices and coffee and tea. From 5:00-7:00 they have happy hour. That consists of bottled beer and wine. They serve hot and cold appetizers with a theme which aren't really "hot". ex. mexican night , taquitas, salsa and chips. One night they had meatballs and rolls, and pasta salad. Between the breakfasts and happy hour, we never had to have lunch. If you were to get 2 beers at the pool bar it would cost you about $14. They automatically add a 15% gratuity onto all bar bills. They also serve dessert at night. Usually just cookies/brownies. Also they offer bottled water and mini cans of soda, coffee and tea all day. We really feel it was worth the money. We saved a whole meal for 4, and happy hour can get expensive. And if you are at the parks when it its really hot and are constantly buying bottled water, that can add up. Make sure you check out all web sites to stay here because the same room on the same floor can be charged differently depending where you found it. The rooms themselves weren't anything to write home about. Who cares? They were very clean, the beds were very comfortable. You're not there to hang out in your room. The pool only goes up to 4 1/2 feet. The kid's didn't mind at all. (12&14) There is a basketball hoop hanging over the water, a 260 ft. slide. There is a volleyball pit, and a game room off the bar area. Some nights they have "movie night". A huge screen is pulled down in front of the bar area and you can watch a movie while you swim. The pool is always warm. If you have read any other reviews you will already know about your room key being used as an express pass onto all rides (Except the teradactyl). There we waited 45 minutes for an 80second ride. I know it was 80 seconds because I asked the girl working it.Other than that I wouldn't do Universal again without it! Supposedly you get priority seating at the restaurants on city walk with your hard rock card. I don't agree with that. The strawberry margaritas in Margaritaville are amazing. Be prepared to spend alot of money on food and drinks. Even at city walk, which is where we ate all of the time. We looked at a menu in the room and a cheeseburger was $14. That is why we ate at City Walk. I think you can pull up the hotel menus online. They are The Kitchen and the Velvet Room, and I think the Palm. Another thing- the parks are literally a five minute walk. You go out to the pool, and follow a beautiful flowered winding path right to the front of Universal. Or you can take a water shuttle. My family can hardly wait to go back. s

Reviews.Title: “Hit and Miss”
Reviews.Author: theKiwi
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations of the Hard Rock Hotel in Orlando. Maybe that was the problem. The check-in was smooth. A pre-requisite to working here must be that you have to look like a rock star. The staff all were OK, and had personality, but this sometimes overshadowed that they had a job to do. I waited at the luggage services desk while 3 staff members chatted amongst themselves 5 feet away. The room was OK. The desk and walls had chipped paint in some places, and aside from some black-and-white pictures on the walls, there was no indication that this was a rock-themed hotel. The corridors and rooms were generally bland. In my opinion, in any themed hotel, wherever you are standing in the hotel you shouls know what the theme of the hotel was. The bathroom was very small, but some musical note or instument themed tiles or shower curtain would have been a 100% improvement. give the rooms personality. Also, some music themes carpetting in the corridors and hallways would have been fantastic. The rooms themselved were barely better than a motel 6. Nevertheless, the location could not be beat. just steps from the citywalk and universal studio's, and even if you don't want to do the short walk, the water taxi is right there. Your room key allows you to skip the lines, and you can charge anything, absolutely anything in either park and any restaurant to your room. even at the little hot-dog stands!

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected But Still Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a few nights. I had higher expectations after staying at the Portofino Bay at Universal for the Hard Rock Hotel. Dont get me wrong...this is a very nice hotel but the only thing that dissappointed me were the rooms. I just expected a little more out of them. The ammenaties are unbeatable here. If you are planning on going to the parks, spend the extra money and stay on-site. It pays for itself. You get virtually no wait ride access with the express pass. When you go to the park all you need to carry is your room key. It is your express pass, and you can use it for purchases at the parks and it charges it to your room. Parking at Universal is $9 per day. Staying on-site allows you to be taken by water taxi to the parks and that is the ticket after a long day of walking at the parks. A piece of advice...get AAA if you are planning on staying on-site. The $40 dollars will pay for itself when you receive discounts on your room and 10% off everything you buy at the parks. The AAA discount and the Annual pass holder discounts are the same. I saved $170 dollars over 2 nights with AAA discount.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off, I can't stress enough the value of the express passes that staying on site affords you- especially when you have antsy teenage kids with you :) We stayed at the HRH for 6 nights from Feb 21st until Feb 27, and to be honest, the hotel itself was one of the highlights of our trip. We went with our 13-year old son, who for the most part, preferred staying by the pool- trying to catch lizards and using the amazing waterslide (by the way, it's fun for us adults too)....instead of going to the parks. The amazing part is that since you're so close, you can have some down time in the morning just to relax by the pool and get in some Florida sun- no rush to get to the parks early because they are in such proximity to the hotel- just a 5 min. walk or water taxi- in addition, with the express passes, we were able to do the Mummy Ride 3 times in a row in the time it took most families to ride once- TRULY INCREDIBLE- and worth the money if possible. This certainly isn't a cheap place by any means, but for us, it was the Disney trip of a lifetime, and worth all the extra amenities for sure!!! The service was also amazing!! Staff was Always willing to go the extra mile. While we were there, we enjoyed one of the velvet sessions where they have a rockband from the past come in and perform- as many of us 80's buffs remember well- the Romantics performed for us. The HRH did an amazing job transforming the hotel lobby from the luxury of a 5 star hotel to a hip rock-star party-like atmosphere. It was also great for our son because as we sipped on Martinis and beer, he was close by at the pool and always in close reach, which was such peace of mind for us. The whole experience was amazing, and I hope that we are able to return very soon!!!! The final thing worth mentioning is the MUSIC!! After all, this is the hard rock- I heard songs the whole week that I haven;t heard in years... In my opinion, the constant music is perhaps the most under-appreciated aspect of this hotel- it really adds a flare that makes you never want to go back to ultra-snooty places like the Grand Floridian- after all, this is a Florida vacation, and especially with kids, the whole point is to HAVE FUN, and the HRH succeeds this measure beyond all expectations :)

Reviews.Title: “don.t pay for a pool room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: great hotel. Great fun. Pool view rooms are not worth the extra......the lovely palm trees around the area mean you cannot seee the pool anyway! Pay for an ordinary room and use the extra to pay for a cocktail BY the pool. It was a lovely experience .......we may have to visit again the kids loved it so much!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was alright...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Okay maybe I am a jaded, well-traveled New Yorker, but I expected alot more from HRH. I expected something more plush/ deluxe resort oriented. I went with two teenagers and I admit they loved the pool (even i went on the water slide a couple of times) but they were un impressed with the accomodations. I have been to several other Loews Hotels (the one in Miami is terrific) and I thought HRH was going to be more like them. Yes the carpet was a little raggedy but the walls and hallways were clean. Also it was worth staying on the property to have the Universal Express access! It is better that using the one that the park offers because you never have to come back with your ticket you have access right away! We loved IOA much more that Universal Studios (The Mummy ride is fantastic) The restaurants on site were okay but not alot of diversity in the menus. $3.00 for a 16 oz bottle of Sprite! If I ever go again I think that I would upgrade to Club level and if I had been told about the Club level upgrade I would have done it! I would go again but my expectation level would be lowered! I will probably stay at the Royal Pacific...it looked like a better hotel! Don't believe the hype!

Reviews.Title: “Had fun at Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: shpedly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week, and had a great time. Hotel was beautful, rooms were nice. Loved the pool, though it was always crowded. Rented a cabana for three days. Got great treatment and service at the cabana. Had cabana 1 which was close to the bathrooms, and the bar, as well as the pool. Loved that you always had lounge, as well as tv and fridge. Am posting some pics from the hotel. Front of the line with room key is the best thing, and well worth it. The convenience of the walk to the parks and citywalk was phenomenal, about 5 minutes to universal and citywalk, 10 to islands of adventure. This was the short cut through the pool area by the slide. Many rides had over 60-70 minute waits, and we waited no more than 5 minutes if we didn't actually go in and walk on the ride.

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience”
Reviews.Author: counselormom
Reviews.Content: I paid for two nights recently at the Hard Rock Hotel. Two rooms each night, on the club/concierge level. I had problems from the minute I checked in. Unfriendly front desk clerk, non-smoking rooms full of smoke (even the valet noticed the smell) and an unhelpful concierge. The trip was very stressful because of this hotel's staff. Upon checking in, the front desk clerk attempted to re-charge me for the first nights' stay in each room that I had already paid for previously (and had documentation showing it). The clerk argued with me for over 5 minutes, then finally relented. When I got to my two club level rooms, one clearly smelled of smoke, even though a sign listed they were "especially prepared" as non-smoking rooms. The valet noticed it and said he'd send up an ionizer to help. The ionizer never showed up the first night. Because the rooms were adjoining, by the next morning they both smelled like smoke. I called the front desk and they said they'd send up an ionizer while we were at the parks. When I returned later that afternoon, no ionizer and still a bad smell. I called again, and this time the concierge said she'd personally put one in my room, or they could transfer me to another set of ajoining rooms that were smoking (?!!) After complaining for a few moments, the concierge offered my party free breakfast the next morning because of our troubles-not a big deal since I was already paying for the club level's free breakfast and snacks every day as part of my room price. The ionizer was delivered finally and the rooms smelled better for our last night. Upon leaving I went to the concierge to pick up my rental car-as I had been told to do-(one of the other Universal hotels has a rental car company in the hotel), and the concierge couldn't find my rental reservation. He just simply told me he couldn't help me and told me to go find the valet!!! I have stayed in MANY 4 or 5 star hotels and never have had a concierge tell me he could not help me, then refuse to help. I ended up speaking to the valet, who personally took me over to the other hotel where the rental car company was located, and that hotel's manager and concierge helped me from then on. The Portofino's staff was VERY nice and helpful and if I ever go to Universal again I will certainly stay with them. The Hard Rock's location is nice in that it is in walking distance of both Universal parks, but the value for your money is not worth it. Even at the club level the rooms were very small and offered few amenities. Next time we will go back to Disney for sure!

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock Hotel is the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: FrannyK
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 days at the HardRock our lst time at Universal Feb 05 w/our 2 teens. We stayed in a Club level room which was a good price at AAA rate and APH rate. The club lounge was fantastic- free continental breakfast; free wine,beer,hot/cold appetizers from 5-7 each nite; and free waters/sodas 24 hours. It is definitely worth the extra $ to stay club level, especially w/kids. Your room key is also your express pass at the parks and you go to the front of the line for EVERY ride, ANY time you want!! What a fabulous perk to stay on site!! You can do both parks in two days because of this perk--no rushing to the parks at the crack of dawn--go whenever you want! No lines for you!! The parks and Citywalk are a 5 minute walk from hotel or take the water taxi. Pool area is fabulous, kept at 82 degrees, waterside, cabanas to rent, underwater music, beach bar. Can't say enough good things about this hotel. Dined at Margarittaville, Hard Rock Cafe, NBA City, Emerils TchopChop, Islands--all very good.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my God...YES!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you love universal and islands of adventure...you'll love the hard rock hotel. your room key is your express pass to every ride. we rode the mummy at least 3 times while others waited for one ride. the hard rock is so high energy and the staff makes you feel like rock star royalty. it's a short walk or ferry ride to the parks so if you have teenage children, they can go back and forth to the room all day by themselves. for example...we took our 12 year old to the park early and let the teenagers sleep in. when they finally woke up...they had breakfast, charged it to the room (with our permission) and met us at universal. perfect trip for a family of all ages. we love to travel and the entire family agreed that this was the best trip ever. believe me...look into the express pass. it makes staying on the property a no brainer!

Reviews.Title: “Probably wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: citygal
Reviews.Content: We just returned from two nights at the HRH and had a very mixed experience. You can't beat the location. Some of the staff went out of their way to be helpful, others were less so. Our reservation was for a non-smoking room with a king bed. We were escorted to our room, which turned out to be a room with two doubles. The bell person was extremely helpful. He called the front desk, explained the problem and moved us to a king room overlooking the pool. He went down to the desk to exchange our keys and brought them back to us. The staff in the Kitchen were great. I was having breakfast alone one morning and one of the hostesses went out of her way to bring me the newspaper of my choice. On the other hand, my husband called to try to reserve a small meeting room and when the phone was finally answered he was passed from extension to extension. He finally was sent to someone's voicemail and the call was never returned. The rock and roll vibe in the public areas is great if you appreciate that kind of atmosphere, but the hotel rooms are poorly insulated and very loud. The carpet in our room was disgustingly dirty and sticky. I wore flip flops the whole time. The food is decent quality, but the prices are pretty steep. All in all, it was a poor value for the money. In the future, I'd probably stay at the Portofino instead.

Reviews.Title: “Best part of great Universal Orlando was the HRH”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in December during vacation week. It was fantastic. Yes, the hallways do need to be repainted, but besides that, the hotel was beautiful!!! The lobby and hotel amenities (pool and workout center) were beautiful as well as the rooms (get the deluxe for the little extra money, its worth it). Check- in was very speedy and the daytime staff at least was very nice especially the concierge. Stay at the HRH, it is awesome. MY only complaint, the starbucks was dirty and smelled of sour milk. At LEAST a four diamond hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience at the HRH Jan 21 -23. The rooms were clean, the staff was great, and The Kitchen was just excellent. The hotel's closeness to the theme parks and CityWalk was a definite plus also. I didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “The Good & The Bad....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock in Orlando the last week of July, 2004. When we got there, after a 12 hour drive, we were told our room was not yet ready and we would get a free updrade. We got upgraded to a room next to a "pet friendly" room. Dogs barked all night long!! The sleeper sofa was more like a torture device!! Very uncomfortable. Get the Fastpass! Made up for lack of sleep and barking dogs!! No wait on nearly all of the rides when other were waiting up to an hour in the sweltering July heat. Still undecided about coming back...

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock...Hard Heart”
Reviews.Author: babe1477
Reviews.Content: Because of our flight cancellation at the Christmas Holiday, we had to call the Hard Rock Hotel in Orlando and bump the two rooms we had reserved to a day later. When we arrived at the Hotel, they only had one room for us . There were six of us (tow children) and it was late in the evening and I wasn't ready to hear that news. The manager on duty that night ( 12/27/2004 ) was not sympathetic at all with out situation. He incinuated that it was our fault that only one room was reserved . This is not true. We had two rooms reserved for over a month. The manager finally gave us a suite with one queen bed and sent us two cots to sleep on. The manager also told us that they were overbooked by 28 rooms. I asked him why they would do that and he said because people call and cancel rooms. He charged us $ 255.00 ( Tax included ) for each night we stayed ( 2 nights ) I was very disappointed in the way we were treated and the lack of concern for our situation. One nice thing I can say is that we had a beautiful suite. Even though we didn't have enough room for the six of us we managed. I can't say that I would reccomend this Hotel . Thanks for hearing me out. Disappointed Mom in New York

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hard Rock!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hard Rock for 2 nights, 1/1 and 1/2. I can honestly say this hotel is great! Our only mini-glitch occurred at check-in. We arrived at the hotel around 1pm and our room wasn't ready yet (check-in time is 4pm). We checked our bags with the concierge and came back around 4:15 but our room still wasn't ready. The concierge was great and encouraged us to complain to the front desk and we got 2 free breakfast passes at the Kitchen for our trouble. I would say they do need to make the check-in work more smoothly, however everyone was very nice and willing to compensate for their mistakes. We spent most of our time at the pool and ate and drank at the Beach Club. Service was outstanding at the Beach Club and the waiter that came around to the pool was very good as well. Food was surprisingly pretty good. Very relaxing to be able to lie in a chair in the sand and order food and drink without having to get up. We didn't do the parks but did venture out to City Walk both nights. It's such an easy and pretty walk from the hotel. City Walk was fun, ate at Margaritaville and Emeril's. Food was great at both places. I would agree with other posters however and say that the pillows were definitely unconfortable. Other than that the hotel was pretty, clean, fun and in a great location. All of the staff we encountered were very friendly and I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Needs some work”
Reviews.Author: mjhill1004
Reviews.Content: Staff here is very young and apathetic. They make you feel like they're doing you a favor by helping you. I guess if you're not young like they are then you're not hip which is a joke because most of the people we saw were married with children! Granted, we were there at a very busy time (between Christmas and New Years) but I think they should accomodate for that. At $269.00 a night I expected a little better. However, the express pass was invaluable! I can't even imagine being at Universal or Island of Adventures without it. So staying on site was worth the extra $$$. I think I would have rather tried the other two properties. Food is very expensive and not that good. Bring your extra dollars if you plan on eating at the hotel often. When we had breakfast in The Kitchen the waitress strongly discouraged us from ordering off the menu and strongly encouraged the buffet that was not good. The rooms are average in size and clean but many stains on the carpet and in the hallways. Walls are paper thin so you can hear your neighbor next door. I guess I wouldn't stay here again if the other properties were available. I did fill out an online comment survey and was contacted the next day by e-mail from someone but I think it was just a generic e-mail saying they would work on the problems. They need to train their help better. This is supposed to be a luxury property. No staff I encountered treated us as if we were anything special. Sad.

Reviews.Title: “Check-in staff need customer service training. Not 5* rooms!”
Reviews.Author: thatsmydawg
Reviews.Content: We moved to this hotel at 2am, after having money stolen from us at our previous hotel (I Drive Inn/Holiday Inn Express International Drive). My husband had to go out into the valet area to try and find somebody to check us in as there was noone at check in, and we waited for nearly 10 minutes for someone to appear. The girl had either been asleep or was under the influence of something. By the way if anyone has had problems with this girl, she was early 20's, with dark wavy hair tied back in a ponytail. Should have got her name. She was the check in girl from hell. She worked in the evenings the time we were there. We knew that we could get annual pass rates from checking out the availability on the internet through the Universal website. We didn't know that we couldn't get them at front desk. She kept trying to get us to go to a cheaper hotel, and even phoned the Royal Pacific to see if they had rooms and the rates even though we kept repeating that we wanted to stay at the HRH. She was telling us to go to the RPR, or the doubletree or a holiday inn. She kept pointing out that the internet was different as that was Universal, and they were a Loews hotel and nothing to do with Universal. Why are they then a 'Universal Studios resort'? At this point I could quite easily have snapped. Finally managed to get a room booked at $219 + tax for that night (though we were told that we probably wouldn't be able to keep the room that we had and would most likely have to check out the next day if we got the AP rate as they have different rooms for this rate!!!!), and we had to unpack my two younger brothers and all of our luggage from the car, get them to the room and drive back to the other hotel to use their internet access to book up the annual pass rate for the rest of our stay (which was $149-169 per night, with a night free for every 3 nights paid for, so quite a saving on the rack rate). No help was offered with all of our luggage and we had to struggle with it to our room. This room was definately not a 5* standard room, and had a lot of wear and tear. It was on the 3rd floor (same level as the lobby). By the time we got back to our room after booking up the rest of the holiday it was 3.30am. The next day we rechecked in and were asked if we wanted to keep that room or move to a different room, we chose to move up higher, and got room 6131. This room was better that the one on the 3rd floor, so much for nastier rooms for AP rates! The hallways do need sorting out though, and the carpets replacing. Housekeeping were excellent and were the friendliest people there. I decided to use the TV internet, but after it breaking 3 times within an hour and having the wrong type of engineer sent up to fix it (he was for the phones, not the net even though we specified what our problem was), we called down and asked for it to be cancelled and refunded, which it was. Though we couldn't check our folio out for the entire stay as that didn't work, even though we notified them. They do offer internet access in the business centre, but want $10 for 15 minutes. We used the net elsewhere for less that half that price. We had another run in with the check in girl when we took our annual passes down to be added to the booking as we hadn't swapped the paper confirmation for them when we moved room and had been asked to bring it along sometime. My husband asked if it was possible to add the Loews member number to the room, but we were told no as we had a special rate. I said that it was fine (we really weren't bothered), but she kept going on and on and on about how we were already saving $80 off the rack rate and if we wanted points then we had to pay full price and we were getting such a good deal etc etc. We felt like trash. I practically had to shout 'THAT'S FINE!!!' at her for the 2nd time before she would shut up. We might not have been paying rack rate, but we were still a paying customer. We weren't treated like 'royalty' or even like decent people, apart from by housekeeping who were lovely. The front of the line access is great, but I wouldn't pay more that what we did for the hotel. The check in staff and the concierge need basic customer service training ASAP. I doubt if I would stay here again, if I want FOTL I will probably go to the Royal Pacific next time, but only for a couple of nights. 10 nights here was too long but we didn't know where else to go. Perhaps Disney hotels know how to treat the guests correctly. BTW I am not the only guest that felt this way about the staff at the hotel, I was talking to another lady in the laundry room who had a similar experience with the concierge and ended up walking away from him as he was so rude to her. Rooms are nice, the pillows are uncomfortable, bathroom is tiny and you have to really try and manouvre around the bathroom door! Everything costs you extra ($6 for a bottle of Evian anybody?), the barman in the Velvet lounge is really nice. They had Xmas parties on in the lobby at the weekends (well the lounge area was shut off to normal guests), lots of very loud music and really drunk loud people wobbling around, not very nice. There was an ant infestation around one of the jucuzzis, and one morning we walked past the other jucuzzi (around 10.30am) and there were glasses and empty beer bottles scattered around it. Oh, the people that work in the parking security gate bit at the front are really nice, and always welcomed us back in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super for Universal, but it'll cost ya...”
Reviews.Author: edleo13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hard Rock Orlando for one night, on December 17th, 2004. First and foremost, the hotel has a wonderful location. Of the 3 onsite resorts, it's the only one within walking distance to both Universal parks. You don't have to deal with boats or busses to get to either of the parks or City Walk. Secondly, using you room key to enter all the Express lines in Universal is well-worth the additonal expense to stay onsite in comparison with the offsite hotels. My wife and I were easily able to cover both Universal parks and ride all the major rides in one day. In addition, the hotel itself is very nice. The rooms (i.e. carpet and walls) are starting to show some wear, but they are nicely furnished and the in-room stereo is a great touch. Bring your own tunes, play the radio, or use the CD they give everyone at check-in. Perhaps the only real drawback on this hotel is that everything, and I mean everything, costs extra. Self-parking is $7. Small bottles of water in the hotel snack bar are $3.15 - before tax! Want to you the fitness center? It'll cost ya. Need high speed internet...$10 more. I realize that all of these things cost money to maintain but for $250+/night in peak season, this hotel should include a few more extras. If the Hampton Inn and their $69/night rooms can include free Internet and workout facilities, Hard Rock shouldn't have any problem matching. In summary, great hotel for getting in Universal. Not worth the additional cost to use as a homebase for Disney.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay”
Reviews.Author: ocadvisor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HRH during the busy Thanksgiving weekend 2004. As a family of 4, we booked the Lil Rock suite (850 sqft). Two rooms, walk in closet, 2 large bathrooms. Kids had their own room with 2 beds, table and chairs, armoire w/ movies, playstation and TV. We had a very large room (separated by double doors) w/ king bed, living area, television and two phones (cordless). Both rooms had excellent views. Turn down service always left the kids a nice surprise every night. Service was exellent from the front desk to the pool. The 240 ft. water slide was great for the kids, arcade, shuffleboard, ping pong and lots of activities for the kids at the pool put on by the staff (i.e. movies projected onto a large screen at night while the kids swam, etc.). Location is short walking distance or water taxi to City Walk, IOA or Universal Studios. Guests show their room key at both parks and bypass all lines - definitely worth the price of the room. From breakfast at the "Kitchen" restaurant every morning to the ice cream shop - food is a winner as well. Lots of memorabilia and pictures of celebrities throughout the hotel as well as a great gift shop with live video feeds to all the other hard rock hotels in differnet parts of the world. Checked out the Portofino - not a kid friendly place and further away. If you are going to visit Orlando, check out Islands of Adventure (best roller coasters) next door to Universal and stay on site at the Hard Rock. If you have a family upgrade to a suite - You will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: dancingdee28
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hard Rock Hotel with my girlfriends in Oct. 2002 and loved our experience! The valet attendants were friendly and funny, the lobby is gorgeous, the pool is big with a white sand beach, great slide, poolside bar and many other extras. We stayed on the concierge floor (recommended) and enjoyed very nice free breakfast and free cocktail hour each evening. Our room was very roomy and stylishly decorated. Each room has its own CD player stereo and we had a great view of Universal's Citi Walk and theme parks. There are a number of different restaurants at the hotel and a posh little bar/lounge called Velvet that we hung out at one night. We met cool people who were also staying there. I loved it and I'd definitely stay at the Hard Rock again!! I felt like a rock star!

Reviews.Title: “Think Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Terrible. Upon check in they billed me for over $1,000 that was not supposed to be billed. It took 2 days and a trip to Management and Acocunting to straighten out. 4PM check in is strict and when you come back you find out you did not get the room you requested. For the money spent on the concierge level this was bad news. There were no Stars in the kitchen. The rooms were not very nice . The bathrooms are extremely small. Not a good experience. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, service not so nice”
Reviews.Author: CaseyV
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Hard Rock. The hotel itself is still beautiful and the grounds are kept very nice. Rooms seemed a bit more shabby though. Carpet has seen better days. I think the big difference in this trip was the staff. Did not feel that anyone went out of their way for you, with the exception of the restuarant staff. Front desk was downright rude - seemed to have more interest in talking to their co-workers than helping us check in. I have serious doubts whether we will stay again, although my kids love the theme and the pool. May be willing to try the Portofino next time. If they didn't have the express pass room key option I doubt this hotel would be so popular. There are just too many other nicer hotels in Orlando, but the express pass brings us back to on-site hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Gstray
Reviews.Content: Was a bit disappointed at the Hard Rock Hotel. I agree with other users that it is in need of some maintenance. All of those kids definitely are hard on the carpet and rooms. It's hard for me to understand how a chain can charge $250 PLus per night for a room that is similar to Hampton Inn, and then charge you $1 to make a credit card phone call, $10 plus for a day of internet access (drive across the street and sit outside any of the suite hotels and you'll get great access to check email over wireless), $3 plus for Starbucks coffee that Starbucks charges $2 around the corner. Our remote didn't work and it took three calls over two days to get a new one. Our room was not cleaned one day until 4:45 PM after we had returned from the parks and were ready for a clean room. We had a good time...the express pass was a nice plus. We did the 3 day pass for Universal and Islands of Adventure...worked out great since it rained one afternoon. You can easily do both parks in 1 or 2 days witht he express pass. Did not check out the Portofino. Pool is great at Hard Rock. Staff were polite. I guess just overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “best days in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock was the best. Having already spent 60 vacation days at Disney Parks (Which I love!) we decided to try a "Universal Hotel". We were baited in by the Express Pass , which turned out to be the best thing since sliced bread! This is the first Orlando Hotel that I could actually RELAX at. The pool though a little shallow had enough activities to keep kids of all ages happy and busy! The service around the pool area was excellent and courtieous. The room had a great view of the Park and area and the accessibility to City Walk and Universal saved me $200 on rental cars ! My wife and I are thinking of foegetting the kids and going for a weekend! LOVED IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: pamhaap
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went to FL has her graduation gift. We stayed at the HRH for 4 nights and loved it. We had a nice room on the 6th floor great view of the pool. Staff was nothing short of excellent.. Did eat at the Kitchen one night food was good but expensive as others said but our waiter was great.. Loved Universal Studios alot better then Disney.. Can't wait to go back..

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hard Rock! Favorite part of the vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Nola_Gal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (late twenties, early thirties, no children) stayed here 4 nights on a 9 night trip to Orlando's theme parks. The Hard Rock was not only our favorite part of the trip, it is our favorite hotel we've ever stayed in! We loved the express pass and the Universal parks much more than Disney. The service was amazing and our room was spotless. We had our welcome gift delivered upon check in. One of our favorite memories is having a night cap in the Velvet Lounge and ordering the Smores. You roast your marshmallow's right at the table! The ice cream parlor in the hotel was amazing - you have to get a cone for the walk over to the parks. The pool was the coolest I've ever been in and have thought of it longingly since we left. We brought a cooler with drinks and snacks and sandwhiches for lunches which helped with expenses. Very glad we did that. Overall, it was the best hotel and vacation experience we've had! We loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: GOOFYANT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel from Sept 18th - 3rd October 04 with anticipation from a few reports I had read before we got there, but its a good job I didn't take any notice of them, once we drove through the gates we knew that this was simply an awesome place, the room, the music everywhere you went, the friendly and efficient staff, the pool, the express passes, the Water Taxis, I could go on but I will definitely be coming back again, the sooner the better. It is much nicer and larger than the brochure pictures made out. It can be taxing on the wallet for eating there if you let it, we had a couple of breakfasts and lunches there throughout our stay but there are plenty of options available eg: City Walk, Waffle Houses, IHOPS etc all within an easy 5 minute drive. I would come back at the same time of the year also for the Halloween Horror Nights as we managed to get the first night on our last night there and it was unforgettable. GREAT PLACE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We returned from a weekend getaway to the Hard Rock Hotel and it was great. Staff is very helpful and eager to please. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Mel-in-Florida
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for the first time Sept 9 & 10th. I was pretty disappointed with our room. When we checked there was some really gross stuff on the spread, I called to have it replaced but they never showed up so we just tossed in aside. I am a Loews First Gold Member and I never received my welcome gift. Didn't bother to call and ask for it. We waited so long for our luggage to be brought to our room that I sent my son to try to find it. Never again will I stay at the Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best...”
Reviews.Author: Lindaejf
Reviews.Content: Everything here is top-notch....without a "snobbish" atmosphere... fun place with great pool, activities on-site, quick walk to Univesal parks and City Walk - Express Pass is awesome! My son forgot his school bag when we checked out. We called the hotel from the airport and reported it - the bag arrived at our home the next day - at no cost to us! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Express Pass”
Reviews.Author: TerriPittsburgh_Pa
Reviews.Content: Do not go to Universal without staying onsite. The express pass is worth the extra $$. I won't bore you with repeating what past reviewers have written. The main point is, that when other visitors were waiting 30 to 60 minutes to get on an attraction, we were waiting 0 to 10 minutes!! We did get some rude stares and 1 women directed a nasty comment to us. Too bad, so sad, I am sure she's over it by now. LOL We had great time and we will definately go back. Hard Rock was cool hotel. Good music (not too loud) played by the pool area and even underwater!We also stayed on the 7th floor Club rooms. The breakfast, snacks and drinks saved us $$ for sure. The only bad thing is some of the people were sooo greedy and pushy when they are getting "free" food. Geez, people there is enough to go around take it easy. The Club Room, where they served the food, needed a good cleaning and had a nasty odor.

Reviews.Title: “Universal Express is fabulous - not the hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed Aug 15-20'04. The Hotel is worth staying at for Universal Express; however, 5 nights is too long (Express allows you to easily see everything in 3 nights). Overall, we enjoyed our stay but were extremely disappointed at the way we were treated our last day. Here's why: we took a convenient tube of sunscreen our 1st day expecting to use it; however, we returned it without removing the seal. Upon checkout, they did not (and would not) provide an itemized list of the mini bar charges and it took over 15 minutes for them to confirm they did in fact charge us for the unused sunscreen. Why they chose to dispute an $8.50 sunscreen charge when our bill was $2200 US is beyond me (especially since I repeatedly suggested they send someone up to the room to see the suncreen for themselves) - I guess they're not interested in repeat guests. That would also explain why they refused to allow us to use a trolley to bring our 6 bags down from the room after we checked out.

Reviews.Title: “just do it”
Reviews.Author: NickTobs
Reviews.Content: Booked via internet 4 for 3 nights and although you pay for the privilege it is worth staying for the fast pass system - showing your key and avoiding the lines gives you a totally different experience of Universal. The hotel is fine, breakfast buffet is good and situation unbeatable. Go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: sexymexi
Reviews.Content: We vacationed in Orlando and stayed at the "Hard Rock" for 3 nights August 7-10th. Initially we had booked elsewhere but decided at the last minute to change our minds and booked the Hard Rock figuring the "Express Passes" were worth the extra $$$ as we rarely visit the same place twice and wanted to see all of Universal. The property is clean, fun, hip and yes, expensive, but people have to remember the old real estate adage "location, location, location" as that is truly what you are paying for! This is a family resort we were happy to discover. We were a little afraid the crowd would be too hip, with silicone and thongs everywhere, but we were happy to see more flab than ab! :) We were Loews first members and did not receive our welcome gift or newspaper as others have complained, but I just called the front desk and it was taken care of right away. Best features: Location, pool (altho we only spent one afternoon since it rained most days) Needs improvement: more washer/dryers for guests and the beds are rock hard (the beds at the Chicago Hardrock are to die for, and was disappointed when these were not the same!) Overall, worth the $$$ and would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have never felt compelled to share any travel experiences before now. After reading mixed reviews on this board, I was a bit nervous about our impending trip. We spent four nights at the Hard Rock (Aug 13t - 17th) and couldn't have had a better time. We were there for Hurricane Charley, which the hotel weathered extremely well. We never lost power or any services - except the pool was closed early the day of the Hurricane and opened a few hours late the next day due to cleanup. The large waterslide didn't open until the next day due to fallen tree on it. The Hard Rock was the ideal location for my family (myself, husband and two boys, 10 and 7). We arrived before 9:00 am and our club level room was ready - already a surprise if you believe what others experienced. The hotel staff were unbelievably friendly and not only those who worked for tips!!! The club level is the way to go - the breakfast, lite dinner fare, drinks and dessert worked perfectly for us. The concierge people in the club lounge were very helpful with everything from dinner recommendations to checking our departure flight. They were super friendly and again they don't work for tips. The room was very nice - not too big but comfortable for the four of us. The maid service was very good and each night we had turn down service, they left small gifts for the kids which our sons looked forward to. They were small trinkets but the "thrill" of getting something each day was special for the kids. The close proximity to the parks and city walk is priceless. It is literally a few minute walk or water taxi ride to the park entrances. The express pass is worth it's weight in gold!! I actually started feeling bad for those people waiting in line without the express pass!!! Of course the price for the hotel is substantial but considering the location and extra perks it is definitly worth it! The pool area was beautiful and we all enjoyed the shallow water and the incredible water slide. Each day there were activities for the kids (and kids at heart). We will absolutely return to this hotel. Go, relax, and enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bad Things: They have a four o'clock check in time and they are very serious about it.We arrived at the hotel @ 12:30 and did not get a room until almost 5:30. When we finally got in our room, the carpet was wet, the beds were hard, and the pool view (which I paid extra for) was non-existant. Make sure to request a room on the highest floor you can get, otherwise all you'll see is tree trunks and palm leaves. We ate at The Kitchen one time for breakfast - it was really good but really expensive.We ate off site the rest of the time. Good Things: The pool is great and they play games with the kids. You can hear cool music everywhere you go (including underwater) and the rest of the hotel made up for the so-so room. It was a very short walk to both parks and skipping the regular lines was almost worth the extra cost of staying on site. I would stay there again now that I know how they handle reservations and room upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sharpattack
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our 3 week vacation as a bit of a treat for my two sons of 12 & 15. They loved it. The first thing to note is that if you avail of valet parking on arrival it will cost $12 a day for the privilege even if you do not take your car out of the hotel. Self parking still costs $6 a day. The room for the 4 of us had 2 twin beds and was a little on the cramped side. I would be prepared to pay extra for a 2 room suite but none are available. All the memoribilia is great fun, just like the restaurants. I went to sleep beneath a picture of Frank Zappa! The kids never heard of him! The rooms were very clean and the maid visited daily. The internet access via TV was handy and reasonable at $10 for 24 hours unlimited access. The bar in the hotel was good and they even catered for smokers out on the balcony. The pool was excellent and the music underwater was a great thrill for the kids. A couple of big advantages by staying here were that there was no queueing at Universal or Islands of Adventure, really handy when some queues were 75 minutes long. It also meant no queueing at the Hard Rock Cafe on a Saturday where some people waited over an hour for a table, and the restaurant holds 1500! There was also a water taxi to take you back from City Walk which was free. Certainly recommended hotel for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Music Lovers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If your family is ready to party down at a hotel, this is the place for you. If you want the mausoleum vibe try the Portifino across the street. We stayed in a club room on the 7th floor, meaning free beer & wine for happy hour, and free food during other parts of the day. This was extremely convenient for our family and well worth the price of the club room upgrade. From our first contact with staff and for 8 continuous days, we were treated like kings, and every request was granted. I could rave on and on about this place - but 2 things struck me as truly exceptional. Being there for a week, we decided to spend one full day just at the hotel (mainly the pool area), and for us it was comparable to the enjoyment we had at the parks. At first I thought the price of a cabana rental at the pool was a waste, but my wife talked me into it so we got the Yellow Submarine themed cabana for a day ($70 which is half price for club room guests) - this made our pool experience wonderful! The cabana acted as our motel room at the pool complete with TV, Phone, fridge stocked with soda and bottled water, Ceiling fan, table, chairs, towels, and privacy tent. and in the evening we had a great private view of the movie which was played on a huge screen poolside (with a fireworks preshow). My kids made tons of friends that day and had a blast swimming, using the waterslide, and playing the organized poolside games. Me and the wife also opted for massages that day a few minutes walk down a beautiful landscaped path at the Portifino Hotel. When we went to that hotel, (me and my wife at seperate times for our massages) we both shared with each other how the Portifino was beautiful, but eerily quiet and dismal over there -- and we both knew we made the right choice by picking Hard Rock. The second great thing is...well, perhaps the most overlooked and underappreciated thing about the place - the music. I heard some great songs I haven't heard in a long time (mixed with new songs). And it isn't the usual 20 songs over and over like the radio - song after song you never know what you will hear next - I only heard one song repeated the entire week. You can tell someone put a lot of time making the play list. The variety of musical genres represented were wide, and the tonal quality was amazing all over the hotel. All over you could see both staff and guests singing to the music -- a great learning experience for my kids! If you are a musician, shame on you if you stay anywhere else in Orlando. Your kind is accepted here! As far as the other stuff goes - our room was beautiful, had a great view (7th floor folks have no problem seeing over the trees) and the maid staff gave us Hard Rock gifts every day. The only tips we gave were to the valet, waitress and bartender (we carried our own bags), and we never got any funny looks for not tipping anyone else. The amusement parks were amazing but stressful, and the cut-in-line passes were a life saver. A lot of people complained about the staff on this board. For those I have this advice...I kind of got the vibe that the staff will wait hand and foot on those who appreciate the culture that the hotel has to offer -- as opposed to looking at the staff like they are overpaid slaves who you can walk all over just becuase you feel you paid too much for the room. This place is expensive, and certainly not for everyone -- but for our family -- everything was just how we like it.

Reviews.Title: “A good time! But read on....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After visiting Disney several times, my husband and I had never been to Universal and decided to try it. We visited July 25-28, reserving a garden-view 5th floor room. Check-in was no problem, but we had a 9 p.m. arrival. Room was clean, maids attentive to our likes. The first night there we could see fireworks from our window. Express pass by showing room key was very fine! Ninety minute waits turned into 3 minutes. The downside was EVERYTHING is extra...even if you self park, which was $6.00/day. (And valet was $12.00.) We self-parked but weren't allowed to use the luggage carriers. Workout room is $8.00/day. These are normal amenities that are usually covered at normal hotels. Read the fine print if you don't want any surprises on your bill when you leave! There was problems with the concierge. We had tickets for Arabian Knights, and had to make reservations. I went through 3 different people over 2 days by phone at the concierge desk. I decided to doublecheck them at the desk. Instead of reserving for 2 people they had reserved for 6 and had the first name wrong. I think it would have been better to skip the concierge and make reservations myself. But they finally got it right! (Oh yes, there is a $1.00 charge to make local calls.) We didn't touch the $6.00 water, but brought our own water, cokes and snacks. The pool was guitar shaped, nice if you like to wade, but not very deep. The slide was fun, even for grownups! The sandy area for lounge chairs made pool area more beachlike. The landscaping is groomed and fountains are clean. The hotel was accessible to CityWalk and both parks. We walked some and rode the water taxi when we didn't want to walk. We watched fireworks from pool one night. The sandy area for lounge chairs made the pool area more beachlike. All in all, we had a great time! Going Back? Not for awhile. The express pass would be the reason I would return. Probably try a cruise next year. At least meals are included!

Reviews.Title: “What a poor excuse for a Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It just amazes me that someone comes up with an idea and then it is a hotel, then the theme is picked, in this case hard rock, what a joke....this is nothing more than a expensive marketing ploy to get into families wallets,,and boy do they!!!! While the rooms are nice you pay for them. You know it is bad when your son ask,,daddy do we also have to pay for the coffee in the room? You pay for everything..nothing is free. When you order food in the KITCHEN not only is it expensive but they cant get it right,, salads are not included in the meals,,, this place is ridiculous...We waited for over 30 minutes to get seated then did not get the seats that we wanted...In the morning all you hear is some employee going down the hall using her room card tapping on the doors to check the in room bar. Oh and stay away from that, 6 dollars for a evian water,, never agian will we be duped by this ploy,,, these places call themselves family places, there is nothing family about it..its all about money..what a joke!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Hard Rock. We have 9 year old twin boys and they had a great time. They said it was their best vacation yet! We enjoyed the pool, the music and the kids entertainment was great as well. The Front of the Line Pass was THE BEST. My husband and I agreed that we would never go again without it. The wait times were 1 hour plus, and we never spent more than 10-15 minutes in line tops! You could spend a couple of hours, ride alot of rides, and not feel like you had to hurry through to get your moneys worth. The food at the hotel was expensive, and we found eating in the parks and at City Walk was much more reasonable. The Mythos in Islands of Adventure was wonderful. The front of the line pass also gives you priority seating there, and you have a great view of the park and lake. Food was outstanding! The hotel was clean and the staff was pleasant, although they didn't really go out of their way unless they were looking for a tip. If you are looking for alot of pampering, this probably isn't the place for you, but if you just want a nice hotel, clean room and plenty to do for the entire family, without long waits in line, you'll have a great time. My only major complaint (my kids would disagree) were all the amusement games at both parks and at City Walk. My kids couldn't walk past them without begging to play. At $3-5 per game, this can get costly quick. Not to mention having to carry all of those stuffed animals home on the plane. I had a hard time trying to figure out how to get around without going past them all the time. Overall, we had a great time, and all agree we would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Front of line priviledges the best,, hotel okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Best features, 1) Front of the line priviledges, 2) the pool and water slide, and 3) front of the line priviledges. Worst features, 1) tip happy staff, 2) noisy guests in the hallways after midnight, and 3) beware of pool view rooms. We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel from July 17-24, 2004, and booked a "pool view room" thru AAA. Upon checking in, we were advised our room wouldn't be ready until 4PM,,, but the staff told us we were welcome to go to one of their restaurants, "The Kitchen", where my wife and I,, and our 9 yr. old son could have a $55. lunch; burgers and chicken fingers. Once our room was ready, (room 2124, on the 2nd floor), I opened to curtains to find a beautiful view of trees. Not lush palm trees positioned around the pool, but trees, 30 feet high, right outside my window, blocking all view of the pool. If the wind blew in a certain directions, I could see a lovely blue which I assumed was the water in the pool. I didn't find this out until AFTER we had unpacked. I wasn't moving to another room. As the week progressed, I got madder and madder about the "view". After the 3rd night, I commented to the front desk associate thatI wasn't happy with the view. I found 3 breakfast buffett passes under my door the next day. I'll give them an "A" for effort, but I would have liked the difference refunded. The grounds are very nice, as is the property itself. As stated in prior reviews from other travelers, the staff is very "tip-happy". they expect one for every little thing they do. We found all the employees very competent and gracious. The pool is awesome, as is the water slide. The only true reason to stay at this property is for the front of the line priviledges at the Universal Theme Parks. We saw posted wait times of 75 and 90 minutes on some of the most popular rides (The Hulk, Spiderman, and Jimmy Neutron) and we waited about 3-5 minutes with the room card passes. I doubt we will stay there again. For $250. a night, I think our dollars can be better spent elsewhere. ALL room service orders have a $3. charge AND an 18% tip added. My son's kids meal cheeseburger ended up being $14.00.

Reviews.Title: “Hard YUCK Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: copperpenny626
Reviews.Content: What a Huge disappointment this hotel was. We booked a suite with two bedrooms with a pool view. What we got was a king room with a table and a small regular room that was attached. They put us on the 3rd floor which is the floor you enter on and could see nothing. The room smelled horrible the carpets were filthy, the furniture was filthy, we had to wait until 5:00 before the room was ready. There was no comforter on our bed and after the third request we finally received one. The coffee in room service was great, but one pot cost $15. They add 20% and a $3 service fee. We paid $700 a night for these accomadations and had booked 3 nights. The only good thing was Sem the gentleman who checked us out and the guy he was training, and the express pass. Maybe the other two Universal Hotels are better!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Hard Rock Hotel. We stayed from July 11th-16th. The staff and service were either great or terrible. At the end of our stay we noticed that we had been charged an extra nights stay. We had gotten our intinary half way threw this trip to find incorrect charges and a outlandish room hold. We are still working to clear up the Hard Rock's expensive mistakes. Pray that nothing goes wrong because if you have any problems the staff here could care less. The room was clean and spacious. The room key with express pass is the only reason for staying on property. We will not stay here again because of the lack of service.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel....but fast pass is wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel was alright, nothing great. Arrived 4th of July to find that they lost our reservation, make sure you confirm before you go!! All lounge chairs at pool were taken for the two out of five days we were there! Food and drinks extremely expensive; and I'm one who usually doesn't care while I'm on vacation; but I felt robbed everywhere I turned. Cost my two daughters almost $40.00 for lunch at the Beach Club and that was with no alcohol. The best part is the Fast Pass, park was packed and we had no wait. Try to eat most meals out, try Citywalk. Look for discount coupons at the dining reservation kiosk. Lots of 2 for 1's.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful when making reservations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a great time. I made reservations for a pool view. One week before I changed to a club room. I was told no problem and they charged me the club room rate. When we arrived no club room was available. The girl and her boss said no problem, we could go up to the club floor to get our little breakfast and soda but would have to stay on a different floor... for 360 per night. I said no way. We got the bosses boss and he did help us out. Got us a club room the next day at a reduced rate. Bottom line, when you make reservations with loews, call the hotel and make sure before you go. by the way, the club floor is not worth the money, but the express pass to the parks is. The pool was also nice.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: angelasmom
Reviews.Content: Our family with two kids ages 11 and 14, stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel the week before Easter for four days. We absolutely loved it. I initially booked the hotel over the internet (garden room for $237) When we arrived, I was able to upgrade to the Hard Rock Club level for an additional $50 per night. They had a vacancy with a king bed and a queen sleeper sofa which the kids slept on. The sleeper sofa was like a catchers mitt, but that was only a minor inconvenience. The room had a nice sized bathroom and an additional sink with a large countertop outside of the bathroom, which made getting ready much easier. The club level lounge is very large with TVs and nice sitting areas. Continental breakfast is served every morning in the lounge and hors d'oeuvres are served every evening along with complimentary wine and soft drinks. We saved a lot of money on food by upgrading to the club level. It is also open during the day with complimentary soft drinks and water. and later in the evening cookies and desserts are available, all at no additional charge. The kids loved the pool with the sandy beach and there was a DJ out by the pool playing games with the kids (air guitar contest, hula hoop contest, etc) The hotel is spotless - great memorabilia all around. Best of all, the parks are an easy walk, and with your Express Pass room key, you are on the rides in only minutes. Even though we were there during Easter break, the longest wait we had for any ride was 15 minutes, compared to the regular ride lines that were anywhere from 30 - 90 minutes. We felt we definitely got our money's worth and are planning another trip back.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes, What a rip off!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site, I had reservations about staying at the Hard Rock. We decided to give it a shot, since you never know unless you try. We are Lowes first members, so when we arrived at the hotel. We asked for the upgrade that is supposed to come with the membership. We were informed that no upgraded rooms were available. So my family went up to our room and were shocked at the size. There were 5 of us all together. Two adults, two 11 year olds, and a 2 year old.You barely have room to turn around. We decided to call the hotel to see if we could reserve a room a deluxe room(just to see if the hotel was really full like they said). We were told that the rooms were available. Hmmm.I guess they don't like to upgrade the middle class. The service at the Kitchen was outstanding. The express pass was awesome. One of the few pluses about staying on this property. The final straw is when we went to check out. I called to ask if we could arrange a later checkout, as our plane did not leave till 7 p.m, and my two year old daughter requires a nap around 11:30. We were told that it was not possible, and we would need to be out of the room by 11:00. So my two year old took her nap in the busy hotel lobby. Most of the staff at Hard Rock deserves an A. Especially Angel and Tony. But it only takes a few bad ones to spoil the whole experience. For 280.00 a night, we deserved better.

Reviews.Title: “City Walk Bucks Way to go!”
Reviews.Author: terrie4812
Reviews.Content: We won a contest, so the room was just average. The best deal, however, are City Walk Bucks. You can buy them At the Conceirge desk. Get $50 for $40 and use them at City walk for your food and souvieners. All the restaurants accept them except Emerils. We saved boo-coo bucks by using Payless Transportation for our airport transfers because they will stop at the grocery store on the way to the resort. Their Lincoln Town Cars were far superior to the taxis, Shuttle vans, and buses offered at the airport. The cost r/t was $80 actually cheaper for our group of 4 than the other modes of transpotation offerred. Unless you're Loaded, forget HRH. We really enjoyed Margarittavile, GReat Food, reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel from June 12 - June 21 and LOVED every minute of it. The absolute best perk was the front of the line express pass. There were times when the lines had a 60 - 90 minute wait and we by-passed it all and waited less than 5 minutes. That was by far the very best perk. The hotel itself was great. The pool was beautiful, the slide was a blast, the lifeguards were all great with kids and they had different activities for kids every day at the pool that were alot of fun. The food at the Beach Club was way over priced but we only ate there once and did the restaurants at City Walk the rest of the time and their prices were much better. The only thing that was bad was the free shuttle to Sea World. We went twice and the first day it was 40 minutes late and when waiting with 3 small kids that starts your day off kind of bad and the second day the bus was so completely over crowded we stood the whole way there along with about 50 other people and no air conditioning. That was AWFUL! All of the staff at the HRH were so friendly and accomodating it made our stay there very much worth the money. We are going back in November and definetly staying, once again, at the Hard Rock Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: bellskee
Reviews.Content: Loved it, loved it, loved it. I was there in May 2004 for several days. Took my niece 13 and nephew 16. We all went nuts over the hotel. Rooms are just super and comfy. We had to rent a rollaway ($25, worth it) that was just as comfy as the beds; not one of those folded cots. Music everywhere - missed it when we didn't hear it. Food was good. Music in the pool, just wish the pool had a deeper end. Stayed at Portofino in March and liked the Hard Rock better!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings. Good for Express Pass”
Reviews.Author: Hab
Reviews.Content: Just came back on June 14th, 2004 from staying at this property. Room was nice and clean. No complaints there. I'll start with the negative points first: 1)We are generous tippers and agree that people should be paid for their services BUT everywhere you go or every service you request, a tip is expected! This can be costly. We had to tip from the moment we stepped out of our car at the front lobby. Scarey! I wanted to tell some of the staff...LET ME DO MY OWN LABOR AND I'LL KEEP MY MONEY! I felt a little violated considering we paid quite a bit for the room itself and then to have to tip tip tip on top of it. Hmmmmmm............You would think the staff wasn't being paid by the hotel at all. They sure get over well with all the required tips. This would be the biggest reason that I would NOT want to stay here again. 2) The check in process took too long, especially since I paid months ago and had to only get my key and go. The check in person failed to see that I already paid and was going to charge me for the room. I had to tell HER that I already paid which is not good. 3) Reservationist spelled my name completely wrong when I made the reservation although I spelled it numerous times and 4) Although the reservation noted that there would be FIVE people in the room well in advance, we did not have enough towels upon entering the room which meant we had to call someone to bring towels which meant...you guessed it....another TIP! 5) Parking - self park is $6.00 and $12.00 for valet with in and out priviledges. Self parking lot is a walk and not welcomed on a very hot day or after a long, tiresome day. JUST A NOTE: Be careful with valet parking as a tip is expected each time your car is provided to you and dropped back off. Very costly. This is why I opted for self-park 6) I asked the luggage desk to have my luggage delivered to my room as our room wasn't ready at 11:00 am (no problem, we didn't expect it to be - checkin is at 4:00 pm) and the person behind the desk said "no problem but leave the tip with me". I found this VERY OFFENSIVE and INAPPROPRIATE to say to a customer/client. I was going to do that anyway but it should be MY DECISION and the person should have kept his words to himself! I did not use the eating facilities or swimming pool (due to time constraints) but they looked nice. Swimming pool was to close at 10:00 or 11:00 but closed early due to rain although I didn't see the point. It was just sprinking but..............that's their call....maybe due to liability issues. I won't count this as a negative as it may be due to safety. Can't knock safety. The advantages is of course the express pass. It was wonderful and I would not visit Universal Studios without it. The location is great if visiting the parks. Room was clean. No complaints there. Beds were very comfortable. Furniture was nice. Bathroom small but nice. No complaints about the room itself and I'm picky about it being clean! The hotel is located not far from Universal Boulevard where you will find Wet and Wild Amusement Park and a host of restaurants and other amusements. I would recommend this hotel but just know that is needs to improve in some area that I've mentioned. My biggest complaint is the tipping and my biggest satisfaction was the Express Pass. I would stay there again in a heartbeat but watch my pocketbook in terms of tipping.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock June 10-14th. We arrived on an early flight and checked in early, but the room was not ready. They say they don't guarantee it ready until 4pm. They took my cell phone # and said they would call when it was ready. Meanwhile, we obtained our room cards early so we got to the parks and have express access to the rides. My sister-in -law who arrived later that evening didn't fare as well. They are LoewsFirst gold level members, but that really didn't mean anything. Her room was still not ready at 7pm. They also would not give her the LoewsFirst welcome amenity since she booked her vacation package through American Airlines. Of course no room upgrade was not available. She had to plead her case to get the late check out. Since I'm only a loewsfirst blue level memeber, I didn't get a late check out...even though they didn't arrive to clean my room until after 3pm anyway! The food in the Kitchen was very good and the wait staff was great. There was a wait for dinner so get a reservation. Be sure to ask for the kids menu..otherwise there's a kids buffet. Prices for drinks in the Hard Rock store were ok, but downstairs in the Market/StarBucks the water (Evain) is $6 for the large. Hotel is noisy and pool is crowded. We visted the pool at the Royal Pacific and I liked it much better. There seemed to be more adults and couples there and the lounge chairs around the pool are more comfortable. Music plays all over HR except I didn't hear it in the halls. It would be nice if they would give it a little break or a least turn it down. Unfortunately, the room next door to us was up around 7:30pm singing karokee! After a few raps on the wall things quieted down, but started up again the next day. Room itself is just ok. Carpet in hallways need to be cleaned. We stayed at the Portofino Bay last year and I liked it much better. Room we had was much bigger with a big bath and separate tub. The big advantage to the HR is being close to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Hared Rock Hotel Awesome for adults and kids alike!”
Reviews.Author: chrystaldave
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock in Orlando about a year ago. Great hotel with an AWESOME pool with slide. Rooms are nice and very clean. Very upbeat hotel with nice staff and not overly stuffy or arrogant. I loved the music everywhere and the energy at this hotel. Great access to Universal and City Walk which is a plus. I will stay there again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our three kids stayed at the hard rock during April vacation.It was great.. You can't beat the front of the line access.We did 6 rides in 1 1/2 hours and then a 3-5 minute walk back to the hotel for a swim and relaxation. We would visit the park again later that night and off to city walk for dinner. The only thing everything was exspensive !!!! FOOD-DRINKS. the hotel food was good but exspensive.Overall, Hard Rock is worth every penny and can't wait to go back with the kids for another fun vacation. We stayed 4 nights and it was plenty.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Universal,didn't love The Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at The Hard Rock Hotel in March 2003 and coming from Disney's Old Key West it was a huge letdown.Check in took about 45min.and we were the only people in line!The rooms were very small and a regular coffee was around $4,not to mention the price of food at any of the eateries,about $10 for a burger.I thought Disney gouged you in this area but Universal takes the cake!
